Name: TECHNICAL BUSINESS ANALYST
Description: Ultimate Software is seeking an experienced Technical Business Analyst to join a fast-paced development team focused on our Identity Platform.Business Analysts play a key part in software development at Ultimate Software. The primary responsibility is to capture functional requirements and define the“how” a feature is implemented. Working with stakeholders around the organization, customers and development engineers, you are able to articulate the reasons behind a software feature and are responsible for ensuring technical and functional scope is captured in the delivered solution.Here at Ultimate Software, we truly put our people first. We strongly believe in teamwork, and we encourage and trust our people to reach higher, learn more, and live up to their potential. Ultimate is ranked #1 on Fortune's“Best Places to Work in Technology” for 2018 and #3 on the“100 Best Companies to Work For” list in 2018. Ultimate is also ranked #1 on the Fortune’s“100 Best Workplaces for Millennials” for 2018 and #3 on its "Best Workplaces for Diversity” list for 2017.Primary/Essential Duties and Key Responsibilities:Research, refine and document functional requirements for technical and complicated Identity systems– infrastructure requirements, services/back-end only flows, etc.Communicate directly with customers in collaboration with Product ManagersCreate and collaborate on detailed functional designs, using Agile methodologies and toolsDefine the problems and features using system flow diagrams, AP specifications, and (occasionally) wireframesStory writing including conditions of satisfactionValidate with Product Managers of the stories definedCollaborate with engineers and testers during the build phase to ensure scope is adhered toCreate materials (presentations, demos, UML artifacts) to help train teams on new functionalityTriage, prioritize and follow-up on enhancement requests and defects raised by customers and organizational stakeholdersTake ownership of the delivery of features/capabilities through the development processUnderstand customer issues conducting any necessary technical research or team collaborationRequired Qualifications:3+ years as a Business Analyst working on technical topics in an Agile environmentAble to look at the big picture, speculate and conceptualize outcomes and identify trendsSuperior planning skills with the ability to handle large workload, facilitate the activities of dynamic workgroupsExpert knowledge of all phases of the software development life cycle, with an emphasis on requirements elicitation, requirements and design modeling, documentation, communication, org readiness and project managementPower user of MS Excel, MS Word, MS Visio and MS PowerPointUnderstanding of SOAP/Restful Web Service technology, infrastructure conceptsComfortable working on multiple workstreams simultaneouslyPassion for learning new methodologies/technologiesDetail-oriented, with the ability to prioritize work and self-manageStrong written and verbal communication skillsExcellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skillsPreferred Qualifications:3-5+ years of experience working with on Identity products or infrastructure teamsStrong analytical skills to understand business requirements and decompose into more granular level requirementsAbility to work independently and balance multiple prioritiesProven ability to lead diverse groups of resources to solution agreement by leveraging influencing skills to drive consensusThink imaginatively and intuitively while quickly grasping and synthesizing new ideasAbility to work in a collaborative team environment to solve business problemsTeam player with strong negotiation skillsPhysical Requirements:There are no unique physical requirements for this position.Travel Requirements:Occasional but irregular travel. Very remote friendly.This job description has been written to provide an accurate reflection of the current job and to include the general nature of work performed. It is not designed to contain a comprehensive detailed inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of the employees assigned to the job. Management reserves the right to revise the job or require that other or different tasks be performed when circumstances change.Ultimate Software will reasonably accommodate employees with disabilities as defined by the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and other appropriate statutes.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Job title: Senior Business AnalystReports to: Managing DirectorWe are currently seeking a Senior Business Analyst to join our local Business Development teams in the UK, US, Canada, Asia and Europe. You will report directly to the country / sector Managing Director. About UsProudfoot is the preeminent global operational consultancy. Our core philosophy is “transformation through people” – creating alignment, changing behavior, and transforming companies with people-first solutions to their operational challenges. Our unique approach links hard analysis with one-on-one coaching and boots-on-ground support to achieve dramatic business improvements, helping leaders tap into the energy and ideas of the people across their organization. With 70+ years of experience, we know that employees will engage and contribute when given information, tools, authority, and respect — and we know our clients achieve their highest aspirations through the commitment and hard work of their people.Our expanding portfolio has created an exciting opportunity for an energized new team member with an exceptional track record serving Industrials, MRO, and/or Natural Resource clients. This is a senior level position, empowered to help support identifying, advancing, and closing operational consulting projects, while building your network and expanding your influence in target markets. In this role, you will be responsible for financial analysis of prospective companies and developing a point of view on the financial and operations health of their business. You will be responsible for developing initial hypothesis regarding improvement opportunities to improve business operational performance and leading the development of the business case and expected returns to address.As a part of our team, you will lead business analysis activities for engagements with prospects / clients. It is expected you will expand our existing business analysis offers and shape how we deliver business analysis services. You will interact with target senior executives at brand-name companies around the globe, while driving the execution of business analysis and improvement opportunity initiatives.To be successful in the role, you will be an involved senior executive relationship builder, a compelling thought leader, and a proud team player, providing valuable insights to help prospects achieve measurable operational and financial improvements as they transform their businesses.Experience Required Bachelor’s degree, Graduate degree preferred5 plus years of related financial or business analyst workSuperior financial acumen regarding the ability to interpret financial reports and assess the health of a business based on financial information and reportingMastery of financial modelling and specific client needs Strong insight into operations and their financial structures, including P&L, balance sheets, and cash flow statementsA proven network of successfully interacting with senior level and C-Suite executivesDemonstrated familiarity with key market trends and emerging macro financial situations that the markets we serveThe ability to build and nurture relationships at a CEO level, working autonomously to demonstrate experience and expertise to business leaders at premier international corporationsExperience selling complex, large ticket B2B offeringsExceptional leadership skills able to collaborate with diverse groups, and persuade, influence, and encourage their peers We are seeking ambitious and driven candidates who thrive in a high-energy environment, and who are excited by the opportunity to stake their claim in a fast-growing sector and business.Locations HiringUS, Canada, UK, Europe, AsiaBenefitsSuccessful candidates can look forward to a competitive salary plus a full benefits package.Proudfoot is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to creating and celebrity an inclusive workplace environment.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Our Company Ally Commerce is a turnkey e-commerce solution for brand manufacturers selling direct to consumers. Our multi-channel offering includes branded websites and marketplaces. We provide the technology, marketing, customer service, fulfillment and more. What sets us apart from the market is our combination of expertise and proprietary technology, which yields significantly greater results for our clients.  This is a rare opportunity to be part of building a rapidly growing business, with strong financial backing, for a product that you believe in. We are a collaborative, fluid, entrepreneurial team. Summary The Business Intelligence Analyst works closely with teammates across a variety of functions to improve and optimize overall business performance and drive outcomes in a fast-paced startup environment. Examples of this are standardizing analysis & reporting, improving the distribution of data throughout the organization, and working with others to ensure data accuracy throughout the system. This is a high impact role and this individual must be able to quickly transform & visualize data from a variety of sources to present to internal and external stakeholders. This individual must think critically, surface insights, make informed recommendations across the organization and ultimately get results. Our ideal candidate is smart, scrappy and can translate raw data into meaningful results for our clients and the company. ResponsibilitiesBuild tools & dashboards to monitor KPIs across multiple eCommerce functionsEnable the analysis of client performance across channels (Website, Amazon, eBay, etc) and deliver recommendations for improvementLead projects to add clarity to the performance of internal teams (Customer Service, Warehouse, Merchandising) through accurately tracking each functions KPIsWork with the Technology and Product teams to ensure we are capturing relevant & accurate dataWork with leadership on client-facing presentations, internal projects, and moreRequired Qualifications2-4 years of professional experience working with a wide variety of data sets to drive outcomes cross-functionallyExperience creating reports and dashboards with business intelligence tools (e.g. Domo, Tableau, Qlik)Demonstrated experience using SQL and working in relational databasesEnergetic team player who isnt afraid to ask the tough questions of themselves and others, and excels at independently solving problemsBachelors degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Engineering, or a relevant field of workWorkplace and Benefits The Ally Commerce workplace is casual in dress but rigorous in all other ways! You will be surrounded by smart people who like to work hard and have fun with each other. We offer the typical benefits including medical, dental, 401k and paid time off.  Ally Commerce provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. We prohibit any form of workplace harassment related to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status.

Name: Talent Acquisition Operations and Reporting Analyst
Description: OverviewThe Talent Acquisition team at WellStar Health System is growing! We are currently seeking a confident and highly motivated individual looking for an outstanding career opportunity as a Talent Acquisition Operations and Reports Analyst with a nationally recoginzed employer of choice. At WellStar we all share common goals. That’s what makes us so successful – and such an integral part of our communities. We want the same things, for our organization, for our patients, and for our colleagues. As the largest not-for-profit healthcare system in Georgia, this means we pride ourselves on investing in the communities that we serve. We continue to provide innovative care models, focused on improving quality and access to healthcare.ResponsibilitiesThe Talent Acquisition (TA) Operations and Reporting Analyst provides strategic business analysis services and project support to business partners through reporting, data analysis and dashboards. The focus of this position is to work closely with talent acquisition/recruiting areas to gain in-depth understanding of processes, operational and reporting needs while helping to identify opportunities to improve efficiency. The individual in this role uses strong problem solving, analytical and technical knowledge to develop data-driven recruitment dashboards, reports and analytics that drive recruitment decision making. Serves as dedicated Applicant Tracking System and other talent acquisition software SME to track, report and support future TA activities and initiatives using organizational metrics. This position functions independently using strong technical and internal systems knowledge to complete analyses, respond to requests and partner on system-wide projects.Through this work, we strive to provide value-added metrics and analytics that can inform and deliver solutions and next-generation recruiting to the organization and talent market. This Analyst will help in developing and maintaining new and existing reporting and models, along with recommending and implementing data-driven solutions that will help acquire quality talent for our businesses. Responsibilities of this role will include but is not limited to:• Develop customized analytical reports/dashboards to meet requests of external and internal customers.• Deep understanding of innovative reporting and performance Talent Acquisition metrics that align with business needs.• Management and Analysis of Surveys and Scorecards on Recruitment Performance.• Designs queries, reports and dashboards to assist leaders and team members in understanding historic and current metrics as well as predictive analysis.• Monitors and evaluates quality and effectiveness of Talent solutions by creating, maintaining and analyzing Talent metrics.• Provides ongoing reporting to TA and HR teams on talent programs.• Analyze business process flows and impact on technology flows.• Collaborate with Talent Acquisition leaders and other partners to ensure data integrity and develop appropriate auditing tools, reports and analysis methodologies.• Maintain, enhance, and streamline standardized reporting to ensure clients have timely, relevant, and accessible information and our processes are efficient and legally compliant.• Participate in continuous training efforts to TA team to ensure effective use of ATS and strong knowledge TA processes.• Synthesize information from various recruiting areas, functions, projects, etc. enabling the TA team to make key strategic decisions in a timely manner.• Attend meetings and daily communication sessions to keep abreast of project objectives, process workflows and progress of business concepts.QualificationsRequired Minimum Education: Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Data Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics Business Management, Finance or related field.Required Minimum Experience: • 3+ years of prior work experience in a business analyst, data analyst, or business intelligence analyst role including Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) administration experience.• Experience in stakeholder management and vendor management.• Ability to build business cases that facilitate and accelerate the adoption of analytics and solutions.• Experience developing requirements and formulating business metrics for reporting.• Experience in an analytical role with the ability to interpret data, analyses results using statistical techniques to identify trends or patterns in complex data sets and provide ongoing reports.• Able to communicate complex messages and outputs from analysis in a confident and simple way, and the ability to train others in technical/analysis skills. • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy preferred skills.• Advanced experience using report writing software and developing data visualizations using tools preferred.• Demonstrated expert proficiency in MS Excel and analytical platforms as well as creating PowerPoint presentations and storyboards that captivate business partners.• Intermediate to advanced SQL query writing and a strong understanding of relational data structures required.• In-depth knowledge of advanced technologies for analyzing large amounts of data.• Experience with applicant tracking, CRM, HRIS, and/or customer tracking databases to manage data and candidate relationships. • Intermediate level experience of VBA programming – including ability to update/maintain existing VBA code.• Ability to collaborate and work effectively with internal and external customers/vendors.• Innovative and creative thinker. Ability to identify opportunities for improvement and communicate them effectively.Required Minimum Skills: • Aptitude for using various software products and their corresponding report writing tools. • Excellent analytic skills and ability to manipulate/interpret raw data.• Possesses a high level of integrity and ability to work in a highly confidential environment.• Strong sense of urgency.• Self-starter with ability to multi-task.• Ability to work in fast-paced environment and adapt to change easily.• Strong organizational and planning skills required with a close attention to detail and accountability.• Excellent communication skills (written and oral) as defined by the ability to create and deliver effective correspondence and presentations to Senior Leaders.• A passion for educating and communicating analytic findings at all levels.Join us for outstanding benefits and development opportunities. We also offer state-of-the-art technology, professional support and advancement, and colleagues that rank amongst the best in the country. The WellStar culture of caring has also been nationally recognized by Fortune Magazine as one of the “100 Best Companies to Work For”. Step up to your potential. Find out more and apply today. WellStar is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All applicants are considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, veteran status or any status which is protected by local, state or federal law.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Challengers Wanted.  See how we're embracing the challenges of tomorrow!The Kronos HRIT team is a collaborative group of individuals who support the Kronos application for companies across Koch. We provide value to Koch by transforming the Kronos user experience, eliminating manual processes, and providing accurate time records for employees’ pay. Members of this team work together to advance our initiatives and strategy. Members of our team are interested in expanding their knowledge of the system while working to support customers through requests and projects. A successful candidate is motivated to learn, think critically about processes and how to make improvements and is comfortable working independently in a fast-paced environment. You will primarily focus on providing essential system support to ensure a smooth customer experience, through utilization of our Service Now support ticket system. With increased system experience, additional work efforts will include researching, designing, and implementing solutions through small to mid-size projects. Interpersonal skills, effective collaboration, analytical skills, functional design and problem-solving skills will be key to your success in this role. Open to remote candidates with preferred locations in Kansas City, Atlanta, Reno, Dallas, Chicago, Green Bay or Wichita. Learn more about usSalary and benefits commensurate with experience.  We are an equal opportunity employer. Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran  Except where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test.  This employer uses E-Verify. Name: Systems Analyst
Description: We are the leading provider of  payment reimbursement solutions for the healthcare industry, facilitating over  50 million complex financial transactions per hour on the largest healthcare  network in the U.S. We provide services that increase efficiency, meet  regulatory requirements, and empower a new generation of healthcare economics.  You can find our website at https://payspan.com/ System Analyst Job Duties: Assist in solution design by  analyzing requirements; constructing workflow charts and diagrams; system  diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specificationsImprove systems by studying  current practices; suggesting modificationsRecommend controls by  identifying problems; writing improved proceduresMonitor progress of deliverables  by tracking activity; resolving problems; recommending actionsMaintain system protocols by  writing and updating proceduresPartner with engineering teams  to develop software solutions and participate in Integration Testing, User  Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Functionality TestingMaintain professional and  technical knowledge of relevant Payspan systemsPartner with support teams to  troubleshoot and resolve customer-reported errors in accordance with  defined SLA’sContribute to team effort by  accomplishing related results as needed Job Description: Degree in Computer Science or  equivalent experienceMinimum 5 years’ experience as a  System AnalystDemonstrated expertise with  writing detailed requirements and acceptance criteriaDemonstrated ability to quickly  grasp system architecture inter-dependencies and recommend implementation  optionsWorking experience with Agile  software development methodologies and toolsPrior experience building  consensus within and across cross-functional project teamsDemonstrated experience leading  and influencing solutionsFamiliarity with programming  languagesDemonstrated experience working  independently, balance competing priorities and managing several  time-sensitive projects with minimal direction in a fast-paced environmentExcellent written and verbal  communication skills, including the ability to communicate effectively  with technical and non-technical staffExcellent analytical skillsA great problem-solving attitude Payspan, Inc. is an Equal  Opportunity Employer. Employment at Payspan, Inc. is based upon your individual  merit and qualifications. We don’t discriminate on the basis of race, color,  religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national  origin, age, physical or mental disability, marital status, protected veteran  status or disability, genetic characteristic, or any other characteristic  protected by applicable federal, state or local law. We will also make all  reasonable accommodations to meet our obligations under the Americans with  Disabilities Act (ADA) and state disability laws. All qualified applicants will  receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion,  sex, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: OverviewA Business Analyst in the Professional Services organization implements PowerPlan’s software products and solutions to meet specific customer requirements.ResponsibilitiesActively participate and be highly engaged as part of a project team (including clients, colleagues, other consultants, vendors, etc.) Activities include: contributing to project and tasks plan and development, completion of templates and documentation.Complete tasks and activities as assigned by the Project Lead/Manager, and in accordance with PowerPlan’s methodology. Adhere to project schedules and budgetary constraints; provide early notice of any potential risks or issues with respect to adherence to project schedules or budgetsHands-on project execution: Gather, document and analyze client requirementsDevelop functional/technical specificationsConfigure the application to meet the approved designAssist clients with data conversionTesting: Assist with the development of use and test cases, as appropriateSupport client testing and provide defect resolutionSupport application go-live Provide knowledge transfer to clients and ensure the client staff are ready to operate the application upon go-liveAssist clients in transitioning the application to client’s production support teamPlan and execute effective hand-off to PowerPlan’s Support organizationIdentify client skill or knowledge gaps that might be addressed via PowerPlan’s training organization and/or via an enhanced support modelCommunicate status updates, risks and issues to customers and internal stakeholders as appropriate.Address risks and resolve issues relating to implementation; if needed, with assistance/direction from the Project Lead/ManagerDevelop application and domain/industry specific expertise, and utilize this knowledge on projects QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent combination of education and relevant experienceExcellent, effective communication skills, including: verbal, written, listening and presentation skillsability to engage and successfully interact with the client and project team at all levelsConsulting and client/project team relationship-building skillsStrong technical backgroundAbility to establish oneself as a trusted advisor to client, project team and PowerPlan colleaguesExcellent organizational and time management skillsAbility to adhere to a firm’s methodologySkilled in MS Office SuiteWillingness to travel, on average, up to 80%

Name: Salesforce Business Analyst/Trainer
Description: Company DescriptionSalesforce Business Analyst/TrainerOur Pitch: Merchant e-Solutions is a growing payments organization that wants to invest in your sales career!  We partner with financial institutions and software companies/developers, to bring our payment solutions to market. By leveraging industry expertise and innovative, easy-to-use solutions we aim to improve the payment experience for our customers.  We offer an inspiring work environment where you can experience first-hand the impact of your contributions. Merchant e-Solutions invests in training, personal development, and career growth. Jump start your sales career by joining our outside sales team! The Opportunity: Salesforce Business Analyst/Trainer  Merchant e-Solutions is looking for a full-time Salesforce Business Analyst and Trainer. In this position youll collaborate with business partners to advise, design and support an optimal Salesforce environment for our and internal and external sales and partner management functions in addition to creating/maintaining a communication and training strategy. Your ResponsibilitiesGather and document business requirements to support the implementation of those requirements on the Salesforce platformExecute large scale client data improvement projectsSupport change management process to develop and implement new application and update existing applicationsDevelop and deliver best practice training within SalesforceCreate, run, and analyze reports to make data-based recommendationsConfigure Salesforce for individual teams to ensure effective sales processes and lead follow up · Establish processes, workflows, and reporting from lead generation through closed sale Qualified Candidates need: As the Salesforce Business Analyst/Trainer, you will solve problems and discover new needs. You will be responsible for requirements gathering, implementing solutions and measuring results. It is important to be a diplomat as well as be a good listener and bridge needs of a varied group. We are looking for a self-motivated, energetic, confident individual with strong presentation skills and an experience level which emulates a keen awareness of what can be done in which programs and how to package this for our Salesforce development team for implementation. 2+ year experience performing administration of Salesforce.comSalesforce.com Certified Administrator is a plusSkilled in verbal/written communications, presentation and negotiation, effective time management, direct-sourcing and prospecting skilled in diplomacyOccasional travel to the Atlanta and/or Spokane Corporate officeSolid understanding of sales processes, pipelines, opportunities, metrics, etc.Ability to solve real-world business problemsDetail-oriented with a strong work ethicAbility to build workflows, metrics, and reports in SalesforceHot Prospects will have:Experience in the financial services industry and/or payment processing industry3-5 years of sales operations experience including salesforce analyst/trainer

Name: IT Business Analyst (Senior level)

CS or CE degree preferred5-8 years’ experience in working as an IT Business Analyst in an environment with challenging timeframes and deliverablesExcellent written and verbal communication skills, demonstrated experience of working with senior stakeholders at all levels within and external to the businessCreative, proactive, logical and innovative and will not just accept the status quoHighly results driven, with the energy and determination to succeed in a very fast paced environment where the pace of response and leadership is critical to successAn independent thinker with the ability to multi task in a fast paced environmentExperience working with distributed teams and relationship building with stakeholders who are also not located within the same geographical areaExperience with exposure to the full project life cycle, from inception to user acceptance testingAbility to combine “soft” influencing, persuasion and consultancy skills with “leadership” qualities that will encourage business leaders to positively respond to questions, inquires and requests to meet deadlines.Diligent and passionate about achieving deadlinesExperience working in JiraExperience of agile delivery methodologies required (specifically Scrum)Experience working in the insurance sector a plus

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Challengers Wanted.See how we're embracing the challenges of tomorrow!The Kronos HRIT team is a collaborative group of individuals who support the Kronos application for companies across Koch. We provide value to Koch by transforming the Kronos user experience, eliminating manual processes, and providing accurate time records for employees’ pay. Members of this team work together to advance our initiatives and strategy. Members of our team are interested in expanding their knowledge of the system while working to support customers through requests and projects. A successful candidate is motivated to learn, think critically about processes and how to make improvements and is comfortable working independently in a fast-paced environment.This opportunity is for an entry level Kronos Business Analyst. You will primarily focus on providing essential system support to ensure a smooth customer experience, through utilization of our Service Now support ticket system. With increased system experience, additional work efforts will include researching, designing, and implementing solutions through small to mid-size projects. Interpersonal skills, effective collaboration, analytical skills, functional design and problem-solving skills will be key to your success in this role. Open to remote candidates with preferred locations in Kansas City, Atlanta, Reno, Dallas, Chicago, Green Bay or Wichita.A Day In The Life Typically Includes:Communicate with business contacts to gather detailed requirementsPerform maintenance and configuration activities for Kronos modules such as accrual, timekeeper, and attendancePartner with customers on support activities by responding to and resolving customer requestsPartner and collaborate with a diverse IT team including systems analysts, business analysts, architects and vendorsLeading smaller projects and efforts to implement solutionsSeek to identify opportunities to optimize application performance and utilizationIdentify opportunities to improve and transform internal business processes and day to day activitiesDeveloping your knowledge, skills and leadership abilities for future career advancementWhat You Will Need:Basic Qualifications:1+ years of experience supporting a Kronos system, either in an IT setting or Payroll/HR Admin roleExperience supporting or knowledge of Kronos Timekeeper and Accruals modulesExperience identifying process improvement opportunitiesExcellent computer skills, including Microsoft Outlook, Microsoft Excel, and Microsoft WordWhat Will Put You Ahead?Preferred Qualifications:Degree in MIS, CIS, or CS obtained or in progress3+ years of experience supporting a Kronos system, either in an IT setting or Payroll/HR Admin role. Experience supporting or implementing modules such as Timekeeper, Accruals, Attendance and Scheduler.Experience using a service ticketing system, such as ServiceNow.Familiarity with programming languages such as SQLKnowledge of ITIL including IT implementation methodologies (SDLC, Agile, etc) or equivalent IT service management training & experienceExperience writing and/or executing test plansExperience creating end user training materials, either written or recorded.Project Management experience, including MS Project or Planview. Learn more about usSalary and benefits commensurate with experience.We are an equal opportunity employer. Minority/Female/Disabled/VeteranExcept where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test. This employer uses E-Verify. Please visit the following website for additional information: www.kochcareers.com/doc/Everify.pdfFollow us

Name: Insights Analyst
Description: We are actively seeking an Insights Analyst to join our firm as a dedicated full-time employee. Our goal is 100% client satisfaction through a relentless focus on the clients objectives. To succeed at Strong-Bridge, you need to be a hands-on doer with a flexible working style and excellent communications who can think strategically and act tactically.  To be successful in this role, the Insights Analyst will play a key role in managing data via the clients discovery Business Intelligence (BI) platform and translate it into actionable insights for their customer, commercial, and brand teams. The ideal candidate should have a strong analytics background, a tech-savvy and entrepreneurial spirit, and be comfortable working collaboratively with other teams. Brand marketing experience in CPG and/or food service/QSR is a plus. Lead, produce, and distribute Post-Program Analyses (PPAs) for 5-6 National Programs; including analysis of 360-degree components (POS, media, on-dispenser, etc).Lead, produce, and distribute Weekly Tracker for clients Marketing, Commercial, and Sales stakeholders. (~4-6 hrs / wk)Consult on and develop ad hoc analyses using (business/media/social/digital) data sources as required by the business.Act as SME for this group in support of business user on-boarding, training, and development.Manage updates in a client specific platform. (Minimum Qualifications & Experience:Minimum 3 years experience in Analytics / Data-driven Research.Experience working with Business Intelligence (BI) systems such as Tableau, Alteryx, SAS, Cognos, SPSS, Microstrategy, et al.Experience with Applied Predictive Technologies (APT) is a big plus.Experience with Python, R, VBA, or other scripting/coding languages is a big plus.The Ideal Candidate Will Have:Strong analytics and research experience with a focus on Business and Media data sales, COGS, impressions, Social/Digital metrics, surveys, focus groups, et al.Proven ability to synthesize data and findings into actionable insights and communicate them in a compelling way (storytelling) to stakeholders ranging from engineers / data scientists to the clients leaders.Comfort-level for learning and adopting new analytics and related technologies; curiosity for learning new analytics techniques every day.Passion for big data and the opportunity to play with a highly-proprietary data source.Strong project and timeline management skills.Must be an advanced MSFT Excel user (complex formulae, etc).

Name: Business Analyst
Description: About SUPPLY.comWith offices minutes from downtown Atlanta, SUPPLY.com is a place to buy all volumes and varieties of plumbing and homebuilding materials. From faucets to floor lamps, we’ve got one of the most expansive catalogs in the business, and we rely on our crackerjack team of developers and data scientists to keep it all straight. The plumbing supply industry is about as old school as it gets, but just when our competitors think they have all the answers, we change the questions. How? By taking an innovative and entrepreneurial approach to every challenge, every day. Come on board, and help us build something great.About the PositionAs a Business Analyst, you identify opportunities to run our business more effectively and serve our customers better. We provide a great runway for you to execute on these findings. A successful Business Analyst will thrive in this entrepreneurial environment amidst a mature industry using a healthy mix of creativity, strong business analytics, critical thinking, and good old-fashioned elbow grease. Great opportunities exist to grow this role to include broad responsibilities owning brand or customer relationships, and other career paths exist in multiple business units inside the company.You will:Develop analytics and reporting to identify opportunities and execute appropriate actionsManage a detailed product data on-boarding process and own the integrity of that dataConduct pricing analysis for products, brands, customers, etc. to improve profitabilityConduct market research to improve our position versus competitors in the industryCollaborate with a team of project managers and developers to improve processes and increase salesYou have:1-2 years of experience as a Business Analyst or in a similar role is preferredBachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or a related fieldAdvanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel (Pivots and VLOOKUPs)Multi-tasking capabilities and a desire to work in a fast-paced environmentAn analytical, detail-oriented personality with an ability to think creativelyStrong interpersonal skills for working with customers, vendors, and team membersA burning desire to learn and be impactfulYou’ll get:Competitive salary, as well as health, dental & vision benefitsA 401k plan that matches your contributionsGenerous vacation and holiday scheduleA seat on an energetic team that collaborates and pushes each other to be betterA fast-paced but cooperative environment with endless potential for growthCelebration events for team and company successes throughout the yearAccess to a group of smart people who care about what they do and want to help you succeedThursday Thank Yous: free lunches and fun activities every Thursday, courtesy of SUPPLY.comSuper discounted gym membership, team outings, company swag, and more Apply For Job

Name: Financial Analyst - FP&A
Description: I believe my work is my calling. Compassionate care, uncompromising service and clinical excellence – that’s what our patients have come to expect from our clinicians. Kindred at Home, a division of Kindred Healthcare Inc., is the nation’s leading provider of comprehensive home health, hospice, and non-medical home care services.  Kindred at Home, and its affiliates, delivers compassionate, high-quality care to patients and clients in their homes or places of residence, including non-medical personal assistance, skilled nursing and rehabilitation and hospice and palliative care. Our caregivers focus on each unique patient to deliver the appropriate care and emotional support to our patients and their families.  As a Financial Analyst - FP&A you will prepare financial analyses/budgets and act as a liaison to management for the interpretation of financial data. Prepare monthly financial management reports and assist in the monthly reviews. Works under general supervision but can act independently. Position reports to the Vice President, FP&A. Prepares and reviews monthly financial results for senior management. Analyzes profit and loss statements, prepares general analyses, and completes special projects/reporting as required.Provides presentations to senior and line management covering topics such as financial performance, improvements needed and changes to financial outlook.Responds to questions/problems regarding financial statements and budgets.Proactively performs research and analyses on profit and loss statements to understand key trends and issues.Prepares monthly financial management reports comparing current performance with year-to-date results and budget projections. Reviews/prepares monthly general closing entries, analyzes preliminary monthly performance and defines variances.Adheres to and participates in Company's mandatory HIPAA privacy program/practices and Business Ethics and Compliance programs/practices.Reviews and adheres to all Company policies and procedures and the Employee Handbook.Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.Approximate percent of time required to travel: 10-20%.Required SkillsBachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting or the equivalent.Minimum of 1-3 years’ experience preparing/analyzing financial statements and related management reports and presentations, month-end closings, and annual budgets generally required.Proficient in Microsoft tools (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).Experience in SAP, Adaptive and MicroStrategy preferred.Strong knowledge of financial software and effective communication and presentation skills also required.Must read, write and speak fluent English.Must have good and regular attendance. Required ExperienceKeywords: Girling, Girling Home Health, Girling Hospice, AmHeart Hospice, Asian American Home Health, Asian American Hospice, Girling Healthcare, Harden Home Health, Harden Hospice, Healthfield, Iowa Hospice, Missouri Home Care of Rolla, Omega Hospice, The Home Option, Girling Community Care, Odyssey, Vista Care, VistaCare, Olsten Kimberley Quality Care ~MON~  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin.

Name: Business Intelligence Reporting & Data Analyst
Description: OverviewBoys & Girls Clubs of America named "One of the Best Nonprofits to Work for in 2017" Indeed.comBoys & Girls Clubs of America is the nation's premier youth development organization. Our programs, training and services impact nearly 4 million children and teens every year. We are always looking for qualified professionals with a passion for improving young lives as a member of our national staff. We have strong values, embrace diversity and offer great benefits to allow our employees to maintain work/life balance.Under the limited direction of the National Director, the Business Intelligence Reporting and Data Analyst is responsible for building advanced reporting, analysis and data visualization tools for users of the new Club management system. They will also partner with the software vendor to convert Club data from existing system to the new system during the implementation phase of the project. The BI Reporting and Data Analyst will build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables them to identify and address critical issues that can be supported by data management tools, processes, and systems. They will work collaboratively with their team, Clubs and the software vendor to identify and implement reporting and data analysis tools that will increase the value and impact of the common Club management system. ResponsibilitiesDUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESData Conversion & Implementation• Develop and execute a strategy to migrate data from existing Club systems• Create training, tools and turnkey resources to help Clubs prepare for data migration• Partner with vendor to execute data conversions during migrations and implementations, performing extracts and loads and cleanup scripts as necessary• Support Clubs in data conversion activitiesReport Development• Design and build new reports to be included in the new Club management system • Work with Product Manager and Support teams in identifying and developing business intelligence, reporting and data analyses that are necessary for Clubs to successfully utilize the new Club management system• Develops and provides data reports and products to meet needs of multiple audiences• Train advanced users at Clubs to build reports in the systemBusiness Intelligence• Partner with software vendor to integrate data into BGCA data warehouse• Provides leadership and serves on interdepartmental cross-functional teams to ensure that data from the common Club management system is integrated into the BI tools and frameworks at BGCA• Provides guidance and independent service on highly complex, cross- functional, and enterprise business intelligence data solutions• Diagnoses problems using formal problem-solving tools and techniques from multiple angles and probes underlying issues to generate multiple potential solutions• Identifies and evaluates internal and external customers’ needs and abilities in order to provide appropriate solutionsOther• Participate on cross-functional project teams, as required• Perform other duties as assigned by the Product Manager• Demonstrate BGCA mission driven values of integrity, excellence and inclusion and integrate into work environment and ways of work• Adhere to organizational policies and procedures as described in BGCA’s Employee Handbook, Ethics Policy and elsewhere QualificationsEDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE• Bachelor’s degree required. Advanced degree(s) in related areas preferred.• Minimum of 3 years of experience in report writing and data analysisSKILLS1. Technical Skills• Solid understanding of relational databases and data best practices• Advanced skills in report development using SSRS, Crystal Reports, Exago or equivalent enterprise reporting tool• Advanced capabilities with SQL or similar analytical toolset• Experience with iMIS a plus• Able to develop the reports independently based on the business requirements• Demonstrated ability to interpret data and effectively present highly sophisticated analysis and findings• Advanced proficiency in MS Office, especially Excel2. Plans, Organizes, and Manages Time Effectively• Figures out the simplest processes necessary to get things done • Orchestrates multiple activities to accomplish a goal • Scopes out projects accurately• Breaks down projects into tasks, develops schedules, makes assignments; organizes people and activities3. Creates an Approachable Environment• Possesses a sense of humor• Is sensitive to and patient with the anxieties of others, particularly related to data • Practices attentive and active listening4. Demonstrates Intelligence and Perspective• Is bright, intelligent, sharp, capable and agile• Deals with concepts and complexity comfortably• Learns quickly when facing new problems• Is open to change; enjoys the challenge of the unfamiliar work5. Deals with Ambiguity• Shifts gears with ease• Can act without having all the information at hand• Handles risk and uncertainty6. Demonstrates Confidence and Credibility• Enjoys leading teams and projects• Sets strong but flexible standards• Takes personal responsibility7. Consults• Makes self-available for consultation to individuals/organizations• Helps the client look past surface issues to get to root causes• Offers relevant tools, information, and recommendations to cover gaps in client skills/knowledge• Offers deliverables and brings issues to closure in a timely fashion8. Designs Work Systems • Committed to continuous improvement through management by data• Is open to suggestions and experimentation• Creates a learning environment leading to efficient and effective work processes\9. Priority Setting• Spends time on what is most important• Quickly zeros in on the critical few and put the trivial aside• Can quickly sense what will help or hinder accomplishing a goal• Eliminate roadblocks and creates focus10. Customer Focus• Is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirement of customers• Gets first hand customer information and uses it for improvements in products and services• Acts with customers in mind• Establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers• Gains customers’ trust and respectENVIRONMENTAL & WORKING CONDITIONS• Normal internal office environment.• Physical requirements include sight, sitting for four plus hours a day, stooping; skills essential for successful communications include speaking and writing.

Name: Senior IT Business Analyst
Description: PRGX, Inc is the Global leader in Accounts Payable Recovery Audit, with industry leading positions in Supplier Information Management and Source 2 Pay Analytics. Fortune 1000 companies rely on PRGX, Inc. to reduce the time and cost spent managing suppliers, driving ongoing compliance with regulations, and automatically creating an enterprise-wide, real-time single source-of-truth for supplier data. PRGX, Inc. is publicly held and headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia. Job Description: We are looking for a software application Business Analyst to help manage the evolution of our internally and externally-facing business applications. Candidates must have direct experience in designing SaaS products. This role will include business analysis, requirements gathering, and documentation from all business stakeholders including internal and external clients. PRGX employs an agile methodology between stakeholders, the software engineering teams, and our UI/UX designers to deliver solution specifications accurately and efficiently. This role has key responsibility for documenting PRGX Inc.’s newest solutions related to Recovery Audit, Supplier Collaboration, and Source-to-Pay Analytics. This job is for requires an experienced business analyst who thrives in a fast paced, collaborative, start-up environment. Responsibilities: · Work with the Product Manager and project stakeholders to understand requirements translating business needs into user stories that can be understood by the software engineers  · Recognize and predict use cases to help design intuitive applications  · Developing user stories and breaking down requirements into deliverable functionality  · Analyze application/business domain data requirements and business rules, understanding the data flow from source to screen Lead review of features/development that has been completed during the Sprint Reviews of software produced during the sprint to ensure the requirements were interpreted correctly · Ensure the product backlog to align with the product vision and priorities Assist in the troubleshooting of production related customer issuesReview and assist with the generation of product documentation, release notes, and customer education deliverablesRepresent PRGX Inc. as a domain and product expert at customer interactions, industry and corporate eventsSKILLS & EXPERIENCE FOR THIS ROLE · Bachelor’s degree required  · 3-5 years of experience as a BA for a SaaS company  · Able to take feedback constructively and iterate on ideas and solutions from multiple stakeholders with differing opinions  · Meticulous thinker who can effectively work out all the details when presented with big ideas  · Understanding of user-personas and user-centric application design  · Excellent written communication skills  · Ability to communicate effectively with all stakeholders (e.g., technical developers, business leaders, and users)

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Summary:Looking for high powered and quantitatively oriented IT Business Analyst to support the Projects in IT Domain. Analyst will be required to analyze specific business problems and drive value in strategic areas of business. What you will get to do:Typically the customers would be Senior Managers / Directors from different Domains located in US, Latin America, and Asia Pacific.The analyst would typically handle a high impact project at any time which should result in bottom line impact.Most of the work would be around business understanding, data understanding, guiding junior analysts in data preparation, working with the statistical team to create models if required and result presentation. Must have completed Masters Degree in Computer Science.Experience in preparing basic flow diagrams, swim-lane diagrams.

This position serves as a liaison between staff, IT and DevOps departments in support of new of the processes and technologies. Frequently interacts with staff at all levels to identify needs and requirements and propose strategies and solutions to accomplish our business objectives. Name: CIS Strategic Initiatives Analyst
Description: OUR VISION FOR DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION FHLBank Atlanta contributes to our shareholder’s success through a diverse, inclusive, and engaged culture that enables all individuals to work together to fulfill our purpose. IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR Provides development, execution, oversight, and monitoring of small to medium sized projects and initiatives of moderate complexity and provides support on larger more complex projects as it relates to key aspects of the Bank’s Shareholder Business Development Plan generally and the Community Investment Services department strategies and tactics specifically. Works across the Office of the Chief Business Officer division in various leadership, collaborative, and supportive capacities to fulfill position responsibilities. A master’s degree in government and housing systems is a plus.One to three years project management experience, and the ability to take a project from initial specifications to design, draft, proposal, implementation and project assessment, while meeting deliverable deadlines and budgets.Demonstrated experience leading a meeting, strong problem-solving, decision-making, and excellent oral and written communication presentation, interpersonal, time management, and organizational skills. Ability to make sound decisions in short periods of time.An understanding of the Community Reinvestment Act of 1977, including the elements of the Community Reinvestment Act examination process of the Community Reinvestment Act regulations and their impact on the Bank’s shareholdersBENEFITS OF WORKING WITH FHLBANK ATLANTAComprehensive Health Benefits packageHealth Saving AccountsFlexible Spending benefit account for tax free health care and dependent care expense401(k) Savings Plan and MatchingProfessional DevelopmentCommunity Involvement Opportunities and Time OffFree Onsite ParkingOnsite Fitness Facility We are an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Our Company Ally Commerce is a turnkey e-commerce solution for brand manufacturers selling direct to consumers. Our multi-channel offering includes branded websites and marketplaces. We provide the technology, marketing, customer service, fulfillment and more. What sets us apart from the market is our combination of expertise and proprietary technology, which yields significantly greater results for our clients.  This is a rare opportunity to be part of building a rapidly growing business, with strong financial backing, for a product that you believe in. We are a collaborative, fluid, entrepreneurial team. Summary The Business Intelligence Analyst works closely with teammates across a variety of functions to improve and optimize overall business performance and drive outcomes in a fast-paced startup environment. Examples of this are standardizing analysis & reporting, improving the distribution of data throughout the organization, and working with others to ensure data accuracy throughout the system. This is a high impact role and this individual must be able to quickly transform & visualize data from a variety of sources to present to internal and external stakeholders. This individual must think critically, surface insights, make informed recommendations across the organization and ultimately get results. Our ideal candidate is smart, scrappy and can translate raw data into meaningful results for our clients and the company. ResponsibilitiesBuild tools & dashboards to monitor KPIs across multiple eCommerce functionsEnable the analysis of client performance across channels (Website, Amazon, eBay, etc) and deliver recommendations for improvementLead projects to add clarity to the performance of internal teams (Customer Service, Warehouse, Merchandising) through accurately tracking each functions KPIsWork with the Technology and Product teams to ensure we are capturing relevant & accurate dataWork with leadership on client-facing presentations, internal projects, and moreRequired Qualifications2-4 years of professional experience working with a wide variety of data sets to drive outcomes cross-functionallyExperience creating reports and dashboards with business intelligence tools (e.g. Domo, Tableau, Qlik)Demonstrated experience using SQL and working in relational databasesEnergetic team player who isnt afraid to ask the tough questions of themselves and others, and excels at independently solving problemsBachelors degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Engineering, or a relevant field of workWorkplace and Benefits The Ally Commerce workplace is casual in dress but rigorous in all other ways! You will be surrounded by smart people who like to work hard and have fun with each other. We offer the typical benefits including medical, dental, 401k and paid time off.  Ally Commerce provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. We prohibit any form of workplace harassment related to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status.

requirements (as User Stories) and Acceptance Criteria; and in determining level of effort for each User Story (e.g. story points).Required Skills:Bachelor’s degree or higher and a minimum of 7 years working in the Information Technology field directly as a Business/System Requirements Analyst.A minimum of 3 years’ experience managing requirements and conducting requirements analysis in an Agile environment.A minimum of 6 years’ experience eliciting system requirements using standard techniques such as surveys/questionnaires, interviews, user groups, documentation review, and other flows).Prior experience working with Testers and Developers to implement requirements.Must have prior experience being based at a Client site on a day-to-day basis.Preferred Skills/Experience:Public Health or Healthcare subject matter expertise.Proficiency with Jira Agile.Proficiency with Atlassian Confluence.Experience working in a rapid DevOps environment focused on creating APIs and microservices.Experience working at The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) or a state public health agency.Knowledge of HL7 2.5x and HL7 FHIR is highly desired.Certified Scrum MasterProfessional Skills:Must have excellent written and oral communications skills (clear, succinct, and direct).Must be comfortable working in a fast-paced, matrixed team environment, with a client-centric culture, and an environment of high performers.Must be able to shift priorities as needed.Must be able to work effectively with numerous stakeholder types and bring groups to consensus.ICF offers an excellent benefits package, an award winning talent development program, and fosters a highly skilled, energized and empowered workforce. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Description: You work closely with both our customers and the client's UX design and development teams. You are the product owner for a project and guide the team in making the right choices to maximize project & customer success. Our customers and implementation partners see you as a trusted consultant. Together we work on successfully delivering our enterprise solution and achieving our customers goals.  In the multi-disciplinary and internationally diverse teams at Backbase you analyze, capture and prioritize customer requirements for new customer experience initiatives. You perform business process gap analysis and write user stories. Every project has its own set of unique challenges that must be overcome, and you think and react quickly to find solutions that work for everyone.  On the customer side you are managing expectations and helping them translate their vision into a sound project backlog. As not all our customers work Agile, you have knowledge of Agile development methodologies. You organize engaging workshops with our customers to identify all technical requirements needed.  This role offers the opportunity to work side by side with customers worldwide. You will travel internationally frequently, sometimes for long periods of time. Nice to have: You are an excellent communicator and feel comfortable interacting with stakeholders at various levels.  Organizational and cultural sensitivity comes naturally to you.  You have worked as a business analyst for quite some time, held customer-facing positions and are familiar with Scrum and Kanban.  You have an analytical mindset and hold a university degree (preferable business or IT related).

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Title - Sr. Business Analyst Location - Atlanta, GA Required Skills: • Require strong Healthcare Business Analysis experience in the Payer domain • Experience in Requirements gathering, elicitation, user story documentation, grooming, assisting team with clarifications, change management • Agile experience. • Sound understanding of Claims Management System. • Must have strong Payer and Clinical background. Strong understanding of Claims data, Member and Clinical data sets • Should have completed at least two SDLCs for any of the above applications in the past • Coordination with Offshore team is required Job Description: • Should interact with business stakeholders to gather/elaborate and document the requirements • Should create use case models / user stories and should be able to elaborate them without any ambiguity. • Should take ownership on requirement management completely and coordinate with the Onsite PM to identify and escalate on any scope changes. • Should be part of all scrum calls with offshore teams, consolidate status and report back to the client as needed • Should be able to raise risks with respect to the entire project and work with the offshore PM/teams to mitigate them in partnership with the client • Predict situations based on patient history and minimize avoidable situations • Understanding of payment and settlement for healthcare services • Claims Management: Need to have a good understanding of claims processing and adjudication. • Healthcare Integration Standards • EDI Standards: must be able to work with Eligibility request/ response (EDI 270/271), Claims Management (EDI 837/835) • Knowledge of Health Level 7 (HL7 Standards) and implementation • Ability to write detailed descriptions and analysis of user needs business impacts and systems functionality for software development life cycle Thanks. kaushik.dhal@emids.com - provided by DiceBusiness Analysis; Agile, Claims; Healthcare - Payer

Name: Business Analyst
Description: JOB DESCRIPTIONJob Purpose The Market Administration Analyst will be responsible for managing the reference data for ICE's derivatives markets and distributing that data across multiple systems to the trading and clearing platforms. Additional responsibilities will include ongoing product maintenance, creation and execution of deployment plans for new product launches, and serving as a subject matter expert for operations incident resolution.  Additionally, the Market Administration Analyst will draft functional requirements for software enhancements to the systems and interfaces across the platform. The Analyst will also serve as a stakeholder representing the configuration team on new derivatives market initiatives. Duties and ResponsibilitiesCreate and execute workflow processes for reference data managementExtract and analyze product reference data using a number of tools (SQL, Excel, etc.)Work on the project team for new productsPrioritize and track the deployment of new product initiativesAssist operations with incident resolutionDevelop requirements and analysis artifacts including use-cases, activity diagrams, user-interface schematics, business rules, technical specifications, and process flow for ICE's derivatives reference data systemsKnowledge and ExperienceBachelor’s Degree, CS or CIS preferredMust possess excellent communication skills, written and oralBasic PL/SQL knowledge required. Moderate or advanced skills a plusMicrosoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio) - Strong Excel skills requiredDetail-oriented with demonstrated ability to write unambiguous requirements that do not imply designMust be results-oriented and self-motivatedAbility to effectively facilitate requirements gathering sessions, reviews, and issue resolution involving multiple stakeholdersAbility to work effectively in a fast-paced, sometimes stressful environmentExperience with derivatives industry preferredData modeling experience a plusExperience with VBA a plusExperience with API development (particularly XML, FIXML, and/or FpML) a plusExperience working on systems with high transaction volume management a plusCore Competencies Competencies are the skills and behaviors that are critical both to your personal performance and to ICE’s continued success. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionBusiness Analyst (Please, no agency calls or sponsorship)  OneSpring is a group of creative designers and out-of-the box technical problem solvers who believe in delighting clients with an unparalleled approach to visualization. We value critical thinkers, team players with humility and grit who are passionate about their work.  OneSpring projects, like our clients, span the globe and require big picture focus. As a Senior Business Analyst, you'll support complex, multi-disciplinary software projects, plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes eliciting requirements, translating business needs to a single consistent vision, translate technical issues, model and document business requirements, act as a communication broker, support test and validation through user acceptance test cases, and represent stakeholders as a surrogate to obtain information and verify decisions. In this role, it's your responsibility to keep all the players coordinated with progress and meeting deadlines.  We invite you to learn more… ResponsibilitiesThis role is not for the ordinary or mediocre- we are on the search for a serious and disciplinedBusiness Analyst who creates requirements specifications, analyzes requirements, facilitates elicitation sessions, and gets stakeholders involved at the right times and in the right ways to keep everything moving forward achieving exceptional results in an Agile environment.Ability to adapt and pivot on projects while conducting discovery and requirement research.Effectively communicate with teams and stakeholders in detail all project analysis.Creating concepts that are both usable and intuitive for highly complex and functional problems.Using low fidelity mock-ups and prototypes to visually tell a story solving business needs.Masterful as a "consultant" working with multi-disciplinary and stakeholders guiding them through projects with ease, credibility, confidence and achieving results.Requirements5+ years experience as a Business Analyst in an IT environment and/or Consulting5+ years in process design and requirement definition and gathering5+ years conducting and leading both live and virtual JAD sessions5+ years of leading cross-functional teams and guiding other cross-functional teamsProficiency in Agile/Scrum methodologiesExperience with SDLCNice to have user experience design (e.g. wire frames, mock-ups, site maps, etc.)Requirements visualization (prototyping)Flexible and thrives in a fast pace environmentToolsMS OfficeMS VisioAtlassian JIRA and ConfluenceVisualization Tools (e.g. Justinmind Prototyper Pro, Axure, iRise, or Protoshare)Education Level 4-year degree in Business Administration, Marketing Communications, Information Systems, Computer Science or equivalent area.  In addition, U.S Citizenship is required. Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information and be able to obtain a government-granted security clearance. Individuals may also be subject to a background investigation including, but not limited to criminal history, employment and education verification, drug testing, and creditworthiness. OneSpring is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or genetic information.Company DescriptionOneSpring is a professional services consulting firm with deep expertise in designing transformational solutions using UX, CX, and Human-Centered Design. We are a group of experience designers and out-of-the box technical problem solvers who believe in delighting clients with an unparalleled approach to solving problems right the first time. We value critical thinkers, creativity, team players with humility and grit. Our goal is to create beautiful and functional solutions that our clients love.  Learn more about OneSpring by checking out our website, http://onespring.net/.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: About SUPPLY.comWith offices minutes from downtown Atlanta, SUPPLY.com is a place to buy all volumes and varieties of plumbing and homebuilding materials. From faucets to floor lamps, we’ve got one of the most expansive catalogs in the business, and we rely on our crackerjack team of developers and data scientists to keep it all straight. The plumbing supply industry is about as old school as it gets, but just when our competitors think they have all the answers, we change the questions. How? By taking an innovative and entrepreneurial approach to every challenge, every day. Come on board, and help us build something great.About the PositionAs a Business Analyst, you identify opportunities to run our business more effectively and serve our customers better. We provide a great runway for you to execute on these findings. A successful Business Analyst will thrive in this entrepreneurial environment amidst a mature industry using a healthy mix of creativity, strong business analytics, critical thinking, and good old-fashioned elbow grease. Great opportunities exist to grow this role to include broad responsibilities owning brand or customer relationships, and other career paths exist in multiple business units inside the company.You will:Develop analytics and reporting to identify opportunities and execute appropriate actionsManage a detailed product data on-boarding process and own the integrity of that dataConduct pricing analysis for products, brands, customers, etc. to improve profitabilityConduct market research to improve our position versus competitors in the industryCollaborate with a team of project managers and developers to improve processes and increase salesYou have:1-2 years of experience as a Business Analyst or in a similar role is preferredBachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or a related fieldAdvanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel (Pivots and VLOOKUPs)Multi-tasking capabilities and a desire to work in a fast-paced environmentAn analytical, detail-oriented personality with an ability to think creativelyStrong interpersonal skills for working with customers, vendors, and team membersA burning desire to learn and be impactfulYou’ll get:Competitive salary, as well as health, dental & vision benefitsA 401k plan that matches your contributionsGenerous vacation and holiday scheduleA seat on an energetic team that collaborates and pushes each other to be betterA fast-paced but cooperative environment with endless potential for growthCelebration events for team and company successes throughout the yearAccess to a group of smart people who care about what they do and want to help you succeedThursday Thank Yous: free lunches and fun activities every Thursday, courtesy of SUPPLY.comSuper discounted gym membership, team outings, company swag, and more Apply For Job

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Hello Everyone, Hope youre doing well! Please find the below Job Description and let me know youre interest. Job Role: Business Analyst Duration: Long Term Location: Atlanta, GA VISA: USC, GC Position: W2& 1099 JOB SUMMARY The Business Analyst provides the first level of support for their respective business unit. This includes working directly with key business leaders to fully understand AGRICULTURAL EQUIPMENT business processes. The Business Analyst will gather business requirements and design solutions based on knowledge of the AGRICULTURAL EQUIPMENT environment while working closely with the global team to implement value added solutions. JOB FUNCTION AND RESPONSIBILITIES Provide Tier 1 support for related issues including data quality, configuration defects, training, reports & dashboards, user management, minor enhancements, and other system related issues. Oversee regional/functional change management. Work with global team to promote to UAT environment for testing. Provide final signoff once changes have passed UAT and been promoted to stage and production environments. Train end-users and support the business during roll out periods. Support business by identifying opportunities for process improvement and automation. Gather detailed business requirements and offer recommended solutions to Business Process Manager. Work with business leads to establish regional/functional priorities and work with global support team to implement prioritized enhancements within budget. Recommend and prepare documentation on best practices, business procedures, reporting, configuration and master data maintenance that can be handled by super users. Collaborate with other Business Analysts and identify solutions to business challenges. Own data quality for region/function. Ensure individual compliance with all AGRICULTURAL EQUIPMENT policies and procedures including Sarbanes Oxley, IT and Security. Follow established governance processes and standards. FUNCTIONAL KNOWLEDGE Knowledge and demonstrated experience in supporting opportunity and business case development, business process re-engineering, requirements gathering, and project management. Detailed knowledge of the following: How to link business processes to enterprise strategy How to create workflows and approval processes, design solutions, and update system configuration Security and sharing models How to manage complex data bases including database design and data quality management Good working knowledge of the following: Day-to-day operational environment locally, regionally and globally All systems being supported and their impact on the business both regionally and globally The roles and responsibilities of the key stakeholders within the region/function Deep expertise in one or more specialties with broad knowledge across a wide spectrum of industry technologies. Previous experience with Mobile, ERP, and other large system deployment is a plus. BUSINESS EXPERTISE Detailed understanding of the business areas supported by the systems is required to ensure solutions meet true business needs and requirements. Minimum 4 years of AGRICULTURAL EQUIPMENT commercial business experience Agricultural experience is a plus. Global company experience is a plus. ESSENTIAL SKILLS: QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE Strong communication / interpersonal skills, capable of interacting with multiple levels of IT and business management. Successfully influences diverse groups and teams in a complex, ambiguous and rapidly changing environment to deliver value-added solutions. Expert in advanced writing, verbal and other presentation skills. Bachelor’s degree in IT or a related field. Regards, Sai Deepika Talent Acquisition | Vuesol Technologies Inc. +1(678)568-2696 | deepika.s@vuesol.com - provided by DiceBusiness Analyst, Capital markets, SCRUM Certified
