Name: Business Intelligence Analyst - Diversity & Inclusion
Description: You will work closely with our All-In, Diversity and Inclusion teams to advance the mission and contribute to the strategic goals, initiatives, and activities of the team members and key stakeholders.  You will also develop fluency in the firm's people systems and help translate the All-In team's strategic and tactical questions into rigorous analysis. You will be responsible for supporting projects that examine representation levels of women and diverse colleagues, developing a methodology for measuring and tracking inclusion across the firm, and identifying high-impact initiatives through thorough understanding of pain points and return on investment.  Additionally, you will communicate and present the results of this analysis, help translate the results, and suggest potential actions supported by the data.

Name: Business Analyst I
Description: DescriptionJOB DESCRIPTION: Supports efforts to ensure that information systems support departmental objectives and information management needs. Works at the direction of Enrollment Services and managers and closely with departmental customers to conduct business analysis and identify objectives and requirements. and report the results of analysis conducted.  Collects, organizes and presents information to assist in the development of technology plans and strategies. Assists in planning and implementing systems related projects. Supports customer satisfaction by monitoring the delivery of ongoing information services to designated clients, responding to customer questions and offering alternative solutions to identified problems and issues. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Five years of position specific subject matter knowledge and/or experience in planning and applying information technology to one or more business functions OR a bachelor's degree and three years of position specific subject matter knowledge and/or experience in planning and applying information technology to one or more business functions. DATE CREATED.MODIFIED/REVIEWED: 11/4/10 DRSAdditional DetailsAdditional Job Details  Position Assignment: Enrollment Services Department  Direct Supervisor: Director of Enrollment Services Oversees, monitors, and handles information associated with the University initiative of maintaining the integrity of data management with respect to enrollment and financial data for the Rollins School of Public Health. Closely coordinates efforts with the Department of Admissions, Registrar’s Office, Financial Aid and Student Financial Services to ensure integrity of data from the status of admission to matriculation and throughout student enrollment. Assists in the conversion of data input and troubleshooting with On-Base. Assists in training and troubleshoots issues of projects with appropriate department personnel.Assures accuracy of all student enrollment records’ data including student program plans, student sub-plans affecting accurate tuition posting, anticipated graduation dates, external residency programs etc. Coordinates activities with appropriate departments that have different program options and demonstrates the ability to explain program options to customers and professional staff.Processes and enters student data changes such as course withdrawal requests, leave of absence, grade change status requests, enrollment status to residency status, degree extension plans, etc. Reviews and monitors compliance of change in status to assure compliance with University policies.Responds to inquiries regarding enrollment and financial data by Dean’s Office, departments, faculty, staff, students, and other university offices. Develops queries as needed to meet requests. Assures that the data released is in accordance with FERPA. Works closely with the Registrar’s Office in handling sensitive data requests.Coordinates, oversees, and administers financial aid awards for the School of Public Health assuring that RSPH students receive the allotted distribution for need-based scholarships, merit scholarships, and special departmental/program awards. Manages and enters the financial awards and award postings with host organizations/programs that provide financial assistance including the RSPH Merit and Assistantship Program, Adopt-A- Scholar program, Returning Peace Corp Volunteers, AmeriCorp, Saudi Arabia Fellows program, Humphrey, Foege, and Fogarty fellows, NIOSH grant recipients, Health Sciences and MD/MPH dual degree awards, four special fellow programs at Emory and the CDC, Yellow Ribbon program, and the RSPH REAL program. Maintains a record of individual award formulas and their disbursements. Posts awards to student accounts and apply for item types as necessary.Monitors merit award program and maintains records of all awards, scholarships, and fellowships. Initiates and coordinates the analysis of data of student acceptance and financial awards, determining whether there is a relationship between specific awards and the acceptance rate.Works closely with departments and the Registrar’s Office to assure accuracy of the electronic advising program process. Develops new advising reports for new degree and certificate programs. Updates program plans as necessary.Researches and develops a database of potential financial assistance resources for both national and international recipients. Assist individual students with their request of additional contacts for financial assistance.Monitors merit award program and maintains records of all awards, scholarships, and fellowships. Initiates and coordinates the analysis of data of student acceptance and financial awards, determining whether there is a relationship between specific awards and the acceptance rate.Works closely with departments and the Registrar’s Office to assure accuracy of the electronic advising program process. Develops new advising reports for new degree and certificate programs. Updates program plans as necessary.Researches and develops a database of potential financial assistance resources for both national and international recipients. Assist individual students with their request of additional contacts for financial assistance. Preferred  Enrollment/academic affairs experience or experience in higher education  Experience working with MS Office Products (e.g. Excel, Word, Visio),Advance experience in Excel including developing and working with Pivot Tables, OnBase to document business process and business process improvements  Experience extracting data from line of business software and use of statistical analysis software such as SAS or SPS to provide institutional reports for project stakeholders. Working knowledge of relational databases (PeopleSoft and OnBase) and CRMs such as Slate

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Who We Are:POSSIBLE Mobile builds native apps for mobile devices in iOS, Android and connected devices including Apple TV, Chromecast and Android TV.  We are trusted by and have long lasting relationships with our clients including renowned brands like JetBlue, PGA Tour, Hasbro and Major League Soccer.  More than development, our team partners with our customers providing strategy, consulting, and business analytics from start to ship to ensure each app performs well and meets user needs.  Founded in 2008 as one of the first mobile consulting shops, we pride ourselves on continually being cutting-edge and place a high priority on staying in the forefront of technology.  We are the mobile strategy, user experience, design, and development capabilities division of POSSIBLE, a creative agency, part of the WPP portfolio.  By nature, we are visionaries, innovators and pioneers in the mobile space. If that describes you too, then by all means, get in touchwe'd love to work with you.Who are we looking for:POSSIBLE Mobile is looking for a Business Analyst to join our growing team in Atlanta.  The Business Analyst will focus on system integration analysis and design, working closely with customers, functional organizations, application developers, respective users, and internal business leaders on defining and documenting various applications and system processes. You will be responsible for articulating concepts and solutions to project teams and providing technical expertise in requirements documentation. Additionally, you will provide leadership in the creation and implementation of business and functional requirements for mobile application integration.What you'll do:Provide technical expertise in writing requested capabilities, features, improvements and changes in existing applications.Identify and document process improvement opportunities, and translate them into requirements specifications to support business needs.Provide expert level guidance in requirements of mobile applications, tools and technologies.Provide mentoring to associate level Business AnalystsPrioritize features based on business need and scope through active dialogue with business stakeholders.Conducts business process analyses to understand, define, document and inform mobile solution requirements.Create Business Requirements, organize reviews, and obtain necessary approvals for handoff to project team members.Work with the project team leadership to identify continuous improvements as needed.What you'll need:5+ years technical business analysis experienceStrong business analysis skills and ability to quickly understand and analyze business processes and flows.Self-starter with a 'can do' attitude and motivation to learn new skillsFlexible, with the ability to multitask and adapt to changing business needs and priorities.Excellent verbal and written communication skillsRequired to have data query and report writing skills, enabling this person to study "data" in the environment and create ad-hoc reports as needed.Superior project management skills, to include breaking down major tasks into smaller pieces, attention to detail and excellent communication skills are required traits.Expert prioritization skills; able to manage tasks on behalf of the project team, while managing and owning backlogs in JIRA.Leadership and mentoring skills; able to provide guidance to others and step in to lead processes where needed.Demonstrate empathy, confidence, negotiation and decision making skills under pressure. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.  We rely on legitimate interest as a legal basis for processing personal information under the GDPR for purposes of recruitment and applications for employment.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Toolbox No. 9 is currently seeking a full-time Business Analyst to assist our team in taking our clients' projects from ideation to delivery. As a Business Analyst at TB9, you'll be working on a wide variety of digital application and marketing projects, ensuring the client s vision is carried out each step of the way and effectively communicating requirements across teams.This person will:* Collaborate with cross-functional teams and key stakeholders to identify product vision and capture requirements* Create and groom product backlogs, breaking epics down into detailed, development-ready user stories, information architecture and wireframes* Communicate requirements across design and development teams* Collaborate with project management, design, and development teams to identify gaps and blockers* Assist in devising product roadmaps, timelines and development strategies* Run backlog grooming and sprint planning sessions* Devise QA and usability testing plans* Develop user testing scenarios and questions for usability testing* Report on usability testing feedback and outcomesThe ideal candidate:* Has 2+ years of experience working as a business analyst in the digital industry* Has prior experience developing user stories, use cases, test plans and product documentation* Has prior experience developing requirements and UX documentation* Has experience working in agile/scrum environments. Relevant scrum certifications a plus.* Has strong hands-on experience managing backlogs in JIRA* Has a keen eye for details* Is an excellent multi-tasker who can switch contexts without skipping a beat* Can boil down complicated client requests into actionable tasks* Has strong customer facing skills and enjoys interacting with people, socially and professionally  Associated topics: analyse, analysis, business, business intelligence, consult, forecasting, government, guidance, legal, market

Name: Analyst
Description: Genesis Capital continually seeks qualified candidates for its Analyst program. We are committed to a rigorous, selective evaluation process to determine whether you are right for Genesis Capital — and whether we are right for you. From thousands of applicants, we recruit an elite group of self-starters who share our passion for excellence. While our expectations are extremely high, so are the rewards for performance. You have our commitment to provide the richest experience possible. In turn, we are looking for a small but dedicated group of individuals who see the value of such a commitment.  Analysts participate in a variety of financial transactions including mergers and acquisitions, divestitures, private placements, and general financial advisory services across a wide range of industries. Analysts will research and analyze financial statements, general economic conditions, industry specific conditions and trends, acquisitions and divestitures, and various investment attributes of both privately-held and publicly-traded companies. Analysts hone their business judgment, develop an understanding of how the capital markets work and learn how to model complex financial situations.  Genesis Capital encourages a collegial and entrepreneurial environment and rewards its Analysts with substantial responsibility and interaction with senior-level accounting and legal professionals and CFOs and CEOs of client companies. Analysts will complete a diverse array of projects, usually working on several assignments simultaneously. Analysts are members of three to four-member deal teams and work side-by-side with senior bankers.  The recruitment process at Genesis Capital is a comprehensive one in which we gather information and share feedback with candidates. As a potential candidate, we work closely with you to schedule meetings that are mutually convenient. You may speak with one or more individuals about the open position and skills required to fill the role. If there is a mutual interest, you will be invited to meet with further team members to learn more about how your skills may match the available position.

Name: Senior Business Analyst- ATG
Description: Delta IT is on a journey to becoming the best IT organization in the airline industry, a journey of transformation. We are changing the way we do business from top to bottom as we strive to create meaningful and innovative solutions and are looking for team members to help us realize our vision.  You, our Delta employees are thinkers, doers, innovators. We are proactive. We are collaborative. We deliver impact to our customers. Lets continue on our transformation journey in becoming a world-class IT organization while continually working at the world's best airline! JOB OVERVIEW: This position is responsible for building strong business understanding and relationships to enable the delivery of technology solutions that deliver the intended business value in the spirit of the Agile Scrum Methodology. The Sr. Business Analyst's primary responsibilities are to assist the Product Owner, business and IT product teams by the management of the Backlog along with active participation in the following but not limited to: Inception, Future State, Alignment, Sprint Planning, Retrospectives, User Story Writing and Refinement. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Responsible for conducting complex and thorough research of existing processes, systems, and desired objectives to meet the objectives of the assigned products  Work with Product Owner, and SMEs to prioritize feature development, based on the business value  Eliciting and creating initial epics/features and elaborating into user stories that clearly describe the functional and non-functional requirements  Delivers business requirements via artifacts such as epics, features, stories, acceptance criteria, process flows, wireframe diagrams, interaction diagrams, mockups/demos, etc  Collaborate with a cross-functional teams inside a Scrum framework  Coordinate multi-system solutions to clarify interdependencies so that systems appear seamless to the customer  Conduct work sessions and document new features, requirements, and strategies.  Perform testing in Dev and UAT environment.  Track bugs, enhancements and ensure issues are resolved before going to production  Able to work on multiple initiatives and balance constantly changing priorities. WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR? / WHAT EXPERIENCE DO YOU NEED? 5+ years of combined experience as a Business Analyst of relevant development life cycle experience in systems with 3+ years' experience as an Agile Business Analyst  Airline business experience, as well as business process re-engineering and/or extensive experience working with agile teams, is desirable  Define product requirements in partnership with stakeholders and in alignment with the overall product strategy  Communicate effectively and consistently with customers, partners, business and technical teams and maintain strong relationships with relevant stakeholders. Fosters open communication by encouraging the expression of ideas and opinions.  Integrate usability studies, research and market analysis into product requirements to enhance user satisfaction  A passionate commitment to user-centered design and development  Extensive knowledge of product and software development techniques and agile methodologies  Plan and coordinate the execution and delivery of a product roadmap through close collaboration with UX/UI designers, engineering teams, quality assurance, and third party vendors  Ability to negotiate priorities and to resolve conflicts among representatives from various business and development teams  Ability to facilitate meetings and requirements definition and be a liaison between internal/external customers, developers and stakeholders #LI-NHW

Name: Business Analyst

As a CBS professional, you will work across teams to provide the knowledge, resources and tools that help EY deliver exceptional quality service to our clients, win in the marketplace and support EY?s growth and profitability. Major teams within CBS include Finance, Information Technology, Human Resources, Enterprise Support Services, Brand Marketing and Communications, Business Development, Knowledge and Risk Management.  The Senior Business Analyst role is in the TAX pillar. The main function of this pillar is to ensure that projects and programs forming part of specific portfolios are completed on time and on budget and aim to exceed the business expectations.  Essential Functions Of The Job Responsible for elicitation, analysis and documentation of business, stakeholder, solution and transition requirements for an assigned program.Works closely with product owners and other subject matter experts to understand business and technology strategies, develop domain knowledge and to foster reuse and continuity of that knowledge across all projects enabling the program.Plans and actively executes the BA requirements management strategy; communicating, driving and managing the business analysis effort through all phases of the software development lifecycle.Partners with internal and external development and technology delivery organizations; prioritizing their dependencies on the BA to ensure successful delivery of solutions.Actively manages requirements traceability for impact and coverage analysis. Analytical/Decision Making Responsibilities Application of structured business analysis techniques appropriately; modifying accordingly to the software development methodology in use on each project (i.e., Waterfall, Agile, Other Iterative, etc.)Proactive approach to identification and articulation of issues, presentation of solutions and options, and, where appropriate, definition of path towards resolution.Prioritization of personal and team workloads to best meet organizational objectives Knowledge and Skills Requirements Practical exposure to various software development methodologies including Waterfall, Agile, RUP, etc.Hands-on experience with requirements management, modeling, and change control software.Excellent communications skills - strong verbal and written communication skillsTAX Domain knowledgeAbility to work effectively with external vendors and internal clients at varying executive levels.Good relationship building skills both within and between teamsFlexibility to adjust to multiple demands, shifting priorities, ambiguity, and rapid change based on client needsProvide guidance and oversight on effective utilization of Business Analysis techniques in compliance with organizational standards.Delegate, coach, coordinate and lead BAs and project team membersReview deliverables of virtual teams and report performance. Job Requirements A bachelor's degree (computer science, engineering, accounting, finance preferred) or equivalent work experience.Agile experience preferred5-7 years of relevant experience3 years of IT management and/or BA leadership a plusTax technology experience preferred Experience/Required Skills  4-6 yrs Visio  4-6 yrs Word  4-6 yrs Excel  4-6 yrs PowerPoint  4-6 yrs Lotus Notes  1-3 yrs Outlook  4-6 yrs Requirements Managment  4-6 yrs Requirements Development  4-6 yrs Process Modeling  Strong Facilitation, Analytical Thinking, Communication and Conflict Management Skills  Moderate to Strong Effective Listening, Leadership, Report Writing, Problem Solving, Relationship Managment and Negotiation skills  The candidate may need to provide examples of skills, negotiation and facilitation skills during the interview process.  Submit candidates interested in this position, not QA or PM candidates. Education Bachelor's Degree in Comp Science or related discipline, or equivalent work experience.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: What's The Job?Calendly is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to help drive growth throughout the funnel. This person will analyze and report on Calendly's acquisition, conversion and retention funnels break them down by segments and cohorts, measure the impact of campaigns and tests, identify areas of opportunity and collaborate with teams to optimize the business to grow in smarter, faster ways. The role will report to the CEO and serve the highest-priority BI needs of the leadership team.You will be successful in this role if you are a business-savvy, technically-capable analyst with SQL skills and an advanced understanding of SaaS user economics. We're looking for someone with strong analytical and statistical aptitude who possesses the ability to communicate business recommendations; someone driven to ask the right questions about the business and identify data-backed opportunities and solutions. This person will foster close working relationships with the marketing, product and engineering teams and company leadership.Responsibilities:Work as an embedded data analyst to help set, track and achieve quarterly acquisition, conversion and retention objectivesDive deep into customer data and connect our quantitative/qualitative research insights to help us better understand how we can improve the customer journeyFulfill data and analysis requests from the CEO and leadership team and influence Calendly's data driven culture with best practicesPerform analysis and modeling to show how acquisition channel, customer behaviors and product marketing initiatives impact LTV for each cohort and customer segmentHelp drive strategic decision-making and make business recommendations based on detailed analysis, insights and reporting on key performance indicators (KPIs) and financial resultsApply best practices to the design, set-up and analysis of A/B tests to drive iterative improvement through efficient experimentation.Measure the ROI of content and marketing efforts, including organic, paid, and earned content and connect content engagement to business outcomesComplete at least one in-depth customer behavior impact analysis (e.g., analyzing impact of sending a new onboarding email stream) within the first 6 monthsWork with the technical team to improve tracking implementation and data accessibility to increase the information we can measure and its accuracyCreate and maintain the right dashboards and data models in our BI platform, Looker, and specify data integrations necessary to conduct robust cross-channel and cross-platform analysisRequirements:2+ years experience in data analytics, marketing intelligence, or performance marketingA degree in Mathematics, Economics, Statistics or another quantitative field or equivalent experienceAdvanced working knowledge of SQL and excel data manipulationExperience solving complex business problems using data and transforming analyses into concise insights and recommendationsExperience with BI data tools (e.g. Looker), marketing automation platforms (e.g. Intercom), and other attribution or optimization productsFamiliarity with A/B testing and customer acquisition channel optimizationUS Citizen or Permanent Resident (we do not sponsor at this time)What We ValueCalendly is on a mission to take the work out of scheduling so that our customers can accomplish more. Our product is used monthly by more than a million people across industries like sales, recruiting, customer success and education. We're obsessed with providing an elegant, delightful experience for our customers. This shapes how we develop, design, market, sell, support and work as a team.We treat each other with respect and understanding, put first things first and never settle. While we're results driven, we always make time to learn, grow and have fun celebrating our accomplishments.  Our team members' well-being is just as important to us as their work. We offer competitive salary, unlimited paid time off and flexible remote work options to help maintain work-life balance. We also provide a parking or transit pass, snacks, happy hours, team-building events and so many other perks!  Join a diverse workforce, leading the way in scheduling automation.

Name: Business Analyst 1
Description: Job Description:  The primary role is to provide high quality reporting, analytics and automation support and solutions for Credit and Collections, while also providing secondary support for MFC Quote-to-Cash organization. Other responsibilities include:  • Understand, clarify and analyze customer requirements  • Communicate accurate and timely project status, issues, risks and scope changes to Business Support Services manager and customer landscape  • Work with team, customers, and business units to resolve BSS support related issues  • Plan and execute data migrations and solutions migrations between different platforms  • Develop and deliver comprehensive requirements documents and standard operating procedures  • Work with external/internal auditors to support annual SOX requirements  • Raise process/solution improvement ideas to resource manager and share new learning with the rest of the development team  • Capture, document and communicate best practices with other MFC reporting analyst resources  Additional responsibilities will include, but not limited to, assisting in effort estimation, status reporting and project time tracking to refine estimation model.  Key Responsibilities (List the top five to seven essential responsibilities in priority order):  1 Provide ad-hoc support in the form of functional data research, report generation, and analytical support 35%  2. Gather requirements and design/deliver reporting and automation solutions to meet project requirements 30%  3. Support recurring customer operations by generating month end reports, weekly/monthly metrics and other operational duties 15%  4. Training and support for offshore partners for BSS owned reports and activities 10%  6. Testing , reporting and governance support for MFC Strategic projects 10%  Minimum Job Qualifications:  Education/Training 4 year degree or equivalent experience. (Computer science or business)  Business Experience 4+ years related professional experience in business analysis and reporting  Specialized Knowledge/Skills  • Exposure in building SAP/BW and Business Objects reports  • Exposure in SQL Server including SQL Server  • Ability to handle multiple concurrent activities  • Excellent communication and documentation skills  Skills:  Category Name Required Experience  Software Skills SQL No Novice  Thanks & Regards  Parul Chhabra  Primus Software Corporation  Direct: 678 -666- 4393 | Fax: 770-234-4163  Email: parul.chhabra@primussoft.com  www.primussoft.com | 3061 Peachtree Industrial Blvd, Suite 110 Duluth, GA - 30097  Let's connect, LinkedIn: https://in.linkedin.com/pub/parul-chhabra/b1/42b/527

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob Description MarketSource Inc., an Allegis Group Company, designs and delivers innovative and proven marketing and sales-team solutions for companies of all sizes. MarketSource provides the unique skills and expertise to integrate brand-centric marketing and sales programs in the Automotive, Consumer Electronics, Information Technology and Telecom industries and relevant routes to market including Retail and B2B.  Founded in 1975, MarketSource, Inc. became a subsidiary of Allegis Group, Inc. in 2004. Our Company's culture centers on our core values: Open Communication, Relationships, Serving Others and Work Ethic.  MarketSource clients rely on the innovative solutions that vertical-specific, subject matter experts consistently deliver. Our team members thrive in a welcoming atmosphere of diversity and inclusion, better than average salaries, and exemplary corporate practices.  MarketSource is based in Alpharetta, GA, and employs over 9,000 team members. The Atlanta Journal Constitution named MarketSource a "Top 20 Workplace" in 2015, 2016, and 2017.  Position Overview  The role of the Business Analyst is to support self-service reporting and analytics initiatives across the business unit. This includes designing best-practice solutions that can lead to smarter, data-driven decision making and rapid understanding of business processes and process performance. The Business Analyst will understand technical aspects of databases and data warehouses, data infrastructure frameworks, data mining tools, data integration and collection, and appropriate analytic and visualization approaches. Responsibility will include delivering high quality, complex and timely reports and presentations to support various initiatives, and working closely with the Program Managers to identify and resolve potential issues for the client, before they become problems. Key Responsibilities:Design, develop and test reporting solutions using various tools and platformsConsolidates data reports and delivers to help drive data-based strategic decision making.Validates data, daily, through cooperation from team members and regular spot checks.Guide the business, serving as subject matter expert and thought leader, through the resolution of complex reporting and analysis problemsPartner with other technology teams to influence, maintain and effect changes to existing reporting systems and applications and act as key liaison between the business unit and software development teamsDevelop optimal business intelligence strategies to satisfy short and long term business needsLeverage an analytic mindset to develop visualization of key trends and insights for decision makingIdentifies issues, analyzes available data and information and Recommends changes to management.Provides analytical support of actual results against budget and feasibility of proposed business strategies.Create and maintain documentation for training purposes as requiredCandidate Requirements:2-4 years of experience querying large scale Data Warehouse Environments, in addition to uploading data via an ETL process2-4 years of experience automating and managing reports, dashboards, and supporting self-service toolsPassion for using data to effectively support business needs by analyzing existing reports and making changes as requested by usersGood working knowledge of Tableau, WebFocus, Power BI or similar self-service BI productsKnowledge of sales methodology and reporting as it pertains to sales activities is a definite plusAbility to juggle and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously and be comfortable dealing with changing priorities and timelinesMust be able to understand data and transform it into analytics, often in the absence of documentation, through data profiling, interviews, and reverse-engineeringMust be a motivated self-starter who can work independently, but also seeks out opportunities to work collaboratively with othersMust have hands-on experience coding and designing new reports, maintaining and enhancing existing reports, and designing dashboards on scalable intelligence platformsMust have written and verbal communication skills and experience working directly with senior business leaders to understand objectives and articulate the value of business intelligence solutionsAbility to interact with User Community to Gather Requirements and Transform it into Requirement DocumentMS Excel - Proficient with MS Excel including sorting, filtering, pivot tables, power pivots, charting, analytical formulas and macrosMS SQL Server Good understanding of SQL queries, including multi-table joins and data aggregationA Bachelor's Degree is required, with a degree in Information Technology a plusAdditional Information MarketSource is an Equal Opportunity Employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.SDL2017

Name: Sr. Business Analyst
Description: About Conisus Conisus  is a leading provider of strategic medical communication services to the  biopharmaceutical industry. Founded in 1999, we are dedicated to improving the  care of patients with serious or life-threatening conditions by delivering  superior medical education programs to healthcare professionals. Our goal  is to provide best-in-class strategic services while demonstrating unrivaled  service to healthcare professionals and clients, ensuring that all operations  reflect the highest degree of integrity.Summary: The Sr. Business Analyst works with stakeholders from all business units to establish best business practices, define and document business processes and software requirements for technology initiatives, including online products, content management systems, and business information systems. Deliver an effective project management service for a number of business and IT initiatives.The Sr. Business Analyst must be an initiator, a great communicator, a facilitator, assertive, motivated, self-starter, creative, agile, accountable, and be able to balance efficiency with effectiveness. Strong analytical and interpersonal skills are a necessity.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities Participate in establishing practices, templates, policies, tools and partnerships to expand and mature the capabilities for the organizationDefine the business problem and primary objectives of new projects taking into consideration cross functional and company impactsReview, analyze, and evaluate business systems and user needs; identify, write, and validate comprehensive business requirements to those specific needsDocumentation of client requirements, solution design, and other information to support the implementation of productsCoordinate requirements walk-through and sign-offs, verifying with user representatives and stakeholders that use cases and process models accurately portray specific business needsProactively identify, engage and lead business and IT project opportunities and provide benefits and recommended communication and implementation planAccountable for project timelines including managing internal/external client expectations and deliverablesLead internal and client discussions throughout the life cycle of the project and for historical reference as neededIdentify stakeholders for each project and develop a communication plan that includes a stakeholder impact analysis and a change management planPrepare and maintain all project documentation such as; initiation, delivery plans and budgetsEnsure business and IT benefits can be realized or that risks inhibiting realization are highlightedEvaluate potential software solutions, including off-the-shelf and open source components, and the system architecture to ensure that they meet business requirements.Ensure technologies are adding value to business usersEnsure end user support is provided with high degree of qualityReport project status daily to the technical services team and managementAdjust priorities to meet the demands of a diverse organization Qualifications: 4-year Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college/university. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Conisus Perks and  Benefits:Medical,  Dental, Vision401k  with company matchEmployer  Paid Benefits such as STD, LTD, and Basic Life17  PTO days annually (22 for Director & above)12  paid holidaysWFH  privileges for certain level of rolesWalking  distance to SunTrust Park and The BatteryOpportunity  to join the Care Committee

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Primerica currently has the following opening at our corporate office in Duluth, Georgia:The Business Analyst’s primary role and responsibility will be managing their assigned projects, for both mainframe and web based applications, throughout the entire software development life cycle. The Business Analyst should also be able to assist with basic support, maintenance and development of an XML-based SaaS application used for electronic client applications.The Business Analyst will be responsible for the following key functions on each assigned project:Interacting with and interviewing Business Unit SME’s to gather business requirementsWriting detailed business specificationsDeveloping and executing test plansPerforms systems and procedures analysis involved in testingProject implementationPost-Production verification and data validationAbility to assist with basic support/maintenance/development of an XML-based SaaS application used for electronic client applicationsIdentifying issues/concerns and communicating findingsResearching and assisting to resolve system issuesCoordinates with external vendors to ensure projects are completed on timeProvides data analysis for management and other users; experience writing intermediate SQL queries preferredTo determine operational needs for a project, the analyst will study business functions, analyze system data, and utilize the knowledge obtained from various stakeholders to develop comprehensive written business specifications in order to communicate requirements and changes to IT staff and business partners. The analyst is accountable for overall accuracy of project documentation, monitoring a project’s progress, and communicating to management project milestones and challenges.The Business Analyst would act as a liaison between management, the business users and IT staff. Additionally, the analyst would be interacting with a broad range of internal departments; as well as third party service providers. The Business Analyst should be proficient in creating and maintaining various types of project artifacts/documentation that will be used across the department for reporting and tracking critical data.Qualifications, Skills, and Abilities:Bachelors’ Degree or 4 years equivalent business experience3-5 years analysis, quality control, and information systems experience2 years’ experience as a Business Analyst or equivalent business and technical experienceWorking knowledge of basic XML conceptsIntermediate SQL/MS Access database and query writing skills (SQL is preferred)Intermediate knowledge of Agile project management and methodologies, including (but not limited to) experience with the following: Daily Stand-Ups, Scrum Meetings, Backlog Grooming, etc.Excellent presentation, organizational, verbal and written skillsAbility to work with programmers, coordinators, technical support staff, internal and external department management and vendorsAbility to work with extreme time sensitivity in a fast-paced environmentStrong analytical and problem solving skillsAbility to perform assigned tasks within specified time framesAbility to work independently and balance multiple tasks simultaneouslyAbility to lead projects from start to finish and work with extreme time sensitivityMS Office skillsAbout Primerica:Primerica is a Main Street Company for Main Street North America. Our goal is to create more financially independent families. We are located in Duluth, GA. Primerica employees support our representatives to provide appropriate solutions through term life insurance, mutual funds, annuities and other financial products. We insured more than 5 million lives and have over 2 million client investment accounts. Our stock is traded on The New York Stock Exchange under the symbol “PRI”.  Four years in a row Primerica has been recognized by the Atlanta Journal-Constitution as one of the best workplaces in Georgia! Over the past five years Primerica has consistently been voted Best Employer by Gwinnett Magazine in its special "Best of Gwinnett" winner editions. - provided by Dice  analysis, quality control, information systems, xml concepts, sql, microsoft access, query writting

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst Job Description  Job Title: Business Analyst  Job ID: BNS1009  Duration: Permanent/Full Time  Location: Atlanta, GA  Number of Positions: 6 About BNS International: BNS International is a leading global technology company. At BNS you’ll work in a stimulating, exciting environment where everyone is respected. You’ll discover a dynamic organization where teamwork plays a key role within our values. Integrity, empowerment, and commitment are also essential among our values, and are key to the success of BNS International.  The Business Analyst will support, train, and bring innovative solutions to the different groups and functions for the project with the intent of improving our business processes and profitability.  This position reports to the Team Lead, and will work closely with the Team and mobile support group, as well as the Business Units.  The Business Analyst position requires strong business skills to solve organizational information problems and requirements by analyzing requirements; designing computer programs; recommending system controls and protocols.  The position requires bachelor degree (or equivalent) in the same or related field. You must be able to rely on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Responsibilities:Determine operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats.Design new computer programs by analyzing requirements; constructing workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications.Define project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases, and elements; forming project team; establishing project budget.Monitor project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions.Prepare technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends.Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies.Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.Work closely with and business partners to identify and maximize opportunities to use information and technology to improve product, service and/or program business processes.Review, analyze, and create detailed documentation of business systems and user needs, including workflow, program functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer programs.Review use cases and other technical documents with IT project staff to ensure business requirements are adequately reflected in technical planning documents.Develop effective reporting tools for the business unit.Analyze the business unit’s activities and trends and compares analyses against the service standards and best practices. Presents findings and works with the Business Unit Leader and other personnel to identify and implement strategies that will address tactical and strategic goals.Prepare routine reports (financial, quality, production, customer service, operational efficiency, market share, etc.).Qualifications:Should have a bachelor degree (or equivalent) in the same or related field on technical roles in the field.Extensive knowledge of mobile platforms, and enterprise software applications, Web Applications.Technical experience with Web development and user support.Good working knowledge skills with Mobile and Web Applications.Strong project management skills with effective results focus within an information systems environment.Strong analytical and problem solving skills.Experience in the development and implementation of standards, procedures and guidelines to support operational processes.Self-motivated with the ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, and manage changing priorities;Proven ability to be flexible and work hard, both independently and in a team environment, in a high pressure on-call environment with changing priorities.Willingness to work occasionally outside of normal business hours.Excellent English oral and written communication skills.Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or related field.A results oriented individual who thrives working in a fast paced environment.

Name: Business Analyst II
Description: Your Talent. Our Vision. At Anthem, Inc., it’s a powerful combination, and the foundation upon which we’re creating greater access to care for our members, greater value for our customers, and greater health for our communities. Join us and together we will drive the future of health care.This is an exceptional opportunity to do innovative work that means more to you and those we serve at one of America's leading health benefits companies and a Fortune Top 50 Company.This role is based in Atlanta GA. Requirements include but are not limited to more stringent and frequent background checks and/or government clearances, segregation of duties principles, role specific training, monitoring of daily job functions, and sensitive data handling instructions. Associates in these jobs must follow the specific policies, procedures, guidelines, etc. as stated by the Government Business Division in which they are employed. Translates basic business needs into application software requirements. Primary duties may include, but are not limited to: Analyzes business needs to determine optimal means of meeting those needs. Determines specific business application software requirements to address specific business needs. Works with programming staff to ensure requirements will be incorporated into system design and testing. Acts as liaison with users of the software to address questions/issues.Requires a BS/BA degree, 3-5 years related business analysis experience, or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.Anthem, Inc. is ranked as one of America’s Most Admired Companies among health insurers by Fortune magazine and is a 2018 Diversity Inc magazine Top 50 Company for Diversity. To learn more about our company and apply, please visit us at careers.antheminc.com. An Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veteran.

Name: Business Analyst I
Description: JOB DESCRIPTION: Supports efforts to ensure that information systems support departmental objectives and information management needs. Works at the direction of Enrollment Services and managers and closely with departmental customers to conduct business analysis and identify objectives and requirements. and report the results of analysis conducted.  Collects, organizes and presents information to assist in the development of technology plans and strategies. Assists in planning and implementing systems related projects. Supports customer satisfaction by monitoring the delivery of ongoing information services to designated clients, responding to customer questions and offering alternative solutions to identified problems and issues.  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Five years of position specific subject matter knowledge and/or experience in planning and applying information technology to one or more business functions OR a bachelor's degree and three years of position specific subject matter knowledge and/or experience in planning and applying information technology to one or more business functions. DATE CREATED.MODIFIED/REVIEWED: 11/4/10 DRS  Additional Job Details  Position Assignment: Enrollment Services Department  Direct Supervisor: Director of Enrollment Services Oversees, monitors, and handles information associated with the University initiative of maintaining the integrity of data management with respect to enrollment and financial data for the Rollins School of Public Health. Closely coordinates efforts with the Department of Admissions, Registrar’s Office, Financial Aid and Student Financial Services to ensure integrity of data from the status of admission to matriculation and throughout student enrollment. Assists in the conversion of data input and troubleshooting with On-Base. Assists in training and troubleshoots issues of projects with appropriate department personnel.Assures accuracy of all student enrollment records’ data including student program plans, student sub-plans affecting accurate tuition posting, anticipated graduation dates, external residency programs etc. Coordinates activities with appropriate departments that have different program options and demonstrates the ability to explain program options to customers and professional staff.Processes and enters student data changes such as course withdrawal requests, leave of absence, grade change status requests, enrollment status to residency status, degree extension plans, etc. Reviews and monitors compliance of change in status to assure compliance with University policies.Responds to inquiries regarding enrollment and financial data by Dean’s Office, departments, faculty, staff, students, and other university offices. Develops queries as needed to meet requests. Assures that the data released is in accordance with FERPA. Works closely with the Registrar’s Office in handling sensitive data requests.Coordinates, oversees, and administers financial aid awards for the School of Public Health assuring that RSPH students receive the allotted distribution for need-based scholarships, merit scholarships, and special departmental/program awards. Manages and enters the financial awards and award postings with host organizations/programs that provide financial assistance including the RSPH Merit and Assistantship Program, Adopt-A- Scholar program, Returning Peace Corp Volunteers, AmeriCorp, Saudi Arabia Fellows program, Humphrey, Foege, and Fogarty fellows, NIOSH grant recipients, Health Sciences and MD/MPH dual degree awards, four special fellow programs at Emory and the CDC, Yellow Ribbon program, and the RSPH REAL program. Maintains a record of individual award formulas and their disbursements. Posts awards to student accounts and apply for item types as necessary.Monitors merit award program and maintains records of all awards, scholarships, and fellowships. Initiates and coordinates the analysis of data of student acceptance and financial awards, determining whether there is a relationship between specific awards and the acceptance rate.Works closely with departments and the Registrar’s Office to assure accuracy of the electronic advising program process. Develops new advising reports for new degree and certificate programs. Updates program plans as necessary.Researches and develops a database of potential financial assistance resources for both national and international recipients. Assist individual students with their request of additional contacts for financial assistance.Monitors merit award program and maintains records of all awards, scholarships, and fellowships. Initiates and coordinates the analysis of data of student acceptance and financial awards, determining whether there is a relationship between specific awards and the acceptance rate.Works closely with departments and the Registrar’s Office to assure accuracy of the electronic advising program process. Develops new advising reports for new degree and certificate programs. Updates program plans as necessary.Researches and develops a database of potential financial assistance resources for both national and international recipients. Assist individual students with their request of additional contacts for financial assistance. Preferred  Enrollment/academic affairs experience or experience in higher education  Experience working with MS Office Products (e.g. Excel, Word, Visio),Advance experience in Excel including developing and working with Pivot Tables, OnBase to document business process and business process improvements  Experience extracting data from line of business software and use of statistical analysis software such as SAS or SPS to provide institutional reports for project stakeholders. Working knowledge of relational databases (PeopleSoft and OnBase) and CRMs such as Slate

Name: Business Analyst - Treasury
Description: Who is Georgia-Pacific? Watch to find out!You know us already! We make Brawny® paper towels; Dixie® paper cups and plates; Angel Soft® bath tissue; enMotion® paper towel dispensers, DensGlass® gypsum board and Plytanium® plywood you see in your big box home improvement stores and much more! We employ about 35,000 people who want to make a positive difference in today’s world by creating real long-term value for our customers.  We are seeking a Business Analyst - Treasury to join the Georgia-Pacific’s corporate finance and cash management team. We need a tech savvy person, someone who enjoys working within financial systems. We can teach you what you need to know about treasury. A Day In The Life Typically Includes:Treasury Technology – Support and use the treasury workstation including administration as well as process and payments optimization. Seeks and participates in advanced development opportunities with the treasury workstation.Cash and Short-Term Investments – Execute investment transactions and analyze cash investment alternatives to maximize the company’s interest income.Foreign Exchange – Provide FX analysis and execute transactions around the company’s foreign currency exposure.Debt Compliance – Monitor and track the company’s debt compliance and debt payments.Innovation - develop innovative strategies for improving business outcomes and drive innovation generate a continuous pipeline of new ideas.Cash Management – Support domestic and foreign cash management, cash positioning, payments, and bank fee analysis.Financial Controls – Seek opportunities to further enhance financial and cyber controls.Banking Relationships– interact on a day to day basis with commercial banks.Digital Transformation—support emerging technologies and system integration implementations.What You Will Need: Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or higher in information systems, accounting, finance, or related field.Advanced experience with Microsoft Office (e.g., Word, Excel, PowerPoint).What Will Put You Ahead?  Preferred Qualifications: Experience with treasury or financial systems, coding/data analysis, or cash operations.CTP certification.Why Work For GP?You will be working alongside a bunch of great people in a culture that places top priority on integrity and compliance. You will have opportunities for career growth at one of the largest, most financially-stable companies in the world. You will be encouraged to challenge the status quo and share your knowledge with others, and your responsibilities and rewards will be based on your contributions. You will enjoy competitive pay and benefits that help you manage your personal and financial wellness.  Want to learn more about Georgia-Pacific?Salary and benefits commensurate with experience.  We are an equal opportunity employer. Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran  Except where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test.  This employer uses E-Verify. Please visit the following website for additional information: www.kochcareers.com/doc/Everify.pdfFollow us

Name: Jr. Business Analyst
Description: Job Description We are currently looking for technically motivated candidates, to be recruited as Jr. Business Analyst in to our team. Name: CACS Business Analyst
Description: CGI is looking for enthusiastic, analytical, candidates who have an understanding of CACS tables and functionality and can translate the business requirements into CACS tables. In addition to the design and definition phases of a CACS project, the functional business analyst will likely be heavily involved with the testing phases of a project, defining test scenarios and validating test results. Business analysts are generally also heavily involved in the generation of user documentation and training. 3-5 years of prior hands-on experience with CACS required or other collections systems.( e.g Debt Manager or Tallyman) Candidates with no collections experience will not be considered for these roles.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Our Company Ally Commerce is a turnkey e-commerce solution for brand manufacturers selling direct to consumers. Our multi-channel offering includes branded websites and marketplaces. We provide the technology, marketing, customer service, fulfillment and more. What sets us apart from the market is our combination of expertise and proprietary technology, which yields significantly greater results for our clients.  This is a rare opportunity to be part of building a rapidly growing business, with strong financial backing, for a product that you believe in. We are a collaborative, fluid, entrepreneurial team. Summary The Business Intelligence Analyst works closely with teammates across a variety of functions to improve and optimize overall business performance and drive outcomes in a fast-paced startup environment. Examples of this are standardizing analysis & reporting, improving the distribution of data throughout the organization, and working with others to ensure data accuracy throughout the system. This is a high impact role and this individual must be able to quickly transform & visualize data from a variety of sources to present to internal and external stakeholders. This individual must think critically, surface insights, make informed recommendations across the organization and ultimately get results. Our ideal candidate is smart, scrappy and can translate raw data into meaningful results for our clients and the company. ResponsibilitiesBuild tools & dashboards to monitor KPIs across multiple eCommerce functionsEnable the analysis of client performance across channels (Website, Amazon, eBay, etc) and deliver recommendations for improvementLead projects to add clarity to the performance of internal teams (Customer Service, Warehouse, Merchandising) through accurately tracking each functions KPIsWork with the Technology and Product teams to ensure we are capturing relevant & accurate dataWork with leadership on client-facing presentations, internal projects, and moreRequired Qualifications2-4 years of professional experience working with a wide variety of data sets to drive outcomes cross-functionallyExperience creating reports and dashboards with business intelligence tools (e.g. Domo, Tableau, Qlik)Demonstrated experience using SQL and working in relational databasesEnergetic team player who isnt afraid to ask the tough questions of themselves and others, and excels at independently solving problemsBachelors degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Engineering, or a relevant field of workWorkplace and Benefits The Ally Commerce workplace is casual in dress but rigorous in all other ways! You will be surrounded by smart people who like to work hard and have fun with each other. We offer the typical benefits including medical, dental, 401k and paid time off.  Ally Commerce provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. We prohibit any form of workplace harassment related to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status.

Name: Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them succeed financially. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you. Wholesale Banking provides financial solutions to businesses across the United States and globally. Our nine major business lines include Business Banking, Middle Market Banking, Government and Institutional Banking, Corporate Banking, Commercial Real Estate, Financial Institutions Group, Wells Fargo Commercial Capital, Wells Fargo Securities, and the Investment Portfolio. We also have groups in credit risk, group risk, finance, marketing, human relations, and the Wholesale Chief Operating Office that support our businesses.  Team members support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following, and adhering to and if applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business units risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements. Eastdil Secured LLCOverview Eastdil Secured is the foremost provider of financial advisory services to real estate owners. We combine superior capital markets expertise with a deep understanding of real estate fundamentals to execute a wide range of transactions for our clients ultimately producing superior results. By maintaining an effective platform that combines conventional real estate advisory and brokerage with the corporate finance and capital markets expertise of an investment bank, Eastdil Secured creates value for clients through unparalleled advisory services, individually-tailored structures, and marketing/placement programs that set the industry standard. Through the ability to navigate the challenges presented in any economic environment, Eastdil Secured maximizes opportunities with customer-crafted, revolutionary strategies that produce the most optimal and efficient transactions possible.  Our team is dedicated to the sale, financing and recapitalization of all major real estate product types including office, retail, and hospitality, industrial and multifamily properties throughout North America. Widely recognized for our capital markets and real estate expertise, our team is also known for their distinguishing access and credibility, incomparable experience, outstanding client service, and proven track record. Training Analysts start with an in-house training program in Santa Monica before beginning work with the Equity Sales group. The training focuses on financial accounting, cash flow analysis, credit analysis, financial modeling and valuation. Analysts will also receive on-the-job coaching, mentoring and feedback throughout their tenure. Opportunities Opportunities exist in New York, Boston, Santa Monica, Washington DC, Atlanta, Dallas, San Francisco and Chicago based on business need. The analyst program is an initial two-year commitment with an opportunity to stay longer at the firms discretion. ResponsibilitiesWorking closely with senior team members on presentations and financial analysis;Assisting team in underwriting for asset sales and debt placement across all property types;Performing comprehensive and in-depth company, real estate, and market analysis;Due diligence collection and review;Creating pitches, proposals, and marketing materials;Participating in client interactions to gain exposure to key executives and senior bankersRequired Qualifications1+ year of experience real estate experience, financial services experience, or a combination of bothOther Desired QualificationsA current student pursuing a bachelors degree with academic distinction and coursework in economics, financial accounting, corporate finance and/or real estate with anticipated graduation in May 2019.Professional experience through internships, part-time or full-time work and/or extra-curricular activities.Candidates must be able to work in the United States on a permanent basis.Candidates must demonstrate a combination of academic aptitude, quantitative skills, personal motivation, and distinguished written and oral communication skills. It is strongly preferred that your background includes:Dedication to building a career in the financial services industry with a focus on real estate finance;Willingness to work long hours in a demanding, highly focused, collaborative, and team environment;Energetic self-starter who is flexible, organized, conscientious, proactive, and detail-oriented;An individual who demonstrates a sense of personal accountability and urgency for achieving results.DisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.  Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.  Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionThis entry-level position will offer the opportunity to learn the business methods and processes for Enterprise Asset Management as applied to a variety of industries for purposes of optimizing production equipment reliability. The position will also afford the business analyst the opportunity to learn and work with IBM Maximo; a contemporary, web-based, best of breed Enterprise Asset Management system.  The role of business analyst is to work with senior consultants as they lead customers in applying industry best practices for asset management while implementing the Maximo product. Business Analysis will play the important role of participating in project workshops, taking notes, and then supporting the development of deliverables to the client in the form of business process definition, functional and technical requirements, and system testing materials. Business Analysts will also support the final solution deployment by assisting customers with using the system properly once the system is placed into product.  Business Analysts will also have the opportunity to apply the leading software development life-cycle methodologies that consist of both agile and waterfall methods.  Essential Job Duties  A successful candidate for this position will be able to execute the following job duties under direction of Cohesive Senior resources: Workshop ParticipationDocument Meeting MinutesDesign of User ExperienceBuild of User Experience PrototypesEnd User Training Program ExecutionPost Software Deployment SupportDocumentation of Business Processes and Functional RequirementsReport DesignsMobile Solution Requirement DefinitionSoftware Quality Assurance Testing Definition and ExecutionSupport Change Management ActivitiesEnd User Training Material DevelopmentEnsuring Quality of Written MaterialsOther duties as assigned Required Qualifications  Bachelors degree or equivalent from a nationally recognized higher educational institution in the United States, in the field of Business, Engineering, or Information Technology. Exceptional written and verbal English communication skillsMust have an aptitude for using and applying technology to address business problems and requirementsProficient in use of the Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)2-3 years experience with ERP, CRM systems, or equivalent systemsMust enjoy working in a team environment and with individuals alikeMust be a resourceful self starter with the ability to work aloneMust be capable of weekly travel to customer locations for long duration projects.Desired QualificationsCursory understanding of Relational Databases (Oracle/SQL Server/DB2)Beginner or better with Structured Query Language (SQL) for DatabasesExperience using the IBM Maximo Asset Management applications is a plus Other Up to 90% travel is required per yearOther Similar Titles: Business Analyst, Business Systems Analyst

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst  Our IT solutions firm needs an IT Business Analyst to join our growing team. We are looking for a professional with experience in both information technology and business administration. The successful applicant will serve as the liaison between the executive and IT departments of our company, leveraging the data the IT team extrapolates while also overseeing the selection and implementation of software programs and hardware resources. The ideal candidate for this position is detail-oriented and highly innovative. He or she will also be responsible for translating business needs to IT solutions, and vice versa, with current programs, projects and initiatives in mind. Responsibilities – Gather intelligence from corporate executives and middle managers about their needs, specific development requirement and future growth.  – Partner with application directors and creators to ensure each project meets a specific need and resolves successfully.  – Assume responsibility for project tasks and ensure they are completed in a timely fashion.  – Evaluate, test and recommend new opportunities for enhancing our software, hardware and IT processes.  – Compile and distribute reports on application development and deployment.  – Design and execute A/B testing procedures to extract data from test runs.  – Evaluate and draw conclusions from data related to customer behavior  – Consult with the executive team and the IT department on the newest technology and its implications in the industry  Work in a relaxed fun environment with developers that are top in their field.  Preferred Qualifications  – Bachelor’s Degree in Software Development, Computer Engineering, Project Management or related field. Or equivalent experience.  – 5+ years’ experience in a supervisory position related to information technology  – 5+ years’ experience in Business Analysis with a technology development and deployment work history.  – Expert Requirement gathering skills  Strong knowledge of Agile methodologies

Name: Business Analyst
Description: OverviewIngenious Med is an industry-leading web and mobile Healthcare IT Company. We automate clinician processes at the point of care, streamlining clinical workflow to simultaneously improve care and lower cost. In addition to calling 9 out of 10 of the largest health care systems and 8 of 10 of the largest physician management companies our clients, we’re also regularly recognized for our innovation and growth – including Inc. 5000 and Deloitte Technology Fast 500. Competitive compensation including Medical, Dental, Vision, guaranteed company contribution to 401k, education benefits and excellent paid time off. We're always looking for talented, smart, and independent thinkers to join the team. Ingenious Med is innovative and different. Are you?  Working within a project team, the Business Analyst is responsible for analyzing business needs from stakeholders, interpreting them into functional requirements, and leading the solution development efforts. The BA serves as subject matter experts through the life of any given development initiative and are responsible for collecting and interpreting feedback and ensuring that appropriate feedback makes its way into the development cycle at the proper time. At times, the BA supports the various department needs, including sales, marketing, training, implementations and technical support.Responsibilities· Elicit and analyze requirements from internal and external stakeholders  · Organize, translate and simplify requirements into user stories  · Drive completion of solution design and manage deliverables from Architecture and User Experience  · Work with Development and QA teams to implement solutions  · Communicate status  · Review and approve Test Strategy  · Accept completed user stories  · Manage project scope TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS · Less than 5% KEY COMPETENCIES · Must be proactive in identifying, heading off issues, and escalating when appropriate  · Strong verbal and written communication skills  · Excellent culture fit and ability to collaborate with the team  · Must be able to work independently within a quickly changing environment  · Must have an excellent analytical skill set, with attention to detail  · Proven track record of successful management of resources and timelines  · Excellent time and task management skills  · Understanding of systems engineering conceptsQualificationsBachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, related field or commensurate work experience5-8 year(s) experience working as a business analyst including:documenting results of analysis and work-flowsinterpreting customer business needs and translating them into application and operational requirementsworking with cross functional teams, including developers, architects, QA resources2-3 year(s) experience working within the Agile development methodologyExperience with managing projects from inception, through production release and beyondCBAP (Certified Business Analyst Professional) Certification, or equivalent, optionalExperience in a health-care related fieldMid-level SQL, database skills. Ability to write and execute queries.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Title: Microsoft Dynamics - Business Analyst  Location: Atlanta, GA  Duration: Full time, Permanent Job Description: The Financial ERP Functional Analyst will be responsible for Microsoft Dynamics 365 ERP Systems and Finance related software, as well as providing direct support for the costing systems.  Act as the ERP Subject Matter Expert (SME) and perform functions outside the scope of general accounting staff or functions requiring expert ERP knowledge and related software products. Business Analyst Requirements: A bachelor's degree in business or related field or an MBA.  A minimum of 5 years' experience in business analysis or a related field.  Experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 or MS AX 2012 or higher  Previous experience with successfully migrating organizations to the Cloud.  Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills.  Efficient in using Microsoft SQL, project, and excel  Prior C#, and .NET development experience is preferred but not required.
