Fundamental analytical and conceptual thinking skills.  Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations.  Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook.  A track record of following through on commitments.  Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.  Experience leading and developing top performing teams.  A history of leading and supporting successful projects.SDL2017

Name: Data Integration Analyst
Description: Working at Influence Health means making a difference. The work we do is important, so we hire innovators, trailblazers and leaders. We need people with big ideas who can tackle tough problems and challenge the status quo. If youre ready to design, build or deliver something great, you should join us.  At Influence Health, we believe in a culture of excellence and high performance. We value ideas and results. We hold each other to high standards. We believe our work speaks for itself. We take our work seriously, but not ourselves.  The Data Integration Analyst is a motivated self-starter, quick and creative thinker with the ability to design, develop, test, implement and support ETL/ELT (extract, load, transform) processes that pull data from various source systems and integrate it into the Influence Health data warehouse. This role requires strong technical ability, and a unique combination of business acumen and analytical skills--from requirements gathering to solutions implementation and reporting.  The ideal candidate will have a high level of curiosity and the desire to find new ways to be constantly more productive, effective and efficient in helping clients reach their business goals--this means facing new challenges and pushing yourself to work outside of your comfort zone.  The Data Integration Analyst will function as an integrator between business needs and technology, helping to create data solutions to meet business challenges. A strong drive to learn and a creative approach to problem solving is necessary in this position. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight, and insight into business decisions. Roles & ResponsibilitiesInterpret data requirements for various projects, analyze source data systems and design appropriate method to extract the correct data with good performanceAnalyze source system data to assess data quality; work with technical and business representatives to determine strategies for handling data anomalies identifiedExtract, transform and load consumer, clinical and financial healthcare data from various data sources into a centralized data repository which feeds our reporting and analytics products--integrations range from simple CSV and XML file transfers to complex real-time data transfersImplement new data integrations and support changes to existing integrationsMeet with stakeholders to determine what data is needed, when it is needed and structure it is needed inUnderstand business processes and learn how the data is used in the organizationCreate ETL processes to provide data to business stakeholders--establish and follow guidelines to extract, scrub, normalize and control data qualityMonitor all ETL operations to ensure the timely transfer of data between systemsWrite test scripts and evaluate results--conduct end-to-end testing with business stakeholdersCollaborate with stakeholders to understand data quality issues in order to cleanse or correct dataPerform troubleshooting, analysis, exception handling, and re-processing as necessary to ensure reliable data operationsMaintain documentation of process, data maps and integration flowsFollow existing source code management and version control processes for all coding effortsInterpret data, analyze results and provide ongoing reportsIdentify trends or patterns in complex data setsSupport ad-hoc data analysis requestsWork with internal and external partners to resolve issues--be a collaborative and decisive partner across internal teams, contractors, vendors and clientsStay up-to-date with data trends, including data warehousing, ETL processes, and CRM databasesExperience in the following disciplines desirable:Cloud services and solutionsDatabase design development and managementAnalytical sciencesInformation technology governanceData securityData models/structuresData miningSegmentation techniquesUse case developmentBusiness process designStrategic planningSkills and Qualifications:Knowledge of key health data standards, including but not limited to: HL7, Meaningful Use, HIPAA, and other data security requirementsAbility to model data attributes and make table structure changes if neededExpertise with querying and analyzing data from various sources including data warehouses, flat-file exports, HL7 interfaces or EHR vendor API'sDemonstrated ability to troubleshoot production data pipelinesFamiliarity with data exchanges using various types of encryption and transfer methodologies including web services, ftp and emailKnowledge of Agile methodologies and processesAbility to manage multiple clients, projects, timelines, and deliverables simultaneouslyAnalytical thinker--able to effectively interpret business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements, resolving complex technical business problemsIndependent and creative problem solver - able to bring new ideas and perspectives to projectsStoryteller -- able to organize data and research findings into compelling narrativesLifelong learner -- commitment to learn new skills and follow best practicesAgile -- effectively manage changing priorities in a fast-paced environmentAccurate -- able to produce high quality work deliverables leveraging industry best practicesPolitically savvy -- skilled in maneuvering through sensitive situationsAdaptable -- able to work independently and within a team environment. Comfortable with ambiguityDesire to help define and improve processes and deliverablesResults and service-oriented mindset, tenacious attention to detailExcellent organizational, time management, interpersonal and problem-solving skillsStrong communication skills as interfacing with developers, business users, clients and business partners are critical to successKey Technical Skills:Microsoft Office suite: Excel, PowerPoint, Word, etc.Expertise in SQL, including aggregation and grouping and relational databases such as MySQL and Amazon RedshiftBasic programming skills in JavaScript, Bash, Python, etc.Strong working knowledge of Linux command line and toolsFamiliarity with data formats such as JSON, XML (including XPath and XSLT), and flat filesFamiliarity with BI reporting tools such as TableauExperienceExperience in data integration with enterprise business applications, performing data validation on complex datasets, and reporting from multiple data sourcesMinimum of a 4-year college degree, preferably in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or StatisticsExperience translating data into actionable business recommendations At Influence Health we get all the perks youd expect from a leading technology company including competitive compensation and benefits programs to include 401(k) with company match, casual dress code, employee referral bonuses, quarterly social events, community outreach programs, free healthy snacks and monthly lunches, corporate sabbaticals, and the opportunity to work with a great team of talented, passionate people!

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job IntroductionJoin a core team within an established market leader to turbo charge product and growth initiatives within the organization. To maintain our top position in the payments industry, it is vital to attract extraordinary individuals - individuals who possess an entrepreneurial spirit and are driven to solve business problems.  The successful candidate will be responsible for supporting the operations, analytics and project management of the North American Local Mastercard portfolio. This candidate must enjoy a fast-paced environment with a desire to contribute in multiple facets of the business. Role ResponsibilityAs a Business Analyst, you will be responsible for ensuring the operational success of our North American Local Mastercard portfolio, while providing analytical insights into how to grow the business.  Key Job Duties & Responsibilities Include: Managing and implementing the back-end operational product processesWorking across the team to manage product reportingManage new product development projects from inception through post-market launchWork with the team to identify incremental growth opportunities through analytical insightsRespond to ad hoc requests for data and informationWork with vendors who support sales and marketing effortsManipulate large data sets and produce management reports The Ideal CandidateSome of the things we're looking for in you: Willingness to go deep on technical, operational processesPossesses an enthusiasm for managing projects and solving problemsEnjoys a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environmentAn excellent communicatorAble to wear many hats and work cross-functionally to develop and implement programs Skills & Experience: Bachelor’s degree in Business, MIS, Engineering, Statistics, or related discipline from top school0-3 years of work experienceSuperior analytical skills with a solid business foundationExperience with data analysis; ability to diagnose and solve problems leveraging data insightsA self-motivated player who is able to define, structure and prioritize workSQL and Tableau experience preferred, not required (willingness to learn required)MS Excel and PowerPoint skills expected Package DescriptionIf you are looking for a GREAT work environment with a GROWTH- ORIENTED company, look no further! Benefits on the first of the month following your hire date- no matter when you are hired during the month!Automatic enrollment into the 401k plan within your first thirty (30) days on the job: no more waiting until you’ve been with the company for 1 year!Projected company growth trajectory that shows double-digit year over year growth through both organic growth as well as acquisitions.Fun environment with contests and prizes!Inclusive environment that promotes career growth!Monthly employee appreciation and wellness events!An on-site gym and weekly discounted onsite car wash servicesRobust PTO policy including: major holidays, vacation, sick days, and personal daysDiscounts at major wireless providers, wholesale grocery stores, and gymsPhilanthropic support with both local and national organizations About the CompanyCompany: FLEETCOR (NYSE: FLT) is a leading global provider of workforce payment products and programs including fuel cards, fleet cards, food cards, corporate lodging discount cards, and other specialized payment services for businesses throughout the world. FLEETCOR’s payment programs enable businesses to better manage and control employee spending and provide card-accepting merchants with a high volume customer base that can increase their sales and customer loyalty.  Founded in 2000 and headquartered in Peachtree Corners, Georgia, FLEETCOR generates more than $2.25 billion in revenue through brands such as Fuelman and Comdata. We employ more than 7,800 valued associates worldwide. In 2016, FORBES listed FLEETCOR as the 14th most innovative company in the world, and FORTUNE listed FLEETCOR as the 74th fastest growing company! FLEETCOR is now a member of the S&P 500!  In 2017, FLEETCOR made its debut on the Fortune 1000 national ranking at #988 for the first time since FLEETCOR’s 2010 initial public offering.  Additional list highlights include: #309 Largest Company by Market Value#384 Most Profitable Company Overall#10 Most Profitable Company within the Financial Data Services Industry#19 Most Profitable Company within the Business Services Sector#12 Largest Company in Georgia by Market Value FLEETCOR has a culture founded on integrity, collaboration, innovation, execution, and people. This offers each employee the opportunity to ‘thrive & grow’ through career development, volunteer work, and community and wellness initiatives. This allows each individual to create a balance between professional goals and personal achievement  Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer  If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please contact your local Human Resources Business Partner and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Requests for accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to.  For more information about our commitment to equal employment opportunity and pay transparency, please click the following links: EEO and Pay Transparency.FLEETCOR

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Arke is currently searching for a Business Analyst/QA to join our team. As the business analyst, you will need to have a strong aptitude for relationship management, requirements gathering, transform requirements into a consumable format and technical acumen, including the ability to demo solutions and be an internal champion for the Delivery Organization.  As a QA, you will own the release management lifecycle on behalf of support. This would include QA, User Acceptance Testing, scheduling, coordinating and management of releases across different product categories. These releases can include product feature updates, bug fixes, new feature enhancements, and all other aspects introduced to the product line. Name: Sr. Business Analyst
Description: About Conisus Conisus  is a leading provider of strategic medical communication services to the  biopharmaceutical industry. Founded in 1999, we are dedicated to improving the  care of patients with serious or life-threatening conditions by delivering  superior medical education programs to healthcare professionals. Our goal  is to provide best-in-class strategic services while demonstrating unrivaled  service to healthcare professionals and clients, ensuring that all operations  reflect the highest degree of integrity.Summary: The Sr. Business Analyst works with stakeholders from all business units to establish best business practices, define and document business processes and software requirements for technology initiatives, including online products, content management systems, and business information systems. Deliver an effective project management service for a number of business and IT initiatives.The Sr. Business Analyst must be an initiator, a great communicator, a facilitator, assertive, motivated, self-starter, creative, agile, accountable, and be able to balance efficiency with effectiveness. Strong analytical and interpersonal skills are a necessity.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities Participate in establishing practices, templates, policies, tools and partnerships to expand and mature the capabilities for the organizationDefine the business problem and primary objectives of new projects taking into consideration cross functional and company impactsReview, analyze, and evaluate business systems and user needs; identify, write, and validate comprehensive business requirements to those specific needsDocumentation of client requirements, solution design, and other information to support the implementation of productsCoordinate requirements walk-through and sign-offs, verifying with user representatives and stakeholders that use cases and process models accurately portray specific business needsProactively identify, engage and lead business and IT project opportunities and provide benefits and recommended communication and implementation planAccountable for project timelines including managing internal/external client expectations and deliverablesLead internal and client discussions throughout the life cycle of the project and for historical reference as neededIdentify stakeholders for each project and develop a communication plan that includes a stakeholder impact analysis and a change management planPrepare and maintain all project documentation such as; initiation, delivery plans and budgetsEnsure business and IT benefits can be realized or that risks inhibiting realization are highlightedEvaluate potential software solutions, including off-the-shelf and open source components, and the system architecture to ensure that they meet business requirements.Ensure technologies are adding value to business usersEnsure end user support is provided with high degree of qualityReport project status daily to the technical services team and managementAdjust priorities to meet the demands of a diverse organization Qualifications: 4-year Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college/university. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Job Description SummaryWe are currently recruiting for a Senior Business Analyst in our corporate headquarters in Alpharetta, GA.Job DescriptionThe roleTo heighten sales performance and accelerate organization decision making by conceiving, designing, executing, and delivering world class analytics to sales leadership, sales representatives, marketing, finance and executive management.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Develop and leverage strong understanding of business cycle to conceive, design and execute world class analytics to accelerate decision making.Understand, innovate and leverage system landscape to develop queries, create and update dashboards, collect and analyze data for sales and marketing performance. Name: Business Analyst I - Entry Level (1-3 yrs exp)
Description: Description:  Qualifications  Degrees/Designations:  • Bachelors degree preferred with a minimum of 5 years business analyst experience in the Supply Chain/Procurement space.  • GEP and ServiceNow experience is a plus  • Consulting experience is a plus  System Knowledge/Experience:  • Business savvy individual that is able to interpret the data and not simply crunch numbers  • Advanced Excel and Powerpoint skills  • Ability to be flexible and respond to varied demands  • Effective organization and planning skills with a strong attention to detail  • Understands Supply Chain and Procurement concepts, practices and procedures  • Strong interpersonal, analytical, problem solving and prioritization skills  • Commitment to customer service and ability to work in team-oriented environment  • Written and verbal communication, ability to prepare reports and make presentations to various professional and public groups  Reports to Sr. Manager Strategic Sourcing  The Reporting/Business Analyst will be responsible for supporting the RFx process conducted by the Strategic Sourcing team. This will include scope development for the RFx process as well as analyzing RFx vendor responses to include compiling those responses into a presentation format. The data will be presented to upper management and the analyst also needs to be able to interpret the data and make recommendations for areas of opportunity.  Data source applications includes ServiceNow, SurveyMonkey, GEP, RFx results.  Responsibilities  • Interpret the data and present recommendations of opportunity in the following areas:  • Strategic sourcing  • Assist in ad hoc analysis  • Responsible for gathering, analyzing, and reporting findings on category spend data and market research to assist the supply chain team in making strategic decisions  • Research supply market to identify and understand the potential supply base with supplier cost driver's analysis and trends in the industries  • Analyze the different options by ease and benefit and provide full market and risk analysis and differences in all covered demand points  • Remain current in relevant industry trends, market conditions, and informed about key market leaders.  • Advice category managers on supply market trends (key competitor activity, effect of technology in accelerating globalization, collaboration, risks, and new service offerings).  • Analyze spend, gathering market intelligence and perform opportunity assessments to summarize, standardize and minimize costs.  • Perform in-depth analyses of bid responses and complex market conditions.  • Responsible for providing fact based negotiating support to category managers for direct and indirect products and services  • Support Strategic Sourcing in the execution of cross-functional supply chain projects, including RFIs, RFQs and RFPs  • Develop negotiation strategies  • Assist in the preparation, issue, and analysis of RFxs, contract negotiation and award with category managers  • Collect and analyze responses and populate decision matrix to allow supplier selection  • Prepare for fact based negotiations, planning least and most desired outcomes, arguments and responses  • Support supplier negotiation process, assessing success against desired outcomes. Challenge and negotiate to provide most competitive price/service offers  Perform other duties as assigned depending on department and business needs.  Requirements: Looking for a Junior Level Business analyst  Parul Chhabra  Primus Software Corporation  Direct: 678 -666- 4393 | Fax: 770-234-4163  Email: parul.chhabra@primussoft.com  www.primussoft.com | 3061 Peachtree Industrial Blvd, Suite 110 Duluth, GA - 30097  Let's connect, LinkedIn: https://in.linkedin.com/pub/parul-chhabra/b1/42b/527

Name: Data Analyst II

The ability to work diverse concurrent issues is essential.  This position must be able to communicate equally well with business owners, end users and technology professionals. or equivalent work experience3+ years experience troubleshooting or supporting web based applications3+ years experience with databases and database query tools (MySQL, DB/2, PostgreSQL)Experience with relevant business software, including Microsoft Office applications i.e., Excel, PowerPoint, Project, VisioExperience with the following technology areas: MySQL, DB/2, PostgresSQL, Ruby, SAS, UNIX, OSXPreferred Skills:Working experience conducting quantitative and qualitative analysisWorking experience working with SQL (Oracle, MS-SQL, DB2)Working experience working with reporting tools (Business Objects/Tableau/Jaspersoft/OBIEE)Working experience working with large scale datasetsWorking experience presenting data to leadership for decision makingKnowledge of data extrapolation, interpretation and chart compilationWorking experience in Enterprise Data Warehouses and star schemaWorking experience with all aspects of designing, developing, testing and implementing ETL solutionsWorking experience with SQL Server Integration ServicesWorking experience with SQL and strong Stored ProceduresWorking experience in optimization techniques for both SSIS and SQLWorking experience using Tableau or other reporting toolsCOX-493About Cox Automotive Cox Automotive Inc. makes buying, selling and owning cars easier for everyone, while also enabling mobility services. The global companys 34,000-plus team members and family of brands, including Autotrader®, Clutch Technologies, Dealer.com®, Dealertrack®, Kelley Blue Book®, Manheim®, NextGear Capital®, VinSolutions®, vAuto® and Xtime®, are passionate about helping millions of car shoppers, tens of thousands of auto dealer clients across five continents and many others throughout the automotive industry thrive for generations to come. Cox Automotive is a subsidiary of Cox Enterprises Inc., a privately-owned, Atlanta-based company with revenues exceeding $20 billion. www.coxautoinc.com  Cox is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer - All qualified applicants/employees will receive consideration for employment without regard to that individuals age, race, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, physical or mental disability, veteran status, genetic information, ethnicity, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by law. Name: Watson Health - Business Analyst Lead
Description: Job Description As a Lead Business Analyst, you will provide subject matter expertise both internally and externally to the data warehouse center of excellence and customers alike. You must possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy; a big-picture vision, and the drive to make that vision a reality. You must enjoy spending time in the market to understand their problems, and find innovative solutions for the broader market. You must be able to communicate with all areas of the company. You will work with an engineering counterpart to define product release requirements. You may be asked to travel as is necessary. You will oversee day-to-day activities of the business analyst team responsible for specifying business requirements to support the technical design and application development of healthcare reporting solutions. Essential Responsibilities:Lead a multi-disciplinary team of Business Analysts in a rapid and ever changing business environment.Lead the customer through steps of Agile/Iterative Methodology associated with the delivery of BI solutions; Requirements, Design, Development, System Test, User Acceptance Test and OperationsResponsible for facilitating customer Requirement Analysis Sessions (RAS) and is responsible for capturing and documenting customer business process models (BPM)Acts as a representative from the business area and to identify and refine their requirements for information, informing the creation of a warehouse data modelInteracts with functional users and data stewards/SME to ensure that all the proper questions have been identified and answered satisfactorilyClarify issues relating to scope and business requirements for project team (including technical implementation team, project management and client management)Assists Quality Assurance team with development, execution, and documentation of test casesWorks to identify and document data quality issuesAssists Data Modelers and Data Analysts in assuring requirements are traceable between the source data and target tables/entities in the respective data modelsLeads RAS sessions with clientsWorks with Implementation and Development leads to translate and map business requirements to technical requirements/specificationsDefines scope of work for work proposed to meet business requirementsDefine business requirements for change requests, investigate issues/defects and define remediation requirementsOversee the day to day activities of the Business Analysis team including but not limited to assignments, scheduling, performance evaluationPlays a role in the accounts leadership team, communicating across technical and delivery towers, in support of the Account Executive's ability to deliver on the contract requirements. Required Technical and Professional Expertise Ability to work on site in Santa Fe, NM 5 days a week3-5+ years of experience with Medicaid10+ years experience as business analyst for data warehouse OR business intelligence projects.Experience with large scale system development.Demonstrated ability to understand industry issues and problems, relate them to clients' needs, and propose appropriate solutionsExcellent organization skills, ability to take initiative and work independently or as a member of a small team.Excellent interpersonal skills and relationship building, ability to collaborate and build consensusDesire to continue learning more about healthcare and the technologies supporting healthcare dataStrong presenter, comfortable presenting in front of customers, conveying status, answering Q&ADemonstrated ability to convey complex ideas in an easily understood manner to guide audience through written or verbal communications Preferred Tech and Prof Experience PREFERRED Skills and Experience:Previous experience as a business analyst working with software developersKnowledgeable in technology, specifically data warehousingCompetent in at least one BI technology (e.g. Cognos, Business Objects, Tableau)Competent in at least one analytics technology (e.g. SAS, R, SPSS)Competent in at least on geospatial technology (e.g. mapinfo, ESRI)Understanding of both technical and business process MITA requirements EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: The Senior Business Analyst is part of the Professional Services (PS) team. PS is a team of highly motivated specialists with the specific skills and experience required to make sure that the implementation of our product at our customer's location goes ahead as smoothly as possible. The PS team also provides product training and implementation support services to all of our customers and partners. Every project has its own set of unique challenges that must be overcome, and PS team members must be able to think and react quickly to find a solution that works for everyone.  Our PS consultants work closely with partners and customers all over the world. They have the professional and personal skills required to develop, teach, support, and lead teams towards successfully delivering our enterprise solution and achieving their goals.  As part of the PS team you will report to the Operations Manager PS.  As a Senior Business Analyst at Backbase you work closely with our customers and the Backbase UX design and Development team. You are responsible for analyzing, capturing and prioritizing the requirements for the new customer experience initiatives of our customers.  This is a crucial role within the Backbase PS team, because you are in the driver seat to help our customers realize their customer experience vision. You have to manage customer expectations and help them to translate their vision into a project backlog that can be implemented within time and budget. The job comes with great responsibility and offers the opportunity to work side by side with our customers worldwide and guide them successful implementations with the Backbase product.  The senior Business Analyst is expected to: Gather define and prioritize requirements of the project in close collaboration with the client;Write functional requirements using use case specifications or user stories;Perform business process gap analysis and manage requirement change;Act as "product owner" for the project to guide the team making the right choices to maximize project & customer success;Configure the various customer experience building blocks using Backbase Portal Manager and Backbase Forms Studio.Your profile You need to be an excellent communicator and feel comfortable interacting with stakeholders at various levels. Organizational and cultural sensitivity are a must.  Skills & knowledge:  Essential: University education and degree (preferable business or IT related);Minimum of 5 years experience in a similar role for full service internet bureau;Minimum of 5 years experience in a client facing position;Experienced with Web Content Management;Experienced with Digital Marketing Tools;Experienced in requirements management an/or process modeling;Knowledge of multiple development methodologies, e.g. RUP, Kanban, SCRUM, Waterfall;Excellent written and verbal skills in English;Perseverance and pragmatism to solve complex problems;Ability to work under pressure;Ability to work in a multicultural and international environment;Extreme flexibility about work location and willingness to travel abroad frequently, sometimes for long periods of time. Desirable: Experienced in business processes and forms solutions;Experience in Financial Services industry;Experienced with Digital Marketing;Experienced in requirement management tools;Experienced in project management tools;Experienced with e-commerce.Why Backbase? Whether or not you've heard of us, you and your friends have probably used some of the products we've created. Backbase accelerates the transformation of digital banking. From being a Dutch startup company five years ago, we are now an international market leader. Despite having a leading market position, we haven't lost our startup mentality and we're not done innovating just yet. Working in teams with highly talented and skilled professionals from all over the world, we share a drive to make things better, nicer, and more advanced. More than 400 specialists dedicate themselves to what we do best, which is transforming global financial services with inspiring, innovative solutions. At Backbase, we love to create outstanding experiences, not just for our customers and users, but for ourselves, and this is what motivates us to transform our industry by delivering our best work.

Name: Business Systems Analyst-Campus Recruiting
Description: Category:  Business Analysis (functional and technical) City:  Atlanta, Georgia, United States Position ID:  J1018-3177 Employment Type:  Graduate Position Description:CGI is seeking students interested in careers in the Information Technology field. CGI is more than just an IT consulting company; we are a global organization offering a world of opportunities. Become part of a unique culture that gives you the freedom to innovate, to make decisions, to achieve your full potential and to chart your own career.  Our Business System Analysts typically have a demonstrated interest in technology and business, strong problem-solving abilities, and excellent interpersonal skills. Business System Analysts will be placed on one of our many projects and provide technical/functional expertise in identifying, evaluating, and developing basic systems. What you’ll need:Bachelors degree required in a relevant field (i.e.: Business Majors to include Finance, Accounting, Management Information Systems, IS/IT and other majors that include consulting and technology coursework) A great attitude and hunger for learningExcellent analytical, written and oral communication skillsFlexibility and ability to deal with ambiguityAbility to work within a team environment3.0 GPA strongly preferredAbility to work in the U.S. for an indefinite period of time with ability to obtain a US Government clearance What you’ll do (assignments may include responsibilities in one or more of the following areas): Business Analysis: Developing knowledge of a client’s industry, customers, organization and business objectives in order to help the client in a problem-solving role. Assessing user requirements, procedures and problems to create or improve a system. User Support Analysis: Providing quality client support by answering client questions, researching possible solutions to problems, and fostering open communication between the client and the CGI project team. Tracking software and documentation defects,  performing application maintenance, and providing onsite consulting and training as required. System Testing: Working with system developers and designers to identify, diagnose, and document problems and errors in specific components of a system. Assessing how well a product adheres to its design, standards, as well as its usability and ability to meet  business needs. Decision Analysis: Applying quantitative methods to study and make recommendations regarding various business issues, including credit risk management, customer profitability, resource allocation and optimization, and customer segmentation. What you’ll gain:Involvement in a team oriented atmosphereExposure to business issues and challengesOpportunity to leverage your computer knowledge and analytical skills Join our team and experience the commitment at CGI!  CGI IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER What you can expect from us:Build your career with us.It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.  At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.  Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.  Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.  No unsolicited agency referrals please.  CGI is an equal opportunity employer.  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, sex, religion, creed, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, medical condition, military and veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, familial status, political affiliation, genetic information, or any other legally protected status or characteristics.  CGI provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please note, this email address is only to be used for those individuals who need an accommodation to apply for a job. Emails for any other reason or those that do not include a requisition number will not be returned.  We make it easy to translate military experience and skills! CGI will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with CGI’s legal duty to furnish information.

Name: Junior Business Analyst
Description: Entry Level Business Analyst One of our highly respected client is currently seeking a highly motivated and qualified Business Analyst to join a dynamic team responsible for ensuring the quality of important and highly visible projects. Helps implement customer-centric solutions (web, mobile and call center applications) in a cost-effective way by learning and comprehending business process, eliciting and documenting requirements, and communicating clearly to business and technology. This role requires a level of energy and assertiveness to drive work with multiple groups in a complex, busy environment. The successful candidate will possess experience with full life-cycle application development along with exposure to evaluating, coordinating and creating deliverables; meeting with customers and resolving issues. The role works across functional boundaries to connect-the-dots between IT department products and services. ResponsibilitiesDevelop comprehensive E2E test cases at the application and multi-application levelsCreate direct channels of communication to software and application developers that get the job done without managerial interjectionIdentify business trends utilizing real data, compile analysis reports that are delivered to developers and then follow-up on all resultsImplement a comprehensive management plan for each project and hold regular stakeholder meetings to keep all interested parties updated in project progressDetermine and document user requirements for business processes and abide by those requirements for future projectsQualifications & SkillsMasters degree in Computer Science/ Information Technology (2017 or 2018)SQL database management and maintenance skillsPractical application ability with Microsoft Office and VisioDetailed analytical abilitiesStrong experience in user testing and project management

Name: Business Analyst - Salesforce
Description: RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce has a client seeking a Business Analyst - Salesforce in Atlanta, Georgia (GA).  Job Summary:  The client is looking for a Salesforce Administrator with a passion for winning in the Internet-of-Things economy. Our client is looking for someone who specializes in understanding how to apply new customer centric and "internet of things" solutions to join a diverse team whose mission is to develop new products and services that will truly transform the markets in which we serve. via information gathering sessions with business users and technical staff in Agile delivery environment Conduct analysis of existing business processes; recommend process improvements Create design documentation based on business requirements In coordination with the Salesforce Administrator, when needed, build and implement new solutions in Salesforce related to process improvement Responsible for customer understanding and ownership of related reporting needs Advise the organization when necessary on how to best utilize the data within Salesforce and reporting warehouse Assist in evaluation of app exchange tools Responsible for creating, managing and reporting backlog Responsible for development and maintenance of field reports/dashboards using Salesforce report builder/workbench Develop training materials and conducts training sessions with business users Track user adoption and report on related performance metrics Communicate effectively with business users on the status of features and enhancements Develop comprehensive test plans with users, coordinate test activities and/or help execute test components Achieve training plan and maintain certifications Up to 50% travel first 6 monthsREQUIREMENTS: Either already Salesforce Certified (preferred) or has a drive to achieve required certifications At least 4 years of experience working in a Business Analyst, Salesforce Administrator or SFDC developer function Detailed experience with the CRM reporting and analytics Experience with Service Cloud, Sales Cloud and Marketing Cloud Strong knowledge of Salesforce.com including workflows, triggers, reporting, general design concepts and overall approach of Salesforce.com as a CRM platform Knowledge of SFDC custom development and visual force code is a plus Proven knowledge of the software and systems development life cycle Proficient understanding of relational database concepts Knowledge of SSRS reporting platform is a plus Ability to analyze business processes, design process improvements, and train business users Excellent writing skills with the ability to express strategy, technical knowledge, and processes in easily understood presentations Ability to rapidly learn and take advantage of new concepts, business models, and technologies Ability to work independently and on multiple projects against deadlines Solid teamwork skills - works well with a diverse team Execution minded - someone who makes and keeps commitments Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Security Analyst-Data Loss Prevention

The main duties of the person in this role will include proper care and administration of the Data Loss Prevention (DLP) environments and monitoring and responding to the alerts that generate from the tool. not anticipated at this timePreferred:Masters or Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering or a related field5+ years of experience in Privacy, IT Security, Compliance, or related fieldKnowledge and experience with Symantec DLP toolsProfessional certifications such as the Security+, GCIA, and/or CISSPKnowledge of the telecommunications industry3+ years of experience in one or more of the followingSupporting Information Security TechnologyInformation Security concepts related to Governance, Risk, and ComplianceData Loss Prevention (DLP) Technology support and Event HandlingAbout Cox Communications Cox Communications is committed to creating meaningful moments of human connection through broadband applications and services. The largest private telecom company in America, we proudly serve six million homes and businesses across 18 states. We're dedicated to empowering others to build a better future and celebrate diverse products, people, suppliers, communities and the characteristics that makes each one unique. Cox Communications is the largest division of Cox Enterprises, a family-owned business founded in 1898 by Governor James M. Cox. manage multiple projects and responsibilities, utilizing agile/sprint methodology for work management, and continually prioritizing what’s most importantPursues continual improvement and exhibits personal drive for excellenceStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsStrong written and oral communication skillsServant spirit with strong sense of stewardshipAttention to detailTravel: up to 5-10% Preferred QualificationsFamiliarity with and understanding of payroll and labor software environments within the retail and/or restaurant industryExperience developing reports and visualizations Name: Associate Business Analyst- Operations Research
Description: YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES IN THIS ROLE:-Work on a variety of high-visibility IT projects either in the form of internal development or in conjunction with internal and external partners. -Actively communicate with the customer (e. g., the partnering IT and business units) to clearly define needs, report progress, define an execution plan and formally report results in a concise and understandable way. -Provide expertise and advice to business unit owners, IT leaders, project teams, and other support teams.-Understand, document and prioritize high level business requirements.-Convert high level business requirements into executable, detailed action items to enable development.-Identify gaps in the application functionality and work with the Optimization team and IT application owner to provide solutions.-Work with application support and development teams to fix software bugs and escalate issues.WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR? / WHAT EXPERIENCE DO YOU NEED?-M. Sc. or Ph. D. in Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science or a comparable quantitative field.-Ability to understand customer and business needs and convert them into a compelling product vision.-Ability to create detailed, well-written documentation for a variety of audiences.-Excellent stakeholder management and influencing skills.-Excellent problem-solving, analytical and verbal and written communication skills.-Enthusiasm to proactively coordinate and take action within a team environment.-Strong initiative and desire to work with urgency.-Ability to work well collaboratively and independently.-Superb background in modeling, optimization and algorithms.-Experience with constructing and implementing optimization models.-Excellent programming skills.-Experience in using commercial solver software such as CPLEX, Gurobi and Xpress.-Experience with the use of an algebraic modeling language such as AMPL.-Experience with data visualization software such as Tableau.-Work experience with airline planning and operations is strongly preferred.As thought leaders within Delta, we strive to create meaningful and innovative solutions and are always looking for team members to help us realize our vision. This is your chance to bring to us your passion for proactively identifying opportunities to leverage technical solutions and emerging technologies to facilitate business solutions.Develops both strategic and tactical plans that create a safety-conscious environment resulting in employee safety and well-being.

Name: Capitation Business Analyst
Description: telecommute, can sit anywhere in US. flex on TimeZone Specific Duties: Serve as a subject matter expert for Capitation Processing and Administration  Be the business subject matter expert, experienced in business analysis and requirements gathering  Act as business liaison to technology teams for project discussions and planning  Assist in formulating and defining business system scope and objectives through research and fact finding under broad general direction with minimal supervision  Assess operational impacts to other business areas / systems for financial system enhancements and vice versa  Develop detailed business requirements, test plans and scripts, and perform implementation check out processes for projects; maintain defect documentation / resolution library  o Develop business scenarios and test cases for E2E testing. Perform E2E testing.  Assimilate, integrate and interface technical and business knowledge with business system or process requirements  Lead and manage customer readiness activities and project implementation teams in process improvement activities  Coordinate and conduct user acceptance testing with other systems and business areas  Participate in Agile Scrum methodology meetings  Gather, develop, and document business requirements and user stories - ensure requirements are clear, concise and complete  Facilitate work sessions to gather business requirements / user stories  Participate in project / program requirements, features, solution walkthroughs and design sessions  Support all phases of agile software development to include initiation, design, development and testing  Collaborate with project stakeholders and technical teams regarding enhancements, changes, issues and defects that may impact development, data, workflow and functionality Must have qualifications/experience: Previous experience with Capitation Processing and Administration for a variety of capitation payment methodologies including Per Member Per Month, Percent of Premium, Capitation Deductions  Bachelor s degree or equivalent work experience  Agile certification or equivalent work experience in an Agile environment  3+ years of experience in writing business and/or system requirements  2+ years of experience with documenting processes and practices, often in accepted project methodology artifacts, while effectively prioritizing multiple tasks, priorities, projects, and deadlines  2+ years of experience using MS Project, MS Visio, MS PowerPoint, MS Excel  Experience participating in projects that have various levels of complexity  Shift Start/End Time: flexible. 8 hour shift Mon-Fri  Dress Code: not applicable  (Please update as needed)  As a Business Analyst, you will use your sharp business skills to assist in creating, controlling and improving business processes and platform solutions related to Capitation. You will report to and support the the Product Owner for capitation, performing duties as assigned. You will solve complex problems as you serve as a resource to others on your elite team. You will create process design, project implementation, diagnose process improvement opportunities and develop solutions. You will support the design and creation of platform solutions. You will also provide quality reporting, analysis, audits, and develop plans and programs to support continuous quality improvement.BenefitsAt Maxim Healthcare Services, we firmly believe that our employees are the heartbeat of our organization and we are happy to offer the following benefits:Competitive pay & weekly paychecksHealth, dental, vision, and life insurance401(k) savings planAwards and recognition programsBenefit eligibility is dependent on employment status.Maxim Healthcare Services is a leading provider of home healthcare, medical-related staffing, travel nursing, and population health and wellness services across the United States. As an established community partner, we have been making a difference in the lives of our employees, caregivers, and patients for more than 30 years. Our commitment to customer service, improving patient care, and staffing experienced healthcare professionals has paved the way for many rewarding career opportunities in the healthcare industry.Maxim Healthcare Services, Inc. is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity EmployerAssociated topics: analyse, bi, business, business analytic, business finance, business systems analyst, consult, financial analytic, government, investment analyst

Name: Business Analyst

Responsibilities: Leads requirements analysis, validation and verification, ensuring that requirement statements are complete, consistent, concise, comprehensible, traceable, feasible, unambiguous and verifiable. Strong organizational, analytical and project management skills.  Ability to develop wire frames, workflows, case diagrams, flowcharts and other analyst-type documentation. Name: Sales Analyst - US
Description: At Kids II, we’re really good at what we do. And when we’re great at our jobs, we help parents be great at their jobs.  Parenting is demanding, and that’s where we come in. We want to reimagine how brands can make it easier for early stage parents – not by just selling them products, but by providing holistic solutions that transcend borders, categories and aisles.  No matter our title or department, at Kids II, our job is to create more tiny wins for parents, so they can create bright futures for their little ones. That’s a big task!  We’re serious about what we do, AND we love to have fun. Our team is hardworking, entrepreneurial, and passionate about helping families create millions, if not billions of tiny wins. SUMMARY The Sales Analyst supports the Account Team to drive sales and long-term initiatives with customer interaction and communication. The sales analyst provides sales reporting and data analytics to the Sales, Operations, Category. and Finance teams to drive key decision making and success measurement of the business relative to sales. The Sales Analyst creates and maintains weekly and monthly reports regarding sales trends including point of sale data and customer inventory metrics. Sales Analysts play a key role in the monthly forecast consensus process by providing key inputs regarding potential impacts to future forecasts. PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES AND ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Weekly reporting/tracking using customer POS data: Sales, Inventory, Promotions, New Items, etc.Prepare monthly segment trend, competitive analysis and promotional analysis along with insights using POS and syndicated data.Provide support for period and promotional forecastingDevelop and manage account specific business plan/annual sales planHelp with business reviews and fact-based account predictionsAssist with clearing of deductionsAssist in the identification and analysis of business issues and opportunitiesInteraction, Communication, and Collaboration with the account (Buyer, Inventory Analyst)Provide Ad-hoc support and analysis as neededMaintain technical skills on appropriate software applications to provide optimum level of supportOther duties and responsibilities as assigned.QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE1-2 years’ experience in sales or financial analysisExperience and demonstrated ability to analyze data and make appropriate recommendationsAnalytics: Business and marketplaceAdvanced Excel experience with pivot tables, graphs, and reportingEDUCATION & SKILLS4-year college degree in business, engineering, or related fieldPlans and manages effectivelyCritical thinking and problem solvingFocuses on the customerCommunication: Internal and externalExcellent communication skills and working with cross functional groups and customerAbility to consult with account teams and proactively identify appropriateCommunicate and work collaboratively internally and customerDemonstrated ability to work independentlyService orientedLearning agilityCERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS None required. COMPUTER/TYPING SKILLS Must be proficient in PowerPoint, Excel and Word; basic understanding of Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photo Shop  We offer competitive pay, flexible hours, and generous benefits. Plus, to keep things fun (because we are all kids at heart), we offer a host of team member activities and philanthropic efforts throughout the year and company-wide awards and recognition for a job well done!  Check out our website at www.kidsii.com and our social media pages on LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram for more information and open positions in the career section.  Drug Free Workplace M/F/D/V

Name: Business/ Data Analyst
Description: Candid Partners is a cloud consulting firm which combines enterprise-class scale and process with born-in-the-cloud domain expertise. Candid’s seasoned management consultants, coming from the world’s top firms, easily translate complex business needs into specific technology solutions. Our technology consultants have deep public cloud and AWS specialty expertise with more than 80 percent holding AWS accreditations or certifications.  Candid is currently seeking an experienced Business Analyst with Data Analytics experience to join our team of expert management consultants. This person will be working with, and documenting where necessary, the existing and new data model. The Business Analyst is an active participant in all phases of the project lifecycle and will be required to work closely with a variety of internal and external business partners to ensure that all business requirements are met. What you’ll be doing:Understand (and document, where necessary) the existing data modelProvide input and feedback to the new data modelUnderstand existing business performance management reportsDesign new / clearer business performance management reportsDesign / provide requirements for: reporting and data reconciliation processes (i.e. “Audit” processes to make sure our databases do not get out of sync)Manage / assist with migration and data mapping activitiesManage / assist with addressing data quality issues with existing systemPossibly participate in data mining activitiesLead JAD sessions and individual client interviews (discovery and review sessions)Interface with clients and technical teams, including UX designersAddress issues with existing systemCapabilities/ Experience:Process re-engineering, including:Value analysisAs Is and To Be diagrams in Vision Lucid Chart or equivalentDiscovering and documenting process improvement and the value introduced by these changesOCM and role definition for new processesAssist with transition planning to new systemPrototyping, includingUse of prototyping tools such as Invision or iRiseData analysis, including:Creating Data Flow Diagrams (i.e., probably in a support role)Composing queries in SQL or equivalent (i.e., probably in a support role)Understanding entity relationshipsPresentation skills, including:Creating quality PowerPoint slidesComfortable presenting to multiple levels of management Candid Partners is one of the fastest growing companies in the US. Every day brings a new problem to solve and a chance to grow professionally and personally. We hire the best and brightest. You’ll collaborate with a team of like-minded, ambitious experts with the technical talent and business acumen your projects need to succeed. Not only that, but we were voted one of Atlanta’s Best Places to Work by the Atlanta Business Chronicle’s in 2017.  Are you ready to make your unique mark on Candid’s Culture?

Name: Hybris Commerce Business Analyst
Description: Job descriptionAccenture Digital The digital revolution is changing everything, transforming how we work and play. Are you reacting to the disruption each day or are you leading the way as a digital disrupter? Accenture Digital is driving these exciting changes and bringing them to life across 40 industries in more than 120 countries. At the forefront of digital, you’ll create it, own it and make it a reality for clients looking to better serve their connected customers and operate always-on enterprises. Join us and become an integral part of our experienced digital team with the credibility, expertise and insight clients depend on. Accenture Interactive Accenture Digital is powered by three practices – Interactive, Mobility and Analytics. Accenture Interactive helps the world’s leading brands delight their customers and deliver superior business performance and customer experiences. As part of Accenture Interactive Delivery, you’ll balance art and science to create award-winning digital experiences for today’s connected consumers through integrated and dynamic solutions that incorporate strategy, marketing, creative and technology. JOB DESCRIPTION Do clients rely on your impressive ability to define and implement innovative, web-based solutions that transform their ability to acquire and engage customers? Or perhaps you’ve become the go-to thought leader for eCommerce and web content management systems? If driving the business and functional requirements of large-scale projects fits squarely within your digital wheelhouse, Accenture may be the perfect place to build your career. YOUR ROLE: Senior Business Analyst There will never be a typical day at Accenture Interactive, so we’ve highlighted just a few of your exciting responsibilities. Participate in the analysis, design, and implementation of relevant WCM or eCommerce platforms such as Adobe AEM (CQ), SDL Tridion, Sitecore, Fatwire and CrownPeak, hybris, Oracle/ATG, Sterling Order Management, Manhattan Associates, Demandware, Intershop, and IBM Websphere CommerceApply specific functional knowledge of eCommerce or WCM applications to help guide the design and implementation of the solutionManage and conduct requirements gathering, stakeholder interviews and initial client discover workPrepare detailed requirement specifications, functional specifications, use case and work-flow diagrams and manage the requirements throughout the project lifecycleLead testing efforts in conjunction with the Project or QA Manager, including the design and execution of test scripts and scenariosPrepare training materials appropriate for target audiences and developed solution and conduct training sessionsAssist with gap analysis, business process redesign, roadmap planning and developing proof-of-conceptsSupport the development of strong client relationships by building trust, rapport and strong working relationships with key sponsors, stakeholders, and team membersTRAVEL: Required + Basic qualificationsYOUR EXPERIENCE: Basic Qualifications3+ years of experience gathering and documenting requirements2+ years of full lifecycle implementation experience using various SDLC methodologies1+ year of implementing eCommerce and/or web content management applicationsBachelor's DegreeSET YOURSELF APART: Preferred Skills1+ years of project coordination or team lead experienceFunctional expertise in relevant eCommerce or WCM technologies such as hybris, Oracle/ATG, Sterling Order Management, Manhattan Associates, Demandware, Intershop, IBM Websphere Commerce Adobe AEM (CQ), SDL Tridion, Sitecore, Fatwire and CrownPeakExperience eliciting high-level business requirements and creating detailed functional specs as well as other documentation like requirement traceability matrixes, work-flow diagrams and use-casesAbility to lead team and client meetings and to clearly articulate the solution being developed with all the stake holdersExperience in a consulting environment with demonstrated track record of continuing responsibilities, creativity and innovationExcellent communication skills, both written and verbal with strong presentation skillsStrong interpersonal, team building, organizational and motivational skillsBachelors or master’s degree in computer science, engineering, MIS or related fieldWHERE YOU LIVE: West OUR COMMITMENT TO YOU · Your entrepreneurial spirit and vision will be rewarded, and your success will fuel opportunities for career advancement  · You’ll make a difference for some pretty impressive clients. Accenture serves many of the Fortune Global 100 on high-profile projects  · Opportunities to learn daily through training, assignments and collaboration with experts across the company  · Access to leading-edge technology  · Along with a competitive salary, Accenture offers a comprehensive package that includes generous paid time off, 401K match and an employee healthcare plan CALL TO ACTION Now is the time to become a digital disrupter. The opportunity is here—what’s stopping you from pursuing it?  Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).  Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.  Accenture is an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.  Equal Employment Opportunity:  All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law. Job Candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.  Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women. APPLY SAVE THIS JOBShare

Name: Sr. Business Analyst
Description: Responsible for leading initiatives and providing consultation to the internal and/or external customer. Possess expertise in the customer area he/she supports and has technical understanding of the business unit’s systems, capabilities, and respective technologies. Analyze customer processes and requirements. Prepare specified project documentation. Assist in business process redesign as needed. Maintain communication with customer and team members and promote a team environment.  Essential Responsibilities*:  • Lead, gather, develop, coordinate, and maintain business requirements for various projects and/or systems from initial phase to final implementation, assuring requirements meet standards.  • Interact with users, other portfolios, and vendors for full life cycle of project.  • Troubleshoot, coordinate, and maintain production systems/programs/applications, as needed.  • Produce scheduled and ad hoc reports as necessary.  • Assist in maintenance and communication of project status reports and tracking.  • Provide user support and coordinate resolution of issues to include change management, root cause analysis, and appropriate escalation as needed.  • Develop use cases and functional specifications and coordinate the capture of process models and functional testing, ensuring system is functionally appropriate, technically sound, and well integrated.  • Develop and manage user acceptance criteria.  • Coordinate the process to analyze, evaluate, implement, and maintain systems developed internally and/or externally with an outside vendor.  • Assist in the development of project definitions, cost/benefit and risk analysis, work plans, progress reports, and presentations.  • Transition product support to systems operations.  • Assist in establishing end user training.  *May perform other duties as assigned.  Basic Entry Requirements:  • Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or Business Administration with two (2) to five (5) years of IT and/or business experience, or any equivalent combination of experience, education, and/or training.  • The ideal candidate has the above with three (3) to five (5) years project coordination and previous airline business experience. Name: Intranet Portal Business Analyst
Description: Intranet Portal Business Analyst  This Business System Analyst role will be part of IT Transition Program Management Office (IT T-PMO). T-PMO is responsible for migrating IT Applications and Infrastructure . This role is a liaison between Business Teams and Technical Teams for a large scale complex Intranet Portal rebuild.  Background  As a result of merger between client's Technology Solutions division (MTS) and client's, a new entity is created; named client's. Transition Services Agreement (TSA) has been defined between client's and client's to ensure Business continuity is maintained for MTS.  Key Responsibilities:  Solves organizational information problems by creating Intranet Portal requirements, tech specs and test scripts.  Business Systems Analyst Job Duties:  Determines portal objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats.  Designs Web Portal rebuild by analyzing requirements; constructing workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications.  Improves systems by studying current practices; designing modifications.  Recommends controls by identifying problems; writing improved procedures.  Maintains system protocols by writing and updating procedures.  Provides references for users by writing and maintaining web content; training users.  Maintains user confidence and protects operations by keeping information confidential.  Prepares technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends.  Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies.  Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.  Minimum Qualifications  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Systems/ Business Administration or related field.  Minimum of five years experience in Web Portal requirements analysis.  Must have ability to exercise independent judgment in planning, organizing, and performing systems analyst tasks. Some independent judgment required in setting priorities of tasks among multiple assigned projects. Description: Business Analyst - PeopleSoft FinancialsIndustry leading Fortune 500 company is looking for a ambitious PeopleSoft Business Analyst to join a team of 8 at their headquarters near Cumberland Mall!You will serve as their team SME in PeopleSoft functional areas of PeopleSoft financials AM, AR, AP, PO, GL and ePRO.
