Your day will consist of writing functional requirements, develop and implement test plans, and work with production issues.This will be a 80% functional role, but you will have to be familiar with SQL and use it to extract data and review tables. This thrilling direct hire position located near Cumberland Mall offers great benefits, casual dress code, flexible schedule, subsidized cafeteria onsite, and modern work space. If you are looking to join a stable organization and a talented team of thinkers, then apply to this role today!REQUIRED SKILLS:Business Analyst experience with PeopleSoft Financials - 3 - 5 PeopleSoft module experience with AM, AR, AP, PO, GL and ePROProduction Support PS Query and SQL (ability to extract data and review tables) PREFERRED SKILLS:Experience with multi- currency Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or other related technical fieldMust be authorized to work in the U.S. / Sponsorships are not available Contact: 404.###.#### ...@visionairepartners.com - provided by Dice  Business Analyst, PeopleSoft Financials, PS Query, SQL  Associated topics: business analyst, business finance, business intelligence, guidance, inspect, investment analytics, investment banking, market, monitor, refinement

Name: Business Analyst Strategy & Transformation
Description: Job DescriptionSeeking Business Analyst for business strategy and transformation role. This is a fantastic opportunity for an adventurous person with the right skills!  Join a transformation consulting team and work with senior executives at WNA and our clients to develop business and operational strategy, assess current operations, and develop transformational solutions.  Role  Business Analyst will capture and synthesize information in interviews and meetings, conduct research, perform data analytics and prepare outstanding visual presentation materials, working with experienced senior consulting executives and managers, and directly with clients. Demonstrate superior leadership and team work. Requirements2 5 years pre/post MBA experience in consulting, financial services or fintech.Excellent executive presence, verbal and written communications, and polish.Excellent graphics and presentation development skills.Excellent financial analytics skills and experience.Superior skills in PowerPoint, Word and Excel.Understanding of process improvement and transformation.MBA preferred. Undergraduate business degree or similar. Top schools. May consider graduate or undergraduate intern with applicable business experience. To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following characteristics and competencies:  Integrity Share principles and values core to WNA, including honesty and teamwork.  Customer Service Responds promptly to customer needs; Solicits customer feedback to improve sales and service; Responds to requests for service and assistance; Meets commitments; Manages difficult or emotional customer and employee situations.  Teamwork Balances team and individual responsibilities; Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views; Gives and welcomes feedback; Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Puts success of team above own interests; Able to build morale and group commitments to goals and objectives; Supports everyone's efforts to succeed.  Business Acumen Understands business implications of decisions; Displays orientation to profitability; Demonstrates knowledge of market and competition; Aligns work with WNA business goals.  Strategic Thinking Develops strategies to achieve client and WNA business goals; Understands clients strengths & weaknesses; Analyzes market and competition; Identifies clients external threats and opportunities; Adapts solutions to changing conditions.  Innovative Takes initiative; Displays original thinking and creativity; Meets challenges with resourcefulness; Generates suggestions for solving problems and identifying business needs; Develops innovative approaches and ideas; Presents ideas and information in a manner that gets others' attention and gains trust of the client.  Oral Communication Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; Influences and negotiates without conflict; Listens and gets clarification; Responds well to questions; Demonstrates executive level conversation and presentation skills; Generates excitement and enthusiasm.  Written Communication Writes clearly and informatively; Edits work for spelling and grammar; Varies writing style to meet needs; Presents numerical data effectively; Able to read and interpret written information.  Presentation Develops vivid images and stories to support communications; Incorporates graphics, data and text in a seamless and coherent way to help clearly articulate and summarize client challenges and solutions and WNAs value proposition. Hands on creation and creativity with presentation development tools including PowerPoint, Excel, Visio and others. Outstanding presentation delivery.  Analytical Synthesizes complex or diverse information; Collects and researches data from appropriate sources; uses intuition and experience to complement data.  Strong References Has a strong network of references willing to speak to character, integrity and past success.

Name: Sr Business Analyst (SalesForce)
Description: Job Title: Sr Business Analyst (SalesForce)Duration: 6 MonthsWork Location: Atlanta GA 30328Description: This job offers an unique opportunity to work in a high growth company, with multiple recent acquisitions, rapidly maturing data and analysis practice, need to shape the future of master data management technology, within the enterprise platform teams to support organizations goal of becoming the industry standard for automotive data delivery, analysis and quality capabilities. Requirements:Required Skills and Experience:Degree in Computer Science, Math or Business Information Systems strongly preferred. Extensive Business, Data or Systems Analysis experience would also be considered.3-5+ years experience in adopting various Business Analysis methodologiesExposure to business applications such as Informatica MDM platform, Sales Force (CRM), Oracle RMB (Revenue Management), or other fulfillment systems.Ability to work with Relational Database Management Systems such Oracle RDBMS, or SQL Server.Experience / exposure to integration and data quality applications such as Informatica Data Quality.Ability to document clear business data requirements and business processes.Ability to design and document data quality standards, process and reports required.Knowledge of various data types and an understanding of data models. Knowledge of data exchange standards and file formats.Knowledge of data management and governance best practices.Proficiency in the use of all applications in the Microsoft Office Suite and SharePoint.Thanks & Regards Parul Chhabra  Primus Software Corporation  Direct: 678 -666- 4393 | Fax: 770-234-4163  Email: parul.chhabra@primussoft.com  www.primussoft.com | 3061 Peachtree Industrial Blvd, Suite 110 Duluth, GA - 30097  Let's connect, LinkedIn: https://in.linkedin.com/pub/parul-chhabra/b1/42b/527  "All Clients Require Employment, Background Checks & Drug Test as a Part of Pre- Employment Hiring Process"

Name: Business Analyst - MDM Data
Description: Job DescriptionRole Name: Business Analyst - MDM Data About the Role This Business Analyst MDM Data Role will be part of IT Transition Program Management Office (IT T-PMO) within Change Healthcare. T-PMO is responsible for migrating IT Applications and Infrastructure from Client into Change Healthcare. This role is primarily focused on overseeing migration of all applications under Transition Services Agreement.  Background  As a result of merger between Client Technology Solutions division (MTS) and Client, a new entity is created. Transition Services Agreement (TSA) has been defined between Client and Client to ensure Business continuity is maintained for MTS. Responsibilities Lead and facilitate functional and technical requirement analysis sessions with business users to identify data sources, users, products, processes, limitations and workarounds Identify critical information delivery gaps through a combination of interviews, workshops, and analysis of existing reporting environmentCreate high quality written communications like Technical, Non Functional and Functional business documentation including design documents, system diagrams, workflow diagrams and presentationsAnalyze and verify compatibility and accuracy of healthcare data received from external sources against destination data structures, attributes, relationships and data models.Work with IT, Product and clinical teams to design and build and optimize simple to complex SQL queries based on of deterministic and probabilistic matching logic on relational databases.Use data analysis tools to profile data to identify existing and internal data sources, structures, elements and attributes for data quality, data deficiencies, data duplication and redundancy.Collaborate with source systems data stewards and technical personnel for data governance and to resolve any data quality or technical issues related to data ingestion.Liaison, Partner, Advise and provide support to data stewards, other system owners and technical personnel in master data management (MDM) concepts and technical matters across different departments and functional teams.Work closely with SMEs, Program Manager, Project Sponsors, Product Owners, Data Stewarts, IT Infrastructure Teams, Solution Architects and Enterprise Architecture to design solutions driven by data.Be result oriented and quick learner with ability to deal with ambiguity and make quality decisions in a dynamic, fast-paced environment with strong teamwork and interpersonal skills. Experience Demonstrate hands on experience working with data analytical tools and working with Strong proficiency with SQL programming and experience with different relational databases like SQL, Oracle, DB2, Access and Microsoft Excel.Demonstrate experience leading and facilitating formal meeting and discussions with senior managers, executives, business users, Infrastructure, Compliance and other teams.Demonstrate Experience and understanding of database architecture, software and database management systems, data strategy, governance, stewardship, data management, and data quality programs using data quality tools, including data profiling, cleansing and identity resolution.Demonstrate experience using data quality tools, including data profiling, cleansing and identity resolution with ability to apply data quality techniques such as match, merge, profiling, score carding, data standardization, and parsing using enterprise data quality platforms.Demonstrate effective problem solving skills and ability to deliver on multiple projects simultaneously and ability to articulate ideas to both technical and non-technical addressees with ability to communicate and persuade at all management levels.Demonstrate experience in creating Technical, Non Functional and Functional business documentation including design documents, system diagrams, workflow diagrams and presentations.Demonstrate experience working with Healthcare data in clinical and non-clinical nomenclature with good understanding of key terms like Provider, Payer, Patient, Eligibility, Insurance, Medicare, Claims and standards like EDI, HL7 etc.Optional - Demonstrate experience in creating Data Modeling, Business Process Modeling, Matching Rules, Hierarchy and Relationship Management, Data Mapping, MDM Data Models, and Data Governance.Optional - Demonstrate experience in analyzing and definition of requirements for data matching and merging rules, survivorship criteria and data stewardship workflows including maintenance and tuning of match rules. Qualification Minimum 5-7 year experience with large and complex data management projects in the role of Data Analyst or Architect with must have hands-on data analysis and programming experience.Minimum 3-5 year experience with US healthcare eco System across clinical and/or non-clinical environments like health plan, TPA, hospitals, medical centers, medical research and similar healthcare related organizations.Minimum 3-5 year experience delivering IT Services and/or consulting projects within an IT consulting organizations. Duration: 6 months  Thanks & Regards  Parul Chhabra  Primus Software Corporation  Direct: 678 -666- 4393 | Fax: 770-234-4163  Email: parul.chhabra@primussoft.com  www.primussoft.com | 3061 Peachtree Industrial Blvd, Suite 110 Duluth, GA - 30097  Let's connect, LinkedIn: https://in.linkedin.com/pub/parul-chhabra/b1/42b/527

Name: Technical Business Analyst, Product Innovation Team
Description: Every day, the people of TSYS® and Netspend® improve lives and businesses around the globe through payments. We make it possible for millions of people to move money between buyers and sellers using our payments solutions including credit, debit, prepaid and merchant services. We are "People-Centered Payments", and our team has the unique opportunity to help create a world in which payments make people's lives easier and better. This is both a tremendous honor and an important responsibility for those who accept the challenge. If you are looking to make a valuable difference for people everywhere and for yourself we may have the right place for you. Technical Business Analyst, Product Innovation Team At TSYS, were building the future of payments. As a member of the Digital Innovation team, youll be part of a team passionate about technology and using it to modernize payments, and the overall banking experience. We build a wide variety of solutions from automated infrastructure and cloud-based systems, to machine learning and user experiences for web, mobile and Iota. Were looking for people who want to join our team of designers, engineers and enthusiasts and be a part of whats happening. Example products that youll be working on as a part of the TSYS DI team...Create open APIs and content for TSYS Developers (developers.tsys.com), our client hub for open technology (APIs, SDKs and much more) developed by TSYS.Mobile and mobile web cardholder experiences that leverage open technologies like react.js and react native, node, swift2, java, springboot.Campaign, content and push notification systems that leverage things like Kafka, javascript, java9 and spring to deliver content to multiple channels.Our industry leading fraud engine that leverages ML to learn and detect fraud patterns.Our hybrid cloud application infrastructure thats based on docker, kubernetes, microservices and postgres.Everyday youll do these kinds of thingsCollaborate with engineers in the Digital Innovation team to create technical designs, develop, test and deliver products in an iterative manner from concept to launch.Design & test RESTful APIs to adhear to our OPEN API standards including data elements for both requests and responses.Help create meaningful and innovative mobile, web and IoT products, help research and design User Experience flowsLeverage technologies like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Unix, SQL and others to access all levels of a solution.Prepare and execute cross device, cross browser tests and help us automate them.Prepare and execute acceptance testing and help automate them.Write complex queries to understand sources of data.Elicit, identify, document, and refine requirements from business problems to detailed user stories and acceptance criteria that may include technical requirements.Lead design sessions and plan sprints, groom the backlog and keep yourself and the team moving forward.Demo your work for colleagues and members of the business team.To qualify, youll need to have: Highly Preferred Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in computer science, information technology or business information systems or related field.Ability to quickly absorb technical concepts and effectively communicate them to a non-technical audience.Experience integrating APIs into enterprise applications.Fluent, open communication style speaking, writing, collaborating.Demonstrated understanding of user experience, user centered design and responsive web design.Experience designing and delivering RESTful APIs. Preferred Minimum two years relevant experience with integrating and delivering RESTful APIs, and building strong UI/UX solutions.Experience designing and delivering large distributed, mobile, machine learning, responsive web or API software systems.Experience working in a team-based, start-up or agile development environment.Experience with tools such as Postman, Swagger UI, SOAP UI, and SOAP Sonar.Knowledgeable on ADA standards and web accessibility evaluation tools.Strong data analyst, with experience in writing SQL scripts to access data from an Oracle database.Knowledgeable of UI design systems such as responsive grids, web design, android and iOS cross-platform and native design.High level understanding of development languages, mobile, web, react, CSS/HTML.Whats it like to work in our Team? Our Digital Innovation Team is a team of advanced technical experts in a variety of fields who work together to incubate new capabilities in a rapid, prototype-oriented environment that emphasizes product over process. Were huge advocates of open source and as a member of the Digital innovation team, youll not only work innovative user experiences, massive data sets and infrastructure at scale, but youll also be working with a team of people who represent some of the best and brightest minds in payments. We have a growth culture that emphasizes learning and adoption of technologies that push the envelope. We have sessions designed each week to bring the team together to learn and discuss topics that are critical to our industry and the evolution of our systems. Add to that our open work environment that emphasizes collaboration across teams.What Are We Looking For in This Role?TSYS Minimum QualificationsBachelor's DegreeRelevant Experience or Degree in: Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Business or related field; or equivalent training or experience in lieu of degreeTypically Minimum 2 Years Relevant ExpProfessional experience working with end-users to meet business needsNot Ready to Apply? Join Our Talent Community!!US Applicants: TSYS is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) committed to employing a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. For more information about your rights, click here.  Qualified individuals with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodations to assist in their pursuit of employment with TSYS. This includes assistance in completing the job application (online or otherwise) and reasonable accommodations during the hiring process. For assistance with reasonable accommodations needed to apply for a job, please contact the TSYS Pay and Benefits Center between 8 a.m. and 7 p.m. Eastern Monday-Friday at +1.706.644.8747 or +1.877.644.8747 or email at PayandBenefits@tsys.com.  EOE/Minorities/Females/Vet/Disability Outside of US Applicants: TSYS is committed to diversity and equal opportunities for everyone. We are committed to ensuring that all job applicants and team members are treated equally, without discrimination because of gender, sexual orientation, marital or civil partner status, gender reassignment, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, disability, age or any other characteristic prohibited by law. For more information, please refer to our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, found here.

Name: Business Analyst- Project Manager
Description: “The limit of our growth is going to be our imagination and product ideas – not technology” – Mohit Kapoor, CIOWhat we’ll bring: A work environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. We consistently explore new technologies and tools to be agile.Flexible time off, workplace flexibility, an environment that welcomes continued professional growth through support of tuition reimbursement, conferences and seminars.Our culture encourages our people to hone current skills and build new capabilities, while discovering their genius.What you’ll bring: At least six years of Technical Project Manager experience Hands on experience working with external clients, partners, and customers Hands on experience successfully managing and influencing teams to complete deliverables on strict deadlines Ability to level set unrealistic customer expectations and provide alternative solutions Hands on experience gathering, authoring, and translating technical requirements What we’d prefer to see:Bachelor’s degree in Business or related degree Experience working in the Credit or Financial Services industry Impact you’ll make: You’ll work on our Global Decisioning team, that leverages industry data, analytics, and technology to deliver strategies and solutions that help our customers make better risk based decisionsYou’ll serve as a Project Manager, Business Analyst, and Configuration Expert to deliver automated decisioning solutions to our external customers You’ll deliver projects on time and in budget, making modifications to project phases as needed to address changes or problems to original scopeYou’ll drive projects to delivery by performing project administrative tasks including, but not limited to: creating and maintaining project plans, completing project estimates, identifying and reporting action items and risks, project status reporting, meeting facilitation and preparation of meeting notes You’ll facilitate meeting with external customers to identify all details of business objects and requirements. You’ll lead collaboration to help identify creative solutions to meet customer needs and address problems experienced by our external customers You’ll set up (configure), test and deliver decisioning solutions requests to customers in a timely manner ensuring that appropriate standards are followed and customer needs are metWe are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability status, veteran status, marital status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law. #DICE#LI-AL1

Name: Business Systems Analyst-Campus Recruiting
Description: Category:  Business Analysis (functional and technical) City:  Atlanta, Georgia, United States Position ID:  J1018-3177 Employment Type:  Graduate Position Description:CGI is seeking students interested in careers in the Information Technology field. CGI is more than just an IT consulting company; we are a global organization offering a world of opportunities. Become part of a unique culture that gives you the freedom to innovate, to make decisions, to achieve your full potential and to chart your own career.  Our Business System Analysts typically have a demonstrated interest in technology and business, strong problem-solving abilities, and excellent interpersonal skills. Business System Analysts will be placed on one of our many projects and provide technical/functional expertise in identifying, evaluating, and developing basic systems. What you’ll need:Bachelors degree required in a relevant field (i.e.: Business Majors to include Finance, Accounting, Management Information Systems, IS/IT and other majors that include consulting and technology coursework) A great attitude and hunger for learningExcellent analytical, written and oral communication skillsFlexibility and ability to deal with ambiguityAbility to work within a team environment3.0 GPA strongly preferredAbility to work in the U.S. for an indefinite period of time with ability to obtain a US Government clearance What you’ll do (assignments may include responsibilities in one or more of the following areas): Business Analysis: Developing knowledge of a client’s industry, customers, organization and business objectives in order to help the client in a problem-solving role. Assessing user requirements, procedures and problems to create or improve a system. User Support Analysis: Providing quality client support by answering client questions, researching possible solutions to problems, and fostering open communication between the client and the CGI project team. Tracking software and documentation defects,  performing application maintenance, and providing onsite consulting and training as required. System Testing: Working with system developers and designers to identify, diagnose, and document problems and errors in specific components of a system. Assessing how well a product adheres to its design, standards, as well as its usability and ability to meet  business needs. Decision Analysis: Applying quantitative methods to study and make recommendations regarding various business issues, including credit risk management, customer profitability, resource allocation and optimization, and customer segmentation. What you’ll gain:Involvement in a team oriented atmosphereExposure to business issues and challengesOpportunity to leverage your computer knowledge and analytical skills Join our team and experience the commitment at CGI!  CGI IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER What you can expect from us:Build your career with us.It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.  At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.  Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.  Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.  No unsolicited agency referrals please.  CGI is an equal opportunity employer.  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, sex, religion, creed, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, medical condition, military and veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, familial status, political affiliation, genetic information, or any other legally protected status or characteristics.  CGI provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need an accommodation to apply for a job in the U.S., please email the CGI U.S. Employment Compliance mailbox at US_Employment_Compliance@cgi.com. You will need to reference the requisition number of the position in which you are interested. Your message will be routed to the appropriate recruiter who will assist you. Please note, this email address is only to be used for those individuals who need an accommodation to apply for a job. Emails for any other reason or those that do not include a requisition number will not be returned.  We make it easy to translate military experience and skills! Click here to be directed to our site that is dedicated to veterans and transitioning service members.  All CGI offers of employment in the U.S. are contingent upon the ability to successfully complete a background investigation. Background investigation components can vary dependent upon specific assignment and/or level of US government security clearance held.  CGI will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with CGI’s legal duty to furnish information.

Name: BUSINESS ANALYST
Description: Position Description: POSITION PURPOSEThe Business Analyst contributes in a lead role to the merchandising group function in the evaluation, design development, and implementation of standardized reporting, business processes and information systems solutions. This allows customers (the associates in the merchandising function) to maximize their productivity and make sound, effective decisions based on consistent, accurate information. The Business Analyst works within a defined scope of the business and proposes new solutions based on data analyses.The Business Analyst regularly communicates the output of their work and provides recommendations to senior leadership. Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:Analyzing and developing conclusions using quantitative skillsCreating communication for different levels of leaders/associatesLeading projects without direct authorityMAJOR TASKS, RESPONSIBILITIES AND KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES20% Plan and lead all phases of a project's life cycle (i.e. feasibility, design implementation, evaluation); this includes extracting the business need; defining the business requirements, understanding the impact on the business, and designing and carrying out the project(s) 10% Serve as liaison between merchandising and finance by facilitating meetings including both departments 10% Mentor other analysts in developing/honing business knowledge and analytical skills 20% Service as a subject matter expert and perform research and/or analysis within assigned projects 20% Multi-task to work on 2 to 4 projects simultaneously, recommending process improvements and making final project recommendations which impact the business 20% Establish and report on metrics of assigned projects to gauge business valueNATURE AND SCOPEReports to a director-level position within merchandising No direct reports, however, the position will be required to mentor others who have the need for assistanceENVIRONMENTAL JOB REQUIREMENTSEnvironment: Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.Travel: Typically requires overnight travel 5% to 20% of the time. ESSENTIAL SKILLS: MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSMust be eighteen years of age or older.Must be legally permitted to work in the United States.Education Required:The knowledge, skills, and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a high school diploma and/or GED.Years of Relevant Work Experience: 2 yearsPhysical Requirements:Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. Join a transformation consulting team and work with senior executives at WNA and our clients to develop business and operational strategy, assess current operations, and develop transformational solutions. Demonstrate superior leadership and team work. Requirements2 5 years pre/post MBA experience in consulting, financial services or fintech.Excellent executive presence, verbal and written communications, and polish.Excellent graphics and presentation development skills.Excellent financial analytics skills and experience.Superior skills in PowerPoint, Word and Excel.Understanding of process improvement and transformation.MBA preferred. Undergraduate business degree or similar. Top schools. May consider graduate or undergraduate intern with applicable business experience. To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following characteristics and competencies:  Integrity Share principles and values core to WNA, including honesty and teamwork.  Customer Service Responds promptly to customer needs; Solicits customer feedback to improve sales and service; Responds to requests for service and assistance; Meets commitments; Manages difficult or emotional customer and employee situations.  Teamwork Balances team and individual responsibilities; Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views; Gives and welcomes feedback; Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Puts success of team above own interests; Able to build morale and group commitments to goals and objectives; Supports everyone's efforts to succeed.  Business Acumen Understands business implications of decisions; Displays orientation to profitability; Demonstrates knowledge of market and competition; Aligns work with WNA business goals.  Strategic Thinking Develops strategies to achieve client and WNA business goals; Understands clients strengths & weaknesses; Analyzes market and competition; Identifies clients external threats and opportunities; Adapts solutions to changing conditions.  Innovative Takes initiative; Displays original thinking and creativity; Meets challenges with resourcefulness; Generates suggestions for solving problems and identifying business needs; Develops innovative approaches and ideas; Presents ideas and information in a manner that gets others' attention and gains trust of the client.  Oral Communication Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; Influences and negotiates without conflict; Listens and gets clarification; Responds well to questions; Demonstrates executive level conversation and presentation skills; Generates excitement and enthusiasm.  Written Communication Writes clearly and informatively; Edits work for spelling and grammar; Varies writing style to meet needs; Presents numerical data effectively; Able to read and interpret written information.  Presentation Develops vivid images and stories to support communications; Incorporates graphics, data and text in a seamless and coherent way to help clearly articulate and summarize client challenges and solutions and WNAs value proposition. Hands on creation and creativity with presentation development tools including PowerPoint, Excel, Visio and others. Outstanding presentation delivery.  Analytical Synthesizes complex or diverse information; Collects and researches data from appropriate sources; uses intuition and experience to complement data.  Strong References Has a strong network of references willing to speak to character, integrity and past success.

Name: Sr. Business Analyst
Description: Responsible for leading initiatives and providing consultation to the internal and/or external customer. Possess expertise in the customer area he/she supports and has technical understanding of the business unit’s systems, capabilities, and respective technologies. Analyze customer processes and requirements. Prepare specified project documentation. Assist in business process redesign as needed. Maintain communication with customer and team members and promote a team environment.  Essential Responsibilities*:  • Lead, gather, develop, coordinate, and maintain business requirements for various projects and/or systems from initial phase to final implementation, assuring requirements meet standards.  • Interact with users, other portfolios, and vendors for full life cycle of project.  • Troubleshoot, coordinate, and maintain production systems/programs/applications, as needed.  • Produce scheduled and ad hoc reports as necessary.  • Assist in maintenance and communication of project status reports and tracking.  • Provide user support and coordinate resolution of issues to include change management, root cause analysis, and appropriate escalation as needed.  • Develop use cases and functional specifications and coordinate the capture of process models and functional testing, ensuring system is functionally appropriate, technically sound, and well integrated.  • Develop and manage user acceptance criteria.  • Coordinate the process to analyze, evaluate, implement, and maintain systems developed internally and/or externally with an outside vendor.  • Assist in the development of project definitions, cost/benefit and risk analysis, work plans, progress reports, and presentations.  • Transition product support to systems operations.  • Assist in establishing end user training.  *May perform other duties as assigned.  Basic Entry Requirements:  • Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or Business Administration with two (2) to five (5) years of IT and/or business experience, or any equivalent combination of experience, education, and/or training.  • The ideal candidate has the above with three (3) to five (5) years project coordination and previous airline business experience.  Major Skills and Competencies: Interested in this position? Name (required)empty Email (required)empty Phone (required)empty Job IDempty JSON parse warning!

Name: Business/ Data Analyst
Description: Candid Partners is a cloud consulting firm which combines enterprise-class scale and process with born-in-the-cloud domain expertise. Candid’s seasoned management consultants, coming from the world’s top firms, easily translate complex business needs into specific technology solutions. Our technology consultants have deep public cloud and AWS specialty expertise with more than 80 percent holding AWS accreditations or certifications.  Candid is currently seeking an experienced Business Analyst with Data Analytics experience to join our team of expert management consultants. This person will be working with, and documenting where necessary, the existing and new data model. The Business Analyst is an active participant in all phases of the project lifecycle and will be required to work closely with a variety of internal and external business partners to ensure that all business requirements are met. What you’ll be doing:Understand (and document, where necessary) the existing data modelProvide input and feedback to the new data modelUnderstand existing business performance management reportsDesign new / clearer business performance management reportsDesign / provide requirements for: reporting and data reconciliation processes (i.e. “Audit” processes to make sure our databases do not get out of sync)Manage / assist with migration and data mapping activitiesManage / assist with addressing data quality issues with existing systemPossibly participate in data mining activitiesLead JAD sessions and individual client interviews (discovery and review sessions)Interface with clients and technical teams, including UX designersAddress issues with existing systemCapabilities/ Experience:Process re-engineering, including:Value analysisAs Is and To Be diagrams in Vision Lucid Chart or equivalentDiscovering and documenting process improvement and the value introduced by these changesOCM and role definition for new processesAssist with transition planning to new systemPrototyping, includingUse of prototyping tools such as Invision or iRiseData analysis, including:Creating Data Flow Diagrams (i.e., probably in a support role)Composing queries in SQL or equivalent (i.e., probably in a support role)Understanding entity relationshipsPresentation skills, including:Creating quality PowerPoint slidesComfortable presenting to multiple levels of management Candid Partners is one of the fastest growing companies in the US. Every day brings a new problem to solve and a chance to grow professionally and personally. We hire the best and brightest. You’ll collaborate with a team of like-minded, ambitious experts with the technical talent and business acumen your projects need to succeed. Not only that, but we were voted one of Atlanta’s Best Places to Work by the Atlanta Business Chronicle’s in 2017.  Are you ready to make your unique mark on Candid’s Culture?

Name: Hybris Commerce Business Analyst
Description: Job descriptionAccenture Digital The digital revolution is changing everything, transforming how we work and play. Are you reacting to the disruption each day or are you leading the way as a digital disrupter? Accenture Digital is driving these exciting changes and bringing them to life across 40 industries in more than 120 countries. At the forefront of digital, you’ll create it, own it and make it a reality for clients looking to better serve their connected customers and operate always-on enterprises. Join us and become an integral part of our experienced digital team with the credibility, expertise and insight clients depend on. Accenture Interactive Accenture Digital is powered by three practices – Interactive, Mobility and Analytics. Accenture Interactive helps the world’s leading brands delight their customers and deliver superior business performance and customer experiences. As part of Accenture Interactive Delivery, you’ll balance art and science to create award-winning digital experiences for today’s connected consumers through integrated and dynamic solutions that incorporate strategy, marketing, creative and technology. JOB DESCRIPTION Do clients rely on your impressive ability to define and implement innovative, web-based solutions that transform their ability to acquire and engage customers? Or perhaps you’ve become the go-to thought leader for eCommerce and web content management systems? If driving the business and functional requirements of large-scale projects fits squarely within your digital wheelhouse, Accenture may be the perfect place to build your career. YOUR ROLE: Senior Business Analyst There will never be a typical day at Accenture Interactive, so we’ve highlighted just a few of your exciting responsibilities. Participate in the analysis, design, and implementation of relevant WCM or eCommerce platforms such as Adobe AEM (CQ), SDL Tridion, Sitecore, Fatwire and CrownPeak, hybris, Oracle/ATG, Sterling Order Management, Manhattan Associates, Demandware, Intershop, and IBM Websphere CommerceApply specific functional knowledge of eCommerce or WCM applications to help guide the design and implementation of the solutionManage and conduct requirements gathering, stakeholder interviews and initial client discover workPrepare detailed requirement specifications, functional specifications, use case and work-flow diagrams and manage the requirements throughout the project lifecycleLead testing efforts in conjunction with the Project or QA Manager, including the design and execution of test scripts and scenariosPrepare training materials appropriate for target audiences and developed solution and conduct training sessionsAssist with gap analysis, business process redesign, roadmap planning and developing proof-of-conceptsSupport the development of strong client relationships by building trust, rapport and strong working relationships with key sponsors, stakeholders, and team membersTRAVEL: Required + Basic qualificationsYOUR EXPERIENCE: Basic Qualifications3+ years of experience gathering and documenting requirements2+ years of full lifecycle implementation experience using various SDLC methodologies1+ year of implementing eCommerce and/or web content management applicationsBachelor's DegreeSET YOURSELF APART: Preferred Skills1+ years of project coordination or team lead experienceFunctional expertise in relevant eCommerce or WCM technologies such as hybris, Oracle/ATG, Sterling Order Management, Manhattan Associates, Demandware, Intershop, IBM Websphere Commerce Adobe AEM (CQ), SDL Tridion, Sitecore, Fatwire and CrownPeakExperience eliciting high-level business requirements and creating detailed functional specs as well as other documentation like requirement traceability matrixes, work-flow diagrams and use-casesAbility to lead team and client meetings and to clearly articulate the solution being developed with all the stake holdersExperience in a consulting environment with demonstrated track record of continuing responsibilities, creativity and innovationExcellent communication skills, both written and verbal with strong presentation skillsStrong interpersonal, team building, organizational and motivational skillsBachelors or master’s degree in computer science, engineering, MIS or related fieldWHERE YOU LIVE: West OUR COMMITMENT TO YOU · Your entrepreneurial spirit and vision will be rewarded, and your success will fuel opportunities for career advancement  · You’ll make a difference for some pretty impressive clients. Accenture serves many of the Fortune Global 100 on high-profile projects  · Opportunities to learn daily through training, assignments and collaboration with experts across the company  · Access to leading-edge technology  · Along with a competitive salary, Accenture offers a comprehensive package that includes generous paid time off, 401K match and an employee healthcare plan CALL TO ACTION Now is the time to become a digital disrupter. The opportunity is here—what’s stopping you from pursuing it?  Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).  Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.  Accenture is an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.  Equal Employment Opportunity:  All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law. Job Candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.  Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women. APPLY SAVE THIS JOBShare

Name: Capitation Business Analyst
Description: telecommute, can sit anywhere in US. flex on TimeZone Specific Duties: Serve as a subject matter expert for Capitation Processing and Administration  Be the business subject matter expert, experienced in business analysis and requirements gathering  Act as business liaison to technology teams for project discussions and planning  Assist in formulating and defining business system scope and objectives through research and fact finding under broad general direction with minimal supervision  Assess operational impacts to other business areas / systems for financial system enhancements and vice versa  Develop detailed business requirements, test plans and scripts, and perform implementation check out processes for projects; maintain defect documentation / resolution library  o Develop business scenarios and test cases for E2E testing. Perform E2E testing.  Assimilate, integrate and interface technical and business knowledge with business system or process requirements  Lead and manage customer readiness activities and project implementation teams in process improvement activities  Coordinate and conduct user acceptance testing with other systems and business areas  Participate in Agile Scrum methodology meetings  Gather, develop, and document business requirements and user stories - ensure requirements are clear, concise and complete  Facilitate work sessions to gather business requirements / user stories  Participate in project / program requirements, features, solution walkthroughs and design sessions  Support all phases of agile software development to include initiation, design, development and testing  Collaborate with project stakeholders and technical teams regarding enhancements, changes, issues and defects that may impact development, data, workflow and functionality Must have qualifications/experience: Previous experience with Capitation Processing and Administration for a variety of capitation payment methodologies including Per Member Per Month, Percent of Premium, Capitation Deductions  Bachelor s degree or equivalent work experience  Agile certification or equivalent work experience in an Agile environment  3+ years of experience in writing business and/or system requirements  2+ years of experience with documenting processes and practices, often in accepted project methodology artifacts, while effectively prioritizing multiple tasks, priorities, projects, and deadlines  2+ years of experience using MS Project, MS Visio, MS PowerPoint, MS Excel  Experience participating in projects that have various levels of complexity  Shift Start/End Time: flexible. 8 hour shift Mon-Fri  Dress Code: not applicable  (Please update as needed)  As a Business Analyst, you will use your sharp business skills to assist in creating, controlling and improving business processes and platform solutions related to Capitation. You will report to and support the the Product Owner for capitation, performing duties as assigned. You will solve complex problems as you serve as a resource to others on your elite team. You will create process design, project implementation, diagnose process improvement opportunities and develop solutions. You will support the design and creation of platform solutions. You will also provide quality reporting, analysis, audits, and develop plans and programs to support continuous quality improvement.BenefitsAt Maxim Healthcare Services, we firmly believe that our employees are the heartbeat of our organization and we are happy to offer the following benefits:Competitive pay & weekly paychecksHealth, dental, vision, and life insurance401(k) savings planAwards and recognition programsBenefit eligibility is dependent on employment status.Maxim Healthcare Services is a leading provider of home healthcare, medical-related staffing, travel nursing, and population health and wellness services across the United States. As an established community partner, we have been making a difference in the lives of our employees, caregivers, and patients for more than 30 years. Our commitment to customer service, improving patient care, and staffing experienced healthcare professionals has paved the way for many rewarding career opportunities in the healthcare industry.Maxim Healthcare Services, Inc. is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity EmployerAssociated topics: analyse, bi, business, business analytic, business finance, business systems analyst, consult, financial analytic, government, investment analyst

Name: BI Business Analyst
Description: We are looking for a high caliber Business Intelligence Business Analyst for an opportunity in the Atlanta area, specifically Tech Square. The company offers business operation services, including strategic/business planning, pricing analysis and strategy, opportunity assessment, sales force, category management and trade promotion, supply chain and logistics management and optimization, asset management, and call center strategy/operations; and strategic implementation services, such as program management, business process improvement, balanced scorecard, strategic sourcing, organizational design, and change management. It also offers technology and solution advisement services, including information technology (IT) strategy, enterprise architecture, technology assessment and selection, IT process improvement, IT portfolio governance, network infrastructure architecture and security, solution program management and project management, and solution and system architecture. Responsibilities: Hiring a Business Intelligence focused Business Analyst to their growing team.Requirements Gathering and a true BI Business Analyst; Fully focused on BI and data analysis.Someone that can work independently and take full ownership of the process; This individual will be responsible for the full reporting aspect of the project as well.Must be open to wearing many different hats.Requirements:Needs to have knowledge of SQL, Flat Files, Excel and have been primarily working with SQL Server Database.Preferably, have experience with Tableau or Microstrategy or some other data visualization tool.Any experience working with Qlikview would be a plus!Must have strong written and spoken communication skills.Will allow candidates to become a permanent employee if they prove themselves during the project.

Name: IT Business Analyst (Senior level)
Description: Position: IT Business AnalystReporting to: Software Delivery ManagerLocation: AtlantaType:Permanent Hiscox USA is currently searching for an enthusiastic and driven IT Business Analyst in our Atlanta office to rigorously ensure accurate requirements management for our consumer and partner portal initiative. This role has full accountability for delivery of change based on the agreed upon scope, timelines and budget. Key Responsibilities:Fully responsible for documenting detailed technical requirementsWorks closely with key stakeholders within the US Business and across IT in order to deliver the agreed upon list of changesHolds requirements gathering sessions, captures meeting minutes, documents clear and concise requirements, follows up on action items and is accountable for requirements documentationManages scope creep and clearly communicates with business stakeholders on feasibility and effort analysisCollaborates closely with the Development and Testing teams throughout the SDLC to ensure technical feasibility, requirements are understood, and development is aligned.Reviews test cases and test plans from the System Test team, negotiates testing scope and timelines, triages defects raisedIdentifies issues and actively works with appropriate teams to mitigate.Understands the roles & responsibilities within each phase of the SDLC.Communicates regularly with business stakeholders, developers, and system testers to provide appropriate status and clarificationsDevelops extensive knowledge on key internal applications and acts as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for on-going Portal changesPerson Specification:BA/BS Degree; CS or CE degree preferred5-8 years’ experience in working as an IT Business Analyst in an environment with challenging timeframes and deliverablesExcellent written and verbal communication skills, demonstrated experience of working with senior stakeholders at all levels within and external to the businessCreative, proactive, logical and innovative and will not just accept the status quoHighly results driven, with the energy and determination to succeed in a very fast paced environment where the pace of response and leadership is critical to successAn independent thinker with the ability to multi task in a fast paced environmentExperience working with distributed teams and relationship building with stakeholders who are also not located within the same geographical areaExperience with exposure to the full project life cycle, from inception to user acceptance testingAbility to combine “soft” influencing, persuasion and consultancy skills with “leadership” qualities that will encourage business leaders to positively respond to questions, inquires and requests to meet deadlines.Diligent and passionate about achieving deadlinesExperience working in JiraExperience of agile delivery methodologies required (specifically Scrum)Experience working in the insurance sector a plus

Name: Sr. Business Analyst, Corp Financials, Foundation & Ppl Sol
Description: OverviewAs a Senior Business Analyst, you will join a team responsible for supporting Chick-fil-A’s Corporate Financial Systems. In this role, you will serve as a liaison between the Corporate Financial Services and IT Departments, providing technical and functional solutions to support Chick-fil-A’s growth.  In this role, you will learn our Corporate Financial Systems and how they integrate to other platforms. You will be responsible for building and supporting technical integrations from the Corporate Financial Services portfolio to other systems. You will gather functional requirements, solve and design technical problems, write reports, and create project plans. You will be focused in the areas of accounts receivable, fixed assets, projects, general ledger, and budget.ResponsibilitiesServes as a trusted IT advisor to the Corporate Financial Services Department.Writes and supports technical integrations.Leads small projects and serves on medium to large projects providing both technical and functional solutions to help the Corporate Financial Services department achieve strategic goals and objectives.Understands Corporate Financial procedures and IT capabilities and recommends process changes to standardize functionality and reduce manual work.Works with other functional and technical teams in IT to document, develop, test, and support solutions.Oversees consultants for large scale implementations.Develops and enhances reports to provide relevant data to business users. Minimum Qualifications5 years of experience working as a technical systems analystBachelor’s degree in a technical field of studyProficient in writing SQL queries against databaseExperience coding in a language such as Python, PL/SQLExperience with XMLStrong analytical and problem solving skillsGood interpersonal skills and desire to work collaborativelyStrong written and oral communication skillsAttention to detailOrganized and comfortable with managing project detailsTravel: up to 5% Preferred QualificationsExperience with Oracle Applications or other ERP Financial Applications (i.e. General Ledger, Accounts Receivable, Projects, Fixed Assets)Experience with ERP Cloud migrationsExperience with SOA, BPELUnderstanding of basic accounting principles Minimum Years of Experience5  Required Level of EducationBachelor's Degree  Major/ConcentrationIndustrial Engineering, Management Information Systems, or a technical field of study  Minimum GPA (4.0 Scale)3.0

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: What's The Job?Calendly is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to help drive growth throughout the funnel. This person will analyze and report on Calendly's acquisition, conversion and retention funnels break them down by segments and cohorts, measure the impact of campaigns and tests, identify areas of opportunity and collaborate with teams to optimize the business to grow in smarter, faster ways. The role will report to the CEO and serve the highest-priority BI needs of the leadership team.You will be successful in this role if you are a business-savvy, technically-capable analyst with SQL skills and an advanced understanding of SaaS user economics. We're looking for someone with strong analytical and statistical aptitude who possesses the ability to communicate business recommendations; someone driven to ask the right questions about the business and identify data-backed opportunities and solutions. This person will foster close working relationships with the marketing, product and engineering teams and company leadership.Responsibilities:Work as an embedded data analyst to help set, track and achieve quarterly acquisition, conversion and retention objectivesDive deep into customer data and connect our quantitative/qualitative research insights to help us better understand how we can improve the customer journeyFulfill data and analysis requests from the CEO and leadership team and influence Calendly's data driven culture with best practicesPerform analysis and modeling to show how acquisition channel, customer behaviors and product marketing initiatives impact LTV for each cohort and customer segmentHelp drive strategic decision-making and make business recommendations based on detailed analysis, insights and reporting on key performance indicators (KPIs) and financial resultsApply best practices to the design, set-up and analysis of A/B tests to drive iterative improvement through efficient experimentation.Measure the ROI of content and marketing efforts, including organic, paid, and earned content and connect content engagement to business outcomesComplete at least one in-depth customer behavior impact analysis (e.g., analyzing impact of sending a new onboarding email stream) within the first 6 monthsWork with the technical team to improve tracking implementation and data accessibility to increase the information we can measure and its accuracyCreate and maintain the right dashboards and data models in our BI platform, Looker, and specify data integrations necessary to conduct robust cross-channel and cross-platform analysisRequirements:2+ years experience in data analytics, marketing intelligence, or performance marketingA degree in Mathematics, Economics, Statistics or another quantitative field or equivalent experienceAdvanced working knowledge of SQL and excel data manipulationExperience solving complex business problems using data and transforming analyses into concise insights and recommendationsExperience with BI data tools (e.g. Looker), marketing automation platforms (e.g. Intercom), and other attribution or optimization productsFamiliarity with A/B testing and customer acquisition channel optimizationUS Citizen or Permanent Resident (we do not sponsor at this time)What We ValueCalendly is on a mission to take the work out of scheduling so that our customers can accomplish more. Our product is used monthly by more than a million people across industries like sales, recruiting, customer success and education. We're obsessed with providing an elegant, delightful experience for our customers. This shapes how we develop, design, market, sell, support and work as a team.We treat each other with respect and understanding, put first things first and never settle. While we're results driven, we always make time to learn, grow and have fun celebrating our accomplishments.  Our team members' well-being is just as important to us as their work. We offer competitive salary, unlimited paid time off and flexible remote work options to help maintain work-life balance. We also provide a parking or transit pass, snacks, happy hours, team-building events and so many other perks!  Join a diverse workforce, leading the way in scheduling automation.

Name: Business Analyst III, Supply Chain Strategy & Design
Description: OverviewAs a Business Analyst III, you will serve as a liaison between the Supply Chain team and IT Department, providing technical solutions to meet user needs. This work is specifically focused on supply chain challenges related to our international expansion. In this role, you will have the opportunity to develop expertise in the business unit(s) you support, as well as an understanding of the IT organization’s systems and capabilities. A goal of this work is to grow your understanding of technological trends and bring solutions to supported business units to enhance the enterprise’s competitive edge.ResponsibilitiesServe as a trusted IT advisor to the Supply Chain DepartmentLeverage technical understanding and business acumen to translate high-level supply chain business requirements into functional and technical specifications for the IT organization and manage changes to those specificationsEffectively communicate with others to understand specific processes, deliver technical and functional requirements, and define success criteriaManage multiple projects/tasks of varying complexities with effective project managementAssist in integration and user acceptance testingSupport the development of training and implementation materials, partnering with IT Communications TeamManage/validate the implementation process and provide post-implementation support to business usersManage the lifecycle of technology products including their roadmapsInitiate and facilitate collaboration between business areas and technology teamsDrive decisions and determine compromises to keep projects moving forwardDemonstrate awareness of business opportunities to streamline processes with automated solutions, both internally and externally Minimum QualificationsExperience with Agile project management, including ScrumProficient writing SQL queriesStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsExcellent interpersonal skills; gets along well with othersStrong written and oral communication skillsServant spirit with strong sense of stewardshipAttention to detailSelf-starter who completes tasks with minimal supervisionAbility to manage multiple projects at onceTravel: 0-5% Preferred Qualifications4+ years of relevant experienceUnderstanding of Supply Chain systems and processes (distribution, ordering, inventory management, sourcing, supplier onboarding, etc.)Experience with international supply chain operations, systems, networks, and related challenges.Familiarity with supply chain software platforms (ex: Anaplan, LLamasoft, etc.)Experience working on projects and/or product development in a software engineering organizationExperience managing a software implementation and rolloutFamiliarity with some or all of the following: modern databases, cloud software patterns including microservices, Internet of Things, machine learning, and modern scripting languages such as Python or JavaChick-fil-A Restaurant experience, or general familiarity with restaurant operation Minimum Years of Experience3  Required Level of EducationBachelor's Degree  Major/ConcentrationIndustrial Engineering, Management Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field  Minimum GPA (4.0 Scale)3.0

Name: Business Analyst - Treasury
Description: Who is Georgia-Pacific? Watch to find out!You know us already! We make Brawny® paper towels; Dixie® paper cups and plates; Angel Soft® bath tissue; enMotion® paper towel dispensers, DensGlass® gypsum board and Plytanium® plywood you see in your big box home improvement stores and much more! We employ about 35,000 people who want to make a positive difference in today’s world by creating real long-term value for our customers.  We are seeking a Business Analyst - Treasury to join the Georgia-Pacific’s corporate finance and cash management team. We need a tech savvy person, someone who enjoys working within financial systems. We can teach you what you need to know about treasury. A Day In The Life Typically Includes:Treasury Technology – Support and use the treasury workstation including administration as well as process and payments optimization. Seeks and participates in advanced development opportunities with the treasury workstation.Cash and Short-Term Investments – Execute investment transactions and analyze cash investment alternatives to maximize the company’s interest income.Foreign Exchange – Provide FX analysis and execute transactions around the company’s foreign currency exposure.Debt Compliance – Monitor and track the company’s debt compliance and debt payments.Innovation - develop innovative strategies for improving business outcomes and drive innovation generate a continuous pipeline of new ideas.Cash Management – Support domestic and foreign cash management, cash positioning, payments, and bank fee analysis.Financial Controls – Seek opportunities to further enhance financial and cyber controls.Banking Relationships– interact on a day to day basis with commercial banks.Digital Transformation—support emerging technologies and system integration implementations.What You Will Need: Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or higher in information systems, accounting, finance, or related field.Advanced experience with Microsoft Office (e.g., Word, Excel, PowerPoint).What Will Put You Ahead?  Preferred Qualifications: Experience with treasury or financial systems, coding/data analysis, or cash operations.CTP certification.Why Work For GP?You will be working alongside a bunch of great people in a culture that places top priority on integrity and compliance. You will have opportunities for career growth at one of the largest, most financially-stable companies in the world. You will be encouraged to challenge the status quo and share your knowledge with others, and your responsibilities and rewards will be based on your contributions. You will enjoy competitive pay and benefits that help you manage your personal and financial wellness.  Want to learn more about Georgia-Pacific?Salary and benefits commensurate with experience.  We are an equal opportunity employer. Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran  Except where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test.  This employer uses E-Verify. Please visit the following website for additional information: www.kochcareers.com/doc/Everify.pdfFollow us

Name: SR BUSINESS ANALYST
Description: Position Description:POSITION PURPOSEThe Sr. Business Analyst contributes in a lead role to the Sr. Management team in the evaluation, design, development and implementation of standardized reporting, business processes and information systems solutions. The Sr. Business Analyst will act as a strategic thought partner on issues facing the business. The Sr. Business Analyst will develop and track category and performance as well as monitor trends.The Sr. Business Analyst should be able to leverage a strong merchandising knowledge base, a proven record of business process improvement, and data handling proficiency to be an agent for driving business value and organizational change. The Sr. Business Analyst should also possess exceptional communications skills and be able to effectively manage expectations of stakeholders, the project team and executive management. The Sr. Business Analyst should be able to utilize strong technical skills coupled with business intelligence to deliver valuable analytics offerings and reports.MAJOR TASKS, RESPONSIBILITIES AND KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES 50% Lead all phases of a project's life cycle including defining the business need, establishing criteria and business requirements, understanding the impact to the business and designing and rolling out the project  25% Serve as a subject matter expert and perform research and/or analysis within assigned projects or category of business  25% Establish and report on metrics of assigned projects or categories to gauge business value NATURE AND SCOPE Reports to Manager/Sr. Manager  No associates report to this role on a permanent basis, but requires the technical leadership of a project work team: may select team members and assess capabilities, provide technical training, provide information necessary to meet work, project or program objectives, evaluate program or project performance. ENVIRONMENTAL JOB REQUIREMENTSEnvironment: Located in a comfortable indoor area.  Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable. Travel: Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time.  ESSENTIAL SKILLS:MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Must be eighteen years of age or older.  Must be legally permitted to work in the United States. Education Required: The knowledge, skills, and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a bachelor's degree program or equivalent degree in a field of study related to the job. Years of Relevant Work Experience: 3 years Physical Requirements: Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about.  On rare occasions, there may be a need to move or lift light articles. Preferred Qualifications:Experience with designing business reports, dashboards and graphical presentations conveying analytical conceptsExperience with business data modeling, data warehousing and data mining techniquesExtensive knowledge of SQL and TableauKnowledge, Skills, Abilities, and Competencies: Strong project management skills, including strong process orientation, ability to work and lead cross-functional teams, strategic thinking, and creative problem-solving skills.  Analytical; Extensive knowledge of statistical methods and modeling  Ability to establish priorities and procedures for accomplishing work within established deadlines; ability to lead multiple projects and manage toward deadlines and deliverables  Strong communication and presentation skills, including ability to interact at Officer level; ability to negotiate and persuade  Proven success in increasing management roles handling multiple projects with competing deadlines.  Ability to assimilate extensive amounts of detailed data, analyze and summarize vast amounts of information as well as understand all of the detail supporting the analysis.  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.
