Name: Business Analyst IT
Description: Job DescriptionThe Next Media Group is looking for a motivated professional that can work independently in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment, developing enterprise platforms and mobile applications in the healthcare sector. The Business Analyst (BA) will ensure we are building the best application to fulfill the customer needs and optimize internal processes.  The BA will analyze data, decipher business and operational challenges / workstreams, and guide assigned stakeholders through business case development to define new applications and functionality. Assignments will include but not be limited to: cost / benefit analysis, risk / impact analysis, identify and develop key metrics, wireframing of UI requirements, and develop business cases for the integrated platforms and/or applications. The successful candidate will be highly analytical, have a strong understanding of operational workflow, and have a 360-degree view of the technical/functional mobile landscape in order to translate business objectives into proper system requirement specifications. The ideal candidate will have comprehensive experience with LMS, CMS, and HR systems as well as the interoperability requirements of related enterprise software. What you’ll be doingAnalyze business processes and user needs. Translate business objectives into documented system requirement specifications / functional specifications.Word with front-end designers.Business process definition, technical road-mapping, requirements definition, gap analysis, and development / support of integrated business applications that drive consistencies across Company platforms.Drive process improvement and best practices that result in exceptional user experience / elevated engagement.Define integration requirements for enterprise software systems; negotiate licensing, pricing, and customizations to ensure interoperability.Build user scenarios / test plans, perform functional testing, and ensure proper user acceptance testing of completed projects.Identify opportunities for improvement in our business operations and design / implement business solutions to facilitate day-to-day operations.QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Management Information Systems or equivalentMinimum 4 years of documented experience in iOS application developmentBusiness Analyst Certification (CBAP) is preferredAgile experience and/or certification and experience with case tools: CRM, MS SQL server, Jira, Sketch, MS Project, SharePoint, and Visio Lean certification or Six Sigma Green/Black Belt a plus Ability to communicate (exceptional written, verbal, and presentational skills) across various level of the organization to ensure acceptance and alignmentSuperior organization and planning skills, including the ability to direct and prioritize multiple and complex projects to completion within deadlines. Company DescriptionThe Next Media Group is a successful healthcare-focused organization (7+ years) that is growing rapidly. The Company connects healthcare professionals through intelligent digital, social, and mobile platforms.

Name: Senior Product Analyst
Description: Mailchimp is a leading marketing platform for small business. We empower millions of customers around the world to build their brands and grow their companies with a suite of marketing automation, multichannel campaign, CRM, and analytics tools.  The Sr. Product Analyst is a strategic member of the individual product domains which are mapped to customer problems. As a Sr. Product Analyst, you will be responsible for helping product teams build data-driven roadmaps by sizing and prioritize initiatives, providing a consistent flow of data-driven insights to help achieve targeted KPIs and creating dashboards and reporting to monitor and measure success. You're a skilled collaborator who is able to work across departments and disciplines. You're able to tell stories with data that help contextualize opportunities. The ideal candidate will have experience in similar product analytics, marketing optimization or digital analytics roles with strong technical and analytical abilities.  As a part of the Product team, the work you do will help shape our product strategy and drive us towards our company objectives - if you're excited to dig right in and have meaningful, we'd love to hear from you! ResponsibilitiesLead and manage analytics activities for a product domain, including partnering with and mentoring Product AnalystsIdentify KPIs for Product teams that map to customer problems and how to measure success; Partner with Product Managers and Product Marketing Managers for buy in and socialize across the teamPartner with Product Managers to size opportunities and build a prioritized roadmapIdentify opportunities for product changes/experiments based on analysis and proactively share these opportunities to the product teamUnderstand both quantitative and qualitative research and trends related to your product domain and be able to actively leverage those insights to help teams make data-informed decisionsCombine results of experiments and product launches to show how product teams have impacted KPIs and revenueCreate dashboard and automated reports to track KPIsDefine data tracking requirements and ensure proper executionContribute to data quality - identify discrepancies, create data tables needed for analysis and automationSupport experimentation initiatives by calculating sample size, monitoring and reporting on resultsPartner with other analysts on other product domains and across other disciplines in the company to share insights across teams and bring findings back to your domainRequirementsExtensive experience in an analytics focused role, product analytics experience is a plusBachelor's or Graduate degree (business or mathematics a plus or equivalent work experience)Desire to work in a fast-paced environmentExpertise in SQL, Web Analytics, Excel - R/Python is a plusProficiency in wrangling and transforming dataStrong communication, collaboration, and problem-solving abilitiesDemonstrated, hands-on experience with data visualization toolsExpertise with web analytics tools, specifically Google Analytics (certification preferred)Experience working with Google BigQuery a plusExperience with statistical methods such as regression and hypothesis testingProven experience analyzing data from a variety of different sources (quantitative and qualitative), presenting the data in a clear and concise manner, and create actionable insightsAbility to build relationships, be persuasive and influential within and across immediate working groupsExpertise in A/B testing analytics and best practices (a plus) Mailchimp is a founder-owned and highly profitable company headquartered in the heart of Atlanta. Our purpose is to empower the underdog, and our mission is to democratize cutting edge marketing technology for small business. We offer our employees an exceptional workplace, extremely competitive compensation, fully paid benefits (for employees and their families), and generous profit sharing. We hire humble, collaborative, and ambitious people, and give them endless opportunities to grow and succeed.  We love our hometown and support sustainable urban renewal. Our headquarters is in the historic Ponce City Market, right on the Atlanta Beltline. If you'd like to be considered for this position, please apply below. We look forward to meeting you!  Mailchimp is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity at our company. We don't discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Business/ Data Analyst
Description: Candid Partners is a cloud consulting firm which combines enterprise-class scale and process with born-in-the-cloud domain expertise. Candid’s seasoned management consultants, coming from the world’s top firms, easily translate complex business needs into specific technology solutions. Our technology consultants have deep public cloud and AWS specialty expertise with more than 80 percent holding AWS accreditations or certifications.  Candid is currently seeking an experienced Business Analyst with Data Analytics experience to join our team of expert management consultants. This person will be working with, and documenting where necessary, the existing and new data model. The Business Analyst is an active participant in all phases of the project lifecycle and will be required to work closely with a variety of internal and external business partners to ensure that all business requirements are met. What you’ll be doing:Understand (and document, where necessary) the existing data modelProvide input and feedback to the new data modelUnderstand existing business performance management reportsDesign new / clearer business performance management reportsDesign / provide requirements for: reporting and data reconciliation processes (i.e. “Audit” processes to make sure our databases do not get out of sync)Manage / assist with migration and data mapping activitiesManage / assist with addressing data quality issues with existing systemPossibly participate in data mining activitiesLead JAD sessions and individual client interviews (discovery and review sessions)Interface with clients and technical teams, including UX designersAddress issues with existing systemCapabilities/ Experience:Process re-engineering, including:Value analysisAs Is and To Be diagrams in Vision Lucid Chart or equivalentDiscovering and documenting process improvement and the value introduced by these changesOCM and role definition for new processesAssist with transition planning to new systemPrototyping, includingUse of prototyping tools such as Invision or iRiseData analysis, including:Creating Data Flow Diagrams (i.e., probably in a support role)Composing queries in SQL or equivalent (i.e., probably in a support role)Understanding entity relationshipsPresentation skills, including:Creating quality PowerPoint slidesComfortable presenting to multiple levels of management Candid Partners is one of the fastest growing companies in the US. Every day brings a new problem to solve and a chance to grow professionally and personally. We hire the best and brightest. You’ll collaborate with a team of like-minded, ambitious experts with the technical talent and business acumen your projects need to succeed. Not only that, but we were voted one of Atlanta’s Best Places to Work by the Atlanta Business Chronicle’s in 2017.  Are you ready to make your unique mark on Candid’s Culture?

Name: Sales Analyst - US
Description: At Kids II, we’re really good at what we do. And when we’re great at our jobs, we help parents be great at their jobs.  Parenting is demanding, and that’s where we come in. We want to reimagine how brands can make it easier for early stage parents – not by just selling them products, but by providing holistic solutions that transcend borders, categories and aisles.  No matter our title or department, at Kids II, our job is to create more tiny wins for parents, so they can create bright futures for their little ones. That’s a big task!  We’re serious about what we do, AND we love to have fun. Our team is hardworking, entrepreneurial, and passionate about helping families create millions, if not billions of tiny wins. SUMMARY The Sales Analyst supports the Account Team to drive sales and long-term initiatives with customer interaction and communication. The sales analyst provides sales reporting and data analytics to the Sales, Operations, Category. and Finance teams to drive key decision making and success measurement of the business relative to sales. The Sales Analyst creates and maintains weekly and monthly reports regarding sales trends including point of sale data and customer inventory metrics. Sales Analysts play a key role in the monthly forecast consensus process by providing key inputs regarding potential impacts to future forecasts. PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES AND ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Weekly reporting/tracking using customer POS data: Sales, Inventory, Promotions, New Items, etc.Prepare monthly segment trend, competitive analysis and promotional analysis along with insights using POS and syndicated data.Provide support for period and promotional forecastingDevelop and manage account specific business plan/annual sales planHelp with business reviews and fact-based account predictionsAssist with clearing of deductionsAssist in the identification and analysis of business issues and opportunitiesInteraction, Communication, and Collaboration with the account (Buyer, Inventory Analyst)Provide Ad-hoc support and analysis as neededMaintain technical skills on appropriate software applications to provide optimum level of supportOther duties and responsibilities as assigned.QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE1-2 years’ experience in sales or financial analysisExperience and demonstrated ability to analyze data and make appropriate recommendationsAnalytics: Business and marketplaceAdvanced Excel experience with pivot tables, graphs, and reportingEDUCATION & SKILLS4-year college degree in business, engineering, or related fieldPlans and manages effectivelyCritical thinking and problem solvingFocuses on the customerCommunication: Internal and externalExcellent communication skills and working with cross functional groups and customerAbility to consult with account teams and proactively identify appropriateCommunicate and work collaboratively internally and customerDemonstrated ability to work independentlyService orientedLearning agilityCERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS None required. COMPUTER/TYPING SKILLS Must be proficient in PowerPoint, Excel and Word; basic understanding of Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photo Shop  We offer competitive pay, flexible hours, and generous benefits. Plus, to keep things fun (because we are all kids at heart), we offer a host of team member activities and philanthropic efforts throughout the year and company-wide awards and recognition for a job well done!  Check out our website at www.kidsii.com and our social media pages on LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram for more information and open positions in the career section.  Drug Free Workplace M/F/D/V

Name: Sr Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Elavon provides end-to-end payment processing services to merchants and financial institutions in the United States, Brazil, Canada, Mexico, Puerto Rico, and throughout Europe. Our payment products are supported by the most reliable network in the industry and include credit and debit card processing, electronic check services, gift cards, dynamic currency conversion, multi-currency support, and cross-border acquiring. We handle every aspect of the acquiring relationship?transaction processing, risk and underwriting, settlement, equipment deployment, chargeback management, reporting, and customer service. Our customers can also count on us to keep their payment processing compliant with changing payment security requirements.  Elavon employs about 3,600 people located worldwide. Together, we support more than one million clients spread among the retail, restaurant, hospitality, government, healthcare, education, and e-commerce sectors. Elavon utilizes a white-label branding model, and we work with strong partners to market our services through a variety of sales channels, including large financial institutions, community banks, trade associations, government agencies, and ISOs/MSPs. We are the:  + \#1 airline processor  + \#2 hospitality processor  + \#4 U.S. acquirer, based on bank card volume  + \#6 European acquirerElavon?s Global Acquiring Solutions organization is part of U.S. Bank?s Payment Services division. U.S. Bancorp is the fifth-largest commercial bank in the United States.Elavon is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst who enjoys solving business problems. He/she will interact with business stakeholders and technology teams to define requirements, mine data, and provide insights and business recommendations. This role will be measured by timeliness, frequency, and accuracy of insights delivery and their impacts on Elavon business stakeholders assigned. Main responsibilities include:  + Develops executive-level reports and presents complex, customized analytic findings to senior leadership team;  + Delivers actionable and measurable insights that drive business for the organization;  + Analyzes customer behavior and business performance data; and  + Assists in streamlining and broadening the access of analytics to strategic decision makers  + Motivated by driving revenue through data based analytics  _Your Career is Here._ *Qualifications:***Basic Qualifications** + Bachelor?s degree in accounting, finance, statistics, engineering, or equivalent experience  + 5 years in an analytical role  + Possess great communication skills and a passion for analysis  + Ability to articulate how data and analysis relates to Key Performance Indicators  + Communication and persuasion skills at the executive level  + Excels at bridging between the customer, relationship management and data  + Understanding of what can be improved by better data and analysis  + Ability to provide stewardship/ evangelism to drive standardization, adoption, and acceptance on an ongoing basis  + Ability to navigate, extract, explore, qualify, and analyze diverse internal and external data  + Experience building multidimensional analysis models  + Experimental/R&D based mindset  + Ability to self-govern Business Intelligence content and analytic environment  + Ability to train and educate others *Preferred Qualifications** + SQL Experience  + Tableau Experience  + Statistical modeling experience in regression, forecasting, and segmentation  + Extensive knowledge of financial analysis concepts and methodologies  + Excellent financial analysis, forecasting, and planning skills *Job:** Information Technology*Primary Location:** Minnesota-MN-Minneapolis*Shift:** 1st - Daytime*Average Hours Per Week:** 40*Requisition ID:** 180042354*Other Locations:** United States U.S. Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse workforce.  U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

Name: Business Analyst II
Description: Title & Id: Business Analyst II  Location: 6205 Peachtree Dunwoody, Atlanta, GA 30328  Description:  Creating and maintaining the strategic partnership between business needs and technology delivery  Eliciting and developing business requirements  Work closely with the team in the definition, testing, training, implementation, and support of functional requirements  Requirements:  Qualifications:  3 to 5 years of experience with PeopleSoft Payroll  3 to 5 years of experience in performing IT Business Analyst activities including client interviewing, requirements gathering (1-on-1 and leading large workshops), solution review, process improvement, and training.  Excellent written and oral communication skills coupled with the ability to listen, question, and understand clients' needs relative to enterprise software solutions.  Experience working in a team environment in which passion, curiosity, and mutual respect are a must.  Prefer college degree preferably a technical degree (or equivalent experience)  Ability to work with clients to understand their needs:  Strong technical writing/documentation preferred  Functional design ability including screen flows/mockups, data validation  Soft technical design to include modeling of underlying data structures.  Ability to communicate with business people in a clear/professional manner.  Strong ability to work with developers to minimize gaps between business need and technical out come  Strong ability to interface DIRECTLY with developers and hardware/systems engineers  Absolutely must be a team player. Name: Hybris Commerce Business Analyst
Description: Job descriptionAccenture Digital The digital revolution is changing everything, transforming how we work and play. Are you reacting to the disruption each day or are you leading the way as a digital disrupter? Accenture Digital is driving these exciting changes and bringing them to life across 40 industries in more than 120 countries. At the forefront of digital, you’ll create it, own it and make it a reality for clients looking to better serve their connected customers and operate always-on enterprises. Join us and become an integral part of our experienced digital team with the credibility, expertise and insight clients depend on. Accenture Interactive Accenture Digital is powered by three practices – Interactive, Mobility and Analytics. Accenture Interactive helps the world’s leading brands delight their customers and deliver superior business performance and customer experiences. As part of Accenture Interactive Delivery, you’ll balance art and science to create award-winning digital experiences for today’s connected consumers through integrated and dynamic solutions that incorporate strategy, marketing, creative and technology. Or perhaps you’ve become the go-to thought leader for eCommerce and web content management systems? If driving the business and functional requirements of large-scale projects fits squarely within your digital wheelhouse, Accenture may be the perfect place to build your career. the solutionManage and conduct requirements gathering, stakeholder interviews and initial client discover workPrepare detailed requirement specifications, functional specifications, use case and and scenariosPrepare training materials appropriate for target audiences and developed solution and conduct training sessionsAssist with gap analysis, business process redesign, roadmap planning and developing proof-of-conceptsSupport the development of strong client relationships by building trust, rapport and strong working relationships with key sponsors, stakeholders, and team membersTRAVEL: methodologies1+ year of implementing eCommerce and/or web content management applicationsBachelor's DegreeSET YOURSELF APART: Preferred Skills1+ years of project coordination or team lead experienceFunctional expertise in relevant eCommerce or WCM technologies such as hybris, Oracle/ATG, Sterling Order Management, Manhattan Associates, Demandware, Intershop, IBM Websphere Commerce Adobe AEM (CQ), SDL Tridion, Sitecore, Fatwire and CrownPeakExperience eliciting high-level business requirements and creating detailed functional specs as well as other documentation like requirement traceability matrixes, work-flow diagrams and use-casesAbility to lead team and client meetings and to clearly articulate the solution being developed with all the stake holdersExperience in a consulting environment with demonstrated track record of continuing responsibilities, creativity and innovationExcellent communication skills, both written and verbal with strong presentation skillsStrong interpersonal, team building, organizational and motivational skillsBachelors or master’s degree in computer science, engineering, MIS or related fieldWHERE YOU LIVE: West OUR COMMITMENT TO YOU · Your entrepreneurial spirit and vision will be rewarded, and your success will fuel opportunities for career advancement  · You’ll make a difference for some pretty impressive clients. Accenture serves many of the Fortune Global 100 on high-profile projects  · Opportunities to learn daily through training, assignments and collaboration with experts across the company  · Access to leading-edge technology  · Along with a competitive salary, Accenture offers a comprehensive package that includes generous paid time off, 401K match and an employee healthcare plan CALL TO ACTION Now is the time to become a digital disrupter. The opportunity is here—what’s stopping you from pursuing it?  Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status). Accenture is an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.  Equal Employment Opportunity:  All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law. Name: Corporate Analyst
Description: About First Data First Data is the global leader in payment technology and services solutions. With 23,000 owner-associates and operations in 34 countries, the company provides secure and innovative payment technology and services to more than six million merchants and financial institutions around the world, from small businesses to the world’s largest corporations. Today, businesses in nearly 70 countries trust First Data to secure and process over 2,000 financial transactions per second. First Data’s unparalleled infrastructure and partnerships go “beyond the transaction” with next-generation point-of-sale technology fueled by powerful analytics to detect fraud, gain insights into consumer spending, and strengthen customer loyalty. All day, every day, First Data helps its clients thrive in the evolving world of commerce. Job Description First Data is driving technological enhancements and solutions within the dynamic Payments Industry, and is helping to transform the global economy. Our product line and client base continue to grow, as do the customers we serve. First Data helps its customers by optimizing its own operations through process improvement and smart business management. If you want to be on the cutting edge of the Payments Industry, then the First Data Corporate Analyst Program is for you! During this career development program, you will have two one-year assignments in core roles in one of our four main functional areas: Operations, Global Business, Corporate or Technology & Innovation. Each role will build upon the other and together will provide a breadth of experience unique in the business world…and unique to you! First Data is looking for university graduates with drive and enthusiasm. The best & brightest will be the framework of the firm’s future; a pipeline of top talent for manager positions in critical functional areas of the firm. Candidate Qualifications & Education RequirementsWhat we are looking for… Recent graduate of a bachelor’s degree programGPA 3.5 preferredEnthusiasm and inquisitivenessDrive and initiativeSelf-starter capable of working autonomouslyAnalytical/quantitative skillsCollaboration skills and ability to work effectively as a team memberStrong communication and presentation skillsAttention to detail, highly adaptable, ability to multi-taskStrong Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skillsProject management skills and experience a plusMust possess unrestricted work authorization and not require future sponsorshipPlease Note: Our Corporate Analyst Program interview process begins in November and typically lasts through March for a July 2018 start date. You can expect to hear from one of our recruiters if your qualifications align. First Data is an Equal Opportunity Employer (Minorities/Women/Veteran/Disabled/LGBT). Please visit our website firstdata.jobs.net and conduct a search for "Corporate Analyst Program" to create a candidate profile and apply. *MJSA

Name: Sr. Business Analyst
Description: Responsible for leading initiatives and providing consultation to the internal and/or external customer. Possess expertise in the customer area he/she supports and has technical understanding of the business unit’s systems, capabilities, and respective technologies. Analyze customer processes and requirements. Prepare specified project documentation. Assist in business process redesign as needed. Maintain communication with customer and team members and promote a team environment. Name: Senior Data Integration Analyst
Description: Working at Influence Health means making a difference. The work we do is important, so we hire innovators, trailblazers and leaders. We need people with big ideas who can tackle tough problems and challenge the status quo. If youre ready to design, build or deliver something great, you should join us.  At Influence Health, we believe in a culture of excellence and high performance. We value ideas and results. We hold each other to high standards. We believe our work speaks for itself. We take our work seriously, but not ourselves.  The Senior Data Integration Analyst is a motivated self-starter, quick and creative thinker with the ability to design, develop, test, implement and support ETL/ELT (extract, load, transform) processes that pull data from various source systems and integrate it into the Influence Health data warehouse. This role requires strong technical ability, and a unique combination of business acumen and analytical skills--from requirements gathering to solutions implementation and reporting.  The ideal candidate will have a high level of curiosity and the desire to find new ways to be constantly more productive, effective and efficient in helping clients reach their business goals--this means facing new challenges and pushing yourself to work outside of your comfort zone.  The Senior Data Integration Analyst will function as an integrator between business needs and technology, helping to create data solutions to meet business challenges. A strong drive to learn and a creative approach to problem solving is necessary in this position. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight, and insight into business decisions. system data to assess data quality; work with technical and business representatives to determine strategies for handling data anomalies identifiedDevelop and follow best practices for data mapping, Comfortable with ambiguityDesire to help define and improve processes and deliverablesResults and service-oriented mindset, tenacious attention to detailExcellent organizational, time management, interpersonal and problem-solving skillsStrong communication skills as interfacing with developers, business users, clients and business partners are critical to successSkilled presenter - able to effectively conduct formal and informal presentations in both small and large group settings within all levels of an organizationKey Technical Skills:Microsoft Office suite: Excel, Power Point, Word, etc.Expertise in SQL, including aggregation and grouping and relational databases such as MySQL and Amazon RedshiftBasic programming skills in JavaScript, Bash, Python, etc.Strong working knowledge of Linux command line and toolsFamiliarity with data formats such as JSON, XML (including XPath and XSLT), and flat filesFamiliarity with BI reporting tools such as TableauExperience:7+ years' experience in data integration with enterprise business applications, performing data validation on complex datasets, and reporting from multiple data sourcesMinimum of a 4-year college degree, preferably in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or StatisticsExperience translating data into actionable business recommendations At Influence Health we get all the perks youd expect from a leading technology company including competitive compensation and benefits programs to include 401(k) with company match, casual dress code, employee referral bonuses, quarterly social events, community outreach programs, free healthy snacks and monthly lunches, corporate sabbaticals, and the opportunity to work with a great team of talented, passionate people!

Name: Business Systems Analyst (ERP)
Description: McKesson is in the business of better health and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. McKesson Medical-Surgical provides medical-surgical supplies and equipment to physicians' offices, home care agencies, long-term care facilities and surgery centers. Our catalog includes more than 150,000 national brand products from bandages to exam tables, plus McKesson's own line of high-quality medical-surgical products. We're proud to be the only national distributor serving the entire continuum of healthcare.  Every single McKesson employee contributes to our mission—by joining McKesson Medical-Surgical you act as a catalyst in a chain of events that helps millions of people all over the globe. Your expertise, drive and passion can help us improve everything we touch, from providers to payors to pharmacies. You’ll collaborate on the products and solutions that help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Working here is your opportunity to shape an industry that’s vital to us all.  Join our team of leaders to begin a rewarding career.Position DescriptionThe Business Systems Analyst will administer Security for the JD Edwards E1 ERP. This includes group, individual,  and role provisioning. Work with applications and business groups to establish  roles. Provide segregation of duties support for SOX and audit compliance.  Also, work with off shore, and configuration network computing groups for  application upgrades. The candidate should have detailed knowledge of the  JD Edwards application structures along with database table intersection  knowledge.  The administrator will also work with the corporate security  office regarding the need to  identify cyber threats; devise appropriate defense strategies; develop policy;  plan and conduct security assessments; and understand the ethical, legal, and  regulatory environment as it relates to operating in cyberspace.Minimum Requirements 8 years experience in designing, building, and implementing business solutions using information technology. Proven, significant experience in business analysis, requirements definition and deployment of business requirements to information systems. Critical SkillsExperience with JD Edwards ERP systemsSpecialized Knowledge & SkillsKnowledge of the JD Edwards ERP, the file structures, and the application intersections. How to retrofit code changes from JD Edwards release 9.1 to 9.2 Education 4-year degree in computer science or related field or equivalent experience Physical Requirements General Office Demands Benefits & Company Statement McKesson believes superior performance – individual and team – that helps us drive innovations and solutions to promote better health should be recognized and rewarded. We provide a competitive compensation program to attract, retain and motivate a high-performance workforce, and it’s flexible enough to meet the different needs of our diverse employee population.  We are in the business of better health and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. We partner with payers, hospitals, physician offices, pharmacies, pharmaceutical companies and others across the spectrum of care to build healthier organizations that deliver better care to patients in every setting.  But we can’t do it without you. Every single McKesson employee contributes to our mission—whatever your title, whatever your role, you act as a catalyst in a chain of events that helps millions of people all over the globe. Talented, compassionate people are the future of our company—and of healthcare. At McKesson, you’ll collaborate on the products and solutions that help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Working here is your opportunity to shape an industry that’s vital to us all.  McKesson is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer – minorities/females/veterans/persons with disabilities.  Qualified applicants will not be disqualified from consideration for employment based upon criminal history. Agency Statement No agencies please.

Name: Business Analyst - Salesforce
Description: RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce has a client seeking a Business Analyst - Salesforce in Atlanta, Georgia (GA).  Job Summary:  The client is looking for a Salesforce Administrator with a passion for winning in the Internet-of-Things economy. Our client is looking for someone who specializes in understanding how to apply new customer centric and "internet of things" solutions to join a diverse team whose mission is to develop new products and services that will truly transform the markets in which we serve. Responsibilities: Analyze business performance and manage stakeholder requirements primarily related to Salesforce service, sales, and marketing environments Conduct requirements gathering/analysis via information gathering sessions with business users and technical staff in Agile delivery environment Conduct analysis of existing business processes; recommend process improvements Create design documentation based on business requirements In coordination with the Salesforce Administrator, when needed, build and implement new solutions in Salesforce related to process improvement Responsible for customer understanding and ownership of related reporting needs Advise the organization when necessary on how to best utilize the data within Salesforce and reporting warehouse Assist in evaluation of app exchange tools Responsible for creating, managing and reporting backlog Responsible for development and maintenance of field reports/dashboards using Salesforce report builder/workbench Develop training materials and conducts training sessions with business users Track user adoption and report on related performance metrics Communicate effectively with business users on the status of features and enhancements Develop comprehensive test plans with users, coordinate test activities and/or help execute test components Achieve training plan and maintain certifications Up to 50% travel first 6 monthsREQUIREMENTS: Either already Salesforce Certified (preferred) or has a drive to achieve required certifications At least 4 years of experience working in a Business Analyst, Salesforce Administrator or SFDC developer function Detailed experience with the CRM reporting and analytics Experience with Service Cloud, Sales Cloud and Marketing Cloud Strong knowledge of Salesforce.com including workflows, triggers, reporting, general design concepts and overall approach of Salesforce.com as a CRM platform Knowledge of SFDC custom development and visual force code is a plus Proven knowledge of the software and systems development life cycle Proficient understanding of relational database concepts Knowledge of SSRS reporting platform is a plus Ability to analyze business processes, design process improvements, and train business users Excellent writing skills with the ability to express strategy, technical knowledge, and processes in easily understood presentations Ability to rapidly learn and take advantage of new concepts, business models, and technologies Ability to work independently and on multiple projects against deadlines Solid teamwork skills - works well with a diverse team Execution minded - someone who makes and keeps commitments Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Business Analyst/Technical Analyst (ASAP)
Description: Job DescriptionSummary:The Business Analyst/Technical Analysts primary role is to  provide leadership and coordination of the development activities  required to meet the business requirements of the organization.  The Business Analyst/Technical Analyst role is grounded in  technology, solution design, and development. This role is  primarily responsible for understanding business requirements,  facilitating technical design and development execution. The  analyst will be responsible for scoping and working with the  technology team to design and develop an of data warehouse and  its components and work closely with Business analysts, Technical  Analysts, Architects, and Developers in the supported functional  areas to execute and deliver a solution based on the business  requirements.  Key Accountabilities Collects, understands and defines business requirements and translates these into functional specifications Participate in quality assurance/testing, providing ad-hoc reporting to clients in support of business/project needs and  assisting Managers with workshops as needed Become a subject matter expert on the product, business processes, data, and existing reports. Facilitating analysis meetings with customers and product teamUse business knowledge to research customer requests and recommend solutions Recommend business process improvements, where appropriateParticipate in process and/or data modelingSupporting the development team and QA with testing activities and needs Coordinating and participating in User Acceptance TestingCommunicating regularly with senior team members regarding task or project status Coordinating the migration of projects into productionPreparing application release notes and distribute them to the customer, when needed Assess data quality exceptions and coordinate with upstream data providers/ reference data teams for resolution of the data  issues Undertake periodic review of procedures and control documentsParticipate in preparing Technical Design / Specifications, creates prototypes, and develops routines for data extraction and  loading Coordinates technical activity; oversees scheduling, training, long-term planning, and quality control activities to ensure the  stability, integrity, and efficient operation of the data  warehouse Executes and assists in Unit testing, Regression testing and provide support for UAT testing Prioritizes and manages multiple complex projects within time, technical and resource constraints Provides written documentation to appropriate team members and clients, addressing each facet of implementation/support for  every project Provides advanced problem solving, troubleshooting and system consultation as needed for clients Participates in the delivery of high-quality software releases within budget and to schedule  Essential skills and Qualifications Ability to translate complex concepts between business and technical groups Support the user definition, business design, development, and testing phases, and is a liaison between the application  development team and the clients Experience in Reference Data Management, Operations or Reconciliation or related control function, with good product  knowledge and good understanding of data, flows and product  reference data Solid analytical skills to identify the scope of issues and ability to provide appropriate solutions Good knowledge of financial products across various asset classes Good knowledge of Reference Data/Master Data and data management controls Solid presentation and communication skills, especially with stakeholder groups, including senior management face-off Ability to understand Data model and is proficient in SQL Query writing and analyzing data Ability to multi-task and meet critical deadlines in a fast-paced environment Solid understanding of software quality assurance and processesPossesses excellent written, oral and interpersonal communications skills Ability to navigate related technology, such as SQL, coding and .Net technology Possesses basic project management skills, is highly self-motivated, and has demonstrated achievement in  establishing/meeting responsible deadlines as well as managing  time effectively Desired Experience:Bachelors degree (or equivalent experience ) in IT, computer science or related Strong understanding of software development lifecycleThree (3+) plus years of experience in data warehouseMust have good knowledge of Microsoft Project/Sharepoint Workspace planning tools Must be able to write and troubleshoot complex SQL queriesExperience with multiple data formats and systems requiredMust have at 2 plus years and a good understanding of data modeling and some experience in fact-finding and documentation  techniques

Name: Workday Absence Analyst (Entry-level)
Description: Collaborative Solutions offers entry-level consulting opportunities for individuals looking to gain hands-on experience with cutting-edge technology. We proudly partner with Workday, one of the leading cloud-based software solutions for HR, finance and payroll management.Our Absence Management Analyst position is best-suited for self-starters who are eager to work with exciting, Fortune 500 companies and dive head first into all phases of Workday system implementations. We provide world-class, on-the-job training; an incredibly supportive network of mentors and an environment that inspires teamwork and collaboration.Responsibilities:Earn your Workday HCM and Workday Absence Management certifications and continue to seek out opportunities for learning, development, and mentorship.Buddy-up with other new hires to attend our Freshmen Orientation, Workday certification and Consulting 101 training as part of your onboarding experience.Partner with our talented Workday Absence, Time Tracking and Payroll teams to continue learning “tricks of the trade”, consulting best practices, and how to “speak” Workday after completing onboarding training. Continue to network with other “Collabies,” as well as others in the Workday ecosystem as you draw upon your strong communication and interpersonal skills.Learn how to best support our customers and how to work with a variety of employee levels. Contribute to all phases of our Workday implementations from assisting lead consultant(s) in gathering business requirements, designing and prototyping Absence solutions, and thoroughly testing and implementing those solutions while developing and utilizing Collaborative tools. This helps ensure excellence in all tasks and deliverables, and will empower our customers to succeed after their projects are “live.”Assist in configuring the system to the customers’ expectations and requirements under the supervision of your lead consultant. This includes core configuration, iLoads in data conversion tasks, tenant to tenant configuration moves, business processes, security, testing, fit gap analysis, reports, and much more. We will provide you the tools and training to become an expert in these areas.Skills & Requirements:1 year of work experience in an office environment preferredBachelor’s degree in Business Management, Computer Science, Economics, Information Systems, Mathematics, or Finance requiredStrong aptitude for critical thinking and logic problems with an appetite for problem solvingExceptional resourcefulness, planning and time management, attention to detail and process, and research skillsIntermediate to advanced Microsoft Office skills, including Excel, PowerPoint, and WordAbility to travel up to 75%, including international travel, and a valid passport requiredEqual Opportunity statement:All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or status as a Vietnam or disabled veteran.Disability statement:Because we do business with the government, we must reach out to, hire and provide equal opportunity to qualified people with disabilities. If you’d like to voluntarily submit your disability status to us, please use the url in this posting to complete the Voluntary Self-Identification of Disability form and send it to EEO@collaborativesolutions.com. Any answer you provide will be kept private and will not be used against you in any wayhttps://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/sec503/Self_ID_Forms/VoluntarySelf-ID_CC-305_ENG_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.Apply Now

Name: Associate Business Analyst
Description: JOB SUMMARY The purpose of this position is to provide analytical support through research, data collection and data management of information for the organization. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Responsible for data collection, data input and/or aggregation and data auditing to support accurate key metric reporting and analysis performed by the organization.  Reviews accuracy of information provided and responds to requests from management and vendors.  Assists in generating Business As Usual (BAU) reports. Supports ad-hoc presentation/analysis development and responds to information requests from management.  Other duties may be assigned. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position.  \n\nQUALIFICATIONS  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE  Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) from 4-year college or university. Master's degree preferred. 0-2 years of related experience.  CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES  None. COMMUNICATION SKILLS Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information. FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis. REASONING ABILITY Ability to understand and carry out general instructions in standard situations. Ability to solve problems in standard situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.  OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES  Experience in the use of Microsoft applications with emphasis on Excel and PowerPoint. SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY Decisions made with general understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor.

Name: Business Operations Analyst
Description: Collaborative Solutions is a team of trusted advisors providing objective, experience-based consulting to public-sector agencies, mid-sized businesses and Fortune 500 companies. We support the entire Workday implementation cycle and work closely with our customers from start to finish, helping them avoid the pitfalls that erode the profitability, efficiencies, and accountability these enterprise platforms promise.  Our company is searching for an Business Operations Analyst who has experience in understanding data and its components, analyzing the data against metrics and trends and report these to the executive management team for both sales and delivery organizations. This person will be the in-house guru for the overall integrity of sales and delivery data as well as maintaining and providing key metrics to the management team. In this newly created role, the team will look to the Business Operations Analyst to help establish/streamline policies and procedures throughout both departments and support best practices in forecasting, reporting, and communications. As the Business Analyst, your responsibilities would include data analysis, reporting, market research, competitive analysis, planning, and process optimization. The successful candidate will also work with the management team to identify opportunities to help increase profitability and develop specialized service offerings for clients, build efficiencies and drive productivity. Ideal candidates will have excellent communication skills, and the ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced and fun environment. This ideal candidate is an independent thinker, highly analytical and process driven. Responsibilities:Track and analyze key metrics within the businessCollect, consolidate and generate weekly delivery and sales forecasts (month and quarter focus)Compile key pieces of information related to performance against objectives to be reviewed by ManagementProactively analyze win-loss data and reports on key findings to sales leadershipAct as liaison for all Salesforce data and reporting for accuracy needed for KPI MetricsReporting and analysis including: executive reporting of sales and delivery results, key metrics and KPIs, campaign tracking and analysis, and ad hoc strategic analysis.Implement and manage reports and dashboards ensuring sales and delivery leaders have access to key data required to successfully manage the business.Recommend revisions to existing reports, or assists in the development of new reporting tools as neededWork with the management team on process improvements to gain efficiencies within the businessSkills & Qualifications:3-plus years in a Business Analyst or similar roleMust be able to work effectively with minimal supervisionBachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Operations Research, Finance, Marketing, or related DegreeStrong quantitative and qualitative analytical abilities. ·Ability to project manage operational tasksExcellent oral and written communication skillsAbility to work with management at every levelMust be able to be in their local office at least 3 days per weekEqual Opportunity statement: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or status as a Vietnam or disabled veteran. Disability statement: Because we do business with the government, we must reach out to, hire and provide equal opportunity to qualified people with disabilities. If you’d like to voluntarily submit your disability status to us, please use the url in this posting to complete the Voluntary Self-Identification of Disability form and send it to EEO@collaborativesolutions.com. Any answer you provide will be kept private and will not be used against you in any way.  For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.

Name: Business/Data Analyst
Description: Business/Data Analyst Excellent opportunity to join a world-class organization as a Business/Data Analyst. If you're a data centric BA who enjoys digging into data to present findings and drive decision making, than you don't want to miss out. If you thrive on making an immediate impact and enjoy fast-pace environments, this is an excellent direct hire opportunity to join a dynamic team that is critical to this industry leader..  This is a key techno-functional role where you will work closely with the product owners and tech team to provide Business Intelligence (BI) insights that are disrupting the industry. You will work with several large and complex SQL databases and a number of applications to query data and participate in data analysis and use your findings to drive decision making. In this role you will work closely with development to create product designs and document technical specifications  This is an excellent opportunity to join an intelligent, fun and innovative team that is driving innovation and staying on the forefront of their industry. You will have the opportunity to work with internal customers and create views and design analysis models for business users. The ideal person for the role should have a strong interest in data, quantitative analysis and gathering/translating requirements.  This is a 6 month contract to hire position in Atlanta, GA with a leading enterprise organization. If you're a Business/Data Analyst, this is your opportunity to catapult your career! You will gain invaluable experience and work within a highly visible environment that is delivering innovative solutions. Collaborative team, environment and flex hours. Excellent benefits as well as an annual bonus and 401k matching. REQUIRED SKILLS:3-8 years Business Analyst experience1+ years Data Analyst or Business Intelligence focusAbility to write SQL queriesPREFERRED SKILLS:Tableau or QlikviewSSRS or other reporting toolsUnderstanding of dimensional modelling and data warehouse conceptsPower BIExperience working in an Agile environment Must be authorized to work in the U.S./Sponsorships are not availableGet alerts to jobs like this, to your inbox.Create Job AlertSimilar Jobs You May LikeSee More JobsSee AllSuggested searches

Name: Business Analyst I
Description: DescriptionJOB DESCRIPTION: Assists in identifying and developing solutions for customers' information technology needs. Monitors and analyzes the delivery of ongoing information services to assigned customers to assure a high level of customer satisfaction. Collects, organizes, and analyzes data and generates and provides accurate and complete reports for management and/or regulatory agencies. Interprets applicable regulations and establishes filing and auditing procedures to ensure records and files are accurate and in compliance. Provides input into departmental goals and objectives. Attends meetings of professional, civic and service organizations. Promotes positive public and professional relations. Works closely with clients to support the development and successful implementation of innovative, high quality business solutions. Assists in developing strategies to ensure that systems projects meet business objectives and requirements. May assist in the development of or contribute to published articles or presentations. Performs other related duties as required. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Five years of experience in planning and applying information technology to one or more business functions OR a bachelor's degree and three years of experience in planning and applying information technology to one or more business functions. PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS (MediumMax 25lbs): up to 25 lbs, 0-33% of the work day (occasionally); 11-25 lbs, 34-66% of the workday (frequently); 01-10 lbs, 67-100% of the workday (constantly); Lifting 25 lbs max; Carrying of objects up to 25 lbs; Occasional to frequent standing & walking, Occasional sitting, Close eye work (computers, typing, reading, writing), Physical demands may vary depending on assigned work area and work tasks. ENVIRONMENTAL FACTORS: Factors affecting environment conditions may vary depending on the assigned work area and tasks. Environmental exposures include, but are not limited to: Blood-borne pathogen exposure Bio-hazardous waste Chemicals/gases/fumes/vapors Communicable diseases Electrical shock, Floor Surfaces, Hot/Cold Temperatures, Indoor/Outdoor conditions, Latex, Lighting, Patient care/handling injuries, Radiation, Shift work, Travel may be required. Use of personal protective equipment, including respirators, environmental conditions may vary depending on assigned work area and work tasks.

Name: Business Analyst I
Description: DescriptionJOB DESCRIPTION: Supports efforts to ensure that information systems support departmental objectives and information management needs. Works at the direction of Enrollment Services and managers and closely with departmental customers to conduct business analysis and identify objectives and requirements. and report the results of analysis conducted.  Collects, organizes and presents information to assist in the development of technology plans and strategies. Assists in planning and implementing systems related projects. Supports customer satisfaction by monitoring the delivery of ongoing information services to designated clients, responding to customer questions and offering alternative solutions to identified problems and issues. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Five years of position specific subject matter knowledge and/or experience in planning and applying information technology to one or more business functions OR a bachelor's degree and three years of position specific subject matter knowledge and/or experience in planning and applying information technology to one or more business functions. DATE CREATED.MODIFIED/REVIEWED: 11/4/10 DRSAdditional DetailsAdditional Job Details  Position Assignment: Enrollment Services Department  Direct Supervisor: Director of Enrollment Services Oversees, monitors, and handles information associated with the University initiative of maintaining the integrity of data management with respect to enrollment and financial data for the Rollins School of Public Health. Closely coordinates efforts with the Department of Admissions, Registrar’s Office, Financial Aid and Student Financial Services to ensure integrity of data from the status of admission to matriculation and throughout student enrollment. Assists in the conversion of data input and troubleshooting with On-Base. Assists in training and troubleshoots issues of projects with appropriate department personnel.Assures accuracy of all student enrollment records’ data including student program plans, student sub-plans affecting accurate tuition posting, anticipated graduation dates, external residency programs etc. Coordinates activities with appropriate departments that have different program options and demonstrates the ability to explain program options to customers and professional staff.Processes and enters student data changes such as course withdrawal requests, leave of absence, grade change status requests, enrollment status to residency status, degree extension plans, etc. Reviews and monitors compliance of change in status to assure compliance with University policies.Responds to inquiries regarding enrollment and financial data by Dean’s Office, departments, faculty, staff, students, and other university offices. Develops queries as needed to meet requests. Assures that the data released is in accordance with FERPA. Works closely with the Registrar’s Office in handling sensitive data requests.Coordinates, oversees, and administers financial aid awards for the School of Public Health assuring that RSPH students receive the allotted distribution for need-based scholarships, merit scholarships, and special departmental/program awards. Manages and enters the financial awards and award postings with host organizations/programs that provide financial assistance including the RSPH Merit and Assistantship Program, Adopt-A- Scholar program, Returning Peace Corp Volunteers, AmeriCorp, Saudi Arabia Fellows program, Humphrey, Foege, and Fogarty fellows, NIOSH grant recipients, Health Sciences and MD/MPH dual degree awards, four special fellow programs at Emory and the CDC, Yellow Ribbon program, and the RSPH REAL program. Maintains a record of individual award formulas and their disbursements. Posts awards to student accounts and apply for item types as necessary.Monitors merit award program and maintains records of all awards, scholarships, and fellowships. Initiates and coordinates the analysis of data of student acceptance and financial awards, determining whether there is a relationship between specific awards and the acceptance rate.Works closely with departments and the Registrar’s Office to assure accuracy of the electronic advising program process. Develops new advising reports for new degree and certificate programs. Updates program plans as necessary.Researches and develops a database of potential financial assistance resources for both national and international recipients. Assist individual students with their request of additional contacts for financial assistance.Monitors merit award program and maintains records of all awards, scholarships, and fellowships. Initiates and coordinates the analysis of data of student acceptance and financial awards, determining whether there is a relationship between specific awards and the acceptance rate.Works closely with departments and the Registrar’s Office to assure accuracy of the electronic advising program process. Develops new advising reports for new degree and certificate programs. Updates program plans as necessary.Researches and develops a database of potential financial assistance resources for both national and international recipients. Assist individual students with their request of additional contacts for financial assistance. Preferred  Enrollment/academic affairs experience or experience in higher education  Experience working with MS Office Products (e.g. Excel, Word, Visio),Advance experience in Excel including developing and working with Pivot Tables, OnBase to document business process and business process improvements  Experience extracting data from line of business software and use of statistical analysis software such as SAS or SPS to provide institutional reports for project stakeholders. Working knowledge of relational databases (PeopleSoft and OnBase) and CRMs such as Slate

Name: Business Analyst Intern
Description: Job Description The successful candidate will work in a fun team environment that supports implementation projects and ongoing support. An essential part of this position is supporting customers to set up online accounts and managing the collection of the data and delivery processes. Primary duties will be managed in help desk environment and proprietary systems.Desired Skills & Experience Must demonstrate strong experience with Microsoft Office (excel, word, powerpoint). Experience working with Database technology (Access / SQL) a plus Strong attention to detail and high degree of speed and accuracy Aptitude with new technologies and strong flexibility and adaptability to the changing work environments Interest in the energy industry Roles and Responsibilities Assist with customer requirements and develop a plan to execute projects on time and within budget constraints Assist with the quality assurance process surrounding the life cycle of expected accounts until delivery Develop, improve and maintain processes surrounding customer acceptance of delivered Urjanet data Coordinate with the Chennai, India team to ensure that Service Level Agreements (SLAs) are met, and data deliveries are on schedule and in compliance with quality standards Provide recommendations for process and product roadmap enhancements and feature requests Manage standard and custom customer projects Provide support to project managers with standard implementation and miscellaneous tasks Assist with timely closing of help desk tickets, including the source cause of issues, and present the source cause to key stakeholders of the project to ensure positive customer satisfaction Develop KPI reports and metrics, and prepare documentation to support customer processes

Name: Agile Business Analyst
Description: The Baer Group is looking for Agile Business Analyst for a 24 months federal contract located in Atlanta- GATitle: Agile Business AnalystLocation: Atlanta- GADuration: 24 months.Rate: All inclusive.Extensive experience writing user stories. Candidate will get questions on such topics as: what constitutes a good user story, the varying levels of details they ve created in their user stories across different projects or clients, how they typically document business rules or background information (if any) for a user story, etc. We may also ask for sample user stories before making an offer. Important that the candidate knows the drill and can crank out user stories quickly but thoroughly, as well as follow up on any Blocks thoroughly Experience conducting requirements discovery interviews primarily with non-technical SMEs Candidate will also have to conduct a few requirements discovery interviews with technical SMEs Good experience and familiarity with Agile projects Relaxed under pressure (a good sense of humor helps) Works well in a team setting Preferred skills, in order of importance: Experience with a prototyping tool. Though not required, this skill would zoom candidate to the top of the list. Some experience with process redesign projects; the more experience, the bigger the plus in candidate s favorExperience working with UI / UX team to create visuals for the user stories the BA creates Summary of position: Candidate is applying for a role as a Business Analyst for a major process re-engineering project. Candidate will be asked to review As Is and To Be process diagrams and related documents, after which candidate will be asked to write user stories for those business processes. Candidate will work with a team of other BAs, and may participate in peer reviews of each other s user stories, so that the stories are buttoned up before presenting to the Product Owner. Product Owner is heavily involved and available for questions. Candidate is expected to be really, good at writing user stories.Candidate will work with UI / UX team members to align user stories with UI designs.Candidate must be also an unusually good writer, as candidate will also participate in composing Learning / Training Artifacts and modules for the Learning Management SystemCompany Overview:The Baer Group, an award-winning ERP staffing and consulting firm, has a solid track record of finding and providing the right candidates for each distinctly different staffing assignment. With its deep experience in enterprise applications from SAP and Oracle including ERP, Business Analytics and Cloud solutions plus extensive industry coverage, The Baer Group knows that ERP is a solution where generalists are not nearly as effective as specialists.Today, The Baer Group has in excess of 150 consultants deployed in client projects. Over 85% are subsequently redeployed by clients. Better yet, over 90% complete all engagements assigned. You can trust our ability to successfully deliver on every engagement. - provided by Dice  BA, UI, UX, Agile  Associated topics: business finance, business intelligence, examiner, financial analytic, investment analyst, investment analytics, law, legal, refine, valuation analyst

Name: AP BUSINESS ANALYST
Description: Position Description:POSITION PURPOSE: The Loss Prevention Business Analyst is responsible for identifying, distinguishing and analyzing multiple components of a problem and providing conclusions using high-level quantitative skills. Responsibilities include reviewing sales, operational and financial data, identifying trends, scanning business / industry trends and interpreting complex information. Loss Prevention Business Analysts typically take direction from Loss Prevention Managers, work cross-functionally and collaborate on assigned projects. Strong communication skills and cross-functionally partnering with all Loss Prevention teams and others throughout Home Depot is critical for the success of a Loss Prevention Business Analyst. MAJOR TASKS, RESPONSIBILITES AND KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:Use quantitative skills to help drive projects and bring value to our Share holders.Able to identify, distinguish and analyze multiple components of a problem, and then make conclusions.Use strategic thinking to see the big picture, determine the problem and understand fundamental parts of the problem.Prepare and deliver insights and recommendations based on analyses.Review sales, operational and financial data (i.e. data process modeling / analysis of problems, regression analysis).Identify trends in merchandise lifecycle and conduct customer focus groups and analyze / synthesize findings.Interpret data based on specific knowledge of statistics and procedures used.Provide input on forecasting based on knowledge of product and technology.Provide input on strategy based on knowledge of industry and technology trends.Provide customers with specialized information from a variety of resources.Facilitate problem-solving sessions with multiple groups of people.Synthesize findings from analysis and make verbal / written recommendations to upper management.Ability to draw conclusions from store and customer data.Additional Environmental Job Requirements:Due to forklifts and other heavy equipment traveling through the store, temporary cracks may appear in the floor, causing an uneven walking surfaceThe warehouse environment can be dusty and noisyDoors are frequently open, causing drafts and interior temperature changesFloors around work area may become slippery during wet weather conditionsMay have to handle merchandise and work with tools with sharp edgesPassing forklifts emit gas fumesTools, supplies and related merchandise may contain hazardous materials ESSENTIAL SKILLS: MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Must be eighteen years of age or older.  Must be legally permitted to work in the United States. Education Required: The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a high school diplomas and/or GED. Years of Relevant Work Experience: 2 years Physical Requirements: Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles. Preferred Qualifications:Bachelors Degree in the areas of Engineering, Finance, or Business ManagementStrong experience with MS Access Database (queries, visual basic, reports), SQL, & MS ExcelKnowledge of relational datbases and experience with SQL serverOne to three years of retail and/or loss prevention experienceKnowledge of MS Word, Project, and Power PointExcellent analytical and problem solving skillsStrong verbal and written communication skillsStrong quantitative analysis skillsKnowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies:Delivers Results: Sets challenging objectives and communicates clear expectations; demonstrates a clear bias for action and a sense of urgency on priorities; takes ownership of success/failures of initiatives and processes.Acts Strategically: Understands and uses financial indicators/metrics to measure the performance of his/her business unit/function and the business as a whole; plans strategically to create growth, improve financial performance, and gain competitive advantage.Drives Excellence: Sets and communicates high standards for achievement; holds Associates accountable for performance; uses sound judgement and makes good decisions in a timely manner.Excels in Customer Service: Treats internal customers (Home Depot Associates) with the highest level of responsiveness; listens to what Associates have to say and values what they know about The Home Depot.Inspires Achievement: Passionate about The Home Depot and his/her role in the business; energizes Associates about the future and their role in the success of the business.Lives Integrity: Demonstrates behaviors and work styles that are consistent with The Home Depot values; stands up for what is right in the face of opposition at any level; makes decisions based on accurate information; is always honest and trustworthy.Builds Relationships: Forms and maintains effective partnerships across organizational boundaries to share information, improve decision making and leverage capabilities; generates a welcoming environment for all customers, associates and business partners.Creates Inclusion: Champions the value of each individual' s contribution, knowledge, skills and abilities; seeks out and uses diverse inputs and contributions to ensure a quality outcome We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce has a client that is seeking a Business Systems Analyst in Kennesaw, Georgia (GA). Summary: Represent the business owners and work with IT to determine, analyze, validate and lead the integration of critical business processes in support of developing the integration between NICE/inContact and Salesforce integration within a Shared Services environment of 250 seats. Manage the implementation of integration tasks associated with the given project to maximize performance within the teams. Principal Duties and Responsibilities: Act as a business and technical process consultant and designer to Patient Admission Services to identify, analyze and document business processes and determine the optimum integration between NICE/inContact's software suite and Salesforce CRM Gather the necessary requirements from stakeholders via discovery sessions, draft reviews of business requirements and be able to manage the integration and optimization of both software product sets Identify and document business workflow challenges and re-engineering options that could be implemented through creative system and/or business process modifications Provide business process re-engineering expertise focused on the design of workflows and processes within the Admissions Shared Services Environment to optimize work force management and CRM optimization Lead a complex/matrixed project and coordinate efforts across functional teams and tracks;
