Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: ***MUST HAVES***  1) Experience as a Business Analyst, strong experience in business analysis techniques, such as gathering requirements, modeling processes, refining user stories, and analyzing data.  2) Extensive experience influencing and guiding others towards most logical and valuable outcomes  3) Specialization in Quote-to-Order processes and/or CRM, CPQ (Configure, Price, Quote), or CLM (Contract Lifecycle Management) technologies. They use salesforce and Apttus.  My client is in the midst of a large enterprise wide initiative transforming their quote to order process. Through mergers and acquisitions our client has continued to grow but they haven't standardized processes as they brought newly acquired entities into the fold. Recently our client completed a merger with another large organizations of equal size in term of revenue making them a $6B privately held entity. The merger has required a lot of processes standardization and the customer experience with sales and support across all lines of business is a top priority.  With all the initiatives underway across the enterprise to exit the TSA from the merger they're not looking to start the enterprise CRM standardization process but they have been tasked with making things easier for sales. It's not required but it would be preferred for candidates to have worked on process improvement projects where Salesforce or Apttus were a large part of scope. **Summary*** The main function of a business systems analyst is to analyze science, engineering, business and all other data processing problems for application to electronic data processing systems. A typical business systems analyst is responsible for analyzing user requirements, procedures and problems to automate or improve existing systems and review computer system capabilities, workflow and scheduling limitations. **Job Responsibilities*** Advise clients on requirements for the organization and translate those to programmers and developers. Prepare cost-benefit and return-on-investment analyses to aid in decisions on system implementation. Interview or survey workers, observe job performance or perform the job to determine what information is processed and how it is processed. Advise clients regarding the nature of the information processing or computation needs. Advise management on current system principles and necessary updates and recommendations. Supervise the expansion or modification of system to serve new purposes or improve work flow. Train staff and users to work with computer systems and programs. **Skills*** Verbal and written communication skills, problem solving skills, attention to detail and interpersonal skills. Strong ability to work independently and manage one's time. Strong leadership and mentoring skills necessary to provide support and constructive performance feedback. Strong knowledge of design techniques and principles involved in production of drawings and models. Strong knowledge of computer software, such as Visual Basic, Java, SQL, etc. **Education/Experience*** Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required. MBA or other related advanced degree preferred. 8 to 10 years of experience required. Experience as a Business Analyst, having worked on a variety of programs and projectsExtensive experience influencing and guiding others towards most logical and valuable outcomesStrong experience in business analysis techniques, such as gathering requirements, modeling processes, refining user stories, and analyzing dataSpecialization in Quote-to-Order processes and/or CRM, CPQ (Configure, Price, Quote), or CLM (Contract Life cycle Management) technologiesStrong stakeholder management, with confidence to challenge preconceptions of outcomes and solutions.Good communication and facilitation skills, ideally running workshops; including the ability to communicate and present ideas to senior leadership About TEKsystems:We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing process due to a disability, please call 888 ###-#### or email accommodation@teksystems .com for other accommodation options. Primerica employees support our representatives to provide appropriate solutions through term life insurance, mutual funds, annuities and other financial products. We insured more than 5 million lives and have over 2 million client investment accounts. Our stock is traded on The New York Stock Exchange under the symbol “PRI”. Name: BUSINESS ANALYST
Description: Job DescriptionBUSINESS ANALYST  Market Force Information LLC operates in the exciting and growing industry of customer experience management. Increasingly multi-location businesses such as retailers, restaurants, banks, hotels and others are differentiating themselves in hyper-competitive markets by focusing on and investing in the experience that they deliver to their customers. These brands need to understand what matters most to their customers, where they are not meeting expectations and what the financial ROI could be for various improvements that they might make in their businesses. That's where Market Force comes in.  Serving over 200 clients globally, Market Force provides a host of measurement, analytics and reporting services that empower its clients to protect their brand's reputation, delight customers, and grow their revenues. We seek out talented, collaborative, and creative team members who are passionately committed to supporting our business and helping our clients reach their goals. Currently, we are looking for a Business Analyst to Application Development team.  The Business Analyst is responsible primarily focused on the documentation and requirements gathering for development and implementation of enhancements to our software platform, driven by either internal or external client modification requests. Responsibilities of this position include the documentation of business requirements; Creating and submitting finalized documents for level of effort estimations. Facilitate work sessions and also act as the liaison between internal teams and external Client representatives to determine needs and propose innovative solutions for requested software platform modifications. IIBA CBAP/CCBA or PMI-PBA certification would be an asset.Displayed ability to identify business requirements and create or participate in the elaboration of process solutions. Developed experience in creating / improving and documenting processes (Process Flow Diagrams, Standard Operating Procedures)Excellent analytical, presentation and communication skills (clear, precise verbal and written skills)Experience communicating effectively with multiple levels of the organization (managers, directors, VPs)Facilitation of work sessions (story boarding/mapping) and liaising between internal cross-functional teams and external Client representatives to determine business needs The successful candidate for this position will possess: Past experience in a technical Business Analyst role or, experience managing or developing Software projectsA degree in a Business Analysis or a related discipline is preferred. IIBA CBAP/CCBA or PMI-PBA certification would be an asset.Displayed ability to identify business requirements and create or participate in the elaboration of process solutions. Developed experience in creating / improving and documenting processes (Process Flow Diagrams, Standard Operating Procedures)Excellent analytical, presentation and communication skills (clear, precise verbal and written skills)Experience communicating effectively with multiple levels of the organization (managers, directors, VPs) Market Force Information fosters an environment of energy, learning and growth. Name: Business Analyst III
Description: Description:  SUMMARY  The Business Analyst III (BA) is a senior position serving as a crucial bridge between our Newspaper digital business objectives and our technology solutioning. The BA works with product managers and stakeholders from all business units to define and document business processes and requirements for technology initiatives, including Clients Newspaper websites, native apps and other digital products.  RESPONSIBILITIES  The BA will work as a member of the Newspaper digital technology team. This position navigates the competing needs of multiple stakeholder groups, defines an end-to-end business process that is accepted by all groups and maps out the requirements for one or more systems to support these needs and the process. This job requires strong communication skills, along with facilitation, prioritization and scope management.  In addition, this role will perform the following functions:  · Participate in pre-project analysis work that helps enable informed decision-making about what investments to make in technology  · Understand the needs of multiple stakeholders and align the business teams around scope  · Facilitate the negotiation of requirements among multiple stakeholders and provide guidance on alignment of initiatives  · Identify the current- and future-state business processes  · Help the business stakeholders envision the future and how their work will need to change to support the future  · Serve as a key member on one or more Technology scrum teams  · Create detailed functional requirements in use cases for the Technology scrum teams to implement  · Work closely with the Technology scrum teams to ensure business requirements are understood and translated correctly to technical solutions  · Work at a strategic level in the technology aspect of the role  Work on many projects at one time  · Become a power user of various Technology applications  · Work with project managers to support the many projects ongoing across the business portfolio team  Requirements:  Education: B.S./B.A. degree required.  Experience:  5+ years of business analysis experience required; Digital Media industry experience highly preferred. 2+ years Agile/Scrum experience preferred. JIRA experience a plus.  Skills:  Strong communication and interpersonal skills required. Technical/analytical skills, continuous learning, innovation, ability to manage work and strong work standards/ethics is also required. Candidates must be customer focus, contribute to a teams success and be quality-oriented.  Parul Chhabra  Primus Software Corporation  Direct: 678 -666- 4393 | Fax: 770-234-4163  Email: parul.chhabra@primussoft.com  www.primussoft.com | 3061 Peachtree Industrial Blvd, Suite 110 Duluth, GA - 30097  Let's connect, LinkedIn: https://in.linkedin.com/pub/parul-chhabra/b1/42b/527

Responsibilities:  ·  Directs all BA activities within a project  ·  Lead and direct Sr BA’s within specified project  ·  Analyze, manage, and report BA activities  ·  Manage cross project requirements and escalated issues within specified program  ·  Manage program requirement interdependencies  ·  Communicate appropriately to program lead BA, stakeholders and program managers/project managers  ·  Request the needed BA’s for a project and get them oriented to work on the project  ·  Direct completion of project BA objective, such as scope, requirement, analysis and solutions, business process modeling, UAT, and customer training  ·  Ensure product deliverables’ quality, such as functional specifications, logical and physical data design, solution design and detailed design, UAT test plans, and completed solution  ·  Resolve issues in a timely manner. When appropriate, escalate problems and issues to program lead BA, program manager /project manager and/or stakeholders and sponsor  ·  Evaluate requirement risks and assess possible outcomes  ·  Monitor individual BA performance and provide feedback to program lead BA and/or resource managers and/or program/project mangers  ·  Direct and delegate BA work effort  ·  Maintain communication with customer and team members and promote a team environment. Name: Consolidation Program Analyst
Description: As a Consolidation Program Analyst you will manage the daily execution of freight consolidation with CaseStack clients. You will administer multiple clients’ distribution needs through load building which requires extensive interfacing within the operations department as well as carrier and warehouse network. You will track, analyze, and develop variables that lead to consolidation program improvements. This is a deadline-driven, analytics-heavy position. As Consolidation Program Analyst, you’ll be part of the backbone of the daily operation at CaseStack.  ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS Prepare accurate and timely vendor pool upload spreadsheets.Accurately build consolidation load spreadsheets within program parameters while maximizing load utilization.Recommend program improvements based on quantitative evidence.Determine viability of best practices of cross docking while factoring in consolidation program constraints.Manage sailing schedules for consolidation programs to achieve maximum potential delivery performance under program parameters, including updates for new programs as well as holiday schedule changes for existing programs.Publish reports on weekly, monthly, and quarterly basis regarding volume and on-time percentage scores.Support implementation team during the launch of new accounts and programs.Receive, analyze, and respond to a high volume of communication each day.Understand the order process flow to contract specifications.Understand system specifications for order releases and tracking.Successfully manage carrier and warehouse partner relationships.Develop optimization strategies on consolidation and create business cases to leverage IT support to execute the strategies.Understand how to deal with client shipment policies, carrier/consignee concerns, special handling instructions, etc.Understand operational challenges with current consolidation programs. Implement improvement initiatives with partner warehouses, internal departments, and retailers to cut lead-time, costs, and complexity.Perform additional duties assigned by company.REQUIREMENTS / QUALIFICATIONSBachelors Degree or equivalent work experience required.3+ years of experience within transportation and logistics industry.Experience working with Wal-Mart distribution preferred.Able to identify patterns and craft compelling solutions for profit maximization.Expertise in Microsoft Excel.Sufficient familiarity with web based tools.Strong understanding of product distribution is desired, especially within CPG.Strong talent for multi-tasking and managing competing priorities effectively.Proven track record for implementing innovative solutions to complex problems.Highly organized; attentive to details.Self-directed, yet strong team player.Minimal travel may be required.

and who are excited by the opportunity to stake their claim in a fast-growing sector and business.Locations HiringUS, Canada, UK, Europe, AsiaBenefitsSuccessful candidates can look forward to a competitive salary plus a full benefits package.Proudfoot is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to creating and celebrity an inclusive workplace environment.

Name: Business Analyst II

With 186 global patents, InComm is headquartered in Atlanta with a presence in over 30 countries in North and South America, Europe and the Asia-Pacific region. Learn more at www.incomm.com or connect with us on www.twitter.com/incomm, www.facebook.com/incomm, www.linkedin.com/company/incomm or www.incomm.com/blog. Develop, build, deploy and configure applications• Technical design and analysis of business use cases in preparation for development.• Work well in Agile or Lean Software Development Life Cycle.• Able to quickly adjust and support changing priorities per business needs.• Create documentation on the existing system and maintain documentation which includes current state of system flow, sequence diagrams, architecture diagrams, runbooks• Participate in the full lifecycle of projects, including effective use of version control, build management, unit testing, and issue tracking software• Effective verbal and written communication• Problem solving skills and the ability to work with innovative solutions• Strong analytical skills with the ability to assess complex situations and understand key issues quick!• Ability to adapt in a dynamic work environment and make independent decisions while keeping management informed• Work effectively in a team environment to produce good quality and timely results• Able to work under tight deadlines while providing high-quality work• Customer Service orientation with the ability to effectively interact with users of all levels• Able to proactively address system issues that have potential impact for the corporation• Strong research, analytical, and troubleshooting skills QualificationsBachelor's Degree in a relevant field of work or an equivalent combination of education and work related experience• At least 2-3 years of Business Analyst experience • Ability to grasp a technical understanding of a project quickly, see the big picture and drive to the project to completion.• Ability to lead large, complex development project discussions with minimal assistance.• General understanding of Financial Services products in the prepaid industry.• General understanding of the Internet, Intranet, Extranet and client/server architectures.• Possesses general understanding in the areas of application programming, database and system design.• Excellent negotiation and communication skills.• Strong communication and personal skills.• Ability to lead discussions with cross-functional teams.• Delivers engaging, informative, well-organized presentations.• Must demonstrate the ability to negotiate and/or diffuse escalating situations and ultimately become a trusted advisor to partner teams.• Communicates and follows-up continuously (face-to-face then email, email then phone, etc.).• Does not wait for information. Goes out and gets it.• Proficient with Microsoft Office applications (word, visio, powerpoint, excel, outlook, etc).• Solid planning (forward thinking), development, evaluation/analytics and recommendation skills.• Experienced in successfully managing multiple initiatives simultaneously.• Critical attention to detail.• Solutions oriented - holistic approach to problem solving and able to identify solutions to various levels of problems without compromising integrity of service; Both strategic and tactical thinker with business process mindset.• Document, share knowledge and train others.• Advanced skills in MS Office Tools (Word, Excel, Project, PowerPoint, Visio).• Ability to analyze and document complex business processes.• Ability to think analytically and should be a problem solver.• Ability to gather and interpret relevant data and information.• Must have superior verbal and written communication skills.• Experience supporting internal and external customers.• Proficiency creating business and functional requirements, visio diagrams, use cases, sequence diagrams and test cases.• Ability to effectively manage time, prioritize work, multi-task across many assignments.SDL2017

These projects may bring new data sources into the TDC or provide enhancements for existing data sources\.**The Day\-to\-Day**+ Review source data files and provide detailed analysis to include field profiles, validation of field, record and files formats, field valid values, required fields, and primary keys+ Assist Data Architect in requirements gathering+ Setup internal processing and automation systems based on architecture design specifications provided by Data Architects\.+ Provide complete testing support to include unit testing, system/integration testing, UAT and implementation support\.+ Partner with QA team to provide adequate test data\.**The Essentials**+ 3\+ years related experience with proven track record+ Experience with profiling and analysis of source data files in a variety of formats+ Ability to work in a fast paced, high pressure environment juggling multiple priorities+ Ability to make a strong first impression and build trust, rapport and lasting relationships with business stakeholders\. Excellent written and verbal communication skills\. Ability to speak \\"tech speak\\" to techies, \\"lay speak\\" to laymen, and \\"business speak\\" to business leaders\.+ Strong facilitation, questioning and listening skills to ask right questions of individuals and groups to surface essential requirements information\. Ability to listen to understand not only what people say, but what they mean, and to detect what they may be hesitant to say\. Ability to think on your feet, to go beyond planned questions and respond to whatever input you hear from the people you are interviewing+ Analytical skills, to critically evaluate the information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high\-level information into details, abstract up from low\-level information to a more general understanding, distinguish presented user requests from the underlying true needs, and distinguish solution ideas from requirements+ Demonstrated ability to exercise good judgment, prioritize multiple tasks, and problem solve under pressure of deadlines and resource constraints+ Ability to create comprehensive test cases to validate the flow of requirements to design to implementation+ Intermediate level SQL knowledge at a minimum+ Previous experience with relational databases, automated processing using custom internal systems \(we'll teach you ours\)+ Knowledge of AWS, Redshift, Snowflake, Hive/Hadoop a plus**The Perks**+ Paid time off every year to volunteer+ Access to wellbeing tools, resources, and freebies+ 2017 Best Company forWorking Mothers+ An in\-house learning and development team to help shape and grow your career+ Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands_Turner Broadcasting System, Inc\. and its subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity Employers and E\-Verify users\. Name: SR BUSINESS ANALYST
Description: Who is Georgia-Pacific?Watch to find out! Georgia-Pacific (GP) is among the world's leading manufacturers of bath tissue, paper towels, napkins, tableware, paper-based packaging, office papers, cellulose, specialty fibers, nonwoven fabrics, building products and related chemicals. Headquartered in Atlanta, GA., we employ approximately 35,000 people.  For more information, visit www.gp.com.  To learn more about our culture, Market-Based Management (MBM®), click here:  http://www.gp.com/aboutus/MBM/index.html http://www.kochind.com/MBM  Georgia-Pacific LLC is looking for a Senior Business Analyst to join our team at our Atlanta, GA headquarters. The Senior Business Analyst will analyze business IT systems, identify key requirements, and validate systems to ensure they meet the needs of our internal customers. Additionally, they will be expected to establish and maintain positive business relationships with our stakeholders. The Senior Business Analyst will be expected to demonstrate a rational and organized approach to completing projects, documenting progress, and providing updates to key stakeholders. Additionally, the will be expected to execute work plans in a timely manner by accepting personal accountability for project deliverables.A Day In The Life Typically Includes: Connecting with the strategyWorking with the business to develop the business case (Venture Summary) on a project initiative.Driving project deliverables by maintaining, executing, and evaluating project plansManaging business requirements for new applications that automate and optimize processesTranslating business requirement into application featuresIdentifying opportunities to leverage applications across the requirements with IT professionals to develop, enhance and support new and existing applicationsWorking with the business to develop test plans, test scenarios, and test cases that will be used to ensure application changes meet business functional and non-functional requirementsPerforming functional and non-functional testing prior to the launch of product enhancements and troubleshooting strategy that will be used to improve the likelihood of end user adoption of new applications and major system changesWorking with the business to develop training plans and training materials that will be used in the training of end users on new systems and enhancementsManaging day-to-day client communicationsFacilitating the resolution of any obstacles that threaten our partnership with internal customersRecommending system solutions by analyzing the advantages and disadvantages of a custom developed solution versus purchased alternativesKeeping up with current trends by researching and experimenting with new technologies and software productsParticipating in educational opportunities and professional organizations aligned with the IT organizational objectives and career objectivesSharing knowledge and experiences with members of the organizationYou Are:A practical problem solver who is resourcefulHumbly competent and open about your progressWilling to take risks within our risk tolerance levelResponsible for your own mistakesWilling to learn and grow as we learn and grow togetherComfortable with respectfully challenging at all levels of the organizationSelf-motivated and have a high attention to detail and can manage multiple projects across stakeholdersLooking for an opportunity to join a growing organizationWilling to travel up to 25%You Value:Delivering high quality solutions, you and your team can be proud ofBringing people together, asking good questions, and listening to what is neededPeople and honor them for who they are.Relationships and mutual respect is important for youHonesty, and are open to providing and receiving honest feedbackSupporting others in achieving success and the success of the greater goodLeveraging other peoples skills to maximize value creationServing others What You Will Need:Basic Qualifications: Bachelors Degree or higherAt least 5 years of experience in a Business Analyst Name: Jr Business Analyst
Description: The Reporting/Business Analyst will be responsible for supporting the RFx process conducted by the Strategic Sourcing team. This will include scope development for the RFx process as well as analyzing RFx vendor responses to include compiling those responses into a presentation format. The data will be presented to upper management and the analyst also needs to be able to interpret the data and make recommendations for areas of opportunity. Data source applications includes ServiceNow, SurveyMonkey, GEP, RFx results. Responsibilities Interpret the data and present recommendations of opportunity in the following areas: Strategic sourcingAssist in ad hoc analysisResponsible for gathering, analyzing, and reporting findings on category spend data and market research to assist the supply chain team in making strategic decisionsResearch supply market to identify and understand the potential supply base with supplier cost driver' s analysis and trends in the industriesAnalyze the different options by ease and benefit and provide full market and risk analysis and differences in all covered demand pointsRemain current in relevant industry trends, market conditions, and informed about key market leaders.Advice category managers on supply market trends (key competitor activity, effect of technology in accelerating globalization, collaboration, risks, and new service offerings).Analyze spend, gathering market intelligence and perform opportunity assessments to summarize, standardize and minimize costs.Perform in-depth analyses of bid responses and complex market conditions.Responsible for providing fact based negotiating support to category managers for direct and indirect products and servicesSupport Strategic Sourcing in the execution of cross-functional supply chain projects, including RFIs, RFQs and RFPsDevelop negotiation strategiesAssist in the preparation, issue, and analysis of RFx’ s, contract negotiation and award with category managersCollect and analyze responses and populate decision matrix to allow supplier selectionPrepare for fact based negotiations, planning least and most desired outcomes, arguments and responsesSupport supplier negotiation process, assessing success against desired outcomes. Challenge and negotiate to provide most competitive price/service offersDegrees/Designations:Bachelor’ s degree preferred with a minimum of 1-3 years business analyst experience in the Supply Chain/Procurement space.GEP and ServiceNow experience is a plus*Consulting experience is a plusSystem Knowledge/Experience:Business savvy individual that is able to interpret the data and not simply crunch numbersAdvanced Excel and Powerpoint skillsAbility to be flexible and respond to varied demandsEffective organization and planning skills with a strong attention to detailUnderstands Supply Chain and Procurement concepts, practices and proceduresStrong interpersonal, analytical, problem solving and prioritization skillsCommitment to customer service and ability to work in team-oriented environmentWritten and verbal communication, ability to prepare reports and make presentations to various professional and public groups

Name: Business Analyst / Project Manager
Description: The Business Analyst/Project Manager will be responsible for the overall success of a project, requirements definition, and quality assurance activities, or a portion thereof as assigned (if working under the direction of another project lead).  As a Business Analyst, they serve as a liaison between functional users and technical staff in the development or modification of typically complex information systems. He or she leads in definition of user business requirements, assures requirements are appropriately addressed in application implementation, and redefines business processes to maximize application usage as required. Responsibilities include creating and executing test plans, performing hands-on functional testing, and leading user acceptance testing. This position will also provide ongoing user support, including troubleshooting and resolution of more complex system issues.  Project Management responsibilities include time and resource management, financial planning, scope management, issue and risk management, project execution. This person plans, directs, and monitors the work produced by the team(s). He or she is responsible for managing stakeholder relationships, including general, ongoing communications, negotiation of scope and schedule changes, key risks, issue resolution, and ongoing progress reporting.  The Business Analyst/Project Manager shapes client expectations, and manages contracts and scope related to the project. This person must have a broad knowledge of industry best practices and be able to proactively identify potential project risks in order to advise and consult with clients on risk identification, analysis, and mitigation strategies.  Job Requirements: 8-10 years job-related experienceAdvanced skills in data organization and analysis, problem solving, requirements elicitation and documentationStrong skills in business process analysis and workflow diagramming; experience using these skills on projects to develop workflow-based enterprise softwareKnowledge of SQL, database, and relational data modelsExperience or strong knowledge in one or more technical solutions/architectures such as web services, portals, business process modeling, UI technologies like AJAX, relational databases, Business Intelligence preferred (coding experience not required)Effective analytical and presentation skillsStrong verbal, written and interpersonal skills; ability to tailor communication to different audiences, such as management, stakeholders, users, SMEs, developers, and othersAbility to lead others to articulate additional possibly hidden needsAbility to communicate and work effectively with both functional area experts and technical team membersExperience being both a PM and BA on the same projectExperience working with Project Management software and toolsStrong working knowledge of Software Development Lifecycle Process, including incremental/iterative and Waterfall methodsAbility to manage work on multiple projects with competing prioritiesExperience overseeing user acceptance testing and providing test cases/test scenarios for UATExperience working with web application development teams who use technologies such as Java and DrupalExcellent organizational experience and professionalismExcellent organizational and time management skillsSelf-motivated and able to work independentlyExperience working in research/educational institutions or small IT companies preferred Sample Projects: Projects supporting researchers and staff internally at GTRI as well as for the entire campus, including proposal management, compliance tools, researcher dashboards, talent management software, and financial applicationsProject types include in-house Java development, web development, Cognos reports, implementation and support of third party software, enterprise systems integration, as well as database and systems infrastructure projects. Education:  A Bachelor’s degree is required: Preferred degree in Business, Accounting, or IT-related fieldRequired Skills Required Experience Job Location  Atlanta, US-GA

Name: Environmental Data Analyst (Busi Support Analyst 3)
Description: This position is located in the Georgia Environmental Protection Division (EPD) – Watershed Protection Branch – Water Supply – Agricultural Permitting Unit (APU) in Tifton, GA. The incumbent serves as the APU’s data steward and supervises three employees supporting the unit’s data entry and data management activities. Primary data platforms associated with this position currently include Microsoft Access, Microsoft Excel, and ESRI Geographic Information Systems (GIS). An ongoing function of this position will be to coordinate and act as liaison to EPD IT in their efforts to update the data management systems to transition from a Microsoft Access/GIS geodatabase to SQL server, address data integrity issues and perform data entry as necessary. The incumbent will develop and enforce business rules and processes for data handling, assure data accuracy through application of QA/QC activities, respond timely to specific programmatic queries for resolving identified issues and resolve data errors. The incumbent will be responsible for tracking State agricultural water source permitting data, irrigated acreage data, water use metering data and compliance activities by administering and developing reports and queries necessary to ensure timely overview of Division, Branch and Program milestones as well as related deliverables to and from EPD contractors. Timely and effective communication with program managers regarding applicable outputs and program data needs is essential.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSBachelor's degree in business or related field from an accredited college or universityAND Four years of experience related to area of assignment.Note: An equivalent combination of education and job specific experience that provided the knowledge, experience and competencies required to successfully perform the job at the level listed may be substituted on a year-over-year basis.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSCoursework or certification in a field of Data and Database ManagementCoursework in Computer InformationExperience in staff management, resource allocation, and results-oriented coordination and communication to effectively achieve a program's data management objectivesKnowledge of database queries, theory and designKnowledge about Microsoft SQL Server or MySQLKnowledge of structured query language (SQL)General understanding of operating systemsGeneral understanding of routine maintenance, recovery, and handling failover of a databasePrior experience in State and Federal environmental permitting and compliance programs and associated data managementNote: If the minimum qualifications for a job require a college education and you have obtained a degree from a college or university outside the USA, you are required to submit an International Education Evaluation Letter showing your degree is equivalent to one obtained at a college or university in the USA. International Educational Evaluations are accepted from the National Association of Credential Evaluation Services (www.naces.org/members.htm) or the Association of International Credentials Evaluators (www.aice-eval.org/Organization.aspx).Because of the volume of applications received, we are unable to provide information on application status by phone or e-mail. All qualified applicants will be considered, but may not necessarily receive an interview. Selected applicants will be contacted by the hiring agency for next steps in the selection process. Applicants who are not selected will not receive notification. This posting may close at any time prior to the posted close date, once a suitable applicant pool is identified. Bachelor's degree in business or related field from an accredited college or university AND Four years of experience related to area of assignment. Note: An equivalent combination of education and job specific experience that provided the knowledge, experience and competencies required to successfully perform the job at the level listed may be substituted on a year-over-year basis.

Name: Global Solutions Business Analyst
Description: Warehousing Services Global Solutions Business AnalystWe are reinventing global trade. Flexport helps more than 10,000 clients and suppliers lead all aspects of their supply chain operations. Started in 2013, we've raised over $300M from investors that include the Founders Fund, Google Ventures, First Round Capital, Bloomberg Beta, Y Combinator, & Wells Fargo.  With offices on three continents, our team is as global as our client base and we're excited to continue building a product and service they love. Wherever you are, whichever role you play, you're guaranteed to share your day with committed, encouraging, and resourceful team members.  Flexport Warehousing Services is an integral part of Flexport operations and is planning to expand rapidly with several new sites globally to improve end-to-end operational control and provide a superior customer experience. Our aim is to build highly efficient warehouses of the future for freight forwarding.  As a result of our very ambitious growth plans we're looking for a Global Solutions Business Analyst to join our growing Warehousing Services Team who will propel us in our next phase of growth. In this new role the Business Analyst will drive several projects related to growing our footprint, standardizing our blueprint and also improving day-to-day operational efficiency globally. What you'll do:Conduct complex network studies based on volume flows, strategic priorities and market trends to develop recommendations on future warehousing footprintMaintain and manage global warehousing SOPs and ensure they are standardized across regionsSupport teams in mapping and maintaining Warehouse Management System (WMS) process documentation globallyConduct studies to quantify efficiency improvements (e.g. cost benefit of using new hardware in the warehouse)Participate and drive global projects on process improvements / new service pilotsConduct research on service offering and additional services we can offerDevelop standard template on opening new facilities, including model for calculating break even points, investment required etc.Conduct Market research on new trends to build the warehouse of the futurePrepare documents for internal and external trainings as well as webinarsInteract with Global Warehouse community to share best practicesDevelop standardized global and regional KPI dashboard structure for Warehousing Services and work with Data science team to implement these (basic SQL knowledge needed for this)Monitor regular progress on key Warehousing Services KPIs and work locally with warehousing teams on improvementsWhat you'll need:Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain, Industrial Engineering, BBA or similar relevant area of study2+ years of prior experience as a Supply Chain Solutions Analyst or in Supply Chain or Management Consulting, Investment Banking, Private Equity or Venture Capital Research would be preferred OR candidates Master's in Supply Chain / Industrial Engineering will also be consideredExperience in building complex data models on Excel, developing macros and prior SQL knowledge is a must (added experience in Python a plus)Experience in market research, building reporting tools and dashboards and working on process improvementExperience working in the Logistics industry or developing strategy for warehouses would be a plusStrategic thinking and ground floor execution - no job is too big or too small;Exceptional technical aptitude and strong desire for learning new technologies and solution architectures.Where you'll work: The role will be based in our Midtown office and you would be working together closely with the Head of Global Solutions team for warehousing. Investing your time with Flexport means having an immediate impact, all over the world. You're empowered to do what's best for everyone and trusted to make the right decisions when and where you need them. Join our collective of entrepreneurs and improve the world's experience in global trade.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Business Analyst (Onboarding Services)
Description: Job Description We are hiring a Business Analyst to join our Client Services team. You will work  alongside other business analysts and PMs and report directly to the Onboarding  Manager. Onboarding involves activating new utility accounts on the Urjanet portal  and maintaining existing ones. This will require frequent utility calling to resolve  issues, going through email inboxes to make sure appropriate emails are responded  to and reaching out to customers with any challenging accounts. To succeed in this  role, you should have a natural analytical way of thinking and be able to explain  difficult concepts to non-technical users. Roles & Responsibilities Act as a one point contact for any onboarding related queries for large Urjanet customers Manage customer utility accounts onboarding process for Urjanet within strict turnaround times. Understand business requirements and develop a plan to execute internal/external projects on time and within budget constraints Follow up on support tickets until closure Coordinate with on-shore and off-shore teams to ensure that Service Level Agreements (SLAs) are met, and data deliveries are on schedule and in compliance with quality standards Liaison with Utility providers to resolve issues within SLA Develop KPI reports and metrics, and prepare documentation to support customer processes Responsible for customer communication for all customer pending accounts, credentials as well as any ongoing customer communication necessary for the success of the project. Provide recommendations for process and product roadmap enhancements and feature requests Attend weekly customer calls and bring up onboarding related issues Monitor customer email Inboxes for any red flagsDesired Skills & Experience Bachelor’s degree required 0-2+ years working with clients to provide client service/technical support Must demonstrate strong experience with Microsoft Office (excel, word, powerpoint). Detail oriented with high degree of speed and accuracy Should possess aptitude to learn new technologies with strong flexibility and adaptability to the changing work environments Excellent verbal and written communications skills are a must for both internal communication and customer-facing communication Well organized and the ability to self-manage and work with minimal guidance Must have solid analytical skills, troubleshooting skills and goal oriented Energetic team player that can work with minimal direction in startup environment Energy industry experience a plus

Name: Business Analyst - Treasury
Description: Who is Georgia-Pacific? Watch to find out!You know us already! We make Brawny® paper towels; Dixie® paper cups and plates; Angel Soft® bath tissue; enMotion® paper towel dispensers, DensGlass® gypsum board and Plytanium® plywood you see in your big box home improvement stores and much more! We employ about 35,000 people who want to make a positive difference in today’s world by creating real long-term value for our customers.  We are seeking a Business Analyst - Treasury to join the Georgia-Pacific’s corporate finance and cash management team. We need a tech savvy person, someone who enjoys working within financial systems. We can teach you what you need to know about treasury. A Day In The Life Typically Includes:Treasury Technology – Support and use the treasury workstation including administration as well as process and payments optimization. Seeks and participates in advanced development opportunities with the treasury workstation.Cash and Short-Term Investments – Execute investment transactions and analyze cash investment alternatives to maximize the company’s interest income.Foreign Exchange – Provide FX analysis and execute transactions around the company’s foreign currency exposure.Debt Compliance – Monitor and track the company’s debt compliance and debt payments.Innovation - develop innovative strategies for improving business outcomes and drive innovation generate a continuous pipeline of new ideas.Cash Management – Support domestic and foreign cash management, cash positioning, payments, and bank fee analysis.Financial Controls – Seek opportunities to further enhance financial and cyber controls.Banking Relationships– interact on a day to day basis with commercial banks.Digital Transformation—support emerging technologies and system integration implementations.What You Will Need: Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or higher in information systems, accounting, finance, or related field.Advanced experience with Microsoft Office (e.g., Word, Excel, PowerPoint).What Will Put You Ahead?  Preferred Qualifications: Experience with treasury or financial systems, coding/data analysis, or cash operations.CTP certification.Why Work For GP?You will be working alongside a bunch of great people in a culture that places top priority on integrity and compliance. You will have opportunities for career growth at one of the largest, most financially-stable companies in the world. You will be encouraged to challenge the status quo and share your knowledge with others, and your responsibilities and rewards will be based on your contributions. You will enjoy competitive pay and benefits that help you manage your personal and financial wellness.  Want to learn more about Georgia-Pacific?Salary and benefits commensurate with experience.  We are an equal opportunity employer. Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran  Except where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test. Name: Business Analyst - Enterprise Resiliency or Business Continuity.
Description: Minimum Required Skills: - Looking for someone with 5-7 years of work experience and at least a couple years of experience/exposure to Enterprise Resiliency/Business Continuity. This is a more entry to mid career level type position. - This person will be working with the team to find out which business units don't have a business continuity plan in place. They will then need to work with the lead person of that business unit to explain the importance of having a business continuity plan and help develop that plan. - They will be managing several of these projects at the same time so they will need to have some good Project Management experienceLocation: Atlanta, GADuration: Long Term Responsibilities:  Establish trusted relationships with business stakeholders across the company to understand requirements for the Enterprise Resiliency program. Identify and establish Enterprise Resiliency processes to enable effective reduction of risk associated with disruptive events. Lead efforts across the Enterprise Resiliency program to set appropriate success metrics and consistently drive execution to reduce risk Build strong relationships and processes with partner teams for Disaster Recovery, Crisis Management and related First Responder functions. Name: Associate Brand Analyst - Napkin Business
Description: Who is Georgia-Pacific? Watch to find out!ASSOCIATE BRAND ANALYST ROLE Georgia-Pacific (GP) and its subsidiaries are among the world’s  leading manufacturers and marketers of bath tissue, paper towels, napkins,  tableware, paper-based packaging, office papers, cellulose, specialty fibers,  non-woven fabrics, building products and related chemicals. Our familiar  consumer brands include: Quilted Northern®, Angel Soft®, Brawny®, Sparkle®,  Mardi Gras®, and Vanity Fair®, as well as the Dixie® brand of disposable cups,  plates and cutlery. Its Harmon subsidiary is among the world’s largest  recyclers of paper, metal and plastics. The company employs approximately  35,000 people directly.  We are seeking a AssociateBrand Analyst to support our Napkin Business based  in Atlanta, GA. The Brand Analyst is primarily responsible for  supporting the brand team in new product launches including commercialization  support and new item marketing materials, marketing and promotions support  projects and market analytics.  A Day In The Life Typically Includes:Responsibilities:Manage all day to day product development,  supply chain management, and sales support activities:Serve as the category liaison to the  commercialization team-ensure commercialization deliverables are accurate,  on time, and aligned with the category team’s needs.Work cross functionally with the commercialization  team on new item management including product kick-offs, image review and  approvalsServe as the day to day business contact for supply  chain -handle supply requests, assist in forecast management, and  collaborate with deployment to manage inventory throughout the systemCoordinate sales samples distribution, mock-up/image  creation, and marketing material development/distribution (including  price/spec sheets, new item communications, packaging images, and  support on couponing/promotional materials)-Provide regular reporting and ad-hoc  analysis:Provide weekly and month-end updates. Work  with category teams to identify key items to be tracked on a regular  basis.Track new initiative key success metrics on an  on-going basisProactively monitor and track competitor and market  activities to drive implications for GP’s business strategyConduct as-needed business analysis using tools  including IRI, Market Monitor Reports and customer POS data, and report  out to business managers -Actively participate in and manage category  staff and trade meetings  What You Will Need:Basic Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree is required.Minimum of 2 years of work experience is required What Will Put You Ahead?Preferred Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Business or  related field is preferred.Knowledge  – Skills – Abilities:Strong Project management skillsAbility to lead and influence cross functional teamsGood analytical and problem-solving skillsBasic financial P&L understandingProficient in Microsoft Office suiteAbility to work independently and manage multiple  prioritiesPays close attention to details and accuracyTeam player with flexibilityWant to learn more about Georgia-Pacific?Salary and benefits commensurate with experience.  We are an equal opportunity employer. Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran  Except where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test.  This employer uses E-Verify. Please visit the following website for additional information:  www.kochcareers.com/doc/Everify.pdfFollow us

The company offers business operation services, including strategic/business planning, pricing analysis and strategy, opportunity assessment, sales force, category management and trade promotion, supply chain and logistics management and optimization, asset management, and call center strategy/operations; and strategic implementation services, such as program management, business process improvement, balanced scorecard, strategic sourcing, organizational design, and change management. Name: Business Analyst (Salesforce Service Cloud)
Description: Job DescriptionWe live in a moment of remarkable change and opportunity. Data and technology are transforming industries, society, and even the workplace by creating professions that did not exist before the emergence of data, cloud, social, and mobile technologies.  As the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, IBM is a leader in this global transformation and is just the place to continue your career. Network in an open, friendly and flexible work environment where diversity is embraced, while new and creative ways of thinking are encouraged and supported. As an IBMer, you can change the way the world works. Join this IBM team and be part of a diverse and global company of thinkers and doerspeople who want to make an impact, cultivate their expertise and collaborate with some of the worlds top business and technology professionals.  The Client Support IT team is looking for an experienced Business Analyst to join our high-performing application development team. Our portfolio of applications spans electronic support, call/problem management, and entitlement systems. We operate and transform the capabilities for IBM worldwide technical support which is key to IBMs growth.  IBM is focused on the client experience. A key measurement of client satisfaction is the Net Promoter Score (NPS). In this role, you will be responsible for driving NPS improvements for clients as well as IBM support professionals. Youll work with the support and transformation leadership teams to gather, analyze and drive change using client satisfaction data, direct client interaction, and executives from across the IBM support organization. Working with the development teams, you will develop actions to improve NPS scores and communicate the progress to executive leadership as well as the IBM support teams. This position will require the ability to work across management matrices and also leverages strong Agile and iteration management skills. Who you are:Self-motivated and self-managed with a demonstrated analytical ability and curiosityTakes creative approaches to problem solving, innovation, and issue resolutionWorks independently and within a team settingStrong oral and written communication skillsFluent in EnglishLive in or willing to move to Armonk NY, Austin TX, Littleton MA, or Raleigh NC to work collaboratively in the officeHow well help you grow:This role will give you executive visibility and the chance to show that you can drive impactful change.Offer an opportunity to be a part of a hardworking team in a collaborative, borderless organization in an inspiring, empowered environmentProvide a place where youre proud to work and where you are motivated to produce the best results possible No remote opportunities exist  Must have the ability to work in the US without current/future need for IBM sponsorshipRequired Technical and Professional Expertise 10+ years of experience with IBM support or development processAbility to work with both the business and technical resources to understand and define functional/technical requirements Ability to use Agile collaboration tools (e.g. Mural, Slack, RTC, Trello)Working familiarity with Agile development conceptsMust have excellent communication skills Preferred Tech and Prof Experience Subject matter expert in Salesforce Service CloudFamiliarity with IBM brand and business structure EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: New Grad - End User Computing - Business Analyst
Description: Business Summary: VMware is a global leader in cloud infrastructure and business mobility. VMware accelerates customers' digital transformation journey by enabling enterprises to master a software-defined approach to business and IT. With VMware solutions, organizations are building extraordinary experiences by mobilizing everything. Our customers are responding faster to opportunities with modern data and apps hosted across hybrid clouds, and safeguarding customer trust with a defense-in-depth approach to cybersecurity.  At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Do you dare to do the stuff you've always dreamed about? Dare to explore at https://careers.vmware.com.  VMware offers cutting-edge cloud infrastructure and security services to companies of all shapes and sizes. Our world is all about technology, and that world is growing because the imagination, ingenuity and talent of our teams knows no bounds. We believe that creativity sparks innovation and inspires our employees to think of VMware differently and change the world around them. Job Role and Responsibilities: In End User Computing (EUC) at VMware, we are in the business of helping customers bring Business Mobility to reality: transforming their high-demand applications, building and leading the next-generation desktop, and helping industries shift core business processes and operations to make things happen only possible in today's mobile environment. With over 60,000 customers around the globe, our EUC team is helping companies deliver work at the speed of life and our technologies are leading what's happening next for users across the enterprise.  Our team is seeking a Business Analyst to participate and contribute to project requirements and business models, business process documentation, and improvement in the process and functions of EUC SaaS Operations. Our objective is project prioritization; process and resource optimization; and key operating indicators development and reporting for EUC in the development, delivery, and technical support of our Unified Endpoint Management products. If you thrive on execution, collaboration, and have a bias for continuous improvement, this is the right team for you. Responsibilities include:Providing analytical support to Project Managers, including business model creation with key project indicator definition and reportingDefinition and reporting of Key Business Indicators for EUC Executive StaffResearch, documentation, optimization, and improvement of key business and operations processes, including communication and change management across functionsRequired Skills:Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Accounting, or relevant field of studyResults-driven mindset with the ability to multitask and navigate through ambiguityGood analytical and organizational skills with high level of accountability and integrityStrong interpersonal skills, including good communication with the ability to clearly articulate ideas in a precise and concise mannerEnthusiastic and detail-orientedPreferred Skills:MS Office (including Excel, Access, and PowerPoint) plus Tableau, Mindjet, or equivalent toolsDesire to support and work with cross-functional teamsStrong quantitative and analytical competencyVMware will not sponsor a visa for this role.SDL2017

Name: ServiceNow Business Analyst

Provide guidance and/or instruction to junior staff members so they can grow into more amazing people. Name: Cost Analyst
Description: Our partner, a worldwide commercial product manufacturer, is looking to add a talented Cost Analyst to work alongside Senior Management on their Atlanta team. This role has great exposure within both the division and the parent company, opening up growth opportunities throughout the organization. The Cost Analyst will play a key role in the success of the cost arm of the business. Comfort with manipulating large amounts of data and interfacing with members of the management team is a must. Position Summary This position is responsible for the cost accounting and material cost reduction projects for the business unit. Responsible for the standard cost accounting and inventory accounting, including annual cost roll process.Tracks and reports materials cost reduction projects and initiatives.Tracks Capital expenditures and coordinates the timely project closure with the respective managers.Assists in various financial research projects and ad-hoc analysesRepresents Finance on cross-functional project teams- providing analytical support as neededPrimary ResponsibilitiesResponsible for all cost accounting, material and inventory variance analysis. Reviews and maintains the cost system, including bill of materials and standard unit cost. Participates in the month-end closing process and reporting activities. Assists during quarterly external and internal audits.Manages the material cost reductions projects - works with the Sourcing and Engineering groups to validate proposed material cost reduction projects. Maintains database, tracks and reports actual performance and prepares variance analysis vs. forecast and budget.Monitors and tracks Capital projects, works closely with project managers to assure timely closing of the projects. Participates during the forecasting and budget process.Works closely with plant management, sourcing and engineering groups to understand operational and financial results and support improvement.Acts as a liaison between Finance and other departments through: participation in special projects, providing analytics using ad-hoc reporting tools, developing financial models, and querying data sets.Participate in the annual cost roll process and assists with the physical inventory counts for multiple locations.Required Education / QualificationsBachelor's degree in Accounting or equivalent, and minimum of 4 years of experience in a cost accounting roleAdvanced knowledge of SAP is requiredWorking knowledge of BW or equivalent requiredAdvanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Applications- primarily Excel, advanced Excel analytic functions such as: sumifs, vlookups, nested functions, complex pivot tables, etcExperience with SpreadSheet Server Designer Query is a plusAbility to work with large amounts of data, create financial models and ad-hoc reportsStrong organizational and communication skills requiredIndividual motivated to grow and develop Manager-level skillset is desired

Name: Entry Level Business Consultant - GBS Commercial Sector
Description: Job DescriptionIBM Global Business Services (GBS) is now hiring Entry-level Commercial Sector Business Consultants. As an Entry-level Business Consultant, you will have the opportunity to join our world class leadership and development program designed to groom top talent entry-level consultants into tomorrows leaders.  IBM GBS consultants help organizations fundamentally redesign experiences to create new sources of value, digitally reinvent operations for great efficiency and transform entire enterprises through the use of cognitive. This is possible by taking advantage of IBMs global reach, outcome-focused methodologies, domain skills and deep industry expertise.  We are looking for enthusiastic and digitally savvy candidates with the skills, creativity and passion to solve some of societys most complex problems with your innovative thinking and ideas. We seek the best and brightest from all walks of life from business to engineering, communications to computer science, analytics to application development, and everything in between.  The entry-level consultant development program was established to help you experience, grow and transform your consulting career with breadth and depth to remain agile in an ever-changing technological world. By providing you with a variety of project and role experiences and focused skills development opportunities, our consultants are prepared to successfully launch and accelerate their careers. New digital technologies along with cloud, mobile, analytics and cognitive computing are changing how we engage and work with one another. The entry-level consultant development program targets high performers and provides focused training, one-on-one mentoring, and career guidance to help you gain the expertise and know-how that you need to become future partners and executives. Join IBM GBS and become part of something special:An elite leadership development program, unmatched in the marketplaceBe part of a unique community connected with peers, project teams and other practitioners and leadersFoster your collaboration and teaming skills with globally accessible teamsDevelop a specialized skill set through experiential learning and a tailored education pathExperience a variety of roles and projects, as well as peer-led initiativesBenefit from customized career planning and mentoringWhat will you do as an IBM GBS Entry-level Business Consultant? As a Business Consultant, you will work on projects that help clients integrate strategy, process, technology, and information to increase effectiveness, reduce costs and improve profit and shareholder value. You will have an opportunity to build a powerful portfolio of interesting and rewarding experiences. You can take advantage of opportunities to master new skills, work across different disciplines, move into new challenges and develop a robust understanding of different industries. What do we look for in a successful IBM GBS Entry-level Business Consultant?A minimum GPA of 3.2 is a preferred qualification of this positionAbility to translate business requirements into technical solutionsDemonstrated leadership experience and ability to adapt, with willingness to readily take ownership of tasks and problems, which often extend beyond initial scope of responsibilityAbility to apply logic to solve business problems through a detailed analytical approachAbility to handle multiple tasks concurrently and meet deadlines, while maintaining focus in an environment with conflicting demandsDrive to overcome the most challenging or difficult obstacles and look for ways to improve resultsInitiative to actively seek new knowledge and improve skillsStrong interpersonal skills with ability to collaborate and work effectively with individuals, strengthening relationships to achieve win-win solutionsAbility to communicate complex situations clearly and simply by listening actively and conveying difficult messages in a positive mannerA passion for innovative ideas, coupled with the ability to understand and assimilate different points of viewAbility to translate requirements into a business caseAbility to understand clients needs and challenges and apply creative and logical approach to identify solutionsPreferred Majors/Degrees: Business Administration/Management, Finance, Marketing, Economics, International Business, Technical Engineering Majors, Computer Information Systems, Management Information Systems, Information Management, Supply Chain Management Opportunities available in the following locations: Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, Dallas, Houston, New York, San Francisco, Washington  IBM will not be providing visa sponsorship for these positions now or in the future. Therefore, in order to be considered for this position, you must have the ability to work without a need for current or future visa sponsorship.  Required Technical and Professional Expertise Willingness and ability to travel up to 4 days a week (home on weekends based on project requirements) but up to 100% if required.Reside within a reasonable commuting distance (generally 20 miles or less) of one of the following cities or willingness to relocate to: Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, Dallas, Houston, New York, San Francisco, or Washington, DC. Preferred Tech and Prof Experience Preferred degrees/majors: Business Administration/Management, Finance, Marketing, Economics, International Business, Technical Engineering Majors, Computer Information Systems, Management Information Systems, Information Management, Supply Chain Management  EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

The Senior Salesforce Business Analyst will play a vital role supporting a large-scale CRM program to ensure the timely delivery of innovative solutions to address complex business objectives across the enterprise. The position will collaborate between business groups and technology teams and will be responsible for working with cross-functional teams to assess and design business models, gather business requirements, integrate technology, develop training and implementation materials, and provide post-implementation support. *Responsibilities:** + Provide program management and conduct business and systems analysis on a variety of projects and initiatives in the Enterprise CRM Program  + Collaborate with business partners, subject matter experts and other team members to define and document high-level business needs and detailed requirements  + Define and implement improvements to business process and ad-hoc projects in the face of ever-changing marketplace and consumers.  + Create and maintain business process flow maps and diagrams to facilitate understanding of business needs and translate to technology solutions  + Define scope of projects and timelines associated with the completion of initiatives  + Develop and maintain relationships and communications with other team members and internal partners  + Conduct meetings and facilitate collaborative discussions to develop requirements and new functionality needs  + Serve as point of contact for user support and problem solving  + Lead efforts to investigate, analyze, and resolve application issues related to system functionality  + Review and validate test plan approaches as well as participate in system testing *Qualifications:***Basic Qualifications:** + Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience  + 6-8 years business analyst experience with utilizing program management methodology  + 3-5 years? experience working with CRM systems  + 3-5 years? experience with system testing *Preferred Qualifications** + Excellent analytical, quantitative, and problem solving skills with the proven ability to communicate and influence effectively at various levels of the organization  + Proven leadership skills and ability to lead others in defining requirements and identifying solutions  + In depth knowledge of business operations and processes for multiple businesses  + Sharp focus on achieving results; persists at completing tasks despite challenges; ability to achieve results and navigate through ambiguity  + Well-organized; plans activities and consistently follows up  + Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment  + Proficient in MS Word, Excel, Visio, and PowerPoint  + Salesforce Administrator Certification (or ability to obtain within one year)  + Project management  + Agile methodology  + Sales processes and methodologies  + Six Sigma or other process improvement methodologies  + Financial services industry experience *Job:** Information Technology*Primary Location:** United States*Shift:** 1st - Daytime*Average Hours Per Week:** 40*Requisition ID:** 180038418*Other Locations:** Minnesota-MN-Richfield U.S. Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse workforce.
