Name: Senior Business Analyst- ATG
Description: Delta IT is on a journey to becoming the best IT organization in the airline industry, a journey of transformation. We are changing the way we do business from top to bottom as we strive to create meaningful and innovative solutions and are looking for team members to help us realize our vision.  You, our Delta employees are thinkers, doers, innovators. We are proactive. We are collaborative. We deliver impact to our customers. Lets continue on our transformation journey in becoming a world-class IT organization while continually working at the world's best airline! JOB OVERVIEW: This position is responsible for building strong business understanding and relationships to enable the delivery of technology solutions that deliver the intended business value in the spirit of the Agile Scrum Methodology. The Sr. Business Analyst's primary responsibilities are to assist the Product Owner, business and IT product teams by the management of the Backlog along with active participation in the following but not limited to: Inception, Future State, Alignment, Sprint Planning, Retrospectives, User Story Writing and Refinement. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Responsible for conducting complex and thorough research of existing processes, systems, and desired objectives to meet the objectives of the assigned products  Work with Product Owner, and SMEs to prioritize feature development, based on the business value  Eliciting and creating initial epics/features and elaborating into user stories that clearly describe the functional and non-functional requirements  Delivers business requirements via artifacts such as epics, features, stories, acceptance criteria, process flows, wireframe diagrams, interaction diagrams, mockups/demos, etc  Collaborate with a cross-functional teams inside a Scrum framework  Coordinate multi-system solutions to clarify interdependencies so that systems appear seamless to the customer  Conduct work sessions and document new features, requirements, and strategies.  Perform testing in Dev and UAT environment.  Track bugs, enhancements and ensure issues are resolved before going to production  Able to work on multiple initiatives and balance constantly changing priorities. WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR? / WHAT EXPERIENCE DO YOU NEED? 5+ years of combined experience as a Business Analyst of relevant development life cycle experience in systems with 3+ years' experience as an Agile Business Analyst  Airline business experience, as well as business process re-engineering and/or extensive experience working with agile teams, is desirable  Define product requirements in partnership with stakeholders and in alignment with the overall product strategy  Communicate effectively and consistently with customers, partners, business and technical teams and maintain strong relationships with relevant stakeholders. Fosters open communication by encouraging the expression of ideas and opinions.  Integrate usability studies, research and market analysis into product requirements to enhance user satisfaction  A passionate commitment to user-centered design and development  Extensive knowledge of product and software development techniques and agile methodologies  Plan and coordinate the execution and delivery of a product roadmap through close collaboration with UX/UI designers, engineering teams, quality assurance, and third party vendors  Ability to negotiate priorities and to resolve conflicts among representatives from various business and development teams  Ability to facilitate meetings and requirements definition and be a liaison between internal/external customers, developers and stakeholders #LI-NHW

Name: Business Analyst I
Description: JOB DESCRIPTION: Supports efforts to ensure that information systems support departmental objectives and information management needs. Works at the direction of Enrollment Services and managers and closely with departmental customers to conduct business analysis and identify objectives and requirements. and report the results of analysis conducted.  Collects, organizes and presents information to assist in the development of technology plans and strategies. Assists in planning and implementing systems related projects. Supports customer satisfaction by monitoring the delivery of ongoing information services to designated clients, responding to customer questions and offering alternative solutions to identified problems and issues.  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Five years of position specific subject matter knowledge and/or experience in planning and applying information technology to one or more business functions OR a bachelor's degree and three years of position specific subject matter knowledge and/or experience in planning and applying information technology to one or more business functions. DATE CREATED.MODIFIED/REVIEWED: 11/4/10 DRS  Additional Job Details  Position Assignment: Enrollment Services Department  Direct Supervisor: Director of Enrollment Services Oversees, monitors, and handles information associated with the University initiative of maintaining the integrity of data management with respect to enrollment and financial data for the Rollins School of Public Health. Closely coordinates efforts with the Department of Admissions, Registrar’s Office, Financial Aid and Student Financial Services to ensure integrity of data from the status of admission to matriculation and throughout student enrollment. Assists in the conversion of data input and troubleshooting with On-Base. Assists in training and troubleshoots issues of projects with appropriate department personnel.Assures accuracy of all student enrollment records’ data including student program plans, student sub-plans affecting accurate tuition posting, anticipated graduation dates, external residency programs etc. Coordinates activities with appropriate departments that have different program options and demonstrates the ability to explain program options to customers and professional staff.Processes and enters student data changes such as course withdrawal requests, leave of absence, grade change status requests, enrollment status to residency status, degree extension plans, etc. Reviews and monitors compliance of change in status to assure compliance with University policies.Responds to inquiries regarding enrollment and financial data by Dean’s Office, departments, faculty, staff, students, and other university offices. Develops queries as needed to meet requests. Assures that the data released is in accordance with FERPA. Works closely with the Registrar’s Office in handling sensitive data requests.Coordinates, oversees, and administers financial aid awards for the School of Public Health assuring that RSPH students receive the allotted distribution for need-based scholarships, merit scholarships, and special departmental/program awards. Manages and enters the financial awards and award postings with host organizations/programs that provide financial assistance including the RSPH Merit and Assistantship Program, Adopt-A- Scholar program, Returning Peace Corp Volunteers, AmeriCorp, Saudi Arabia Fellows program, Humphrey, Foege, and Fogarty fellows, NIOSH grant recipients, Health Sciences and MD/MPH dual degree awards, four special fellow programs at Emory and the CDC, Yellow Ribbon program, and the RSPH REAL program. Maintains a record of individual award formulas and their disbursements. Posts awards to student accounts and apply for item types as necessary.Monitors merit award program and maintains records of all awards, scholarships, and fellowships. Initiates and coordinates the analysis of data of student acceptance and financial awards, determining whether there is a relationship between specific awards and the acceptance rate.Works closely with departments and the Registrar’s Office to assure accuracy of the electronic advising program process. Develops new advising reports for new degree and certificate programs. Updates program plans as necessary.Researches and develops a database of potential financial assistance resources for both national and international recipients. Assist individual students with their request of additional contacts for financial assistance.Monitors merit award program and maintains records of all awards, scholarships, and fellowships. Initiates and coordinates the analysis of data of student acceptance and financial awards, determining whether there is a relationship between specific awards and the acceptance rate.Works closely with departments and the Registrar’s Office to assure accuracy of the electronic advising program process. Develops new advising reports for new degree and certificate programs. Updates program plans as necessary.Researches and develops a database of potential financial assistance resources for both national and international recipients. Assist individual students with their request of additional contacts for financial assistance. Preferred  Enrollment/academic affairs experience or experience in higher education  Experience working with MS Office Products (e.g. Excel, Word, Visio),Advance experience in Excel including developing and working with Pivot Tables, OnBase to document business process and business process improvements  Experience extracting data from line of business software and use of statistical analysis software such as SAS or SPS to provide institutional reports for project stakeholders. Working knowledge of relational databases (PeopleSoft and OnBase) and CRMs such as Slate

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Primerica currently has the following opening at our corporate office in Duluth, Georgia:The Business Analyst’s primary role and responsibility will be managing their assigned projects, for both mainframe and web based applications, throughout the entire software development life cycle. The Business Analyst should also be able to assist with basic support, maintenance and development of an XML-based SaaS application used for electronic client applications.The Business Analyst will be responsible for the following key functions on each assigned project:Interacting with and interviewing Business Unit SME’s to gather business requirementsWriting detailed business specificationsDeveloping and executing test plansPerforms systems and procedures analysis involved in testingProject implementationPost-Production verification and data validationAbility to assist with basic support/maintenance/development of an XML-based SaaS application used for electronic client applicationsIdentifying issues/concerns and communicating findingsResearching and assisting to resolve system issuesCoordinates with external vendors to ensure projects are completed on timeProvides data analysis for management and other users; experience writing intermediate SQL queries preferredTo determine operational needs for a project, the analyst will study business functions, analyze system data, and utilize the knowledge obtained from various stakeholders to develop comprehensive written business specifications in order to communicate requirements and changes to IT staff and business partners. The analyst is accountable for overall accuracy of project documentation, monitoring a project’s progress, and communicating to management project milestones and challenges.The Business Analyst would act as a liaison between management, the business users and IT staff. Additionally, the analyst would be interacting with a broad range of internal departments; as well as third party service providers. The Business Analyst should be proficient in creating and maintaining various types of project artifacts/documentation that will be used across the department for reporting and tracking critical data.Qualifications, Skills, and Abilities:Bachelors’ Degree or 4 years equivalent business experience3-5 years analysis, quality control, and information systems experience2 years’ experience as a Business Analyst or equivalent business and technical experienceWorking knowledge of basic XML conceptsIntermediate SQL/MS Access database and query writing skills (SQL is preferred)Intermediate knowledge of Agile project management and methodologies, including (but not limited to) experience with the following: Daily Stand-Ups, Scrum Meetings, Backlog Grooming, etc.Excellent presentation, organizational, verbal and written skillsAbility to work with programmers, coordinators, technical support staff, internal and external department management and vendorsAbility to work with extreme time sensitivity in a fast-paced environmentStrong analytical and problem solving skillsAbility to perform assigned tasks within specified time framesAbility to work independently and balance multiple tasks simultaneouslyAbility to lead projects from start to finish and work with extreme time sensitivityMS Office skillsAbout Primerica:Primerica is a Main Street Company for Main Street North America. Our goal is to create more financially independent families. We are located in Duluth, GA. Primerica employees support our representatives to provide appropriate solutions through term life insurance, mutual funds, annuities and other financial products. We insured more than 5 million lives and have over 2 million client investment accounts. Our stock is traded on The New York Stock Exchange under the symbol “PRI”.  Four years in a row Primerica has been recognized by the Atlanta Journal-Constitution as one of the best workplaces in Georgia! Over the past five years Primerica has consistently been voted Best Employer by Gwinnett Magazine in its special "Best of Gwinnett" winner editions. - provided by Dice  analysis, quality control, information systems, xml concepts, sql, microsoft access, query writting

Name: Business Analyst - ATL
Description: DescriptionTeam Daugherty is looking to add a Business Analyst to the Atlanta team! This individual will be involved in the creation, design and build of new business models and, upon completion, integration and operation of them. Working across the spectrum of management consulting activity and industries, you will have greater opportunities to broaden your career and tackle complex stimulating challenges. This will enable you to accumulate the requisite skills and experiences to develop the functional and industry expertise needed to progress within management consulting and continue to deliver value to our clients.  As a Business Analyst you will be responsible for the following: Serving as knowledge owner for a single system or business process area.Working with a team to analyze, diagnose and resolve unpredictable and varied problems using diverse methods and tools.Advising client users on application design alternatives and business process change opportunities.Connecting user needs to emerging technologies in order to acquire or design tools, techniques and approaches that allow client users to realize optimal project delivery results.Delivering integrated business systems support to users (internal and external to IT), and applying an expert understanding of the business issues and the impact of technology.Executing and managing moderate functional testing efforts.Identifying, addressing, managing and escalating risks and issues within a project. We are looking for someone with: A 4-year college degree.2+ years related experience in a business analysis role within IT departments and management consulting organizations.Preferred depths in at least one of the following areas: systems integration, business process management, financial analysis, marketing, supply chain, retail or telecommunications.Strong SQL skills with the ability to write complex SQL statements that analyze data and create prototypes.Familiarity with several software delivery methodologies (RUP/Agile/Waterfall).Strong knowledge of requirement gathering, use case analysis and user acceptance testing.CBAP for business analysis (preferred). We offer members of Team Daugherty: Excellent health, dental and vision insurance.Revenue sharing and a 401(k) retirement savings plan.Life, disability and long-term care insurance.Little to no travel.Robust career development and training. Do you think you’re a good fit for Team Daugherty? Apply now and find out why working here satisfies the smart, the talented and the curious!

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Role Purpose  Responsible for working with business partners, stakeholders and other team members to identify and understand highly complex business requirements and processes in order to recommend and support the delivery of quality technical solutions. The individual may be asked to assume responsibility for project management activities, including the planning, coordination and execution of projects in support of our business partners. This is a global role with significant focus on the US.  Key Accountabilities  Business Analysis  - Responsible for eliciting and documenting business requirements and recommending solutions in support of business needs and overall IT strategies. Produces required project lifecycle documentation such as project initiation documents, detailed business requirements, diagrams and use cases.  - Responsible for producing functional and non-functional specifications as well as other deliverables related to the project(s) assigned.  - Leads customer, stakeholders and development team members in the process of analyzing business requirements and developing solutions aligned with business and IT strategies.  - Responsible for gathering, compiling and synthesizing information with regard to business or technology processes and/or systems. Consistently demonstrates in-depth knowledge of core business processes.  - Recommend controls by identifying problems; write improved procedures.  - Provides analytic support by coordinating data extraction from various databases and data interpretation.  - Prepare technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends.  - Participates in Integration Testing and User Acceptance Testing (UAT). Ensure compliance, operational risk controls in accordance with Enstar or regulatory standards and policies; and optimize relations with internal control and external regulators by addressing any issues.  Project Management  - Assumes project management responsibilities on some assignments. In this capacity, Manage smaller technology projects to ensure projects are delivered on time within agreed budget and to agreed quality standards.  - Working with the Project Management Office, manage projects following the Enstar Project Management methodology, ensuring that risks are managed; issues are addressed; costs and time are monitored; communications takes place with stakeholders; quality is managed; and the team is engaged.  Other  - Maintain user confidence and protect operations by keeping information confidential.  - Provides clear written and verbal communications to project team.  - Undertake any other duties as assigned by IT Management.  Person Specification  Experience:  · 8+ years of business analysis experience within financial sector, preferably reinsurance/insurance technology applications.  · Bachelors degree in business, related field or equivalent experience.  · Professional qualifications in business analysis and project management are not required, they are preferred.  Knowledge:  · Strong understanding of business analysis methodology/processes, based either in IIBA, PMI or BCS  · Demonstrated ability to plan, execute and control smaller projects in a structured project management environment, using PRINCE 2 or PMI Practitioner methodologies  General Skills / Attributes:  · Strong analytical and information gathering skills; with the ability to create solid written project artifacts, including the business case creation and production of functional specifications.  · Ability to work effectively as part of a team to drive projects and deliverables.  · Excellent interpersonal skills and communication skills; must be able to effectively communicate with individuals at all levels of the organization.  · Strong problem-solving, lateral thinking, communications, planning, organizational and interpersonal skills.  · Ability to work independently and support multiple projects.  · Strong experience with Microsoft products including Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Project, Visio and MS Access.  · Attention to detail, ability to establish priorities and meet deadlines. Demonstrated success in a fast- paced environment with demonstrated ability to juggle multiple competing projects and demands.  · Flexible approach we are a global operation.  Job Type: Full-time  Experience: business analysis: 8 years (Preferred) Location: Alpharetta, GA (Preferred) Work authorization: United States (Required)

Name: Online Business Analyst, Onsite Search
Description: Position Description: The Online Business Analyst, Onsite Search provides analytics on online data using various analytical tools to uncover trends and provide insight that will maximize HomeDepot.com efforts. Works with the Merchandising and Marketing departments to monitor onsite search, identify opportunities for optimizing onsite search and proactively alerting the team when programs deviate from expected results. Identifies underperforming areas of the site and opportunities to improve site performance. Works with various business teams to establish a cross-channel analytics process to optimize the navigational paths customers take to complete an order on HomeDepot.com. Analyzes and understands the key drivers of performance related to Homedepot.com's online objectives.Major Tasks, Responsibilities and Key Accountabilities30% Responsible for updating and maintaining reporting on key performance indicators for distribution to senior leadership team for Onsite Search20% Responsible for updating insights and dashboards for onsite search and actively reporting back to the business partners successes and/or failures20% Manage off-shore and/or onshore analyst efforts for various reports including clickmap and department dashboard reporting20% Create new operational processes and improvements to ensure data collection and reporting accuracy, including documenting the new procedures10% Perform ad hoc reporting based on the business needs and extract the proper data from relevant systemsNature and ScopePosition reports to Manager, Online Search OptimizationResponsible for helping others and providing on-the-job training or guidance Preferred Qualifications2+ years of relevant work experienceOnsite search tool experience SOLR, B2B experience.Web Analytics knowledge and experience using Big Query, SiteCatalyst, or Adobe Marketing CloudDemonstrated business/financial modeling capabilities with tools such as Excel and AccessDemonstrated skills in applying statistical analysis principles to business challengesSOLR and/or Endeca experienceNATURE AND SCOPEPosition reports to Manager, Reporting & Analytics  Responsible for helping others and providing on-the-job training or guidanceENVIRONMENTAL JOB REQUIREMENTSEnvironment: Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.Travel: Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time.Additional Environmental Job Requirements:  ESSENTIAL SKILLS: MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSMust be eighteen years of age or older.Must be legally permitted to work in the United States.Additional Minimum Qualifications:Education Required:The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a bachelor's degree program or equivalent degree in a field of study related to the job.Years of Relevant Work Experience: 0-1 yearsPhysical Requirements:Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles.Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies:Strong quantitative and analytical skills  Effective presentation skills  Strong verbal and written communication skills  Ability to work effectively across functions and departments  Ability to deal with occasional off-hour calls effectively and professionally  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: Job Summary: Under the guidance of the Director of the Enterprise Data Management(EDM) Office, the EDM Technical Analyst will be responsible for defining and developing new Master Data Domains, leading requirements solicitation and analysis for MDM implementation and system integrations, managing various aspects of MDM delivery throughout the SDLC and developing EDM's standard business analyst practices throughout the SDLC. The EDM Technical Analyst will do this by creating and maintaining relationships with product and application teams, working closely with MDM, System and Data Architects and using proven business analyst methods and tools to deliver solutions to internal business stakeholders while operating in an Agile delivery environment. RequirementsBA/BSAdvanced SQL database skills5+ years of experience in defining and testing requirements for MDM tools5+ years of experience in MDM data modelingAdvanced Workflow modeling and management using Bonita Preferred Experience with Talend MDM, SAP and SalesforceExperience working within an Agile delivery environmentPrevious experience working in the Travel Industry Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

Name: Technical Analyst III
Description: DescriptionConsults with internal customers and external vendors to capture agreed-upon business objectives and processes. Performs research and fact-finding to determine business requirements and specifications for development of end-user programs, operational procedures and support and systems. Communicates these processes and their implications to technical and non-technical contributors to ensure that applications accurately meet business users' goals. Produce documentation and training materials for software applications. May manage software applications training program for user personnel. May direct IT research initiatives moving from the business concept stage through initiative direction, project definition, project execution, and project evaluation, up to and including operational support phase. Maintains, integrates, and communicates knowledge of industry directions and IT trends.PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES AND ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:• Works with Business Analysts or other customers to interpret customer and business needs and translate them into application, system, technical and operational requirements.• Engages and participates in projects/applications requirement sessions in order to ensure proper technical requirements are clearly documented, testable, and managed.• May work closely with business and boundary partners (Field Operations, Customer Care, Sales, HR, Cox Business, Business Operations, Engineering, Outside Plant, Technology, etc. and vendors) to support application lifecycle from development through implementation.• Communicates technical and business aspects of work efforts between team members.• Determines impact on existing applications & databases based on requirements. Understands applications and systems and provides development input to architects/engineers during the analysis phase.• Provides project manager with time and resource estimates for technical requirements.• Works with technical team to ensure all requirements are addressed in solution design.• Coordinates with QA for testing new features, new solutions, and bug fixes.• May write test cases and provide QA testing.• Works directly with Development and QA teams to complete application implementations with minimal impact to customers. • Develops technical documentation, processes, installation procedures and service guides, application training information, and may assist in the development of end-to-end documentation for various projects and supported products/applications. • Participates in peer review of solution design documentation. • Reviews vendor documents as appropriate including detailed functional specifications, and file and field layouts and determines if vendor solutions meet Cox requirements.• Develops measurements and reports on key service-level metrics. • Possesses a clear understanding of the architecture standards, a high-level understanding of the business, and a deep understanding of respective domain architectures (business, information, application, technology). • Depicts the enterprise information conceptually, logically and physically. • Identifies architectural implications of the business requirements. • Interfaces extensively with functional users to confirm the applicability of design alternatives, identifies and recommends cost effective options, and addresses user concerns.• Thorough understanding of software development methodologies, including Agile, Scrum, Waterfall, and others.• Proficient in test case / use case creation and testing methodologies.• Possess both critical-thinking and analytical skills.• Ability to understand and implement instructions furnished in written, verbal, or diagram form.• Excellent verbal and written communication skills.• Experience with process documentation and process flows.• Ability to translate business requirements into system and technical requirements for software development.• Basic proficiency of report writing and report creation.• Strong organizational skills.• Ability to work with minimal supervision.• Participates in the conceptual phases of identifying and solving business problems and initiatives.• Serves as a subject matter expert (SME) between assigned business unit(s) and the IT organization; consults with business unit clients on workflow and prioritization. • Conducts business requirements reviews and formulates logical statements of business requirements.• Collaborates with business to build and maintain application roadmaps that can be translated into technical requirements, designed and developed. • Works closely with cross functional teams in order to fully understand business priorities and work collaboratively to deliver on those.• Proactively understands customer's business processes, the key drivers and measures of success for the business, and the short- and long-term direction of the business and technology.• Understands key applications and assets that can be extended to meet the ongoing business needs. Manages the development and maintenance of relevant process, including context (data flow) diagrams, work flow models, and technology models.• Focuses on developing and improving processes, assisting with the development of metrics for delivery of SDLC initiatives from technical requirements through deployment and warranty of solutions.• Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to develop cohesive working relationships with internal and external clients. QualificationsMinimum:• 5 years of experience in related field.• 3+ years experience in a business process design, technical/business analyst role providing technical solution guidance.• 3+ years experience in design and implementation of Application, Integration, and Data Architectures.• Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges.• Proven experience with software development life cycle (SDLC) and agile/iterative methodologies.• Strong communication and documentation skills.Preferred• BS/BA degree in computer and/or business related desired (i.e. Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology).• Experience in telecommunications industry desired.• Experience in SQL preferred.• Experience with order management systems, ICOMS, and other key Cox Communications systems.• Project management experience a plus.About Cox CommunicationsCox Communications is committed to creating meaningful moments of human connection through broadband applications and services. The largest private telecom company in America, we proudly serve six million homes and businesses across 18 states. We're dedicated to empowering others to build a better future and celebrate diverse products, people, suppliers, communities and the characteristics that makes each one unique. Cox Communications is the largest division of Cox Enterprises, a family-owned business founded in 1898 by Governor James M. Cox.Cox is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer - All qualified applicants/employees will receive consideration for employment without regard to that individual's age, race, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, physical or mental disability, veteran status, genetic information, ethnicity, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by law.Statement to ALL Third-Party Agencies and Similar Organizations: Cox accepts resumes only from agencies with which we formally engage their services. Name: Sr. Business Analyst, Corp Financials, Foundation & People Solutions
Description: OverviewAs a Senior Business Analyst, you will join a team responsible for supporting Chick-fil-A’s Corporate Talent Systems. As our Corporate Staff continues to increase, we aim to use and maintain the best technology platforms to support this growth. You can have an immediate impact to over 1,700 Corporate Staff who are supported through our talent platforms. In this role, you will serve as a liaison between the People and IT Departments, providing technical and functional solutions to support Chick-fil-A’s growth.  In this role, you will learn our Talent Systems and how they integrate to other platforms. You will be responsible for building and supporting technical integrations from the People Solutions portfolio to other systems. You will gather functional requirements, solve and design solutions to technical problems, write reports, and create project plans.ResponsibilitiesServes as a trusted IT advisor to the People Department.Writes and supports technical integrations.Leads small projects and serves on medium to large projects providing both technical and functional solutions to help the People Department achieve strategic goals and objectives.Understands Talent procedures and IT capabilities and recommends process changes to standardize functionality and reduce manual work.Works with other functional and technical teams in IT to document, develop, test, and support solutions.Oversees consultants for large scale implementations.Develops and enhances reports to provide relevant data to business users. Minimum Qualifications5 years of experience working as a technical systems analystProficient in writing SQL queries against databaseExperience coding in a language such as Python, PL/SQLStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsGood interpersonal skills and desire to work collaborativelyStrong written and oral communication skillsAttention to detailOrganized and comfortable with managing project detailsTravel: up to 5% Preferred QualificationsExperience with HRIS Applications, applicant tracking or other talent systemsExperience with HRIS implementationsExperience with XML, SOA, BPEL, AWSExperience with SOAP and REST web servicesUnderstanding of Talent practicesExperience with DEI Minimum Years of Experience5  Required Level of EducationBachelor's Degree  Major/ConcentrationTechnical field of study  Minimum GPA (4.0 Scale)3.0

Name: Watson Health- Business Data Analyst

Name: Intern - Business Analyst
Description: ACCELERATE HERE. SHAPE THE FUTURE OF SUPPLY CHAINS. As one of the largest third party logistics (3PL) providers, we help people around the world get the products they need, when they need them. We have big plans, and shaping the future takes a team as diverse as the worlds supply chains. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, and are energized by solving challenging problems and owning your success, join our industry leading team of supply chain experts as we drive the industry forward. ABOUT THE ROLE Our internship is more than a learning experience; its an opportunity to make an impact at a Fortune 500 global company. Youll help some of the worlds most prominent companies move their products around the globe. The world of logistics is ever changing and youll be in the middle of the action, gaining business experience that will benefit you for a lifetime.  Sales, Account Management, Operations, and Carrier Management interns are integrated into our teams, giving you the opportunity to learn global freight services and help shippers and carriers optimize supply chains. Your internship will begin with an onboarding program where youll learn more about C.H. Robinson, and our technology, processes, and culture. WHAT YOULL DOYoull be exposed to multiple facets of the logistics and transportation industry, such as: Sales and negotiation techniquesBuilding customer relationshipsOperations managementTransportation information systemsWHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?Undergraduate education at a Junior or Senior level (pursuing a business, sales, logistics, supply chain, communications, or related major is a plus)Excellent communication skills, verbal and writtenAbility to thrive in a deadline-driven, team environment, while also delivering independent resultsRelationship building skillsDriven, enthusiastic, and highly motivatedHigh attention to detail and ability to multitaskWorking knowledge of Python, C++, JAVA, DAX Formulas, Power Pivot, Power Bi For more information, visit http://www.chrobinson.com or view our company video. EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER C.H. Robinson - Affirmative Action Employer/EOE/M/F/Disabled/Veteran

Name: Business Analyst 4-Ops
Description: Provides programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization*s financial and tactical business objectives. Provides business practices and processes. Develops, communicates, and trains the organization on business practices and processes.  Serve as a liaison with other divisions such as Finance, Contracts, HR, Legal, Shared Services, Accounts Receivable, Purchasing, and Risk Management in an effort to ensure accurate and timely transaction processing. Collect, input, verify, correct, and analyze data to measure key performance indicator actual versus business objectives. Provide updates to management regarding budget to actual, informing them of deviations and opportunities. Provide management with economic impact and compliance issues surrounding key business decisions and/or deals. Communicate Oracle Business Practices to the organization and monitor process and approvals for full compliance. Drive implementation of new processes and procedures.  Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. Ability to collect, organize, and display data in spreadsheet format. Follow-through skills necessary to get information from internal and third parties and have data errors/omissions corrected. For this, relationship management skills strongly desired. Strong written and verbal communication skills. 8 plus years relevant work experience. Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.**Job:** **Business Operations**Organization:** **Oracle**Title:** *Business Analyst 4-Ops**Location:** *United States**Requisition ID:** *18001EC4*

Name: SaaS Implementation Business Analyst (Atlanta)
Description: Are you experienced in working closely with external customers throughout a software implementation and enjoy traveling? Does working for an award-winning organization sound enticing to you? If you are looking for a career move that will give you all of these things, then look no further as we have a fantastic opportunity to join e-Builder as a Business Analyst. About e-Builder: Founded in 1995 and based in Plantation, Florida, e-Builder, a Trimble Company, is the pioneer of a fully integrated, cloud-based construction management software. Our client list reads as the "who's, who" in all our vertical markets: Facebook, CalTech, INOVA Healthcare, and Chicago Transit Authority to name just a few - . As one of the fastest growing companies in South Florida, we are proud to be named a 'Florida Company to Watch,' to be nominated as one of South Florida's best places to work and have our CEO named South Florida Business Journal's Ultimate CEO. We're excited to find innovative ways to combine technology with construction with a fun work environment. To learn more about our award-winning organization and corporate culture visit www.e-builder.net  In this role you will be responsible for implementing e-Builder and guaranteeing product adoption for our clients by working closely with them throughout the entire implementation lifecycle. This includes but is not limited to: Analyze client business process/requirements and develop corresponding process and data flowsPerform gap analysis activities to identify and document any possible requirement gaps as well as provide creative solutions to ambiguous business problemsDevelop materials and deliver training required for each client assigned implementationConfigure based on requirements and business rules for new/existing implementationsAssist with UAT strategies, conditions and evaluation of expected resultsCreate and distribute meeting minutes, status reports, and required documentationAttributes/Skills Required:SaaS Software implementation experienceAbility to effectively present and communication information to customers, strategic business partners, and company managementPrior experience with writing and analyzing business and system requirement documents that convey complex business analysis and technology solutionsExperience with SaaS software testing strategies, conditions and evaluation of expected resultsHistory of recommending and implementing process improvementsGeneral understanding of financial reporting (Cash flows, G.L. Accounts, etc.)Proficient experience with MS Office Suite, Visio and web technologiesCollege degree preferred If you have the ability to travel around the country up to 75% of the time and can accomplish the above then you will make you an excellent match for this position and will have what it takes to be a successful Business Analyst here at e-Builder! We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Drug-Free Workplacewww.e-builder.net

Name: Business Analyst - Enterprise Resiliency or Business Continuity.
Description: Minimum Required Skills: - Looking for someone with 5-7 years of work experience and at least a couple years of experience/exposure to Enterprise Resiliency/Business Continuity. Productive professional contributor with strong understanding of area of focus. Assigned to larger, moderately complex projects. Work requires increasing independence; guidance is provided on a regular basis but primarily on unusual or complex issues. Work typically involves periodic review of output by others. Moderate to Expert level of Excel proficiency. Name: Business Analyst (Software Design, Training, and Support)
Description: Job DescriptionBusiness Analyst (Software Design, Training, and Support) Please see below for instructions on how to apply for this position. The instructions need to be followed for your resume to be considered. Freedom Suite Services ( www.freedomsuiteservices.com ) is a 25-person company focused on providing franchisors and their franchisees a collection of services to help them grow their businesses.  We are currently seeking a Business Analyst to join our IT team in our Atlanta office. This is a great opportunity for entrepreneurially minded individuals to have a significant impact both on our team and in our industry.  This person's primary responsibility will be to interact with our clients and programming team regarding their business software systems (ERP/CRM), working with them to design new features, create training/user guide materials for them, provide training on software use, and to help test new development. Reports to CTO. Very minimal travel.  Required Qualifications  · Strong resonance with Freedom Suite’s six core values: Act as one team, Lead with a servant’s heart, Be courageous, Think like an entrepreneur, Speak with candor, and Exceed expectations  · “Smart and gets things done”  · Great team player  · Comfortable with analytic thinking processes  · Strong organization skills  · Superior communication skills (written and oral)  Our Qualifications Wish List  · Experience with UI/UX software design for business systems (e.g. in part using Balsamiq Mockups)  · Experience with creating video software tutorials (e.g. using Camtasia) and online software tutorials  · Experience with software testing  · Experience with the Agile software development methodology  · A good feel for small-business best practices -- sales, marketing, operations, finances, admin, HR, project management, etc., particularly in the franchising world  · A Tom Peters devotee (Brand You, WOW projects, PSF greatness)  Compensation depends on experience, skill set, and the ability to hit the ground running. If you are interested in being considered for this position, please send your resume to itjobs@freedomsuiteservices.com and include a cover letter in which you address these three questions:  1. What are 2-4 things you would like to improve about a software program or app that you regularly use? Why? How could they be improved?  2. Acknowledging that no one is great at everything, for the following ten skills, please rank yourself from strongest (first) to weakest (last) - gathering and consolidating software needs/requirements from various users- software UI/UX design (visual and functional)- project management- web page creation (HTML and CSS)- computer programming / software develop- software testing- creating written tutorials for software- creating software how-to videos- number crunching / report analysis- graphic design / e.g. using Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator  3. What is your biggest professional braggable in the past five years? That is, what one thing are you most proud of?Company DescriptionNoble Brands is an innovative group of service, manufacturing, distribution companies and two franchise brands: ShelfGenie & Outback GutterVac. We only work with companies that have a clear and focused Noble Purpose. Noble Brands supports ShelfGenie and Outback GutterVac Franchise Partners, and other Franchise Brands, through our Freedom Suite Services. Freedom Suite delivers 360-degree Brand Development with Media Buying, Creative, Ad Production and Digital services, along with custom CRM technologies and full front-office business support services. Freedom Suite also provides innovation through product development for our Franchise Brands and by incubating new Franchise Brands.  G-O Logistics and Cabinet Components Innovations provide manufacturing and distribution services for hundreds of franchise locations and assist in incubating new Franchise Brands.

Name: Business Systems Analyst

Manage the implementation of integration tasks associated with the given project to maximize performance within the teams. take two initially established projects and bring them together to optimize the ROI of both Work directly with the product owners to ensure a complete understanding of the business requirements Document system parameters and formats, ensure software compatibility and coordinate with end users to optimize the software components to drive both usability and overall serviceREQUIREMENTS: Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as Computer Science, Computer/Software Engineering or related field required Strong knowledge of NICE/inContact software suite and Salesforce CRM Must have strong telephony skills with work force management background; be able to provide guidance on optimal work force management structure and design Must understand Salesforce CRM and its ability to integrate with NICE/inContact (CTI, Work Item Routing, etc.) Experience working in shared service centers and/or contact centers optimizing the agent experience Verbal and written communication skills, problem solving skills, attention to detail and interpersonal skills Strong ability to work independently and manage one's time Strong leadership skills necessary to provide support and constructive performance feedback Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Name: Financial Analyst for Cloud Consultancy
Description: Contino – Financial Analyst  Contino is a driving force in the future of DevOps, Cloud and Container based consultancy services. We've been working long and hard in helping household names in enterprise and technology streamline their processes, reducing cost and increasing efficiency; essentially creating an ultimate technology environment.  Contino is looking for a Financial Analyst in Atlanta, GA to help design and deliver ongoing financial reports, dashboards, and analyses. This role requires a self-starter who is ready to apply prior financial experience to enhance current reporting and participate in creating new strategies. We are looking for someone with an entrepreneurial spirit interested in advancing your career in a fun and exciting environment.  Key responsibilities include: Working directly with Contino's VP of Finance providing proactive insights and recommendations to optimize the North American business performance.Help build, deliver and maintain financial reports, analyses, and forecasts for Contino leadership.Build models and provide in-depth analysis on financial performance of delivery projects.Work with sales, delivery and resource management teams to understand changes in project and staffing plans to provide accurate forecast reporting.Additional responsibilities may include assisting with month-end close, regulatory compliance, annual budgeting process, A/R and A/P related tasks, and other ad-hoc business support.RequirementsFinancial Analyst experience in a consulting environment is of primary importance. At least 2 years of relevant experience is required.Excellent knowledge of consultant project utilization, cost and profitability margins, revenue projections and success measures.BS/BA degree. A degree in business/finance/accounting preferred.Experience performing financial analysis related to consulting.Advanced knowledge with Excel Spreadsheets and formulas and/or Google Sheets preferred.An understanding of accounting principles.Strong interpersonal skills, including written and oral communication.Ability to work and communicate effectively with other departments and Contino leadership.Ability to work independently in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment.Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and prioritize effectively to meet deadlinesBenefitsTime Off: 15 vacation days per year & 10 paid holidays; up to 5 days can rollover per year. There isn’t a limit on sick days right now, take them as needed.Benefits Eligibility: You are eligible to participate in our health, 401k, and life/long-term/short-term disability benefits the 1st of the month following your start date.Healthcare: United Healthcare is our provider for medical, vision, and dental. The plan is a national plan with a deductible and copays for in-network care. We currently pay 100% of your monthly premiums for your whole family. We cannot guarantee this will continue in the future as health care costs are unpredictable and outside of our control. It is true for the current plan year (8/1/2018 - 7/31/2019). Domestic partners are permitted to join the plan.Flex Spending & Dependent Care: You may elect to participate in our Flex Spending and/or Dependent Care programs. These allow you to use pre-tax dollars to pay for eligible medical and child care expenses.401(K): We offer a 401k plan through Principal Financial. There is a company match.Life, Long-term, & Short-term Disability: Contino covers the monthly premiums for this benefit.Commuter Benefits: Your pre-tax dollars toward commuting (train, bus, ferry, parking).Maternity & Paternity Leave: We offer 12 weeks for maternity leave and 2 weeks for paternity leave.Learning & Development: You receive $3,000 per year to use toward classes, seminars, certifications and more! Your first year your budget is pro-rated to your start date.Technology Budget: You receive $1,500 to $1,800 to purchase a laptop and related accessories.Cell Phone Bill Allowance: Each month, you receive $75 to use toward your cell phone bill.Expedited Travel Program: Reimbursement for a expedited travel security program (ex: Clear, TSA Precheck, Global Entry).Race Entrance Fee: Reimbursement for the entrance fee to a race (Ex: 5ks, tough mudder).Monthly Flower Delivery: Flowers delivered to your home each month.

Name: Senior Product Analyst
Description: Mailchimp is a leading marketing platform for small business. We empower millions of customers around the world to build their brands and grow their companies with a suite of marketing automation, multichannel campaign, CRM, and analytics tools.  The Sr. Product Analyst is a strategic member of the individual product domains which are mapped to customer problems. As a Sr. Product Analyst, you will be responsible for helping product teams build data-driven roadmaps by sizing and prioritize initiatives, providing a consistent flow of data-driven insights to help achieve targeted KPIs and creating dashboards and reporting to monitor and measure success. You're a skilled collaborator who is able to work across departments and disciplines. You're able to tell stories with data that help contextualize opportunities. The ideal candidate will have experience in similar product analytics, marketing optimization or digital analytics roles with strong technical and analytical abilities.  As a part of the Product team, the work you do will help shape our product strategy and drive us towards our company objectives - if you're excited to dig right in and have meaningful, we'd love to hear from you! ResponsibilitiesLead and manage analytics activities for a product domain, including partnering with and mentoring Product AnalystsIdentify KPIs for Product teams that map to customer problems and how to measure success; Partner with Product Managers and Product Marketing Managers for buy in and socialize across the teamPartner with Product Managers to size opportunities and build a prioritized roadmapIdentify opportunities for product changes/experiments based on analysis and proactively share these opportunities to the product teamUnderstand both quantitative and qualitative research and trends related to your product domain and be able to actively leverage those insights to help teams make data-informed decisionsCombine results of experiments and product launches to show how product teams have impacted KPIs and revenueCreate dashboard and automated reports to track KPIsDefine data tracking requirements and ensure proper executionContribute to data quality - identify discrepancies, create data tables needed for analysis and automationSupport experimentation initiatives by calculating sample size, monitoring and reporting on resultsPartner with other analysts on other product domains and across other disciplines in the company to share insights across teams and bring findings back to your domainRequirementsExtensive experience in an analytics focused role, product analytics experience is a plusBachelor's or Graduate degree (business or mathematics a plus or equivalent work experience)Desire to work in a fast-paced environmentExpertise in SQL, Web Analytics, Excel - R/Python is a plusProficiency in wrangling and transforming dataStrong communication, collaboration, and problem-solving abilitiesDemonstrated, hands-on experience with data visualization toolsExpertise with web analytics tools, specifically Google Analytics (certification preferred)Experience working with Google BigQuery a plusExperience with statistical methods such as regression and hypothesis testingProven experience analyzing data from a variety of different sources (quantitative and qualitative), presenting the data in a clear and concise manner, and create actionable insightsAbility to build relationships, be persuasive and influential within and across immediate working groupsExpertise in A/B testing analytics and best practices (a plus) Mailchimp is a founder-owned and highly profitable company headquartered in the heart of Atlanta. Our purpose is to empower the underdog, and our mission is to democratize cutting edge marketing technology for small business. We offer our employees an exceptional workplace, extremely competitive compensation, fully paid benefits (for employees and their families), and generous profit sharing. We hire humble, collaborative, and ambitious people, and give them endless opportunities to grow and succeed.  We love our hometown and support sustainable urban renewal. Our headquarters is in the historic Ponce City Market, right on the Atlanta Beltline. If you'd like to be considered for this position, please apply below. We look forward to meeting you!  Mailchimp is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity at our company. We don't discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Senior Business Analyst

Name: Appraisal Analyst II - 18
Description: Job DescriptionJob Description  Performs moderately complex residential and commercial property evaluations, appraisals and appraisal reviews to determine the fair market value, and to provide required reports for extension of credit. Appraisals are conducted through direct inspections, in some cases, according to appraisal theory and guidelines. Job Duties & Responsibilities:Assembles pertinent data such as costs, sales in area, and other relative information pertaining to the subject property. Analyzes data and determines the proper appraisal method. Exercises sound judgment in the formation and conclusions for market value.Conducts appraisals of property through direct inspections, in some cases. Details and documents the information of the subject property evaluations derived from the field inspection.Maintains knowledge of appraisal standards and regulatory requirements.Completes evaluations conforming to FDIC compliant uniform standards and which meet appraisal requirements of the state the property is located in.Performs all work in accordance with corporate policies and procedures.Ensures the progress and conformance inspections of construction loans are made in order to ensure that completed improvements are in accordance with original appraisal assumptions.Reviews appraisal reports received from fee appraisers for accuracy and compliance with governmental regulations.Maintains evaluation files, ensuring completeness and conformance to departmental specifications.Responds to staff and management's inquires regarding appraised values.Keeps abreast of real estate values and property developments to ensure conformance of valuations with current market prices.Each team member is expected to be aware of risk within their functional area. This includes observing all policies, procedures, laws, regulations and risk limits specific to their role. Additionally, they should raise and report known or suspected violations to the appropriate Company authority in a timely fashion.Performs other related duties as required.Required Qualifications:Minimum Education: Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration or related discipline, or an equivalent combination of education and experienceMinimum Experience: 3+ years job specific experienceRequired Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:Demonstrated experience in appraising residential and commercial propertiesAdvanced knowledge of current methods and techniques of property valuationKnowledge of federal and state guidelines and regulations pertaining to appraisalsKnowledge of appraisal related softwareWorking knowledge of database, spreadsheet, and word processing softwareStrong analytical skillsExcellent oral and written communications skillsAbility to prioritize and organize assignmentsPreferred Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:Customer Focus: Is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers; acts with customers in mind; establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers and gains their trust and respect.Time Management: Uses his/her time effectively and efficiently; values time; concentrates his/her efforts on the more important priorities; can attend to a broader range of activities.Decision Quality: Makes good decisions based upon a mixture of analysis, wisdom, experience, and judgment; most of his/her solutions and suggestions turn out to be correct and accurate when judged over time.Process Management: Good at figuring out the processes necessary to get things done; understands how to separate and combine tasks into efficient work flow; knows what to measure and how to measure it; can simplify complex processes.Written Communications: Is able to write clearly and succinctly in a variety of communication settings and styles; can get messages across that have the desired effect.Physical Requirements/Work Environment: Sit Regularly; Stand or Walk Regularly; Talk and Hear Regularly; Climb, Bend, Kneel, Crouch, or Crawl Regularly; Ability to see objects up close or at a distance, use peripheral vision, identify basic colors; Use of Hands/ability to reach; Name: Process Analyst/Business Process
Description: This position will be responsible for supporting medium to large projects mainly through Discovery, Requirements, and Design, in addition to other lifecycle phases. The candidate must have a strong and detailed understanding of processes needed to efficiently define and document requirements, and the ability to present information to leadership. The candidate must have experience in methodologies used to scope projects and experience working with business partners. This position must be able to work with a highly matrixed team to understand the impact of change across multiple work streams and systems. They must be able to present ideas to IT and business leadership. This position must work closely with team members to ensure proper system design, and ensure the highest quality implementations from requirements through QA to production. This position must have and be able to promote an appropriate sense of urgency in regard to deliverables, and be able to effectively partner with the business to develop and deliver point-of-sale solutions. The candidate is responsible for conducting interviews and requirement workshops to ensure that business detailed requirements are captured and documented. This position may be responsible for the translation of the business requirements into succinct clear systems requirements with defined ranges to be used by IT Development. A thorough understanding of multiple functional areas related to complex projects and the ability to identify and quantify business process improvements along with system improvements through the use of technology is critical. MAJOR TASKS, RESPONSIBILITIES AND KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES - Develop detail requirements including cost-benefit analysis for approved small to mid-sized projects and enhancements to existing projects.  Develop User Acceptance testing (UAT) and trace-ability matrix with the Business Client. Develop System Requirement Documents (SRD) and Systems External Specifications (SES) documents for the UAT and System test groups to assist with testing scenarios.  Interface with Business Stakeholders and IT Infrastructure teams to work through the start-up phase of the project including ensuring business requirements and business acceptance documents are accurately developed.  Assist with training and rollout plans for new systems or enhancements to existing systems.  Maintain a working knowledge of business unit processes, procedures and current applications. NATURE AND SCOPE - Typically reports to Manager - Service Management ESSENTIAL SKILLSMINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS - Must be eighteen years of age or older.  Must pass the Drug Test.  Must successfully complete any required training or orientation courses. EDUCATION REQUIRED - The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a high school diplomas and/or GED. YEARS OF RELEVANT WORK EXPERIENCE - 3

Name: Sr. Business Analyst – Mentor
Description: Responsible for leading initiatives and providing consultation to the internal and/or external customer. Possess expertise in the customer area he/she supports and has technical understanding of the business unit’s systems, capabilities, and respective technologies. Analyze customer processes and requirements. Prepare specified project documentation. Assist in business process redesign as needed. Maintain communication with customer and team members and promote a team environment.  Essential Responsibilities*:  • Gather, develop, coordinate, and maintain business requirements for various projects and/or systems from initial phase to final implementation, assuring requirements meet standards.  • Interact with users, other portfolios, and vendors for full life cycle of project.  • Troubleshoot, coordinate, and maintain production systems/programs/applications, as needed.  • Produce scheduled and ad hoc reports as necessary.  • Assist in maintenance and communication of project status reports and tracking.  • Provide user support and coordinate resolution of issues to include change management, root cause analysis, and appropriate escalation as needed.  • Develop use cases and functional specifications and coordinate the capture of process models and functional testing, ensuring system is functionally appropriate, technically sound, and well integrated.  • Develop and manage user acceptance criteria.  • Coordinate the process to analyze, evaluate, implement, and maintain systems developed internally and/or externally with an outside vendor.  • Assist in the development of project definitions, cost/benefit and risk analysis, work plans, progress reports, and presentations.  • Transition product support to systems operations.  • Assist in establishing end user training.  *May perform other duties as assigned.  Basic Entry Requirements:  ·  Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or Business Administration with two (2) to five (5) years of IT and/or business experience, or any equivalent combination of experience, education, and/or training.  ·  Should have more than 5 years of business analysis experience.  ·  Should be able to mentor other BA’s on the process and best practices for conducting requirements elicitation  ·  Excellent analytical skills and ability to translate business functionality and opportunities into clear, precise and easy-to-read functional specifications critical Strong business acumen to quickly learn new business processes and understand how IT needs to support the business in achieving revenue and profit goals.Ability to work with onshore/offshore teams, and communicate using virtual communication tools (phone, conferencing, online meeting)Excellent verbal and written communication and collaboration skills to effectively communicate with both business and technical IT teamsAirlines experience will be a plus. Major Skills and Competencies:  MAJOR SKILLS REQUIRED:  •  Leadership role in identifying and clarifying both the needed changes and the opportunities associated with all aspects of the business operations; process, organization, visual interface, physical environment, data, applications, Infrastructure, and operations. In addition to identifying the needs to be addressed, the BA will lead the definition of the new business process and the selection of a solution that best meets the business needs.  •  Highly skilled in communications, investigative questioning, team leading, group facilitating, consensus building, critical analysis, diagnosis, and writing with clarity.  •  Demonstrate strength and leadership, providing an example for others on:  o  Requirements Elicitation  §  Requirements identification & development  §  Requirements organization & authentication  §  Requirements prioritizing and approval  §  Requirements management & communication  o  Business Process Modeling  §  Process design, and modification  §  Process integration with other business processes  §  Process development management & communication  o  Solution Assessment  §  Identification of alternative solutions  §  Analysis/vetting of alternative solutions  §  Establish Solution Agreement  o  Use Case  o  UAT Planning & Execution  §  Facilitate business acceptance of solution  §  Coordinate/conduct user acceptance testing  o  Work in Agile / RUP/Waterfall Methodology.  o  Mentor Sr. BA and BA’s in the team  •  Able to evangelize the value of BA practices as they relate to project success Interested in this position? Name: Analyst 2, Business Intelligence
Description: Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.Job Summary:Responsible for defining business intelligence requirements forindividual subject areas; develops conceptual data models, design,build, and test sets of reporting and analytic business intelligenceprograms. Works cross-functionally to collect data and makes actionablerecommendations at all levels. Infers trends from a variety of datasources and confidently delivers their interpretation; makesrecommendations to executives. Works with moderate guidance in own areaof knowledge.Employees at all levels are expect to:- Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for howyou do your job- Own the customer experience-think and act in ways that put ourcustomers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint,and make them promoters of our products and services- Know your stuff-be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of ourgame-changing technology, products and services, especially our digitaltools and experiences- Win as a team-make big things happen by working together and beingopen to new ideas- Be an active part of the Net Promoter System-a way of working thatbrings more employee and customer feedback into the company-by joininghuddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to dobetter for our customers- Drive results and growth- Respect and promote inclusion and diversity- Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and ourcommunitiesCore Responsibilities:- Plans and executes multiple projects involving all aspects of businessintelligence solutions and data, including business intelligenceanalysis and data exploitation.- Takes business intelligence to the next level to support businessdecisions and recommend best practices and policy in businessintelligence implementation, maintenance, and data quality.- Contributes to a variety of projects related to development, testing,and implementation of new and modified business intelligence systems inan efficient and cost-effective manner.- Leads analysis and recommendations relating to organization'soptimization and testing efforts.- Customizes business intelligence report contents and views usingExcel, Access, and other tools to meet the requirements of internalbusiness customers.- Works with team and customers to define business requirements, resolvetechnical issues, and provide training.- Works cross-functionally to implement key projects. Interfaces withother departments to leverage data for their respective business needs.- Tracks web site usage using Omniture and other web tracking tools.- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in mattersof significance.- Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to worknights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.- Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.Job Specification:- Bachelors Degree or Equivalent- Business-- Generally requires 2-5 years related experience  Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

Name: Lead Business Analyst – Mentor
Description: This position will oversee and coordinate the activities of multiple business analysts within multiple projects. The lead must be an expert on the process and best practices for conducting requirements elicitation, scope management and UAT. In addition to performing Sr. Business Analyst activities, a Lead will: Coordinate and oversee the work of other BAs as it relates to specific projects. Mentor other BA’s in the team. Oversee the Business Process Model development efforts, report to PMs and/or Pgm’s on project related work and provide status on BA related activities, works with the PM/PGM to manage the relationship and expectations of the IT team and the Business Partners, works with business leaders, PMs/Pgm and acts as a liaison between IT and business units, coordinates, communicates and escalates issues to the PGM/Project Managers.  Responsibilities:  ·  Directs all BA activities within a project  ·  Lead and direct Sr BA’s within specified project  ·  Analyze, manage, and report BA activities  ·  Manage cross project requirements and escalated issues within specified program  ·  Manage program requirement interdependencies  ·  Communicate appropriately to program lead BA, stakeholders and program managers/project managers  ·  Request the needed BA’s for a project and get them oriented to work on the project  ·  Direct completion of project BA objective, such as scope, requirement, analysis and solutions, business process modeling, UAT, and customer training  ·  Ensure product deliverables’ quality, such as functional specifications, logical and physical data design, solution design and detailed design, UAT test plans, and completed solution  ·  Resolve issues in a timely manner. When appropriate, escalate problems and issues to program lead BA, program manager /project manager and/or stakeholders and sponsor  ·  Evaluate requirement risks and assess possible outcomes  ·  Monitor individual BA performance and provide feedback to program lead BA and/or resource managers and/or program/project mangers  ·  Direct and delegate BA work effort  ·  Maintain communication with customer and team members and promote a team environment. Name: Intranet Portal Business Analyst
Description: Intranet Portal Business Analyst  This Business System Analyst role will be part of IT Transition Program Management Office (IT T-PMO). T-PMO is responsible for migrating IT Applications and Infrastructure . This role is a liaison between Business Teams and Technical Teams for a large scale complex Intranet Portal rebuild.  Background  As a result of merger between client's Technology Solutions division (MTS) and client's, a new entity is created; named client's. Transition Services Agreement (TSA) has been defined between client's and client's to ensure Business continuity is maintained for MTS.  Key Responsibilities:  Solves organizational information problems by creating Intranet Portal requirements, tech specs and test scripts.  Business Systems Analyst Job Duties:  Determines portal objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats.  Designs Web Portal rebuild by analyzing requirements; constructing workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications.  Improves systems by studying current practices; designing modifications.  Recommends controls by identifying problems; writing improved procedures.  Maintains system protocols by writing and updating procedures.  Provides references for users by writing and maintaining web content; training users.  Maintains user confidence and protects operations by keeping information confidential.  Prepares technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends.  Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies.  Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.  Minimum Qualifications  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Systems/ Business Administration or related field.  Minimum of five years experience in Web Portal requirements analysis.  Must have ability to exercise independent judgment in planning, organizing, and performing systems analyst tasks. Some independent judgment required in setting priorities of tasks among multiple assigned projects. Name: Salesforce Sr. Business Analyst (Atlanta) - Bluewolf
