As part of the IBM family, we are the next generation Salesforce consulting firm devoted to innovative design, technology and partnership to transform businesses and get our clients to the future first. With our award-winning services, we help organizations come up with simple solutions to their customer experience problems through customization across the entire Salesforce platform. We are currently looking for a skilled Senior Business Analyst to join our Beyond practice in Atlanta. Key responsibilities for this role include: Act as the lead Business Analyst for the workstream, reviewing, analyzing, and evaluating business requirements and user needsCollaborate with Consultants, Sr. Consultants, and Directors to design and implement systems that parallel overall client business objectivesWorks under the immediate supervision of the Project Manager, and exercise independent judgment on small engagements or as a part of a team on enterprise projects Here at Bluewolf, we promote a company culture that thrives on collaboration, encourages creativity and empowers our employees to drive change. We are committed to the nurturing and development of our Pack by providing a wide variety of resources, support systems and professional development programs to fuel your success. The future is always now. Find out why your future should be with Bluewolf. Apply today to learn more!Required Technical and Professional ExpertiseRequirements for the Senior Business Analyst role are as follows:Bachelors Degree in Business or Technical programAT LEAST 2 years prior experience in a related rolePrevious experience with analysis, design, implementation and configuration of enterprise systems such as CRM, SFA, or ERPMust have prior Salesforce experienceExcellent oral and written communication skills Preferred Tech and Prof Experience  None  EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: 3M HIS Healthcare Business Analyst
Description: Position Description 3M is seeking a Healthcare Business Analyst for the Health Information Systems Division located in Atlanta, GA. At 3M, you can apply your talent in bold ways that matter. Here, you go. 3M Health Information Systems (HIS) is the world leader for innovating the language of health and delivers comprehensive software and consulting services. Working at 3M Health Information Systems you will be helping with todays challenges while preparing for tomorrows. Transforming health care from a system that treats disease, to a system that improves health and wellness begins with accurate health information and payment. From improving the efficiency of medical records coding to outlining success in value-based care and healthcare analytics. All while working with the best and the brightest to advance more than your own career, you are working to advance the entire world.  Job Summary :  Our clients are large health care systems and hospitals. We work with them to on-board and process data to improve their clinical documentation and revenue cycle processes and outcomes. The person hired for the position of Healthcare Business Analyst will work within a cross-functional team to load, process, QA & deliver clinical and financial reports to external clients. This individual will also participate in data intake discussions with external clients and assisting with data mapping. The individual hired will work with external clients, and 3M consulting, sales and development teams to identify enhance the customer's experience, improve existing processes and enhance the product offering.  This position provides an opportunity to transition from other private, public, government or military environments to a 3M career. Primary Responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:  Demonstrates high degree of proficiency with data extracts from a variety of sources Applies analytical skills to identify and interpret data trends and statistical outcomes generated from client and 3M systems Compiles reports and presentations based on analysis of client data Creates and maintains relationships with customers by understanding, anticipating, and identifying their product and service needs Determines non-routine and difficult customer inquiries; adapts differing techniques and methods to develop solutions for a variety of complex issues Identifies areas of opportunity to improve communication, the efficiency of operations, and customer satisfaction to strengthen the 3M/customer partnership Uses customer service theories and practices to provide guidance and/or training to co-workers within the same or job-related workgroup on moderately complex duties Prioritizes and executes analyses for data reporting Participates in and may lead project team meetings Participates actively in relevant corporate programs/initiatives, complies with professional and quality standards, complies with corporate policies and procedures, and acts in a manner consistent with 3M values and ethical standards. Basic Qualifications: Possess a Bachelors degree or higher (completed and verified prior to start) from an accredited institution OR a High School Diploma/GED from and accredited institution and four (4) years of healthcare experience in lieu of a Bachelor's degree education requirement Minimum of three (3) years in a provider or payor healthcare setting in a private, public, government or military environment Preferred Qualifications: Possess skills in data collection and analysis Experience with Microsoft SQL and other relational databases Demonstrate the ability to improve on these skills through career development activities Consulting experience or comparable experience that demonstrates expert skills in healthcare data analysis Demonstrated skills in technically sound oral and written communications Demonstrated medical terminology competence Proven track record in successful client relationships Proven track record in successfully dealing with high profile and/or problematic clients. Team player who can function in a totally independent role requiring minimal to no supervision

Name: Accenture Flex - Business Analyst
Description: Job descriptionAccenture Flex offers you the flexibility of fixed duration project-based work powered by Accenture, a leading global professional services company. Accenture is consistently recognized on FORTUNE’s 100 Best Companies to Work For and DiversityInc’s Top 50 Companies for Diversity lists.  As an Accenture Flex employee, you will apply your skills and experience to help drive business transformation for leading organizations and communities. In addition to delivering innovative solutions for Accenture’s clients, you will work with a highly skilled, diverse network of people across Accenture businesses who are using the latest emerging technologies to address today’s biggest business challenges. You will receive competitive rewards and access to benefits programs and world-class learning resources. Accenture is an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.  Equal Employment Opportunity  All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law. Name: Salesforce Business Analyst
Description: Telular is a technology leader in IoT solutions for the commercial telematics, security and home automation markets. Its product and service offerings have evolved from the company’s history in fixed wireless terminals to include a broad range of turnkey solutions for industrial IoT and commercial telematics applications. Today, Telular’s portfolio brands combine the power of SaaS, cloud, services, and data analytics to help customers uncover new revenue opportunities, lower operating costs, and improve productivity.  For over thirty years Telular has made smarter connections for its customers. By combining wireless technologies, purpose built devices, and SaaS commercial offerings, the company has been a disruptive force in the IoT market. A culture of innovation and a dedication to customer success has put the company in a favorable growth position based on a large and loyal customer base and an ever increasing number of applications for its solutions.  The Salesforce Business Analyst is accountable for defining the user stories and functional requirements, driving the definition of configurations that need to be completed in Salesforce and help facilitate meetings and training. This role also requires managing a Salesforce development team.  A successful candidate will be detailed oriented with communication skills that facilitate being liaison between end users, management and Salesforce developers. Assumes ownership of the Salesforce project roadmap coordinating regular meetings with management to determine goals, prioritize, and schedule regular releases using Agile methodolgiesGlean and document project requirements from end users and management then oversee project until completionDefine deliverables necessary to meet project requirements for the development teamDefine use cases and coordinate testing between end users and development teamDocument process maps and deliver training to end users and new hiresServe as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for Salesforce.comManages outsourced Salesforce.com implementation partners (consultants) as requiredEnsure development team follows a process to deploy updates, enhancements, and new system functionality using best practicesSet goals for and review Salesforce developers in accordance with the organization’s policiesHelp coach, mentor, and backup Salesforce developers when neededShares best practices with team members to enhance the quality and efficiency of customer support and contributes to the knowledge baseBachelors Degree preferred in the following field: Computer Science or Information TechnologyMinimum 5+ years’ experience with Salesforce.com development encompassing the Software Development Lifescyle (SDLC)Strong written and interpersonal skills are very importantAbility to introduce new Salesforce elements, processes, proceduresSolid understanding of sales and marketing analytics, including reporting on territory and pipeline health, forecasting, campaign effectiveness, and data quality metrics in a multi-channel environmentDeep understanding of Salesforce.com (both Sales and Service Cloud) technical requirements, system configuration, user requirements and all related policies and proceduresExperience with custom reporting, modifying pages, views and dashboardsExperience working with and supporting Enterprise Software Sales and Presales Teams If you’re looking to further your career with a company at the forefront of its industry, apply today!  Apply online: www.telular.com/#Careers

Business Analyst works on a variety of information security focused projects that enable strategic and tactical decision making ability, storytelling and risk mitigation. The Business Analyst will assist with security control activities and audits, will produce reports, and assist with security coordination and support activities. Name: Citi Retail Services – Business Analyst – Talent Track Program
Description: BUSINESS ANALYST: TALENT TRACK PROGRAMYou are ready to bring your knowledge from the classroom to the boardroom; and Citi wants to help you get there. Whether it is honing your skills or building your network, we know that success can’t come without growth. Our program equips you with the knowledge and training you need to play a valuable role on our team; and establish a rewarding career here. At Citi, we value internal mobility, and career growth is not a question of if, but when. Citi’s North America Consumer Banking (NACB) division is looking for full-time Analysts to join its Citi Retail Services Credit Cards team. Citi Retail Services (CRS) provides consumer and commercial private label credit card products, services, and retail solutions to national retailers across the U.S. servicing more than 70 million accounts. CRS is a relationship business that has established our success through key partnerships with some of the nation’s most iconic retailers: Best Buy, Brooks Brothers, Exxon/Mobil, The Home Depot, Macy’s, and Ford – just to name a few. Here at CRS, we see ourselves as more than a credit card provider to our retailers. In fact, we call them partners. We deliver deep customer and industry insights and expertise to help our partners expand their business and deepen customer relationships so that we can grow together. Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop are widely available to all.We provide you with the knowledge and skills you need to succeed.We are committed to teaching you the ropes. Our two year Analyst program starts in June 2019 with a one-week training program in Elk Grove Village, IL. (near Chicago). The program is a rotational introduction to various disciplines which includes two of the following: Marketing, Research, Program/Project Management, Digital, Relationship/Partner Management, or Decision/Financial/Risk Analysis. After a placement process based on your interests and our business needs, you will join a CRS team in Atlanta or Elk Grove Village, followed by the opportunity to rotate to another team for broader experience. People learn differently, so we’re combining formal training with hands-on experience to help you build your functional skill set, which will be of value to you as well as CRS as you continue your career. This will allow you to ramp up quickly and adapt to your role while learning the culture at Citi. You will begin your journey through the Track with a group of new hires just like you… and you’ll have plenty of opportunities to network with these peers along the way. You will gain exposure to cross functional teams while learning best practices from key leaders within the company to deliver value to the organization. These ongoing learning assignments will help develop professional, technical and interpersonal skills. You will also be paired with a mentor, someone who will help you develop professionally and advise you throughout your training. Participants will have opportunities to interact with senior leaders and executive management teams. By the end of the program, you will have gained an in-depth understanding of Citi Retail Services. Successful employees will have the opportunity to apply for full-time open positions.Your typical day will look something like this…As part of our program, you will gain experience in two of the following areas:MarketingWhether designing break-through customer messaging or the next great rewards program, our Marketing teams are at the center of everything we do. In Marketing, you’ll work with leading creative agencies to design acquisition and existing card member programs, as well as consumer insights teams to peek inside the minds of our customers. You may also work with Citi’s investment banking teams to understand where the industry is headed. Finally, you'll work with our Relationship Management teams (and often times our retail partners) to bring your ideas to fruition.Program/Project Management & Operations (Chief Operating Office)The Chief Operating Officer (COO) touches a little bit of everything. Like the glue that holds it all together, the COO supports a number of cards business initiatives, including how to manage business practices, project management, business reengineering and Operations. The team also works across Citi’s functions to manage portfolios and deliver Citi services to each of our partners.DigitalIn Digital, you'll work with cutting-edge digital agencies and internal partners (Marketing, Relationship Management, and COO) to drive the digital revolution within Citi Retail Services. You'll help build the programs and infrastructure, and execute digital campaigns to provide our customers with a secure and seamless experience, whether they engage with us via their mobile devices, tablets or desktops.Partner/Relationship ManagementYou’ll have opportunities to directly interface daily with the some of the most iconic brands in retailing as part of the Relationship Management team. This team is responsible for applying ingenuity, experience and passion to meet the challenges and opportunities for our Retail Partners on their road from ambition to achievement. A role in Relationship Management is incredibly rewarding as the team serves as a catalyst and enabler of progress in cooperation with all of the fully integrated teams across our business. Analytical Team (Decision Management, Risk, Finance)As a member of one of our analytical teams, you may have the opportunity in finance to participate in preparation and presentation of financial data and metrics analysis to enable meaningful management review and decision-making. Or you may be on a risk team where you will be responsible for developing, analyzing and executing ideas and initiatives designed to achieve business growth & loss mitigation goals. Or you may spend a rotation in decision management translating complex and large amounts of data into insights such as market trend changes, customer purchase prediction or viability of new retail store openings. What we need you to bring is…A Bachelor’s degree.A GPA of 3.0 or above.Recent college graduate with 1-3 years of work experience.An analytical mindset.Excellent project management, interpersonal and organizational skills, with the ability to drive and implement ideas in a changing environment.An extremely proactive and organized style with a track record of success in a team environment.The ability to effectively operate with flexibility in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment.The desire and ability to innovatively and creatively problem solve.

As our Corporate Staff continues to increase, we aim to use and maintain the best technology platforms to support this growth. You can have an immediate impact to over 1,700 Corporate Staff who are supported through our talent platforms. Name: Business Intelligence Reporting & Data Analyst
Description: OverviewBoys & Girls Clubs of America named "One of the Best Nonprofits to Work for in 2017" Indeed.comBoys & Girls Clubs of America is the nation's premier youth development organization. Our programs, training and services impact nearly 4 million children and teens every year. We are always looking for qualified professionals with a passion for improving young lives as a member of our national staff. We have strong values, embrace diversity and offer great benefits to allow our employees to maintain work/life balance.Under the limited direction of the National Director, the Business Intelligence Reporting and Data Analyst is responsible for building advanced reporting, analysis and data visualization tools for users of the new Club management system. They will also partner with the software vendor to convert Club data from existing system to the new system during the implementation phase of the project. The BI Reporting and Data Analyst will build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables them to identify and address critical issues that can be supported by data management tools, processes, and systems. They will work collaboratively with their team, Clubs and the software vendor to identify and implement reporting and data analysis tools that will increase the value and impact of the common Club management system. ResponsibilitiesDUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESData Conversion & Implementation• Develop and execute a strategy to migrate data from existing Club systems• Create training, tools and turnkey resources to help Clubs prepare for data migration• Partner with vendor to execute data conversions during migrations and implementations, performing extracts and loads and cleanup scripts as necessary• Support Clubs in data conversion activitiesReport Development• Design and build new reports to be included in the new Club management system • Work with Product Manager and Support teams in identifying and developing business intelligence, reporting and data analyses that are necessary for Clubs to successfully utilize the new Club management system• Develops and provides data reports and products to meet needs of multiple audiences• Train advanced users at Clubs to build reports in the systemBusiness Intelligence• Partner with software vendor to integrate data into BGCA data warehouse• Provides leadership and serves on interdepartmental cross-functional teams to ensure that data from the common Club management system is integrated into the BI tools and frameworks at BGCA• Provides guidance and independent service on highly complex, cross- functional, and enterprise business intelligence data solutions• Diagnoses problems using formal problem-solving tools and techniques from multiple angles and probes underlying issues to generate multiple potential solutions• Identifies and evaluates internal and external customers’ needs and abilities in order to provide appropriate solutionsOther• Participate on cross-functional project teams, as required• Perform other duties as assigned by the Product Manager• Demonstrate BGCA mission driven values of integrity, excellence and inclusion and integrate into work environment and ways of work• Adhere to organizational policies and procedures as described in BGCA’s Employee Handbook, Ethics Policy and elsewhere QualificationsEDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE• Bachelor’s degree required. Advanced degree(s) in related areas preferred.• Minimum of 3 years of experience in report writing and data analysisSKILLS1. Technical Skills• Solid understanding of relational databases and data best practices• Advanced skills in report development using SSRS, Crystal Reports, Exago or equivalent enterprise reporting tool• Advanced capabilities with SQL or similar analytical toolset• Experience with iMIS a plus• Able to develop the reports independently based on the business requirements• Demonstrated ability to interpret data and effectively present highly sophisticated analysis and findings• Advanced proficiency in MS Office, especially Excel2. Plans, Organizes, and Manages Time Effectively• Figures out the simplest processes necessary to get things done • Orchestrates multiple activities to accomplish a goal • Scopes out projects accurately• Breaks down projects into tasks, develops schedules, makes assignments; organizes people and activities3. Creates an Approachable Environment• Possesses a sense of humor• Is sensitive to and patient with the anxieties of others, particularly related to data • Practices attentive and active listening4. Demonstrates Intelligence and Perspective• Is bright, intelligent, sharp, capable and agile• Deals with concepts and complexity comfortably• Learns quickly when facing new problems• Is open to change; enjoys the challenge of the unfamiliar work5. Deals with Ambiguity• Shifts gears with ease• Can act without having all the information at hand• Handles risk and uncertainty6. Demonstrates Confidence and Credibility• Enjoys leading teams and projects• Sets strong but flexible standards• Takes personal responsibility7. Consults• Makes self-available for consultation to individuals/organizations• Helps the client look past surface issues to get to root causes• Offers relevant tools, information, and recommendations to cover gaps in client skills/knowledge• Offers deliverables and brings issues to closure in a timely fashion8. Designs Work Systems • Committed to continuous improvement through management by data• Is open to suggestions and experimentation• Creates a learning environment leading to efficient and effective work processes\9. Priority Setting• Spends time on what is most important• Quickly zeros in on the critical few and put the trivial aside• Can quickly sense what will help or hinder accomplishing a goal• Eliminate roadblocks and creates focus10. Customer Focus• Is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirement of customers• Gets first hand customer information and uses it for improvements in products and services• Acts with customers in mind• Establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers• Gains customers’ trust and respectENVIRONMENTAL & WORKING CONDITIONS• Normal internal office environment.• Physical requirements include sight, sitting for four plus hours a day, stooping; skills essential for successful communications include speaking and writing.

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Data Analyst  “The limit of our growth is going to be our imagination and product ideas – not technology”  – Mohit Kapoor, CIO  What we’ll bring:  •A work environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. We consistently explore new technologies and tools to be agile.  •Flexible time off, workplace flexibility, an environment that welcomes continued professional growth through support of tuition reimbursement, conferences and seminars.  •Our culture encourages our people to hone current skills and build new capabilities, while discovering their genius. Name: Operations Business Analyst
Description: Position Description:POSITION PURPOSE Identify, distinguish and analyze multiple components of a problem and then make conclusions using high-level quantitative skills to help drive projects and bring value to the Home Depot through store operations. Participate in driving operations processes for specific areas of responsibilities and complete project tasks as assigned by managers.  MAJOR TASKS, RESPONSIBILITES AND KEY ACCOUNTABILITIESUse strategic thinking to see the big picture, determine the problem and understand fundamental parts of the problemPrepare and deliver insights and recommendations based on analysis.Review sales/financial analysis (what sold/did not sell; determine which categories have potential to move upward; cost/benefit analysis; data process modeling/analysis of problems, regression analysis).Identify trends in consumer lifestyle and technology; conduct customer focus groups and analyze/synthesize findings. Scan business/industry trends;scan competitive landscape; analyze consumer dataInterpret data based on specific knowledge of statistics and procedures used. Provide data to all Directors to support decision making. Provide input on forecast based on knowledge of product and technology.Provide input on strategy based on knowledge of industry and technology trends. Provide customers with specialized information from a variety of resources. Facilitate workout problem-solving sessions with multiple groups of people.Synthesize findings and derive conclusions from analysis and make oral/written recommendations to upper management. Execute tasks related to core operations projects and/or process improvements. Execute day to day processes related to their areas of responsibility. Communicate issues and roadblocks related to their areas of responsibility.NATURE AND SCOPE Typically reports to Operations Process Manager or Business Manager  No direct responsibility for supervising others. ENVIRONMENTAL JOB REQUIREMENTSEnvironment: Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable. Travel: Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time.  ESSENTIAL SKILLS: MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Must be eighteen years of age or older.  Must be legally permitted to work in the United States. Education Required: The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a bachelor's degree program or equivalent degree in a field of study related to the job.  Years of Relevant Work Experience: 3 years Physical Requirements: Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles. Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree is preferred.  1 year of experience business, retail, and/or consulting is preferred.  Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies:Leverages Partnerships  Teamwork Adaptability  Problem Solving  Strong quantitative skills such as statistics and data analysis  Self Development  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst - Diversity & Inclusion
Description: You will work closely with our All-In, Diversity and Inclusion teams to advance the mission and contribute to the strategic goals, initiatives, and activities of the team members and key stakeholders.  You will also develop fluency in the firm's people systems and help translate the All-In team's strategic and tactical questions into rigorous analysis. You will be responsible for supporting projects that examine representation levels of women and diverse colleagues, developing a methodology for measuring and tracking inclusion across the firm, and identifying high-impact initiatives through thorough understanding of pain points and return on investment.  Additionally, you will communicate and present the results of this analysis, help translate the results, and suggest potential actions supported by the data.

Name: Principal Business Systems Analyst

We are better known as the folks who bring you CNN, HLN, TCM, TNT, tbs, Adult Swim, Cartoon Network, Turner Sports, truTV and so much more! We tell the stories the world wants to hear. Won't you be a part of our story? www.turner.com  See what it's like to work at Turner! Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Name: Business Analyst II
Description: DescriptionJOB DESCRIPTION: In conjunction with departmental customers, conducts business analysis of information systems and identifies business objectives, requirements and information management needs. Coordinates planning and implementation of systems related projects. Assists in the development of technology plans and strategies which support of departmental objectives and the overall organizational mission and objectives. Works to maintain a high level of client satisfaction with Information Services as provided to assigned clients. Attends meetings of professional, civic and services organizations. Promotes good public and professional relations. Contributes to published articles, presents public speeches, and teaches. Administers and ensures compliance to departmental policies and procedures in accordance with state, federal, and organizational guidelines. Works with manager to formulate plan for professional development. Attends educational in-services as appropriate. Participates in professional activities and organizations to maintain knowledge of current trends, practices, and developments. Identifies and develops solutions for customers' information technology needs. Monitors and analyzes the delivery of ongoing information services provided to assigned clients. Serves as a client advocate identifying and facilitating solutions for the clients' information technology needs. Manages systems projects to assure that business objectives and requirements are realized. Collects, organizes, and analyzes data and generates and provides accurate and complete reports for management and/or regulatory agencies. Interprets applicable regulations and establishes filing and auditing procedures to ensure records and files are accurate and in compliance. Works closely with clients to foster the development and successful implementation of innovative, high quality business solutions and ensure a high level of satisfaction with services provided. Performs other related duties as required. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: A bachelor's degree. Five years of experience in planning and applying information technology to one or more business functions. PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS (MediumMax 25lbs): up to 25 lbs, 0-33% of the work day (occasionally); 11-25 lbs, 34-66% of the workday (frequently); 01-10 lbs, 67-100% of the workday (constantly); Lifting 25 lbs max; Carrying of objects up to 25 lbs; Occasional to frequent standing & walking, Occasional sitting, Close eye work (computers, typing, reading, writing), Physical demands may vary depending on assigned work area and work tasks. ENVIRONMENTAL FACTORS: Factors affecting environment conditions may vary depending on the assigned work area and tasks. Environmental exposures include, but are not limited to: Blood-borne pathogen exposure Bio-hazardous waste Chemicals/gases/fumes/vapors Communicable diseases Electrical shock , Floor Surfaces, Hot/Cold Temperatures, Indoor/Outdoor conditions, Latex, Lighting, Patient care/handling injuries, Radiation , Shift work, Travel may be required. Use of personal protective equipment, including respirators, environmental conditions may vary depending on assigned work area and work tasks.

More than 5 years related business analyst experience required.3+ years of experience working in Healthcare operations or health insurance industries.Experience in Agile tools such as Atlassian products JIRA, Confluence is plus.Willingness to contribute to team successExcellent verbal and written communication skills.Demonstrates strong analytical skills, including thorough understanding of how to solicit and interpret customer business needs, model business functions, and translate them into application and operational requirements.Expert in business analysis tools and techniques, and experience in using such tools to help drive a deeper understanding of requirements.Demonstrated ability to find creative solutions and deal with ambiguity to solve complex business problems.Strong collaboration, multi-tasking, time-management and organization skillsUpholds high performance standards and a strong desire to outperform his/her peersCultivates strong interpersonal, oral and written communication skills with a consultative slantWorks cooperatively and fosters teamwork with others to maintaining positive working relationships, resolve problems and make decisions that enhance organizational effectivenessHas an understanding of ethical behavior and business practices to ensure behavior of self and others is consistent with the values and policies of BioIQPreferred SkillsProficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, Google Suite, and Salesforce Job Type: Full-time  Salary: $85,000.00 to $100,000.00 /year  Experience: Business Analyst: 3 years (Preferred) Location: Atlanta, GA (Required)

Name: Business Analyst II

Whether those consumers are activating prepaid products, paying bills, enjoying real-time discounts through a membership card, purchasing digital goods in-store or adding funds to an online account, InComm is there to provide unique gift-gifting opportunities, cater to on-the-go shoppers, deliver added value through loyalty programs and serve cash-based consumers. With 186 global patents, InComm is headquartered in Atlanta with a presence in over 30 countries in North and South America, Europe and the Asia-Pacific region. Learn more at www.incomm.com or connect with us on www.twitter.com/incomm, www.facebook.com/incomm, www.linkedin.com/company/incomm or www.incomm.com/blog. Develop, build, deploy and configure applications• Technical design and analysis of business use cases in preparation for development.• Work well in Agile or Lean Software Development Life Cycle.• Able to quickly adjust and support changing priorities per business needs.• Create documentation on the existing system and maintain documentation which includes current state of system flow, sequence diagrams, architecture diagrams, runbooks• Participate in the full lifecycle of projects, including effective use of version control, build management, unit testing, and issue tracking software• Effective verbal and written communication• Problem solving skills and the ability to work with innovative solutions• Strong analytical skills with the ability to assess complex situations and understand key issues quick!• Ability to adapt in a dynamic work environment and make independent decisions while keeping management informed• Work effectively in a team environment to produce good quality and timely results• Able to work under tight deadlines while providing high-quality work• Customer Service orientation with the ability to effectively interact with users of all levels• Able to proactively address system issues that have potential impact for the corporation• Strong research, analytical, and troubleshooting skills QualificationsBachelor's Degree in a relevant field of work or an equivalent combination of education and work related experience• At least 2-3 years of Business Analyst experience • Ability to grasp a technical understanding of a project quickly, see the big picture and drive to the project to completion.• Ability to lead large, complex development project discussions with minimal assistance.• General understanding of Financial Services products in the prepaid industry.• General understanding of the Internet, Intranet, Extranet and client/server architectures.• Possesses general understanding in the areas of application programming, database and system design.• Excellent negotiation and communication skills.• Strong communication and personal skills.• Ability to lead discussions with cross-functional teams.• Delivers engaging, informative, well-organized presentations.• Must demonstrate the ability to negotiate and/or diffuse escalating situations and ultimately become a trusted advisor to partner teams.• Communicates and follows-up continuously (face-to-face then email, email then phone, etc.).• Does not wait for information. Goes out and gets it.• Proficient with Microsoft Office applications (word, visio, powerpoint, excel, outlook, etc).• Solid planning (forward thinking), development, evaluation/analytics and recommendation skills.• Experienced in successfully managing multiple initiatives simultaneously.• Critical attention to detail.• Solutions oriented - holistic approach to problem solving and able to identify solutions to various levels of problems without compromising integrity of service; Both strategic and tactical thinker with business process mindset.• Document, share knowledge and train others.• Advanced skills in MS Office Tools (Word, Excel, Project, PowerPoint, Visio).• Ability to analyze and document complex business processes.• Ability to think analytically and should be a problem solver.• Ability to gather and interpret relevant data and information.• Must have superior verbal and written communication skills.• Experience supporting internal and external customers.• Proficiency creating business and functional requirements, visio diagrams, use cases, sequence diagrams and test cases.• Ability to effectively manage time, prioritize work, multi-task across many assignments.SDL2017

Name: SR BUSINESS ANALYST
Description: Who is Georgia-Pacific?Watch to find out! Georgia-Pacific (GP) is among the world's leading manufacturers of bath tissue, paper towels, napkins, tableware, paper-based packaging, office papers, cellulose, specialty fibers, nonwoven fabrics, building products and related chemicals. Headquartered in Atlanta, GA., we employ approximately 35,000 people.  For more information, visit www.gp.com.  To learn more about our culture, Market-Based Management (MBM®), click here:  http://www.gp.com/aboutus/MBM/index.html http://www.kochind.com/MBM  Georgia-Pacific LLC is looking for a Senior Business Analyst to join our team at our Atlanta, GA headquarters. business to develop and maintain strong working relationships, internalizing business strategies, and optimizing value capture while supporting digital transformationDefining project vision and strategyWorking with the business to develop the business case (Venture Summary) on a project initiative.Driving project deliverables by maintaining, executing, and evaluating project plansManaging Name: Senior Business Analyst

Process improvement initiative for the Product Management organization. To support the updating of Future State Process Flows/Supporting Documentation and Procedures  Work with a cross functional team to support the:  1) Assist in the updating and maintenance of project plan  2) development and maintenance of processes and procedures  3) Buildout a tool kit of questionnaires, templates, checklists etc.  4) Document workflow requirements and documentation repositories  Managing mid-size projects/large scale projects (minimum of 10 years)  Experience in financial services (preferred)  Using MS Project (at least 5)  Using MS PowerPoint (at least 5 years)  Using Excel (at least 5 years) JOB DUTIES Creating and updating process flows and procedures  Converting drafted procedures into official Procedure repository  Creating and updating RACI Charts and Risk Controls Matrices  Creating and updating Process supporting Toolkit (examples, Checklists, Questionnaires, Requirements templates etc.)  Documentation of system requirements (primarily documentation repositories and workflow tools). Set up of basic systems/configuration (additional of folders, assignment of names to roles etc.) Conducting process walkthroughs and facilitating smaller meeting sessions independently to obtain information for deliverable creations  Role involves mix of and hands-on work and coordination (leading small cross-functional team as part of a larger program)  Coordinate meetings and stakeholders, including subject matter experts and legal/compliance/risk  Document and deliver status reports and other ad hoc written deliverables  Execute standard project tracking (update relevant sections of MS Project or add additional tasks specific to work) REQUIREMENTS Strong business acumen; Works independently once guidance is given; proactive about delivering status updates and asking for guidance when needed; strong organizational skills; confidence in following up with stakeholders to obtain information, complete tasks and seek status; experience holding small working sessions to build out executions plan and approaches.  Proficient in Visio, PowerPoint, Word, Excel  Working knowledge of MS Project  Ability to conduct one -on- one interviews or small group meetings independently to gain information  Ability to draft deliverables based on guidance and input provided from meetings and working sessions  Ability to present work product in one- on-one sessions or small group meetings for review or as final product  Ability to explain complex things (processes, requirements, issues) in a way others can understand and in a way that highlights the key message  Role involves mix of and hands-on work and coordination (leading small cross-functional team as part of a larger program)  Coordinate meetings and stakeholders, including subject matter experts and legal/compliance/risk  Create procedures, process documents, and other written deliverables  Provide regular status reports and standard project tracking  Proficient in Visio, PowerPoint, Excel and working knowledge of Microsoft Project  Clear written and verbal communication  Bachelor's degree strongly preferred - don't submit candidates without this unless can't find any others  Experience with financial services product management is preferred but not required

Name: Principal Business Systems Analyst
Description: **166681BR****Posting Job Title:**Principal Business Systems Analyst**Time Warner Division:**Turner**Location:**United States \- Georgia \- Atlanta**Posting Job Description:****The Turner Story**Turner is a division of WarnerMedia along with our sister companies, HBO and Warner Bros\. We are better known as the folks who bring you CNN, HLN, TCM, TNT, tbs, Adult Swim, Cartoon Network, Turner Sports, truTV and so much more\! From cutting\-edge breaking news stories, up\-to\-the\-minute sports coverage, and the characters we grew up loving on to the shows we love today, Turner continues to be the gold standard in first class television programming and a demonstrated leader in digital content\. We tell the stories the world wants to hear\. Won?t you be a part of our story? www\.turner\.com**See what it?s like to work at Turner\!** Follow us on Instagram , Twitter and Facebook**The Job**The Principal Business Systems Analyst will be on the architect team within the TDC Data Platform team\. The job will involve supporting the Data Architects throughout the lifecycle of a data source project\. These projects may bring new data sources into the TDC or provide enhancements for existing data sources\.**The Day\-to\-Day**+ Review source data files and provide detailed analysis to include field profiles, validation of field, record and files formats, field valid values, required fields, and primary keys+ Assist Data Architect in requirements gathering+ Setup internal processing and automation systems based on architecture design specifications provided by Data Architects\.+ Provide complete testing support to include unit testing, system/integration testing, UAT and implementation support\.+ Partner with QA team to provide adequate test data\.**The Essentials**+ 3\+ years related experience with proven track record+ Experience with profiling and analysis of source data files in a variety of formats+ Ability to work in a fast paced, high pressure environment juggling multiple priorities+ Ability to make a strong first impression and build trust, rapport and lasting relationships with business stakeholders\. Excellent written and verbal communication skills\. Ability to speak \\"tech speak\\" to techies, \\"lay speak\\" to laymen, and \\"business speak\\" to business leaders\.+ Strong facilitation, questioning and listening skills to ask right questions of individuals and groups to surface essential requirements information\. Ability to listen to understand not only what people say, but what they mean, and to detect what they may be hesitant to say\. Ability to think on your feet, to go beyond planned questions and respond to whatever input you hear from the people you are interviewing+ Analytical skills, to critically evaluate the information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high\-level information into details, abstract up from low\-level information to a more general understanding, distinguish presented user requests from the underlying true needs, and distinguish solution ideas from requirements+ Demonstrated ability to exercise good judgment, prioritize multiple tasks, and problem solve under pressure of deadlines and resource constraints+ Ability to create comprehensive test cases to validate the flow of requirements to design to implementation+ Intermediate level SQL knowledge at a minimum+ Previous experience with relational databases, automated processing using custom internal systems \(we'll teach you ours\)+ Knowledge of AWS, Redshift, Snowflake, Hive/Hadoop a plus**The Perks**+ Paid time off every year to volunteer+ Access to wellbeing tools, resources, and freebies+ 2017 Best Company forWorking Mothers+ An in\-house learning and development team to help shape and grow your career+ Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands_Turner Broadcasting System, Inc\. and its subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity Employers and E\-Verify users\. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status\._**Requisition \#:**166681BR**Position Type:**Full Time**Area of Interest:**Engineering**Business Unit\_TBS:**CORPO**Industry:**Advertising, Cable/Broadcast Television Networks, Games ? Development & Publishing, Online Content/Services

Name: Business Analyst - FiveOut
Description: *Position Summary:** The primary purpose of this position is to serve as a supporting liaison between members of the technical team and the business user community to analyze business and user needs, elicit and document requirements, identify system enhancements, and determine impacts to current processes. This is a client facing, consulting role, and as such, will require up to 80% travel.*Primary Duties & Responsibilities:** + Elicits requirements, defines business requirements, use cases and user stories, and performs analysis on a solution implementation  + Implements techniques for eliciting and validating requirements including: Brainstorming, JAD Sessions, RAD Sessions, Interviews, Surveys, Nominal Group Technique, and/or Structured Walkthroughs  + Conducts functional specification review sessions with cross-functional team members  + Conducts structured walkthroughs of process flow diagrams to establish ?As-Is? and ?To-Be? states  + Ensures business requirements are met, optimal system design is achieved and differences between business requirements and systems capabilities are resolved  + Leverages business experience and analytical skills to define recommendations and process improvements through industry best practices and personal line of business knowledge.  + Identifies potential solutions and evaluates them for both technical and business suitability  + Serve as a liaison between business users and developers  + Contributes to the adoption services/efforts of an implementation project  + Develops training materials for end users *Basic Qualifications:** + Bachelor?s Degree in Systems Analysis, Information Technology, Business, or related field  + At least three (3) years? full software lifecycle development experience in a Business Analyst or similar role *Other Position Requirements:** + Demonstrated ability to work autonomously on BA-related tasks/activities to develop end-customer deliverables  + Experience with various project methodologies including Agile and Waterfall implementation approaches  + Experience with requirements management through a requirements tracking tool (e.g., Jira, SpiraTeam)  + Demonstrated ability to understand and explain both technical material & business-oriented consulting  + Demonstrated communication and presentation skills  + Demonstrated skills in establishing interpersonal relationships with all levels, including business and end-user stakeholders *Preferred Requirements:** + Experience with one or more of the following: Adobe Experience Manager, Adobe Analytics, Adobe Target, Adobe Audience Manager, Adobe Campaign, ecommerce, web, mobile & digital marketing platforms and projects  + Consulting experience  + Experience delivering projects on Cloud platforms *Data Privacy & Security:** + All Sirius employees are responsible to safeguard the information and information systems that they use or handle in the execution of their duties. Employees are obligated to know and perform their duties in accordance with Sirius policies, standards, and procedures related to security and report security violations to the appropriate Sirius authority.  + Participate at hire and annually in the Information Security Awareness training as well as other required training identified by the Human Resources department. Other data privacy and data security related regulatory training may be required based on your role or assignment. *_Essential Functions:_** _This position exists to provide consulting solutions to customers a_ _nd as such requires the ability to travel to and from customer sites and interact with customers on an ongoing and regular basis._ The above primary duties, responsibilities, and position requirements are not all inclusive.  Sirius is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. As a government contractor, Sirius takes affirmative action to employ and advance in employment qualified women, minorities, individuals with disabilities, and protected veterans; maintains a drug-free workplace; and participates in E-Verify.  Individuals who receive job offers will be required to complete pre-employment screening that includes a background check verifying name, residences, education, work experience, and criminal convictions consistent with the Fair Credit Reporting Act; and a drug test for controlled substances consistent with the Drug-Free Workplace Act and the Americans with Disabilities Act.  Sirius will not sponsor work eligibility for this position.

Name: Technical Analyst III OSP E&C Operations

This role will be the Application Administrator for various applications within the Outside Plant Center Operations team.Primary Responsibilities and Essential Functions• Serve as Application Support for multiple toolsets supporting Construction fulfillment activities.• Works with Business Analyst to interpret customer and business needs and translate them into application, system, technical and operational requirements. • Lead and create fully functional Test Scripts to support testing and training for department applications.• Provides analytical support and business/technical review for submitted UET/Remedy (Unified Event Ticketing), emails and BAU (Business as Usual) needs to ensure alignment with ongoing enhancements and changes across multiple platforms. • Attend recurring meetings and work as needed across multiple fulfillment toolsets inside Outside Plant Construction. • Engages and participates in projects/applications requirement sessions to ensure proper technical requirements are clearly documented, testable, and managed.• Will work closely with business and boundary partners (Field Operations, Customer Care, Engineering and vendors) to support application lifecycle from development through implementation. • Determines impact on existing applications & databases based on requirements. • Works directly with Development and QA teams to complete application implementations with minimal impact to customers. • Develops technical documentation, processes, installation procedures and service guides, application training information and may assist in the development of end-to-end documentation for various projects and supported products/applications. • Reviews vendor documents as appropriate including detailed functional specifications, and file and field layouts and determines if vendor solutions meet Cox requirements. • Possesses a clear understanding of the architecture standards, an understanding of the business, and a deep understanding of respective domain architectures (business, information, application, technology). • Provide support to Construction Fulfillment toolset within Construction.QualificationsMinimum: • 5 years of application support• 5 years of experience working in a technical analyst role in Technology or Engineering/Construction• Proficient in MS Word, MS Excel, MS Power Point.• Strong understanding of OSP E&C processes, programs and tools• Knowledge of Cox Construction initiatives, objectives and job types• Construction or Engineering experience a plusPreferred:• BS/BA in related discipline.About Cox CommunicationsCox Communications is committed to creating meaningful moments of human connection through broadband applications and services. Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: The Business Analyst is a champion for the business within IT. The Senior Business Analyst will be responsible for quickly and effectively gathering and communicating requirements for new solutions to meet the changing needs of the business. Superior communication and interpersonal skills, the ability to work across the organization, excellent analytical skills, initiative and the ability to lead a team of Business Analysts in a team environment are keys to this position.   Product Delivery teams work in highly collaborative Agile teams. Candidates who have experience documenting user stories, diagrams and acceptance criteria and collaborating with product, development and QA teams are preferred. The ability to work independently with little supervision is required. We seek candidates who are able to communicate effectively with business partners and technical team members and bring them to agreement.   Responsibilities · Consult with sponsors, Product Owners and team members to define and articulate the business problem and product vision, developing user stories and acceptance criteria to describe success for the story  · Elicit requirements using a variety of techniques, including gap analysis, observation, interviews and facilitating workshops.  · Provide useful models for "as-is" and "to-be" business processes, data flow paths and system interactions  · Own story card quality. Collaborate with subject matter experts, sponsors, developers and QA to reduce potential gaps in requirements.  · Create interface mock-ups, either directly or by collaboration with UX designers  · Proactively work to identify, communicate and resolve issues and risks that inhibit progress  · Communicate project status when needed and assist in resolving issues  · Take initiative and apply problem solving skills to remove blockers, reduce churn and improve team performance  · Demonstrate the ability to effectively work on large complex projects spanning the ecosystem  · Obtain and maintain a working knowledge of web applications, customers and business units. Become a subject matter expert in more than one applications.  · Mentor less experienced team members  Qualifications: · 5-8 years IT business analysis experience implementing software solutions  · Demonstrated experience facilitating requirements gather sessions, articulating user stories and driving completion  · Experience with high volume, external customer facing web applications is preferred  · The ability to understand data relationships, write and execute SQL queries is preferred  · Experience with agile development principles and values is strongly preferred

Name: Salesforce Business Analyst

Within this role, you will be held responsible for system support, configurations to the client's current Salesforce instance, as well as user administration. Name: Senior Systems Business Analyst
Description: RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce has a client in search of a Senior Systems Business Analyst in Atlanta, Georgia (GA).  Summary:  This resource will act as the liaison among internal stakeholders to manage the requirements development process through the elicitation, analysis, specification and verification of multiple levels of requirements from an end-to-end perspective and supports the ongoing management of the requirements. In addition, the job will entail working with internal applications and integrating them with enterprise applications. The Business Systems Analyst will also coordinate and manage the implementation and/or integration of products or new features for clients including client training.  Duties Include:  Reviews and analyzes Business Information Systems Writes detailed descriptions of user requirements, program functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer programs Researches and evaluates systems to meet business needs Utilizes knowledge of electronic claims and payment processing, billing, and payroll to troubleshoot and find resolution to any problems, working with the Clinical Operations, Payroll Operations and outsource vendors The candidate will also be responsible for payroll configuration within Workday for the company Key Results Expected (Essential Job Duties):  Develop functional test plans and user acceptance test plans and scenarios Coordinate functional and user acceptance testing by executing the testing strategy, scheduling resources and tracking test performance Perform data analysis to support evaluation of system defects or to develop requirements for new functionality; triage and troubleshoot complex user-reported system defects; assist in various system trouble shooting and balancing and correction efforts including analysis, verification and validation of issues and fixes Conduct impact analysis of technology changes on business processes and existing technologyREQUIREMENTS: Bachelor of Science degree or an equivalent combination of education and work experience Four years of experience in software application development processes Knowledge of commercial and government health insurance billing standards High degree of professionalism and be able to work effectively with all employees and business associates Excellent written and verbal communication skills Must be experienced in writing application user specifications Excellent organizational and time management skills Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Sr Business Analyst with scrum experience
Description: USC & GCH ONLYNo C2C TCS W2 $90- $95k  Mandatory Technical / Functional Skills  Desired: o Scrum Master or Product Owner certification o Has some experience as a product owner or has worked closely with product owners • Required: o Extensive experience working in scrum/kanban environment o Extensive experience defining agile requirements (Epics/stories) in a product/services organization o In-depth knowledge of Agile process and principles o Outstanding communication, presentation and leadership skills o Excellent organizational and time management skills o Sharp analytical and problem-solving skills o Excellent negotiation skills and ability to partner with business stakeholders to prioritize backlog as necessary o Creative thinker paired with great attention to details  Roles and responsibility  Do you have superior analytical skills, ability to build relationships with product owners and business stakeholders and partner in defining features to deliver? If youre a highly-motivated individual, with genuine interest in technology and interested in continuously delivering valuable features to our customers then join us at Delta Airlines! We are seeking a strong Agile Business Analyst, who has worked in agile/scrum/kanban environment, partnered with business stakeholders (Product Owners, Product Managers) in defining agile requirements (Epics/Stories) and enabling agile teams to deliver incrementally. Duties and responsibilities • Partner with Product Owner and ensure: Release and Sprint backlogs are always prioritized for the Scrum Team to deliver sprint to sprint. • Ensure that the team always has an adequate amount of prior prepared stories to work on • Translate Product Owner / Product Manager visions into meaningful Epics and Stories so that the scrum team can incrementally deliver. • Assist Product Owner with prioritizing stories, epics and themes to ensure work focuses on those with maximum value that are aligned with product strategy • Assist Product Owner with backlog management, iteration planning, and grooming of the user stories • Work closely with Product Owner and Product Management to create and maintain a product backlog according to business value or ROI • Ability to write necessary stories to deliver functionality, such as user interaction stories, or system integration stories or API level stories. Willingness and aptitude to identify technical requirements and translate to adequate technical stories (eg: API creation, integrations, code refactoring, etc). • Lead story grooming sessions or requirements clarifications sessions. • Partner with UX to ensure capturing UX requirements and needs into stories. • Keep abreast with Agile/Scrum best practices and new trends  7+ years as Senior BA

Name: Business Analyst - ATL
Description: DescriptionTeam Daugherty is looking to add a Business Analyst to the Atlanta team! This individual will be involved in the creation, design and build of new business models and, upon completion, integration and operation of them. Working across the spectrum of management consulting activity and industries, you will have greater opportunities to broaden your career and tackle complex stimulating challenges. This will enable you to accumulate the requisite skills and experiences to develop the functional and industry expertise needed to progress within management consulting and continue to deliver value to our clients.  As a Business Analyst you will be responsible for the following: Serving as knowledge owner for a single system or business process area.Working with a team to analyze, diagnose and resolve unpredictable and varied problems using diverse methods and tools.Advising client users on application design alternatives and business process change opportunities.Connecting user needs to emerging technologies in order to acquire or design tools, techniques and approaches that allow client users to realize optimal project delivery results.Delivering integrated business systems support to users (internal and external to IT), and applying an expert understanding of the business issues and the impact of technology.Executing and managing moderate functional testing efforts.Identifying, addressing, managing and escalating risks and issues within a project. We are looking for someone with: A 4-year college degree.2+ years related experience in a business analysis role within IT departments and management consulting organizations.Preferred depths in at least one of the following areas: systems integration, business process management, financial analysis, marketing, supply chain, retail or telecommunications.Strong SQL skills with the ability to write complex SQL statements that analyze data and create prototypes.Familiarity with several software delivery methodologies (RUP/Agile/Waterfall).Strong knowledge of requirement gathering, use case analysis and user acceptance testing.CBAP for business analysis (preferred). We offer members of Team Daugherty: Excellent health, dental and vision insurance.Revenue sharing and a 401(k) retirement savings plan.Life, disability and long-term care insurance.Little to no travel.Robust career development and training. Do you think you’re a good fit for Team Daugherty? Apply now and find out why working here satisfies the smart, the talented and the curious!
