Name: Business Analyst, Insights
Description: Analyst, InsightsCOMPANY SUMMARY: IgnitionOne offers technology and services that help marketers win. The company focuses on intelligent audience creation, real-time cross-channel scoring, and robust optimization – providing a layer for smarter marketing decisions and deeper insights, whether you use native IgnitionOne solutions such as Search, Display, Email, and Website Personalization – or the marketing technology you already have.  With a global footprint of hundreds of employees in 10 countries, IgnitionOne is one of the largest independent marketing technology companies in the world, currently scoring over 300 million users monthly in 75 countries and powering more than $60 billion in revenue each year for leading brands, including General Motors, CenturyLink , La Quinta and Acer, as well as advertising agencies such as 360i, GroupM and ZenithOptimedia.  Work in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment alongside some of the smartest thought leaders in advertising technology. Be the member of a team that delivers innovative marketing technology that simplifies marketers’ lives and drives performance to new heights. Have fun collaborating on ground-breaking, challenging assignments where your opinion matters, you grow professionally and high performers are recognized and rewarded. And join a company on the cutting edge of digital marketing and technology that is regularly honored with awards and has been featured in major news media such as WSJ, NYT, Bloomberg, AdAge, ADWEEK and more. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Accelerate delivery of Automotive, Retail, & Hospitality industry insights across all IgnitionOne channelsLead initiatives to improve existing marketing industry reports and jumpstart implementation of a commercial automotive analytics offeringFor our largest accounts, hone analytics strategy and develop insights roadmap aligned to client goalsBuild automated templates for common client deliverables in Tableau / Excel / PowerpointValidate and QA global site personalization data and play a leading role in data stewardship (i.e. “getting the data right”)Primary vertical focus in automotive industry and functional focus on website personalizationServe as a thought leader for the Automotive industry, both internally and externallyEDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS REQUIRED:3 -5 years of experience in digital analytics / digital media / marketing analyticsBachelor’s degree in business, marketing, statistics, computer science, economics, psychology, or related fieldFluent in SQL, Python, and R and data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau)Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint)Ability to translate complicated data sets and technical queries / models into actionable insights for clientsExcellent verbal and written communication skills - ability to clearly explain complex concepts and statistics in simple termsStrong attention to detail, demonstrates initiative, and facility operating independently and working collaboratively across time zones with global cross-functional teamsCore skill set in establishing priorities while working on multiple assignments, active management of expectations, and delivering against tight timelinesCritical thinker who is constantly looks for ways to improve own skillset and meaningfully contribute to the broader team / organizationIDEAL CANDIDATE:Balanced mix between technical / coding skills and business fluencyMBA, Masters, or PHD in related field a plusPassion for digital marketing, analytics, and driving actionable insightsFluency in Spark, Scala, and other Big Data tools a plusFamiliarity with range of analytic approaches (linear / non-linear regression, Bayesian, clustering, etc.) and AI / Machine Learning concepts a plusPrior experience in consulting and structured hypothesis driven approach a plusPrior experience in Mar Tech, Ad Tech and understanding of DMPs (e.g. BlueKai, etc.) / attribution models a plus

Name: Analyst Intern - Summer
Description: Duration: Ten- Twelve weeks over the course of Summer 2019  Location: Opportunities in Boston, Chicago, Stamford, New York City, Washington D.C., Philadelphia, Atlanta, Houston, Seattle, San Francisco and Los Angeles  Start Date: Flexible  Hours: 40 hours per week  Application Deadline: January 21, 2019 Organization Profile Spencer Stuart is the leading privately held, global executive search consultancy. We are the advisor of choice among top companies seeking guidance and counsel on senior leadership needs, including executive recruiting, succession planning, organizational design and corporate governance. Our clients range across industries, from the world's largest companies to medium-sized businesses, not-for-profits and entrepreneurial start-ups. We operate out of 57 offices in 30 countries. Last year alone, Spencer Stuart conducted over 4,000 assignments around the world placing top corporate executives and board members of leading Fortune 500 companies. The Spencer Stuart Internship Spencer Stuart offers analyst interns a fast-paced, intellectually engaging, entrepreneurial environment working with a diverse group of energetic professionals who are former business leaders and management consultants. Interns have a unique opportunity to gain broad exposure to a variety of industries and functions and to learn about the careers of leading executives around the world. Interns also participate in trainings designed to broaden their skill set and familiarity with executive search. Position Description Analyst interns will work on strategic projects in teams with associates and consultants. Responsibilities include: Coordinating and completing business analysis on multi-faceted business development projects;Bringing creative solutions to search assignments and new business issues.Providing research and analysis support to management and participating in special projects. Analyst interns will work simultaneously on a variety of projects that vary greatly in size and complexity. Some projects target a narrowly defined business problem, while other projects address much larger strategic needs which may result in the creation of a presentation, report, or intellectual capital piece (i.e. article). Interns will be asked to present an overview of their work to their office at the conclusion of their internship. Qualification ProfileRising seniors only.A solid academic record is required (all majors welcome)Broad extracurricular involvement and leadership experience.Strong analytical, communication and writing skills.Proficiency with MS Office applications such as Excel, PowerPoint, and Word is required.Previous experience in a research capacity (either through coursework or previous internships) is a plus. Spencer Stuart is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer F/M/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

Name: Technical Analyst III OSP E&C Operations
Description: DescriptionCox Communications is seeking an innovative Technical Analyst III for the Outside Plant Engineering and Construction organization. This position will work with the Center Operations team and will support tool administration within the Construction department. The Technical Analyst will need to understand the business/project needs & will work with other Analysts and Software Administrators to validate the requirements and user support items. The Technical Analyst collaborates with the design teams to determine application, database, & other system impacts based on the requirements. This role will be the Application Administrator for various applications within the Outside Plant Center Operations team.Primary Responsibilities and Essential Functions• Serve as Application Support for multiple toolsets supporting Construction fulfillment activities.• Works with Business Analyst to interpret customer and business needs and translate them into application, system, technical and operational requirements. • Lead and create fully functional Test Scripts to support testing and training for department applications.• Provides analytical support and business/technical review for submitted UET/Remedy (Unified Event Ticketing), emails and BAU (Business as Usual) needs to ensure alignment with ongoing enhancements and changes across multiple platforms. • Attend recurring meetings and work as needed across multiple fulfillment toolsets inside Outside Plant Construction. • Engages and participates in projects/applications requirement sessions to ensure proper technical requirements are clearly documented, testable, and managed.• Will work closely with business and boundary partners (Field Operations, Customer Care, Engineering and vendors) to support application lifecycle from development through implementation. • Determines impact on existing applications & databases based on requirements. • Works directly with Development and QA teams to complete application implementations with minimal impact to customers. • Develops technical documentation, processes, installation procedures and service guides, application training information and may assist in the development of end-to-end documentation for various projects and supported products/applications. • Reviews vendor documents as appropriate including detailed functional specifications, and file and field layouts and determines if vendor solutions meet Cox requirements. • Possesses a clear understanding of the architecture standards, an understanding of the business, and a deep understanding of respective domain architectures (business, information, application, technology). • Provide support to Construction Fulfillment toolset within Construction.QualificationsMinimum: • 5 years of application support• 5 years of experience working in a technical analyst role in Technology or Engineering/Construction• Proficient in MS Word, MS Excel, MS Power Point.• Strong understanding of OSP E&C processes, programs and tools• Knowledge of Cox Construction initiatives, objectives and job types• Construction or Engineering experience a plusPreferred:• BS/BA in related discipline.About Cox CommunicationsCox Communications is committed to creating meaningful moments of human connection through broadband applications and services. The largest private telecom company in America, we proudly serve six million homes and businesses across 18 states. We're dedicated to empowering others to build a better future and celebrate diverse products, people, suppliers, communities and the characteristics that makes each one unique. Cox Communications is the largest division of Cox Enterprises, a family-owned business founded in 1898 by Governor James M. Cox.Cox is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer - All qualified applicants/employees will receive consideration for employment without regard to that individual's age, race, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, physical or mental disability, veteran status, genetic information, ethnicity, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by law.Statement to ALL Third-Party Agencies and Similar Organizations: Cox accepts resumes only from agencies with which we formally engage their services. Please do not forward resumes to our applicant tracking system, Cox employees, Cox hiring manager, or send to any Cox facility. Cox is not responsible for any fees or charges associated with unsolicited resumes.Organization: Cox Communications, Inc.Primary Location: US-GA-Atlanta-6305 Peachtree Dunwoody RdEmployee Status: RegularJob Level: Individual ContributorShift: Day JobTravel: Yes, 5 % of the TimeSchedule: Full-timeUnposting Date: Ongoing

Name: Process Analyst/Business Process
Description: This position will be responsible for supporting medium to large projects mainly through Discovery, Requirements, and Design, in addition to other lifecycle phases. The candidate must have a strong and detailed understanding of processes needed to efficiently define and document requirements, and the ability to present information to leadership. The candidate must have experience in methodologies used to scope projects and experience working with business partners. This position must be able to work with a highly matrixed team to understand the impact of change across multiple work streams and systems. They must be able to present ideas to IT and business leadership. This position must work closely with team members to ensure proper system design, and ensure the highest quality implementations from requirements through QA to production. This position must have and be able to promote an appropriate sense of urgency in regard to deliverables, and be able to effectively partner with the business to develop and deliver point-of-sale solutions. The candidate is responsible for conducting interviews and requirement workshops to ensure that business detailed requirements are captured and documented. This position may be responsible for the translation of the business requirements into succinct clear systems requirements with defined ranges to be used by IT Development. A thorough understanding of multiple functional areas related to complex projects and the ability to identify and quantify business process improvements along with system improvements through the use of technology is critical. MAJOR TASKS, RESPONSIBILITIES AND KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES - Develop detail requirements including cost-benefit analysis for approved small to mid-sized projects and enhancements to existing projects.  Develop User Acceptance testing (UAT) and trace-ability matrix with the Business Client. Develop System Requirement Documents (SRD) and Systems External Specifications (SES) documents for the UAT and System test groups to assist with testing scenarios.  Interface with Business Stakeholders and IT Infrastructure teams to work through the start-up phase of the project including ensuring business requirements and business acceptance documents are accurately developed.  Assist with training and rollout plans for new systems or enhancements to existing systems.  Maintain a working knowledge of business unit processes, procedures and current applications. NATURE AND SCOPE - Typically reports to Manager - Service Management ESSENTIAL SKILLSMINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS - Must be eighteen years of age or older.  Must pass the Drug Test.  Must successfully complete any required training or orientation courses. EDUCATION REQUIRED - The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a high school diplomas and/or GED. YEARS OF RELEVANT WORK EXPERIENCE - 3

Name: Business Systems Analyst 3
Description: U.S. Bank is seeking a motivated Business Systems Analyst with requirements gathering and functional design experience to contribute toward the success of our technology initiatives. Partners with the business line to develop requirements. Works with the application development team to create functional designs. Participates in testing, training, and implementation of applications. Analyzes and evaluates user needs. Develops and maintains a complete and accurate understanding of how a business unit impacted by an assigned application conducts their business. Assists in developing and maintaining detailed knowledge of the business's current technology and infrastructure from a functional perspective. Assists business lines in use of new and existing capabilities of a system. Works with internal business groups to document, analyze, and redesign business processes. Partners with business representatives to identify, refine, and document detailed business needs. Joins clients and technical staff to investigate, analyze, and resolve application problems related to system functions. May be point of contact for user support and problem-solving. Occasionally manages small projects. Frequently interfaces with business lines, including management, and/or internal resources to ensure quality, timeliness, and testing of all project/release work. Works with technology and application development teams to design functional solutions that appropriately meet the business needs. Reviews, coordinates, and executes test plans for multiple projects and ensures that test cases and results meet requirements.Successful applicants will exemplify US Bank's ethical principles of uncompromising integrity, respect for others, accountability for decisions and actions, and good citizenship.**Qualifications:****Basic Qualifications**-Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience-At least 5 years experience with activities, tasks, practices and deliverables for assessing and documenting business opportunities, benefits, risks, and success factors of potential applications.**Required Skills/Experience**- 5 years SEI Trust3000 experience- 5 years SEI Trust3000 BIS experience- 5 years finance experience**Preferred Skills/Experience**Basic understanding in:-IT project management-Information managementWorking experience in:-IT environment-IT standards, procedures, policy-Business assessment-Business process modeling-Modeling: data, process, events, objects-System testing-System development life cycle-Workflow analysis-SQLExtensive experience in:-Problem Solving-Writing Skills-Communication Impact-Requirements analysis-Drive and Results Orientation-Listening-Teamwork and Collaboration-System Testing**Job:** Information Technology**Primary Location:** United States**Shift:** 1st - Daytime**Average Hours Per Week:** 40**Requisition ID:** 180039485U.S. Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse workforce.U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionCompany: Global Consumer Goods company  Location: Atlanta (Battery)  Compensation: Up to $95K plus bonus  Required Experience: 3-5 years in accounting and finance The Role: Headquartered in Atlanta, our client is a public company within the Consumer Goods industry is looking for talent to join their corporate finance team. As a Senior Financial Analyst, reporting to the FP&A Manager, you will compile and analyze financial information for the organization, perform and/or review variance analysis to provide insights/suggestions to management and executives, create and analyze monthly, quarterly, and annual reports and ensure financial information has been recorded accurately. What You Will Do:Analyze complex financial information and reports to provide accurate and timely financial recommendations to management for decision making purposesPrepares and/or reviews monthly, quarterly, and annual reports and provides analysisEvaluates trends, identifies and investigates unusual or unexpected account variancesPrepares and/or assists with consolidation and consolidated reportingMakes recommendations to resolve issues and makes corrections, as necessaryParticipates in development of functional specifications for projects and updates and ensures customizations are defined, documented, and tested, and conclusions are properly documentedEnsures general ledger accounts are maintained in accordance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP)Increases productivity by developing integrated test plans for new processes and coordinating with related partiesPromotes teamwork between operational groups and departmentsActs a mentor for junior level staff and interns Why Should You Consider this Position?  This is an excellent opportunity for someone to add real-world value to a hyper-active public company. Coming from a world of compliance, this would be a perfect transition for someone with public accounting experience that is looking to grow their skill set.  Not too many opportunities allow for a direct transition into corporate finance...especially ones in which you'd be assisting the office of the CFO in evaluating key business decisions (M&A, new business units, etc.).  And, the company has fully embraced a strong work-life balance culture. They hire smart people that get the job done without having to spend countless hours in the office. The Must Haves:Bachelor degree in Accounting and/or Finance3-5 years of related experienceCPA and/or MBA preferredPeopleSoft experience preferredStrong analytical skills Not looking for a full-time commitment?  Our interesting contract positions help professionals wanting to spend more time with family, travel the world, or start their own side business, all while making money for every hour they work. If you are available for project work and excited to increase your earning potential, apply today.  Interested in hearing about future opportunities? Click here to see your projected annual compensation and join our mailing list.

Name: Business Operations Analyst (Leader)
Description: Skills.Net Department: Department of Health And Human Services  Agency: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention  Job Announcement Number: HHS-CDC-M1-19-********  SALARY RANGE: $******.00 to $******.00/Per Year  OPEN PERIOD: 2018-11-20 to 2018-11-27 SERIES & GRADE: GS--14/14AGENCY MARKETING STATEMENT: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is the agency Americans trust with their lives. As a global leader in public health, CDC is the nation's premier health promotion, prevention, and preparedness agency. Whether we are protecting the American people from public health threats, researching emerging diseases, or mobilizing public health programs with our domestic and international partners, we rely on our employees to make a real difference in the health and well-being of people here and around the world. This position is located in the Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS), Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), Office of the Chief Operating Officer (OCOO), Human Resources Office (HRO), Operations Management Activity (OMA) in Atlanta, Georgia. CDC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. DUTIES: As a Business Operations Analyst (Leader) you will: Plan and manage program budgets Use a broad array of analytical techniques to assess operational data to support the foundation and basis for senior leader decisions. Conduct complex multi-functional studies, reviews, and analysis in order to develop, analyze, and prepare detailed reports on the comparative utility and effectiveness of business operations; Plans and designs research methods for the collection and analysis of data and information critical to the conduct of studies throughout HRO's organizational structures. Lead a team in: identifying, distributing and balancing workload and tasks among employees in accordance with established work flow, skill level and/or occupational specialization. Participate on situation specific workgroups to develop and implement strategies to respond to and resolve business issues, influence attitudes and perceptions, and support and promote business operations throughout OMA and HRO in a positive manner. REQUIREMENTS: US Citizenship is required. Background Investigation is required. E-Verify: If you are selected for this position, the documentation that you present for purposes of completing the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Form I-9 will be verified through the DHS 'E-Verify' System. Federal law requires DHS to use the E-Verify System to verify employment eligibility of all new hires, and as a condition of continued employment obligates the new hire to take affirmative steps to resolve any discrepancies identified by the system. The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services is an E-Verify Participant. Direct Deposit: All Federal employees are required to have Federal salary payments made by direct deposit to a financial institution of their choosing. One-year probationary period may be required. Travel, transportation, and moving expenses will be paid: No Bargaining Unit Position: No Drug Screening Required: No Recruitment Incentive may be authorized: No Annual Leave for non-federal service may be authorized: No Research position: No Promotion potential: No Supervisory position: No Time in grade (TIG) must be met within 30 days of the closing date of the announcement. All qualification requirements must be met by the closing date of the announcement. QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED: Minimum Qualifications: Applicants must have one year of specialized experience at or equivalent to the GS-13 grade level of in the Federal service as defined in the next paragraph. Specialized experience is experience which is directly related to the position which has equipped the applicant with the particular knowledge, skills and abilities (KSAs) to successfully perform the duties of the position to include experience to analyzing and evaluating administrative aspects of mission-oriented programs to identify and develop problem resolution; conducting administrative studies and making recommendations. Documenting experience: In accordance with Office of Personnel Management policy, federal employees are assumed to have gained experience by performing duties and responsibilities appropriate for their official series and grade level as described in their position description. Experience that would not normally be part of the employee's position is creditable, however, when documented by satisfactory evidence, such as a signed memorandum from the employee's supervisor or an SF-50 or SF-52 documenting an official detail or other official assignment. The documentation must indicate whether the duties were performed full time or, if part time, the percentage of times the other duties were performed. It is expected that this documentation is included in the employee's official personnel record. In order to receive credit for experience in your resume that is not within the official series and grade level of your official position, you must provide a copy of the appropriate documentation of such experience as indicated above. HOW YOU WILL BE EVALUATED: Once the application process is complete, a review of the resume and supporting documentation will be made and compared against your responses to the assessment questionnaire to determine if you are qualified for this job. If, after reviewing your resume and/or supporting documentation, a determination is made that you have inflated your qualifications and/or experience, you may lose consideration for this position. Please follow all instructions carefully. Errors or omissions may affect your eligibility. Name: Senior Business Analyst - VP
Description: This position supports State Street Global Services, Alternative Investment Solutions (AIS) business. This position will provide the candidate exposure across multiple applications on the Global Real Estate Platform (GREP). A core responsibility will be assisting end users on day-to-day system issues and on-boarding new clients on the Global Real Estate Platform (GREP). You will have the opportunity to assist and implement ideas that streamline processes and enhance controls, and diagnose, design, test and implement solutions for smaller projects or aspects of large, complex projects. We are looking for someone that will foster a deep partnership and highly productive consultative relationship between IT and internal clients, leading a portfolio of IT projects and services, with a focus on Real Estate business processes.You will provide structure and leadership to process improvement projects as well as expertise in developing new or improved workflows. You have strong verbal and written communications skills and demonstrated success leading multi-functional project teams. You are responsible for understanding the Real Estate business and translating business needs into technical solutions, leading the delivery of services and projects, and ensuring success. You will also play a key role in assessing and supporting support and maintenance, troubleshooting and implementing practices recommendations relating to key Real Estate Fund Allocation systems using Oracle Financial, and Microsoft Dynamics. We focus on high-impact projects that improve our most important metrics or fundamentally change the way we operate. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Development Manager of Global Real Estate Platform.Responsibilities:You will maintain the relationship between Fund Management and IT to ensure projects are delivered on time and within budget while maintaining the critical business systems that drive global Real Estate operations.You will function as a Scrum Master and partner to model, design, and build business solutions that improve State Street’ Real Estate processes.You will collaborates with Fund Controllers to define requirements and lead projects from inception through delivery, including status updates, scope changes, etc.You will respond to issues and incidents and provide day-to-day administration and support of Fund Accounting System, Investor Correspondence, Real Estate Ledger and Sub-Ledgers in MS Dynamics and Oracle FinancialYou will actively identify issues or opportunities areas and proposes process, data, or systematic solutions.You will partner with business leadership, and internal/external development resources to ensure timely, accurate and cost-effective delivery of IT solutions.You will collaborate with offshore application development teams to validate test results for new solutions verifying that they meet the requirements of the business group.You will develop, maintain and document current and new system process flows.Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in the field of computer science or information systems10+ experience in Real Estate IT analysis, design and implementation of complex Fund Accounting Systems, and ERP solutions, with hands-on experience on Oracle E-Business Suite and MS Dynamics Fund Ledger Management experience.5+ years of technical experience and project management in a fast-growing, technology organization.You have deep understanding of Real Estate business processes (Drawdown/Capital Call, Distribution, Preferred Return, Net Income Analyses)Strong problem solving and analytical/critical thinking skills needed, as well as exceptional interpersonal skillsSelf-driven and should be able to troubleshoot and provide quick resolutions to server related issues.Strong working knowledge of relational database structure, theories, principles and practices (Sybase; DB2; SQL Server)Full project management and development life cycle experience (Agile Methodology)You are an excellent communicator with exceptional active listening skills, with ability to convey complex ideas in a clear, concise fashion to technical and non-technical audiences.You will obsess over performance, user experience and efficiency.

Name: BIO Business Solutions Analyst
Description: Req ID: W456798 Job Description Responsible for supporting creation of reporting deliverables by performing analysis and interpretation of business information from the Business Intelligence report output provided by the Reporting team. Recommends business actions to business leaders based on interpreted findings of the analyzed business reports. Also executes data and report validations to support ongoing quality assurance processes. Develops business requirements for new reporting capabilities.  Supports execution of standard and ad hoc reporting capabilities within general guideline by conducting detailed and some in-depth portfolio analysis, and summarizing portfolio performance and trends. Covers a medium amount of business analysis and responds to changes to solve business problems with medium to high complexity. Develops and documents complex business requirements for new reporting capabilities, and conducts the pertinent user acceptance testing. Contributes to small to medium-sized Business Solutions projects based on complexity of assigned LOB/Function(s). Name: Sr Operations Business Analyst, Common Area Maintenance
Description: Position Description: POSITION PURPOSE:Senior Operations Business Analysts are responsible for leading small to medium subsets of larger strategic initiatives and individual processes to help transform and drive the next evolution of Building Services at The Home Depot. They must possess a high level of analytical ability to distinguish multiple components of a problem and develop conclusions using quantitative skills. Key responsibilities include but are not limited to development and execution of strategic initiatives across multiple teams, capital and expense P&L management, development and implementation of capital replacement programs to help mitigate expense pressure, reviewing and understanding sales / financial data, identifying trends in business and the retail industry, and development and execution of key process improvement initiatives. A successful Senior Operations Business Analyst will possess and demonstrate strong leadership skills, analytical abilities to drive intelligent business decisions, and communication.MAJOR TASKS, RESPONSIBILITES AND KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:Lead Project Teams of Analysts and other associates Perform data gathering tasks, synthesis - develop solutions, project/strategy planning and data utilization Produce documents for teams and leadership to review and utilize. Deliver presentations to teams and executive leaders and sponsors Build skills and knowledge including self-development, team knowledge and customer (internal) knowledge. Deliver presentations to teams and executive leaders and sponsors.NATURE AND SCOPE:Typically reports to Store Operations Process Manager or Store Operations Business Manager (or Sr. Managers) No associates report to this role on a permanent basis, but requires the leadership of a work group: assign and review work, train and contribute to performance appraisal (but not hiring, firing or disciplinary action).ENVIRONMENTAL JOB REQUIREMENTS:Environment: Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.Travel: Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time. ESSENTIAL SKILLS: MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:Must be eighteen years of age or older.Must be legally permitted to work in the United States.Education Required:The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a bachelor's degree program or equivalent degree in a field of study related to the job.Years of Relevant Work Experience: 3 yearsPhysical Requirements:Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles.Preferred Qualifications:Strong interpersonal and group communication. Ability to communicate effectively in a variety of settings (One on one, small and large groups, or among diverse styles and position levels).Experienced in working cooperatively with others across organization to meet shared objectives. Comfortable with soliciting input at multiple levels to drive these objectives. Acts with diplomacy and tact. Fosters diversity of thought.Good understanding of meaning and implications of key financial indicators; leverages financial analysis to generate, evaluate, and act on strategic opportunities.Strong decision-making skills, even in the absence of complete information. Relies heavily on data analytics, observations, and good judgement to provide long-term recommendations to team.Self-starter, self-motivated. Maintains a positive attitude and forward-thinking approach despite troubling circumstances or setbacks.Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies:Experience leading high performing teams Consulting management and/or project management. Strong quantitative skills such as statistics and data analysis Problem solving Strong Operations, Retail and/or field knowledge We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Name: Informatics (LOINC/SNOMED) Business Analyst.
Description: SUMMARY OF RESPONSIBILITIES This position reports to the Laboratory Director of Clinical Microbiology and Chemistry & Hematology. In collaboration with the Project Manager, the Business Analyst will oversee support of production, development and test environments to include day-to-day monitoring and maintenance, problem investigation and resolution, back creation and maintenance, SQL and Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS) optimization and tuning. In addition, the Business Analyst leads effort to research, analyze and recommend resolutions, upgrades and new technologies surrounding all aspects of LIMS.COMPETENCIES Skills/Experience/Training-Proficient with:-The terminology of Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes (LOINC) and Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine - Clinical Terms (SNOMED CT) to enable exchange of health information across different systems.-Health Level - 7 (HL7) for transfer of clinical data between multiple applications in various environments and platforms.-Knowledge and experience with laboratory information systems (LIS) ability to store, manage, and send laboratory test orders to lab instruments, tracking of those orders, recording results, and querying the database.-Ad-hoc reporting by means of utilizing SQL.-Anticipate and identify issues and develop recommendations and courses of action which are consistent with Business objectives and functional requirements.-Present technical and laboratory information to a non-technical and/or laboratory audience, and an ability to understand and interpret Business requirements.-Develop and deliver functional/system specifications and be familiar with user-training documents.-The BA may be asked to coordinate application testing, including the maintaining of test scripts and conducting UAT (sessions, to ensure successful deployment)-Developing experience of Use Cases for implementation of Application.Preferred Qualifications-Minimum Required: Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or Health Informatics.-Identifies laboratory workflows and process issues and concerns, and provides leadership and guidance to define process requirements that optimize performance and technology utilization by laboratory personnel.-Experience in Public Sector or Health Related Industry.-Newborn screening experience with heel stick blood (specimen) collections, testing policies, procedures, and outcomes.-Excellent analytical skills with ability to create relevant reports for a variety of stakeholders.-Strong negotiation skills to reach agreement on realistic requirements scope and schedule that align to the Business's priorities.-Confident communicator, with advanced written and oral communications skills.-Able to interact with multiple vendors on technology solutions and complete fit/gap analysis.-Ability to set priorities.-Demonstrated ability in documenting functional specifications.

Name: Business Analyst - eBusiness Strategy
Description: Summary of Position: Delta Community is one of the largest and fastest growing credit unions in Georgia. Our rapid growth has created additional career opportunities within the organization. We are looking for energetic, flexible, and service oriented individuals for the following position.  As a subject matter expert, the Business Analyst serves as a management consultant and trusted advisor for the business to drive change, implement process improvements and deliver value for the organization. The business analyst will accomplish this by managing new and existing requirements on products, services and processes at an enterprise, departmental and operational level.  Practices safety-conscious behaviors in all operational processes and procedures. Essential Functions/Responsibilities of Position:Enterprise Initiatives: · Plan and implement operations strategy to deliver sustainable solutions  · Pilot the onboarding of new products/services and research industry trends for upcoming  opportunities  · Diagnose and resolve complex system issues while assessing and mitigating risks  · Interpret and present data findings to various levels of leadership Departmental Initiatives: · Perform User Acceptance Testing (UAT) for system releases, defects and upgrades  · Design model processes and workflow maps by applying Microsoft Visio  · Gather and execute requirements to streamline and improve new and existing processes  · Identify bugs and recommend system improvement opportunities Operational Initiatives: · Develop and maintain reports based on use cases and stakeholder requirements  · Identify system problems, conduct research and consult with end users to provide ideal  resolution  · Create and implement technical procedures for end user training and corporate knowledge  base (KB) submission  · Promote the delivery of high quality service through effective collaboration and  communication Other · This description reflects managements assignment of essential functions; it does not  prescribe or restrict the tasks that may be assigned.  · This job description is subject to change at any time. Basic/Ideal or Required Minimum Qualifications: · Bachelors degree in business or related discipline.  · Must have strong problem solving, analytical, organizational, and decision making skills.  · Must be able to demonstrate excellent written and verbal communication skills.  · Candidate must be capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously.  · Complies with all Credit Union policies and procedures including those related to Bank  Secrecy Act regulations. Preferred Qualifications: · 5+ years of experience in operations analysis.  · Masters degree  · Experience in gathering business requirements and strong documentation skills.  · Experience should include working with the Project Management, Development,  Implementation and Support teams.  · Should be able to demonstrate a working knowledge of Personal and Commercial Deposit  Account knowledge.  · Candidate should possess the knowledge of credit union systems, policies, and procedures  · Overall knowledge of credit union industry, Symitar software, Delta Community  Credit Union procedures and policies  Job Type: Full-time  Experience: in gathering business requirements: 2 years (Preferred)Project Management, Development, Implementation and Support: 2 years (Preferred)business or operations analysis: 5 years (Preferred)Personal and Commercial Deposit Account: 2 years (Preferred) Education: Bachelor's (Required) Work authorization: United States (Required)

Name: Business Analyst/Strategy Contractor
Description: At Dragon Army, our team is the most important part of our company. Our values are what help us make sure we bring in the right team members. They are: Team First, Think Positively, Celebrate Diversity, Do Good, and Have Fun. If this sounds like your kind of company, keep reading. Were a mobile and innovation company. We strive to build remarkable mobile products and experiences for Fortune 1000 companies. Were looking for an incredible Business Analyst Contractor to join our growing team. Our growing firm employs approximately 40 individuals, and the successful candidate will be responsible for performing detailed requirements analysis, documenting processes, and assisting clients with strategy and roadmap definition. To succeed in this role you should be analytical yet still be able to explain difficult concepts to non-technical users.ResponsibilitiesGathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports.Facilitating workshops, on-site visits, customer and client interviews to elicit project requirements.Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and documenting project needs.Leading ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies.Eliciting and documenting detailed functional requirements.Writing user stories and tasks suitable for development and QA to understand what they need to accomplish.Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management.Working closely with clients, technicians, and managerial staff.Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements.Performing user acceptance testing.Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements.Managing competing resources and priorities.Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects.Required Skills & Experience Bachelors degree in Business or related field required.1-2 years of experience in related role or field.Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills.The ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions.Advanced technical skills.Excellent documentation skills.Fundamental analytical and conceptual thinking skills.Experience creating detailed reports.Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook.A track record of following through on commitments.Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.

Name: Senior IT Business Analyst
Description: PRGX, Inc is the Global leader in Accounts Payable Recovery Audit, with industry leading positions in Supplier Information Management and Source 2 Pay Analytics. Fortune 1000 companies rely on PRGX, Inc. to reduce the time and cost spent managing suppliers, driving ongoing compliance with regulations, and automatically creating an enterprise-wide, real-time single source-of-truth for supplier data. PRGX, Inc. is publicly held and headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia. Job Description: We are looking for a software application Business Analyst to help manage the evolution of our internally and externally-facing business applications. Candidates must have direct experience in designing SaaS products. This role will include business analysis, requirements gathering, and documentation from all business stakeholders including internal and external clients. PRGX employs an agile methodology between stakeholders, the software engineering teams, and our UI/UX designers to deliver solution specifications accurately and efficiently. This role has key responsibility for documenting PRGX Inc.’s newest solutions related to Recovery Audit, Supplier Collaboration, and Source-to-Pay Analytics. This job is for requires an experienced business analyst who thrives in a fast paced, collaborative, start-up environment. Responsibilities: · Work with the Product Manager and project stakeholders to understand requirements translating business needs into user stories that can be understood by the software engineers  · Recognize and predict use cases to help design intuitive applications  · Developing user stories and breaking down requirements into deliverable functionality  · Analyze application/business domain data requirements and business rules, understanding the data flow from source to screen Lead review of features/development that has been completed during the Sprint Reviews of software produced during the sprint to ensure the requirements were interpreted correctly · Ensure the product backlog to align with the product vision and priorities Assist in the troubleshooting of production related customer issuesReview and assist with the generation of product documentation, release notes, and customer education deliverablesRepresent PRGX Inc. as a domain and product expert at customer interactions, industry and corporate eventsSKILLS & EXPERIENCE FOR THIS ROLE · Bachelor’s degree required  · 3-5 years of experience as a BA for a SaaS company  · Able to take feedback constructively and iterate on ideas and solutions from multiple stakeholders with differing opinions  · Meticulous thinker who can effectively work out all the details when presented with big ideas  · Understanding of user-personas and user-centric application design  · Excellent written communication skills  · Ability to communicate effectively with all stakeholders (e.g., technical developers, business leaders, and users)

Name: Data Analyst

Capture information, assess it and make recommendations to Company management (e.g., senior technical management) or give the KO system information about emerging business opportunities, technology capabilities or scientific breakthroughs to offer solutions to technical problems and/or affect the Company's strategic direction.Automate Routine Business Processes.Understand needs of the Business related to a particular process and apply readily available technology to semi-automate or automate the process reducing manual effort and improving the capture of data for analytics.Gather/Org Info to Support Senior Mgmt. Decision. Gather and organize information to support senior management's decision-making during a crisis situation.Performance Data Audit to Ensure Accuracy. Search external and/or internal computerized databases in response to inquiries from scientists or to provide information to management or the field.Apply Basic Statistical Tests/Methods. Welcomes failure as a learning opportunity.SMART RISK: Makes bold decisions/recommendations.EXTERNALLY FOCUSED: Understands the upstream and downstream implications of his/her work. Tracks and shares external trends, best practices or ideas.PERFORMANCE DRIVEN AND ACCOUNTABLE: Has high performance standards. Outperforms her/his peers.FAST/AGILE: Removes barriers to move faster. Experiments and adapts. Thrives under pressure and fast pace.EMPOWERED: Brings solutions instead of problems. Challenges the status quo. Has the courage to take an unpopular stance. Name: Business Analyst - eBusiness Strategy
Description: Summary of Position: Delta Community is one of the largest and fastest growing credit unions in Georgia. Our rapid growth has created additional career opportunities within the organization. We are looking for energetic, flexible, and service oriented individuals for the following position.  As a subject matter expert, the Business Analyst serves as a management consultant and trusted advisor for the business to drive change, implement process improvements and deliver value for the organization. The business analyst will accomplish this by managing new and existing requirements on products, services and processes at an enterprise, departmental and operational level.  Practices safety-conscious behaviors in all operational processes and procedures. Essential Functions/Responsibilities of Position:Enterprise Initiatives: · Plan and implement operations strategy to deliver sustainable solutions  · Pilot the onboarding of new products/services and research industry trends for upcoming  opportunities  · Diagnose and resolve complex system issues while assessing and mitigating risks  · Interpret and present data findings to various levels of leadership Departmental Initiatives: · Perform User Acceptance Testing (UAT) for system releases, defects and upgrades  · Design model processes and workflow maps by applying Microsoft Visio  · Gather and execute requirements to streamline and improve new and existing processes  · Identify bugs and recommend system improvement opportunities Operational Initiatives: · Develop and maintain reports based on use cases and stakeholder requirements  · Identify system problems, conduct research and consult with end users to provide ideal  resolution  · Create and implement technical procedures for end user training and corporate knowledge  base (KB) submission  · Promote the delivery of high quality service through effective collaboration and  communication Other · This description reflects managements assignment of essential functions; it does not  prescribe or restrict the tasks that may be assigned.  · This job description is subject to change at any time. Basic/Ideal or Required Minimum Qualifications: · Bachelors degree in business or related discipline.  · Must have strong problem solving, analytical, organizational, and decision making skills.  · Must be able to demonstrate excellent written and verbal communication skills.  · Candidate must be capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously.  · Complies with all Credit Union policies and procedures including those related to Bank  Secrecy Act regulations. Preferred Qualifications: · 5+ years of experience in operations analysis.  · Masters degree  · Experience in gathering business requirements and strong documentation skills.  · Experience should include working with the Project Management, Development,  Implementation and Support teams.  · Should be able to demonstrate a working knowledge of Personal and Commercial Deposit  Account knowledge.  · Candidate should possess the knowledge of credit union systems, policies, and procedures  · Overall knowledge of credit union industry, Symitar software, Delta Community  Credit Union procedures and policies  Job Type: Full-time  Experience: in gathering business requirements: 2 years (Preferred)Project Management, Development, Implementation and Support: 2 years (Preferred)business or operations analysis: 5 years (Preferred)Personal and Commercial Deposit Account: 2 years (Preferred) Education: Bachelor's (Required) Work authorization: United States (Required)

Name: Product Analyst
Description: At Pandora, we're a unique collection of engineers, musicians, designers, marketers, and world-class sellers with a common goal: to enrich lives by delivering effortless personalized music enjoyment and discovery. People—the listeners, the artists, and our employees—are at the center of our mission and everything we do. Actually, employees at Pandora are a lot like the service itself: bright, eclectic, and innovative. Collaboration is the foundation of our workforce, and we’re looking for smart individuals who are self-motivated and passionate to join us. Be a part of the engine that creates the soundtrack to life. Discover your future at Pandora! Job Description Pandora is seeking a talented, experienced Product Analyst to join the growing Product Management team in Atlanta, GA. We’re looking for someone interested in ad products, analytics, and using insights to help innovate our ad product offering. This analyst will partner with ad product managers, designers, engineers, data scientists and sales teams to provide product usage and trend insights. Responsibilities:Analyze advertising interactions to optimize listener experienceProvide key business insights that drive decision making based on trends (large focus on ad products)Manage analytics lifecycle for ad products from concept to deliveryVisualize key metrics on an ongoing basis to communicate out to product, sales, and exec teamsImplement, manage, and reconcile internal and 3rd party metrics to drive product decisionsCollaborate with cross functional groups including Product, Business Development, Engineering and Sales to identify key product opportunitiesDevelop quantitative analysis, ad hoc reports, models, and A/B tests to support advertising decisionsConduct ad hoc analysis to provide guidance to engineering around bugs and issuesRequirements:Education: BA/BS in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field2-4 years post-collegiate work experience in a quantitative field or equivalent educational experiencePrevious product analytics experience in digital advertising preferredStrong analytical skills and ability to clearly synthesize large dataset into key insightsExperience working with relational databases and SQL query languagesFamiliarity with no-SQL architectures, R, or Python is a plusExcellent time management and attention to detailComfortable in fast-paced and changing environmentExcellent written and communication skills

Name: Sr. Analyst, Restaurant Financial Systems

In this role, you will be responsible for working with Restaurant Operators, cross-functional staff teams and external vendors to design and implement system solutions that meet the project goals. Name: Informatics (LOINC/SNOMED) Business Analyst.

exchange of health information across different systems.-Health Level - 7 (HL7) for transfer of clinical data between multiple applications in various environments and platforms.-Knowledge and experience with laboratory information systems (LIS) ability to store, manage, and send laboratory test orders to lab instruments, tracking of those orders, recording results, and querying the database.-Ad-hoc reporting by means of utilizing SQL.-Anticipate and identify issues and develop recommendations and courses of action which are consistent with Business objectives and functional requirements.-Present technical and laboratory information to a non-technical and/or laboratory audience, and an ability to understand and interpret Business requirements.-Develop and deliver functional/system specifications and be familiar with user-training documents.-The BA may be asked to coordinate application testing, including the maintaining of test scripts and conducting UAT (sessions, to ensure successful deployment)-Developing experience of Use Cases for implementation of Application.Preferred Qualifications-Minimum Required: Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or Health Informatics.-Identifies laboratory workflows and process issues and concerns, and provides leadership and guidance to define process requirements that optimize performance and technology utilization by laboratory personnel.-Experience in Public Sector or Health Related Industry.-Newborn screening experience with heel stick blood (specimen) collections, testing policies, procedures, and outcomes.-Excellent analytical skills with ability to create relevant reports for a variety of stakeholders.-Strong negotiation skills to reach agreement on realistic requirements scope and schedule that align to the Business's priorities.-Confident communicator, with advanced written and oral communications skills.-Able to interact with multiple vendors on technology solutions and complete fit/gap analysis.-Ability to set priorities.-Demonstrated ability in documenting functional specifications.

Name: Financial Analyst for Cloud Consultancy
Description: Contino – Financial Analyst  Contino is a driving force in the future of DevOps, Cloud and Container based consultancy services. We've been working long and hard in helping household names in enterprise and technology streamline their processes, reducing cost and increasing efficiency; essentially creating an ultimate technology environment.  Contino is looking for a Financial Analyst in Atlanta, GA to help design and deliver ongoing financial reports, dashboards, and analyses. This role requires a self-starter who is ready to apply prior financial experience to enhance current reporting and participate in creating new strategies. We are looking for someone with an entrepreneurial spirit interested in advancing your career in a fun and exciting environment.  Key responsibilities include: Working directly with Contino's VP of Finance providing proactive insights and recommendations to optimize the North American business performance.Help build, deliver and maintain financial reports, analyses, and forecasts for Contino leadership.Build models and provide in-depth analysis on financial performance of delivery projects.Work with sales, delivery and resource management teams to understand changes in project and staffing plans to provide accurate forecast reporting.Additional responsibilities may include assisting with month-end close, regulatory compliance, annual budgeting process, A/R and A/P related tasks, and other ad-hoc business support.RequirementsFinancial Analyst experience in a consulting environment is of primary importance. At least 2 years of relevant experience is required.Excellent knowledge of consultant project utilization, cost and profitability margins, revenue projections and success measures.BS/BA degree. A degree in business/finance/accounting preferred.Experience performing financial analysis related to consulting.Advanced knowledge with Excel Spreadsheets and formulas and/or Google Sheets preferred.An understanding of accounting principles.Strong interpersonal skills, including written and oral communication.Ability to work and communicate effectively with other departments and Contino leadership.Ability to work independently in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment.Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and prioritize effectively to meet deadlinesBenefitsTime Off: 15 vacation days per year & 10 paid holidays; up to 5 days can rollover per year. There isn’t a limit on sick days right now, take them as needed.Benefits Eligibility: You are eligible to participate in our health, 401k, and life/long-term/short-term disability benefits the 1st of the month following your start date.Healthcare: United Healthcare is our provider for medical, vision, and dental. The plan is a national plan with a deductible and copays for in-network care. We currently pay 100% of your monthly premiums for your whole family. We cannot guarantee this will continue in the future as health care costs are unpredictable and outside of our control. It is true for the current plan year (8/1/2018 - 7/31/2019). Domestic partners are permitted to join the plan.Flex Spending & Dependent Care: You may elect to participate in our Flex Spending and/or Dependent Care programs. These allow you to use pre-tax dollars to pay for eligible medical and child care expenses.401(K): We offer a 401k plan through Principal Financial. There is a company match.Life, Long-term, & Short-term Disability: Contino covers the monthly premiums for this benefit.Commuter Benefits: Your pre-tax dollars toward commuting (train, bus, ferry, parking).Maternity & Paternity Leave: We offer 12 weeks for maternity leave and 2 weeks for paternity leave.Learning & Development: You receive $3,000 per year to use toward classes, seminars, certifications and more! Your first year your budget is pro-rated to your start date.Technology Budget: You receive $1,500 to $1,800 to purchase a laptop and related accessories.Cell Phone Bill Allowance: Each month, you receive $75 to use toward your cell phone bill.Expedited Travel Program: Reimbursement for a expedited travel security program (ex: Clear, TSA Precheck, Global Entry).Race Entrance Fee: Reimbursement for the entrance fee to a race (Ex: 5ks, tough mudder).Monthly Flower Delivery: Flowers delivered to your home each month.

Name: Process Analyst/Business Process
Description: This position will be responsible for supporting medium to large projects mainly through Discovery, Requirements, and Design, in addition to other lifecycle phases. The candidate must have a strong and detailed understanding of processes needed to efficiently define and document requirements, and the ability to present information to leadership. The candidate must have experience in methodologies used to scope projects and experience working with business partners. This position must be able to work with a highly matrixed team to understand the impact of change across multiple work streams and systems. They must be able to present ideas to IT and business leadership. This position must work closely with team members to ensure proper system design, and ensure the highest quality implementations from requirements through QA to production. This position must have and be able to promote an appropriate sense of urgency in regard to deliverables, and be able to effectively partner with the business to develop and deliver point-of-sale solutions. The candidate is responsible for conducting interviews and requirement workshops to ensure that business detailed requirements are captured and documented. This position may be responsible for the translation of the business requirements into succinct clear systems requirements with defined ranges to be used by IT Development. A thorough understanding of multiple functional areas related to complex projects and the ability to identify and quantify business process improvements along with system improvements through the use of technology is critical. MAJOR TASKS, RESPONSIBILITIES AND KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES - Develop detail requirements including cost-benefit analysis for approved small to mid-sized projects and enhancements to existing projects.  Develop User Acceptance testing (UAT) and trace-ability matrix with the Business Client. Develop System Requirement Documents (SRD) and Systems External Specifications (SES) documents for the UAT and System test groups to assist with testing scenarios.  Interface with Business Stakeholders and IT Infrastructure teams to work through the start-up phase of the project including ensuring business requirements and business acceptance documents are accurately developed.  Assist with training and rollout plans for new systems or enhancements to existing systems.  Maintain a working knowledge of business unit processes, procedures and current applications. NATURE AND SCOPE - Typically reports to Manager - Service Management ESSENTIAL SKILLSMINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS - Must be eighteen years of age or older.  Must pass the Drug Test.  Must successfully complete any required training or orientation courses. EDUCATION REQUIRED - The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a high school diplomas and/or GED. YEARS OF RELEVANT WORK EXPERIENCE - 3

Name: Senior Business Analyst - VP
Description: This position supports State Street Global Services, Alternative Investment Solutions (AIS) business. This position will provide the candidate exposure across multiple applications on the Global Real Estate Platform (GREP). A core responsibility will be assisting end users on day-to-day system issues and on-boarding new clients on the Global Real Estate Platform (GREP). You will have the opportunity to assist and implement ideas that streamline processes and enhance controls, and diagnose, design, test and implement solutions for smaller projects or aspects of large, complex projects. We are looking for someone that will foster a deep partnership and highly productive consultative relationship between IT and internal clients, leading a portfolio of IT projects and services, with a focus on Real Estate business processes.You will provide structure and leadership to process improvement projects as well as expertise in developing new or improved workflows. You have strong verbal and written communications skills and demonstrated success leading multi-functional project teams. You are responsible for understanding the Real Estate business and translating business needs into technical solutions, leading the delivery of services and projects, and ensuring success. You will also play a key role in assessing and supporting support and maintenance, troubleshooting and implementing practices recommendations relating to key Real Estate Fund Allocation systems using Oracle Financial, and Microsoft Dynamics. We focus on high-impact projects that improve our most important metrics or fundamentally change the way we operate. This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Development Manager of Global Real Estate Platform.Responsibilities:You will maintain the relationship between Fund Management and IT to ensure projects are delivered on time and within budget while maintaining the critical business systems that drive global Real Estate operations.You will function as a Scrum Master and partner to model, design, and build business solutions that improve State Street’ Real Estate processes.You will collaborates with Fund Controllers to define requirements and lead projects from inception through delivery, including status updates, scope changes, etc.You will respond to issues and incidents and provide day-to-day administration and support of Fund Accounting System, Investor Correspondence, Name: Business Operations Analyst (Leader)
Description: Skills.Net Department: Department of Health And Human Services  Agency: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention  Job Announcement Number: HHS-CDC-M1-19-********  SALARY RANGE: $******.00 to $******.00/Per Year  OPEN PERIOD: 2018-11-20 to 2018-11-27 SERIES & GRADE: GS--14/14AGENCY MARKETING STATEMENT: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is the agency Americans trust with their lives. As a global leader in public health, CDC is the nation's premier health promotion, prevention, and preparedness agency. Whether we are protecting the American people from public health threats, researching emerging diseases, or mobilizing public health programs with our domestic and international partners, we rely on our employees to make a real difference in the health and well-being of people here and around the world. This position is located in the Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS), Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), Office of the Chief Operating Officer (OCOO), Human Resources Office (HRO), Operations Management Activity (OMA) in Atlanta, Georgia. CDC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. DUTIES: As a Business Operations Analyst (Leader) you will: Plan and manage program budgets Use a broad array of analytical techniques to assess operational data to support the foundation and basis for senior leader decisions. Conduct complex multi-functional studies, reviews, and analysis in order to develop, analyze, and prepare detailed reports on the comparative utility and effectiveness of business operations; Plans and designs research methods for the collection and analysis of data and information critical to the conduct of studies throughout HRO's organizational structures. Lead a team in: identifying, distributing and balancing workload and tasks among employees in accordance with established work flow, skill level and/or occupational specialization. Participate on situation specific workgroups to develop and implement strategies to respond to and resolve business issues, influence attitudes and perceptions, and support and promote business operations throughout OMA and HRO in a positive manner. REQUIREMENTS: US Citizenship is required. Background Investigation is required. E-Verify: If you are selected for this position, the documentation that you present for purposes of completing the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Form I-9 will be verified through the DHS 'E-Verify' System. Federal law requires DHS to use the E-Verify System to verify employment eligibility of all new hires, and as a condition of continued employment obligates the new hire to take affirmative steps to resolve any discrepancies identified by the system. The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services is an E-Verify Participant. Direct Deposit: All Federal employees are required to have Federal salary payments made by direct deposit to a financial institution of their choosing. One-year probationary period may be required. Travel, transportation, and moving expenses will be paid: No Bargaining Unit Position: No Drug Screening Required: No Recruitment Incentive may be authorized: No Annual Leave for non-federal service may be authorized: No Research position: No Promotion potential: No Supervisory position: No Time in grade (TIG) must be met within 30 days of the closing date of the announcement. All qualification requirements must be met by the closing date of the announcement. QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED: Minimum Qualifications: Applicants must have one year of specialized experience at or equivalent to the GS-13 grade level of in the Federal service as defined in the next paragraph. Specialized experience is experience which is directly related to the position which has equipped the applicant with the particular knowledge, skills and abilities (KSAs) to successfully perform the duties of the position to include experience to analyzing and evaluating administrative aspects of mission-oriented programs to identify and develop problem resolution; conducting administrative studies and making recommendations. Documenting experience: In accordance with Office of Personnel Management policy, federal employees are assumed to have gained experience by performing duties and responsibilities appropriate for their official series and grade level as described in their position description. Experience that would not normally be part of the employee's position is creditable, however, when documented by satisfactory evidence, such as a signed memorandum from the employee's supervisor or an SF-50 or SF-52 documenting an official detail or other official assignment. The documentation must indicate whether the duties were performed full time or, if part time, the percentage of times the other duties were performed. It is expected that this documentation is included in the employee's official personnel record. In order to receive credit for experience in your resume that is not within the official series and grade level of your official position, you must provide a copy of the appropriate documentation of such experience as indicated above. HOW YOU WILL BE EVALUATED: Once the application process is complete, a review of the resume and supporting documentation will be made and compared against your responses to the assessment questionnaire to determine if you are qualified for this job. If, after reviewing your resume and/or supporting documentation, a determination is made that you have inflated your qualifications and/or experience, you may lose consideration for this position. Please follow all instructions carefully. Errors or omissions may affect your eligibility.
