Name: System Analyst
Description: **Company Overview**HD Supply (NASDAQ:HDS) ( www.hdsupply.com ) is one of the largest industrial distributors in North America. The company provides a broad range of products and value-add services to approximately 500,000 customers with leadership positions in maintenance, repair and operations and specialty construction sectors. Through approximately 260 locations across 36 states and six Canadian provinces, the company's approximately 11,000 associates provide localized, customer-driven services including jobsite delivery, will call or direct-ship options, diversified logistics and innovative solutions that contribute to its customers' success. With an active commitment to the communities in which we operate, HD Supply associates are part of a thriving organization that supports the virtues of wellness, diversity and inclusion ? all of which are top priorities for the company. Equally as important is empowering our associates to grow professionally while providing competitive benefits and compensation. If you?re ready to find a rewarding career and achieve your full potential with a growing industry leader, HD Supply is ready for you!**Job Description & Qualifications****Job Summary**Responsible for preparing one or more of the deliverables required for project execution for mid-sized projects which include; data validation use cases, requirements system diagrams and coordination and accountability for business and technical reviews. During the requirements phase of the project, the Analyst will coordinate and meet with IT and the business owners to ensure that business requirements are clearly linked with a data validation and profiling plan.**Major Tasks, Responsibilities and Key Accountabilities**+ Works with business users to define data quality problems, redundancies, and inconsistencies and to document and help resolve data quality problems.+ Coordinates with the business and data warehouse team in matters regarding modifications and enhancements.+ Establishes data profiling and preventative procedures to improve data quality.+ Develops operational controls for the monitoring and detection of data quality issues and develops continuous data quality improvement processes.+ Works with Database Administrator and developers to correct data violations.+ Develops and maintains technical documentation.+ Establishes and maintains standards for data quality.**Nature and Scope**+ Works in compliance with established procedures and/or protocols. Identifies and resolves readily identifiable, clearly defined problems. Demonstrates skill in data analysis and techniques by resolving missing/incomplete information and inconsistencies/anomalies in routine research/data.+ Nature of work requires general supervision; exercises judgment. May be paired with a mentor. Work typically involves regular process checks or review of output by a coworker and/or supervisor.+ May provide general guidance/direction to or train junior level support personnel.**Work Environment**+ Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.+ Frequent periods are spent standing or sitting in the same location with some opportunity to move about. Name: 2019 Summer Undergraduate Internship - Business Analyst/Project Management
Description: Looking for an internship where you?ll really make a difference? Apply at U.S. Bank. *What You?ll Do** We offer a competitive 10-week paid internship where you?ll work on meaningful projects and effect real change at our company. Our interns get hands-on experience solving business needs and helping in the communities where we live and work. You?ll build your resume while making new connections and sharpening the skills you need to succeed at work. Plus, the work you do will be tailored to your interests. A typical employee spends eight hours a day at work. We think you should spend that time doing something you love ? not just earning a paycheck.  _As a U.S. Bank intern, you?ll have the opportunity to interact with senior executives, get paired with a formal mentor and attend fun events specifically tailored for interns, including a volunteer day where you?ll give back to the community. In your day-to-day work, you?ll learn how employees collaborate to serve all our stakeholders._ Your meaningful work experience may even translate into a full-time position in the banking industry upon graduation. *Why U.S. Bank?** Join a team of more than 74,000 employees in 28 states and eight countries, all committed to doing the right thing, making smart changes and collaborating for the good of our customers, communities, and other stakeholders ? and especially for the good of one another. But don?t just take our word for it ? we?ve been recognized by the Ethisphere Institute as a 2018 World's Most Ethical Company? for four years running.  Part of doing the right thing is making sure our employees feel welcome and supported at work, while challenging you to develop personally and professionally. At U.S. Bank, you?ll be empowered with the tools you need to succeed in your role and grow your career.  We can?t wait to meet you ? apply today. *Internship Responsibilities May Include:** ? Request, summarize, and analyze data  ? Work with agile team members on projects  ? Collaborate with business line and risk partners to complete validation processes  ? Work with cross functional teams to solve a business problem from ideation to launch  ? Create process flow diagrams for different products and procedures  ? Establish and maintain ongoing relationships with field and operations leaders  ? Prepare materials for internal presentations, memos and projects  ? Assist in handling needs assessment and cost/benefit analysis to align the technology of the company with business strategy  ? Adhoc reporting & analytics  ? Perform other related duties as requested *Qualifications:***Skills and Qualifications:** ? Pursuing a Bachelor?s degree in Accounting, Finance, Business, or related discipline preferred  ? Strong written and verbal communication skills  ? Ability to think and work independently within a professional setting  ? Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills  ? Flexibility to work within a multiple disciplinary team and receive dynamic on-the-job training  ? Highly organized; ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks and deadlines simultaneously  Explore your career possibilities at U.S. Bank and join a company that?s as passionate as you are about helping our customers meet their goals and making a difference in the communities we live and work. Our industry-leading financial performance, innovative spirit and best-in-class reputation empower employees to succeed. U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce.  We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors. *Job:** Campus*Primary Location:** United States*Shift:** 1st - Daytime*Average Hours Per Week:** 40*Requisition ID:** 180032345 U.S. Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse workforce.  U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

Name: Senior Business Analyst -Spanish speaking
Description: A quick snapshot. As a member of the Professional Services team you will work within a project team to implement our order management solution. You will assume project leadership responsibilities, define and document the requirements, map the business processes, scope and estimate, participate in the design preparation and execution of test plan, and implement the solution. Why it's a big deal Aptos Principal Order Management Business Analysts are key to helping our clients and customers keep their businesses running efficiently, consistently, and reliably. They know our clients' and work with them to design and implement Aptos retail solutions. Are you the person we're looking for?Bilingual: We are in need of a Spanish and English speaking colleague in order to meet the demands of our growing customer base who speak Spanish. Related experience. Retail, eCommerce, and direct-to-consumer are certainly not foreign to you.You've probably done at least 4 end-to-end full life cycles of order management implementations and preferably POS software as well. You preferably have 8+ years overall experience implementing off-the-shelf software and in a client facing role. 6 of those years with order management, call center application, inventory, and fulfillment/store fulfillment experience in the retail environment implementing leading Order Management solutions. You're highly effective in identifying important data, understanding our customers' businesses and advising them on maximizing the order management solution to achieve their goals. Technical chops: You have experience/familiarity with website design & implementation, CRM, POS, or Merchandising along with SQL. And you've independently conducted process design sessions and process design. Expert relationship builder and customer service enthusiast. Let's cut to the chase: This is a must. It's important that you genuinely enjoy building relationships. It's not enough to simply be nice to others or enjoy working with others -- the right person will be truly interested in getting to know our project and our client's team in an effort to provide the highest levels of service and support. You love troubleshooting. Seriously. You're tech-Savvy and can easily understand how systems interact/integrate with each other and as well as how changes in one application will affect others. It's your jam. Strong and deliberate communicator. You are skilled at reading and adapting to different communication styles. When you speak you are clear and concise. Your strong listening skills foster connection with your audience. You are good at presenting training to groups of people. Proven success with queries and reporting tools. You've successfully used technologies like SQL Query in your daily routines to extract and analyze data, and create reports. Quality orientation. You rarely make mistakes because you have good processes in place to ensure that every last detail is correct. There's hardly an error that gets past you -- even when you're under pressure to complete something in a very short timeframe Resourcefulness and application. At Aptos, we have a pioneering spirit when we have questions, we find answers When we're faced with challenges, we find solutions. We turn to a variety of resources, including our own colleagues, our professional network, the Internet, articles and books whatever helps us get the job done. But it's not just about using a variety of resources to gain knowledge it's also about applying that knowledge to other areas of the job or business where it might make sense. You are proactive about ongoing learning to better your knowledge about Aptos software and our customers' needs. You find trends in customer questions and work to resolve repeating issues quickly and efficiently. Here's what will give you an edgeYou actually like to travel: Yes, we're serious. This role could travel up to 50% and could be more or less depending on clients needs. Passion. We know it when we see it. Passion is not about saying how much you love what you do in your most excited voice. Passion is revealed in your truest self. It's about what you've accomplished; how you want to grow; the ideas you have; your philosophies. It's demonstrating through your words and your actions that you truly believe in what you do -- and where you work. That it matters to you. And that's pretty cool. Initiative. You don't wait around for things to happen or for your manager to tell you what to do. You're not only proactive about completing your own work, but when you sense the need to introduce an idea that will benefit the team or the organization -- even if it's outside your scope of work -- you take it on and own it. You'll also jump right in and help mentor junior consultants/business analysts if needed. That also goes back to having a pioneering spirit. Related education. A bachelor's degree in industrial engineering or logistics would be awesome, but we also like degrees in engineering, management information systems, or other similar areas, as well.

Name: Principal Business Systems Analyst
Description: Req ID: ****** The Turner Story  Turner is a division of WarnerMedia along with our sister companies, HBO and Warner Bros. We are better known as the folks who bring you CNN, HLN, TCM, TNT, tbs, Adult Swim, Cartoon Network, Turner Sports, truTV and so much more! From cutting-edge breaking news stories, up-to-the-minute sports coverage, and the characters we grew up loving on to the shows we love today, Turner continues to be the gold standard in first class television programming and a demonstrated leader in digital content. We tell the stories the world wants to hear. Won't you be a part of our story? **************  See what it's like to work at Turner! Follow us on Instagram, Twitter and Facebook  The Job  The Principal Business Systems Analyst will be on the architect team within the TDC Data Platform team. The job will involve supporting the Data Architects throughout the lifecycle of a data source project. These projects may bring new data sources into the TDC or provide enhancements for existing data sources.  The Day-to-Day  Review source data files and provide detailed analysis to include field profiles, validation of field, record and files formats, field valid values, required fields, and primary keys  Assist Data Architect in requirements gathering  Setup internal processing and automation systems based on architecture design specifications provided by Data Architects.  Provide complete testing support to include unit testing, system/integration testing, UAT and implementation support.  Partner with QA team to provide adequate test data.The Essentials  3+ years related experience with proven track record  Experience with profiling and analysis of source data files in a variety of formats  Ability to work in a fast paced, high pressure environment juggling multiple priorities  Ability to make a strong first impression and build trust, rapport and lasting relationships with business stakeholders. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to speak tech speak to techies, lay speak to laymen, and business speak to business leaders.  Strong facilitation, questioning and listening skills to ask right questions of individuals and groups to surface essential requirements information. Ability to listen to understand not only what people say, but what they mean, and to detect what they may be hesitant to say. Ability to think on your feet, to go beyond planned questions and respond to whatever input you hear from the people you are interviewing  Analytical skills, to critically evaluate the information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a more general understanding, distinguish presented user requests from the underlying true needs, and distinguish solution ideas from requirements  Demonstrated ability to exercise good judgment, prioritize multiple tasks, and problem solve under pressure of deadlines and resource constraints  Ability to create comprehensive test cases to validate the flow of requirements to design to implementation  Intermediate level SQL knowledge at a minimum  Previous experience with relational databases, automated processing using custom internal systems (we'll teach you ours)  Knowledge of AWS, Redshift, Snowflake, Hive/Hadoop a plus The Perks  Paid time off every year to volunteer  Access to wellbeing tools, resources, and freebies  2017 Best Company for Working Mothers  An in-house learning and development team to help shape and grow your career  Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands  Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. and its subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity Employers and E-Verify users. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

Company DescriptionTegra is an industry leader in domestic and near-shore apparel manufacturing, with an all-star client list. The Company was formed in 2016 through the roll-up of several smaller manufacturers by affiliates of Apollo Management, the world’s largest private equity firm, with the goal of creating a “category killer” in on- and near-shore apparel manufacturing.  Tegra is reshaping the clothing industry. We're a driving force that's changing the way things have always been done, for the better. And we're just getting started.  Our vision is to outfit the world with tomorrow's solutions. We drive innovation forward and don't look back. We do this by creating bold, top of the line products in a workplace that inspires employees to keep pushing for greatness.

Name: Business Systems Analyst - PP/MM
Description: Business Systems Analyst – SAP PP/MMSUMMARY: Our client is seeking a qualified candidate to fulfill the role of “ Business Systems Analyst – SAP PP/MM”. As an expert in SAP Production Planning and Materials Management modules and processes, the mission of this position is to analyze business issues and to identify projects and technologies which will enable significant operational improvements in the corporation’ s supply chain and manufacturing planning functions. The Analyst formulates and defines systems scope and objectives based on both business needs and a solid understanding of industry requirements and best practices. In addition, the Analyst may function as a project manager to coordinate and facilitate the work of cross-functional company resources assigned to technology projects. This position may also assist in routine maintenance for specific modules in the company’ s suite of business applications. This position collaborates with business process owners to foster a positive IT customer relations environment. RESPONSIBILITIES: The SAP Business Systems Analyst is responsible for the following functions: Define information business systems requirements jointly working with management and professional staff in user departments. Technical solutions must satisfy the business needs for the future, i.e., take into account Company growth and customer service objectives.Develop working relationships with a diverse group of business people and gain an understanding of the complex nature of the Company’ s business. Maintain familiarity with the business plans of the Company and the departments serviced. Remain knowledgeable of information technology and Company business operations.Responsible for assisting user and IT management in setting priorities within the supply chain and manufacturing planning area and work with IT Leadership to communicate with senior management.Work with more experienced Business Systems Analysts. Participate on project team, completing individual responsibilities, providing input on resources needed, and consulting schedule to ensure timely completion of project and meeting deadlines of project. Familiar with the systems scope and project objectives, as well as the role and function of each team member in order to effectively complete the activities of the work team.Provide support for designated application systems. Augment and facilitate the design, development, implementation of enhancements to existing business systems.Provide guidance in creating standards, testing procedures, version control, etc. Maintain a professional awareness of tools and techniques that might be used to improve the quality of service.Other duties as assignedProject ManagementEnsures all projects are executed in accordance to the company’ s established IT governance practicesFoster cross-functional relationships inter- and intra-departmentally for effective project managementExecute assigned projects and track the completion of major milestonesQUALIFICATIONS:4+ years IT experience including 2 years in SAP PP and MM modules. Experience in both implementation and application support is desired. General experience should include systems architecture and business processes similar to those at the company.1 year project management experienceExperience in SAP discrete production order process requiredExperience in SAP repetitive manufacturing process requiredExperience in SAP MRP process requiredExperience in SAP PP Master Data (materials, BOM, routings, work centers requiredExperience in SAP PP-PI a plusExperience in SAP variant config a plusExperience in shop floor reporting/interfaces requiredExperience in production scheduling required Experience in SCM/APO a plusExperience in SAP capacity planning a plusExperience in SAP SOP or IBP process a plus4-year college degree in general or IT-Related field required. Equivalent work experience considered.

Name: Commercial/Corporate Credit Analyst
Description: Duties and Responsibilities Effectively partners with credit platform to improve efficiencies of operation, minimize risk, and expand sales opportunities.Evaluates financial statements and concludes independent written credit evaluations.Analysis will comprise of a wide-ranging evaluation of the business and will be used by supervision in approving credit requests. Analysis should sufficiently summarize the important aspects of the business including a detailed financial analysis, management competencies, collateral evaluation, and guarantor support.Offers commendations for monitoring relative to risk and policy, including revision to existing covenants.Offers endorsements regarding credit risk rating of commercial accounts and assesses collateral quality and values.Provides recommendations to loan officers regarding credit structure and policy compliance.Works closely with Commercial and/or Corporate Lenders/Relationship mnagers and may accompany them on client visits.Completes the annual servicing of existing relationships as allocated.Communicates completion dates with sales and credit partners, and works to meet agreed upon deadlines.Analysis will identify the key strengths and weaknesses of that debtor. May also include an evaluation of the borrower’s industry and the borrower’s position within their respective industry. Overview of the Commercial/Corporate Credit Analyst opportunity:  Is responsible for providing an independent and fully inclusive written evaluation of selected commercial loans. Collaborates carefully with commercial loan officers and other employees to recognize and manage risk on commercial loans up to the bank’s legal lending limit. The analysis will achieve in supporting the approval or denial of a loan request and endorsements on structure and risk rating.   Safeguards that loans are underwritten to comply with policy and are also suitably moderated. Incumbent applies knowledge of commercial lending principles to all duties performed. Works under limited supervision and in compliance with established policies, procedures and banking regulations.    Requirements: Position Requirements: Five (5) + years banking experience with emphasis on financial analysis and/or commercial lendingBachelor’s degree in Accounting, Business or Finance and/or equivalent experienceAdvanced written and analytical skills to include a capacity to analyze balance sheet structure, and income and cash flow trends on credits up to the legal lending limit of the bank. Knowledge of national syndications and buying and selling of loan participations.Extensive exposure to commercial credit and lending concepts, practices and regulations.PC proficiency with Word and Excel, including the use of system and user generated formulas, macros, charts, and tables.Experienced with financial statement spreading, including proficiency in preparing pro-forma statements within Moody’s or other software package. Ability to research industry sources needed for credit evaluations.Strong organization skills with the ability to self-manage time and priorities to meet deadlines.

Name: Advanced Business Sys Analyst
Description: Req ID: ****** The Turner Story  Turner is a division of WarnerMedia along with our sister companies, HBO and Warner Bros. We are better known as the folks who bring you CNN, HLN, TCM, TNT, tbs, Adult Swim, Cartoon Network, Turner Sports, truTV and so much more! From cutting-edge breaking news stories, up-to-the-minute sports coverage, and the characters we grew up loving on to the shows we love today, Turner continues to be the gold standard in first class television programming and a demonstrated leader in digital content. We tell the stories the world wants to hear. Won't you be a part of our story? **************  See what it's like to work at Turner! Follow us on Instagram, Twitter and Facebook  The Job  This position is for a Business Analysis to lead the analysis, requirements, training for the Unify application. The purpose of Unify is to buy time on competitor networks, websites, and billboards to market our shows. Unify is the budgeting tool used to manage the finances for $140M of inventory on competing networks air time, billboards, and digital sites. There are audit and sox compliance-related features that will be introduced. They include, but not limited to, automating the invoicing matching process in order to avoid overspending for the $140M budget, and incorporating a systematic marketing budgetary approvals process vs. the manual process done via email, today.  The Day-to-Day  Taking ownership of requirements gathering across multiple teams driving initial implementation, integration, and launch  The Business Analyst (BA) drives the Business Analysis process, including soliciting and documenting requirements, identifying problems that need solutions, and opportunities for systems and workflow enhancements in a future state.  This includes using workflow diagrams, standard modeling techniques, interviews, workshops and site surveys to gather input and opinions from a diverse group of users, peers and managers at all levels.  The BA plays a Subject Matter Expert role in solution delivery, including UAT, training and preparing the business for the system solution.  The BA serves as the conduit between the user community and the solutions teams through which requirements flow, and is involved at some level throughout the entire Systems Development Lifecycle.  Using industry and application knowledge to proactively develop product functionality and recommend solutions  Identifying needs, scoping solutions, evaluating solutions (build/buy)  Providing strategic business process/reengineering consulting as appropriate while working on multiple, technically complex, mission-critical, and/or high-profile projects  The Essentials  2-5 years business analysis experience  Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel  Advanced problem solving and analytical skills  Advanced communication skills (written and verbal)  Ability to work as part of a self-directed team  Meeting facilitation experience  The Perks  Paid time off every year to volunteer  Access to wellbeing tools, resources, and freebies  2017 Best Company for Working Mothers  An in-house learning and development team to help shape and grow your career  Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands  Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. and its subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity Employers and E-Verify users. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

Name: Atlanta Internal Audit and Financial Advisory - IT Audit Senior Consultant
Description: At Protiviti, we believe that a career is about more than just working, providing deliverables, and being compensated for your efforts. A Protiviti Career is about opportunities to lead, learn, grow, and make a difference.  We strive to recruit and hire the best talent. But it doesn't stop there. Once you join us, we build your career through exceptional work experiences, a culture focused on learning and development, and a commitment to the things that matter to you. Are you inspired to make a difference?You've come to the right place.JOB REQUISITIONAtlanta Internal Audit and Financial Advisory - IT Audit Senior ConsultantLOCATIONATLANTA - PEACHTREE RDADDITIONAL LOCATIONJOB DESCRIPTIONAre You Ready to Live Protiviti?The Protiviti Career provides opportunity to learn, inspire and advance within a collaborative and diverse company culture. We hire curious people for whom learning is an everyday activity. We fuel your curiosity with challenging work, talented colleagues and creative learning resources. At every level, we champion leaders who influence and achieve results. We encourage you to “bring your whole self to work” – all of your motivations, passions, priorities and commitments – as these things bring us closer to exceptional.  That's Living Protiviti.  We strive to recruit and hire the best talent, and it does not stop there. Once you join us, we promise to help you bring your career to life through exceptional work experiences, a culture passionate about learning and development, and a dedication to what matters to you.  Are you inspired to make a difference?  Then you have come to the right place.Where We Need You:The Atlanta office is seeking an Internal Audit & Financial Advisory Senior Consultant to join our growing team.What You Can Expect:The Senior Consultant coaches Interns, Consultants, and facilitates the successful completion of project work plan. Serving as both role model and trainer, the Senior Consultant demonstrates the attributes of excellent client service and assists team members in developing technical and professional competency. The Senior Consultant learns to identify areas of risk and opportunities to improve efficiencies. Relationships with client personnel and professional associates strengthen as the ability to communicate, gain trust and network improves. At the direction of managers, the Senior Consultant may accept responsibility for decision-making, ranging from staffing and preparation of deliverables to application of methodologies.What Will Help You Be Successful:You enjoy identifying areas of business risk, potential technical problems, and opportunities to improve the efficiency and profitability of the client’s overall business processes.You are passionate about evaluating, synthesizing, organizing and interpreting data and information.You create a positive work environment that fosters open communication among all engagement team members.You effectively build relationships with your clients and provide them with timely top quality service.You have an inherent interest in project management and team leadership. You seek new ways to create extraordinary development opportunities and ways for your team to make an impact on our clients and communities.Do Your Talents Include the Following?Advanced verbal and written communication skills, including documentation of findings and recommendations.An in-depth understanding of IT audit methodologies, concepts, tools and objectives.Knowledge and interest in technology including topics such as operating systems, mobile technologies, software development, networking, and business applications.Establishing and cultivating critical business relationships / networking with senior executives.Understanding of commonly used internal control frameworks, including COBIT, ISO 27001, NIST Cybersecurity Framework, ITIL, etc.Knowledge of Sarbanes-Oxley Act provisions and methodologies for achieving compliance, in particular the technology implications and requirements.Knowledge of audit methodologies and developing key internal audit deliverables including process flows, work programs, audit reports, and control summaries.Ability to translate technology topics and audit issues into “business speak” to be understood by executives.Supervisory experience of teams including mentoring / coaching, oversight and review of work, coordination across teams, and understanding how to motivate.Your Educational and Professional Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree, preferably in relevant discipline (e.g. Accounting, Finance, Information Technology, Cybersecurity, or Business Related Field).3+ years working in internal audit, consulting, assurance services, or related field, either in professional services or industry.Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite applications with specific emphasis on Word, Excel and PowerPoint. Secondary emphasis on Visio and Access.Professional Certification such as CPA, CIA, CISA, CISSP, or similar strongly preferred.Do You Love Exploring New Places?We travel throughout the month frequently based upon client requests/commitments. Travel may include suburban, regional, or out of state locations. Protiviti is not licensed or registered as a public accounting firm and does not issue opinions on financial statements or offer attestation services.For all US & Canada Postings: You may submit your application materials online or call 1.888.556.7420 for additional ways to apply. Protiviti is an Equal Opportunity Employer. M/F/Disability/VeteranJOB LOCATIONGA ATLANTA BUCKHEAD

Name: Senior Commercial (B2B) Credit Analyst -
Description: Neenah has built a tradition of innovation, service and growth since its founding in 1873 and we create value by improving the image and performance of everything we touch. Based in Alpharetta, GA with R&D and manufacturing facilities in the United States, United Kingdom, the Netherlands and Germany, Neenah is a publicly traded company and a global leader serving customers across 6 continents in more than 80 countries. We are a leading manufacturer of both specialty, performance-based products that serve a variety of end markets, and premium fine papers and packaging used to convey and enhance image through unique colors, textures, and finishes. Neenah presents true, varied and exciting choices that are both environmentally and aesthetically exceptional through sound environmental practices at our manufacturing facilities.  Neenah is actively searching for a Senior Commercial (B2B) Credit Analyst to join our team in the Corporate Office in Alpharetta, GA. This position offers the opportunity to join a dynamic company in a highly visible Accounts Receivable and Credit Analyst role. The role requires an energetic individual with strong business acumen, excellent operations skills and commercial credit experience (B2B). The ideal candidate will be able to make and sustain a positive impact by optimizing free cash flow and improve operational performance in the areas of AR and Credit. In addition, they will also partner with business management to leverage customer credit information to promote company revenue and earnings growth. The Senior AR/Credit Analyst is also responsible for enabling operating efficiencies and value-added services by resolving invoicing, pricing, and credit discrepancies. This is a key credit and collections role for the business and will have International exposure. Individuals with manufacturing experience will do well.Key Areas of ResponsibilityProvide strong leadership to Neenah's credit teams to support our working capital & free cash flow targets. Make appropriate decisions on credit risk, financial exposure, and setting credit limits.Leverage data and analytics to understand credit risks and shape proactive strategies to support Neenah's corporate strategies.Active interaction with customers and account teams to establish appropriate credit terms; managing relationships with clients in order to reduce exposure to potential bad debt.Direct management of company aged receivables and accounts receivable write-offs.Refine and enhance credit strategy utilizing knowledge of industry leading practices. Work in parallel with our sales goals and initiatives.Ensure smooth integration of recently acquired companies into credit process.Report outstanding aged accounts to the Credit Manager on a monthly basis. Communicate on customer analytics.Ensure active engagement with internal and external partner teams, including CFO, Controllers, Treasury, Sales, Service Delivery Managers, and Accounts Receivable team as well as other organizations to optimize cash receipts, and minimize AR aging profile and bad-debt expense.Ensure adherence to collection activity and facilitate resolution of related issues.A Bachelor of Science degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or International Business required5+years of experience in a combination of accounts receivable, commercial (B2B) credit, accounting, finance or international businessCommercial (B2B) Credit experience - Manufacturing experience is a plus.Basic knowledge of financial analysis in order to interpret financial reporting including but not limited to balance sheet, income statement, cash flow statement, notes to financialsAbility to interpret various financial reporting sources such as D&B, Graydon, or Credit Risk MonitorAdvanced ability within collections and utilizing various techniques to convert accounts receivable into cash flowAdvanced knowledge of Incoterms and related payment vehicles- Letter of Credit, Cash Against Documents (CAD), etc.Excellent analytical skills, with knowledge of collections, credit, accounting and finance principles, experienced in assessing portfolio and customer riskAbility to adjust to and work effectively in a dynamic, changing environmentSuperior verbal and written communication skills (at all levels of management)Good conflict management and negotiation skillsDemonstrated ability to effectively build positive and profitable global business with customersInternational credit experience is a plus

Name: Talent Acquisition Operations and Reporting Analyst
Description: OverviewThe Talent Acquisition team at WellStar Health System is growing! We are currently seeking a confident and highly motivated individual looking for an outstanding career opportunity as a Talent Acquisition Operations and Reports Analyst with a nationally recoginzed employer of choice. At WellStar we all share common goals. That’s what makes us so successful – and such an integral part of our communities. We want the same things, for our organization, for our patients, and for our colleagues. As the largest not-for-profit healthcare system in Georgia, this means we pride ourselves on investing in the communities that we serve. We continue to provide innovative care models, focused on improving quality and access to healthcare.ResponsibilitiesThe Talent Acquisition (TA) Operations and Reporting Analyst provides strategic business analysis services and project support to business partners through reporting, data analysis and dashboards. The focus of this position is to work closely with talent acquisition/recruiting areas to gain in-depth understanding of processes, operational and reporting needs while helping to identify opportunities to improve efficiency. The individual in this role uses strong problem solving, analytical and technical knowledge to develop data-driven recruitment dashboards, reports and analytics that drive recruitment decision making. Serves as dedicated Applicant Tracking System and other talent acquisition software SME to track, report and support future TA activities and initiatives using organizational metrics. This position functions independently using strong technical and internal systems knowledge to complete analyses, respond to requests and partner on system-wide projects.Through this work, we strive to provide value-added metrics and analytics that can inform and deliver solutions and next-generation recruiting to the organization and talent market. This Analyst will help in developing and maintaining new and existing reporting and models, along with recommending and implementing data-driven solutions that will help acquire quality talent for our businesses. Responsibilities of this role will include but is not limited to:• Develop customized analytical reports/dashboards to meet requests of external and internal customers.• Deep understanding of innovative reporting and performance Talent Acquisition metrics that align with business needs.• Management and Analysis of Surveys and Scorecards on Recruitment Performance.• Designs queries, reports and dashboards to assist leaders and team members in understanding historic and current metrics as well as predictive analysis.• Monitors and evaluates quality and effectiveness of Talent solutions by creating, maintaining and analyzing Talent metrics.• Provides ongoing reporting to TA and HR teams on talent programs.• Analyze business process flows and impact on technology flows.• Collaborate with Talent Acquisition leaders and other partners to ensure data integrity and develop appropriate auditing tools, reports and analysis methodologies.• Maintain, enhance, and streamline standardized reporting to ensure clients have timely, relevant, and accessible information and our processes are efficient and legally compliant.• Participate in continuous training efforts to TA team to ensure effective use of ATS and strong knowledge TA processes.• Synthesize information from various recruiting areas, functions, projects, etc. enabling the TA team to make key strategic decisions in a timely manner.• Attend meetings and daily communication sessions to keep abreast of project objectives, process workflows and progress of business concepts.QualificationsRequired Minimum Education: Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Data Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics Business Management, Finance or related field.Required Minimum Experience: • 3+ years of prior work experience in a business analyst, data analyst, or business intelligence analyst role including Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) administration experience.• Experience in stakeholder management and vendor management.• Ability to build business cases that facilitate and accelerate the adoption of analytics and solutions.• Experience developing requirements and formulating business metrics for reporting.• Experience in an analytical role with the ability to interpret data, analyses results using statistical techniques to identify trends or patterns in complex data sets and provide ongoing reports.• Able to communicate complex messages and outputs from analysis in a confident and simple way, and the ability to train others in technical/analysis skills. • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy preferred skills.• Advanced experience using report writing software and developing data visualizations using tools preferred.• Demonstrated expert proficiency in MS Excel and analytical platforms as well as creating PowerPoint presentations and storyboards that captivate business partners.• Intermediate to advanced SQL query writing and a strong understanding of relational data structures required.• In-depth knowledge of advanced technologies for analyzing large amounts of data.• Experience with applicant tracking, CRM, HRIS, and/or customer tracking databases to manage data and candidate relationships. • Intermediate level experience of VBA programming – including ability to update/maintain existing VBA code.• Ability to collaborate and work effectively with internal and external customers/vendors.• Innovative and creative thinker. Ability to identify opportunities for improvement and communicate them effectively.Required Minimum Skills: • Aptitude for using various software products and their corresponding report writing tools. • Excellent analytic skills and ability to manipulate/interpret raw data.• Possesses a high level of integrity and ability to work in a highly confidential environment.• Strong sense of urgency.• Self-starter with ability to multi-task.• Ability to work in fast-paced environment and adapt to change easily.• Strong organizational and planning skills required with a close attention to detail and accountability.• Excellent communication skills (written and oral) as defined by the ability to create and deliver effective correspondence and presentations to Senior Leaders.• A passion for educating and communicating analytic findings at all levels.Join us for outstanding benefits and development opportunities. We also offer state-of-the-art technology, professional support and advancement, and colleagues that rank amongst the best in the country. The WellStar culture of caring has also been nationally recognized by Fortune Magazine as one of the “100 Best Companies to Work For”. Step up to your potential. Find out more and apply today. WellStar is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All applicants are considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, veteran status or any status which is protected by local, state or federal law.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Job Description SummaryWe are currently recruiting for a Senior Business Analyst in our corporate headquarters in Alpharetta, GA.Job DescriptionThe roleTo heighten sales performance and accelerate organization decision making by conceiving, designing, executing, and delivering world class analytics to sales leadership, sales representatives, marketing, finance and executive management.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Develop and leverage strong understanding of business cycle to conceive, design and execute world class analytics to accelerate decision making.Understand, innovate and leverage system landscape to develop queries, create and update dashboards, collect and analyze data for sales and marketing performance. Develop and continuously improve measurement systems.Prepare, and assist in the validation of, sales forecasts and budgets. Develop and implement quotas for the sales team and evaluate performance on the basis of quota and forecasted sales, including sales rankings.Analyze sales force structure and provide recommendations for improving efficiency and access to opportunity. Assess necessary changes to systems, reporting, analytics and compensation plans and implement accordingly.Continually assess system landscape to determine relevance to business needs. Name: Sales Operations Analyst
Description: About the Role Due to rapid growth and increased demand for our Privacy Management platform, OneTrust is seeking a Sales Operations Analyst to join our Sales Enablement team.  The Sales Operations Analyst will work closely with the Sales and Marketing teams to provide on-going support and maintenance of our business systems, processes and data. You will provide assistance with sales support/training, project coordination, creating and maintaining documentation, accommodating ad-hoc user requests and developing management dashboard reporting. We believe in recognition for a job well-done, competitive salaries and a fast paced, entrepreneurial environment.

Name: Technical Analyst III
Description: DescriptionConsults with internal customers and external vendors to capture agreed-upon business objectives and processes. Performs research and fact-finding to determine business requirements and specifications for development of end-user programs, operational procedures and support and systems. Communicates these processes and their implications to technical and non-technical contributors to ensure that applications accurately meet business users' goals. Produce documentation and training materials for software applications. May manage software applications training program for user personnel. May direct IT research initiatives moving from the business concept stage through initiative direction, project definition, project execution, and project evaluation, up to and including operational support phase. Maintains, integrates, and communicates knowledge of industry directions and IT trends.PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES AND ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:• Works with Business Analysts or other customers to interpret customer and business needs and translate them into application, system, technical and operational requirements.• Engages and participates in projects/applications requirement sessions in order to ensure proper technical requirements are clearly documented, testable, and managed.• May work closely with business and boundary partners (Field Operations, Customer Care, Sales, HR, Cox Business, Business Operations, Engineering, Outside Plant, Technology, etc. and vendors) to support application lifecycle from development through implementation.• Communicates technical and business aspects of work efforts between team members.• Determines impact on existing applications & databases based on requirements. Understands applications and systems and provides development input to architects/engineers during the analysis phase.• Provides project manager with time and resource estimates for technical requirements.• Works with technical team to ensure all requirements are addressed in solution design.• Coordinates with QA for testing new features, new solutions, and bug fixes.• May write test cases and provide QA testing.• Works directly with Development and QA teams to complete application implementations with minimal impact to customers. • Develops technical documentation, processes, installation procedures and service guides, application training information, and may assist in the development of end-to-end documentation for various projects and supported products/applications. • Participates in peer review of solution design documentation. • Reviews vendor documents as appropriate including detailed functional specifications, and file and field layouts and determines if vendor solutions meet Cox requirements.• Develops measurements and reports on key service-level metrics. • Possesses a clear understanding of the architecture standards, a high-level understanding of the business, and a deep understanding of respective domain architectures (business, information, application, technology). • Depicts the enterprise information conceptually, logically and physically. • Identifies architectural implications of the business requirements. • Interfaces extensively with functional users to confirm the applicability of design alternatives, identifies and recommends cost effective options, and addresses user concerns.• Thorough understanding of software development methodologies, including Agile, Scrum, Waterfall, and others.• Proficient in test case / use case creation and testing methodologies.• Possess both critical-thinking and analytical skills.• Ability to understand and implement instructions furnished in written, verbal, or diagram form.• Excellent verbal and written communication skills.• Experience with process documentation and process flows.• Ability to translate business requirements into system and technical requirements for software development.• Basic proficiency of report writing and report creation.• Strong organizational skills.• Ability to work with minimal supervision.• Participates in the conceptual phases of identifying and solving business problems and initiatives.• Serves as a subject matter expert (SME) between assigned business unit(s) and the IT organization; consults with business unit clients on workflow and prioritization. • Conducts business requirements reviews and formulates logical statements of business requirements.• Collaborates with business to build and maintain application roadmaps that can be translated into technical requirements, designed and developed. • Works closely with cross functional teams in order to fully understand business priorities and work collaboratively to deliver on those.• Proactively understands customer's business processes, the key drivers and measures of success for the business, and the short- and long-term direction of the business and technology.• Understands key applications and assets that can be extended to meet the ongoing business needs. Manages the development and maintenance of relevant process, including context (data flow) diagrams, work flow models, and technology models.• Focuses on developing and improving processes, assisting with the development of metrics for delivery of SDLC initiatives from technical requirements through deployment and warranty of solutions.• Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to develop cohesive working relationships with internal and external clients. QualificationsMinimum:• 5 years of experience in related field.• 3+ years experience in a business process design, technical/business analyst role providing technical solution guidance.• 3+ years experience in design and implementation of Application, Integration, and Data Architectures.• Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges.• Proven experience with software development life cycle (SDLC) and agile/iterative methodologies.• Strong communication and documentation skills.Preferred• BS/BA degree in computer and/or business related desired (i.e. Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology).• Experience in telecommunications industry desired.• Experience in SQL preferred.• Experience with order management systems, ICOMS, and other key Cox Communications systems.• Project management experience a plus.About Cox CommunicationsCox Communications is committed to creating meaningful moments of human connection through broadband applications and services. The largest private telecom company in America, we proudly serve six million homes and businesses across 18 states. We're dedicated to empowering others to build a better future and celebrate diverse products, people, suppliers, communities and the characteristics that makes each one unique. Cox Communications is the largest division of Cox Enterprises, a family-owned business founded in 1898 by Governor James M. Cox.Cox is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer - All qualified applicants/employees will receive consideration for employment without regard to that individual's age, race, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, physical or mental disability, veteran status, genetic information, ethnicity, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by law.Statement to ALL Third-Party Agencies and Similar Organizations: Cox accepts resumes only from agencies with which we formally engage their services. Please do not forward resumes to our applicant tracking system, Cox employees, Cox hiring manager, or send to any Cox facility. Cox is not responsible for any fees or charges associated with unsolicited resumes.Organization: Cox Communications, Inc.Primary Location: US-GA-Atlanta-6305 Peachtree Dunwoody RdEmployee Status: RegularJob Level: Individual ContributorShift: Day JobTravel: Yes, 5 % of the TimeSchedule: Full-timeUnposting Date: Ongoing

Name: Technical Analyst
Description: Technical Analyst Atlanta, GAOur client is a custom software development and services company based out of Atlanta, Georgia. Join this fast growing company looking for the best and brightest professionals to work with both Fortune 500 companies and budding start-ups.DESCRIPTION: Atlanta-based Software Services company that provides a blend of enterprise server and mobile development, as well as architecture and delivery based services. We work with both Fortune 500 companies and budding start-ups. Our software developers are top tier talent with skills in a wide range of technologies and industries. We are seeking Technical Analysts to join our multi-platform engineering team in Atlanta. As a Technical Analyst, you will join an agile team to investigate complex software problems and identify faulty components directly to our clients. You will have the opportunity to participate in hands on debugging and troubleshoot efforts while working with and learning from some of the best talent in the field.RESPONSIBILITIES: - Investigate complex software problems and identify faulty components. - Participate in hands on debugging and troubleshoot efforts in a video environment. - Integrate various software components in a highly agile software development and delivery environment. - Work closely with the development, test and project management teams and assist in each wherever possible. - Write build scripts and help automate various build processes that exist in the development environment - Support automated continuous integration of software components by defining test suites and writing test cases and test scripts. - Analyze logs, identify defects, suggest fixes and report results. - Ensuring high quality of development and test activities. - Prioritizing a busy work schedule to meet tight deadlines. - Keeping ahead of emerging technologies and giving beneficial input during technical discussions. Required: - BS/Masters in Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent.

Name: Sr. Analyst, Restaurant Inventory
Description: OverviewSupply Chain is hiring a Restaurant Inventory Analyst for our new Restaurant Replenishment function within our Inventory team. We are looking for some exceptional talent to help develop the tool and to implement the function. Our mission is to automate in-Restaurant ordering for team members. This will eliminate in-Restaurant complexity and drive efficiencies.  To succeed, you must insist on the highest standards for quality, adaptability, and performance. The systems we own are responsible for delivering the food and packaging needed by Operators to serve millions of customers every day. You will ensure that this tool is leveraged to forecast Restaurant product needs in a way that best meets our business goals. You will demonstrate strong leadership as you control your own destiny in Chick-fil-A's ownership oriented culture.ResponsibilitiesEmpathy for our Operator’s experienceGenerate exception-based reports and research source data to determine validity and resolve errorsMeasure system performance using KPIs for regular reportingWork with Replenishment team and others in Supply Chain and cross functionally to continually improve the Replenishment systemGo beyond established analytical thinking and problem-solving by applying creativity to unconventional concepts and out-of-the-box solutionsAbility to quickly understand patterns within large quantity of data and to reference key characteristics using visualization techniques Minimum QualificationsBachelor’s in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Supply Chain or related fieldExperience with SQL, Alteryx or similar data transformation toolsSolid knowledge of statistical techniques is requiredStrong communication skills and ability to work well with othersDemonstrated ability to quickly learn and apply complex technical skills Minimum Years of Experience3  Travel Requirements20%

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionThe Financial Analyst is responsible for assisting in the preparation and analysis of financial and operational reports and financial forecasts. This position will also support our treasury/cash management function. First Excel Title provides a high standard of service that is unmatched. Join our team to help us lead the charge!

Name: Business Financial Analyst
Description: BUSINESS FINANCIAL ANALYST - Commercial Real Estate, SQL Experience For immediate and confidential considering, please send your resume to Kristen.Stough@RobertHalf.com  If you are an outstanding Financial Analyst, you might be right for the position Robert Half Finance is filling for a fast-growing company. In addition to measuring, analyzing, and forecasting performance in conjunction with operating plans, you will conduct financial modeling on a variety of financial products in this Financial Analyst role. Additionally, you will be responsible for preparing reports for management and advising management on the allocation of resources to best accomplish objectives. In this role, you will serve as a key business partner in areas such as forecasting, performance reporting, and expense management. This Financial Analyst will be responsible for supporting world class strategic and financial planning methods, building long-range operating plans to support business imperatives and developing rolling forecast processes to ensure resources every quarter are consumed at maximum effectiveness. Furthermore, you will help with operationalizing and cultivating a more data-driven planning process and improved monthly and quarterly reporting. In this role, you will be directly involved in the coordination of various planning cycles (annual planning, quarterly forecasts and monthly outlooks), while providing strategic analyses and recommendations. You will provide variance analysis of bookings, revenues and expenses, clearly explaining the business reasons for variances and adjusting the outlook models to reflect operational adjustments. The Financial Analyst role is a full-time employment opportunity in the Atlanta, Georgia. Responsibilities: Develop and maintain sophisticated/advanced level Excel-based analytical tools, including macro-enabled financial models  Assist in real estate purchase and sale preparation by researching property values, market rents, HOA fees, and taxes and updating the financial acquisition underwriting model  Track property results post purchase and benchmark against underwriting  Develop and update periodic performance reports related to acquisitions, renovations, property management and dispositions  Assist with creating deliverables for investors and management team  Effectively delivers presentations to direct management and decision makers  Research and analyze industry trends and benchmarking information as they apply to the business model, strategy and position in the marketplace

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: The Business Analyst is a champion for the business within IT. The Senior Business Analyst will be responsible for quickly and effectively gathering and communicating requirements for new solutions to meet the changing needs of the business. Superior communication and interpersonal skills, the ability to work across the organization, excellent analytical skills, initiative and the ability to lead a team of Business Analysts in a team environment are keys to this position.   Product Delivery teams work in highly collaborative Agile teams. Candidates who have experience documenting user stories, diagrams and acceptance criteria and collaborating with product, development and QA teams are preferred. The ability to work independently with little supervision is required. We seek candidates who are able to communicate effectively with business partners and technical team members and bring them to agreement.   Responsibilities · Consult with sponsors, Product Owners and team members to define and articulate the business problem and product vision, developing user stories and acceptance criteria to describe success for the story  · Elicit requirements using a variety of techniques, including gap analysis, observation, interviews and facilitating workshops.  · Provide useful models for "as-is" and "to-be" business processes, data flow paths and system interactions  · Own story card quality. Collaborate with subject matter experts, sponsors, developers and QA to reduce potential gaps in requirements.  · Create interface mock-ups, either directly or by collaboration with UX designers  · Proactively work to identify, communicate and resolve issues and risks that inhibit progress  · Communicate project status when needed and assist in resolving issues  · Take initiative and apply problem solving skills to remove blockers, reduce churn and improve team performance  · Demonstrate the ability to effectively work on large complex projects spanning the ecosystem  · Obtain and maintain a working knowledge of web applications, customers and business units. Become a subject matter expert in more than one applications.  · Mentor less experienced team members  Qualifications: · 5-8 years IT business analysis experience implementing software solutions  · Demonstrated experience facilitating requirements gather sessions, articulating user stories and driving completion  · Experience with high volume, external customer facing web applications is preferred  · The ability to understand data relationships, write and execute SQL queries is preferred  · Experience with agile development principles and values is strongly preferred

Name: New Products Analyst Intern
Description: Kabbage is blazing a trail in big data and fintech, and we are looking for a New Products Analyst Intern in the summer of 2019 (June 3 August 2) to join the Kabbage team as we continue our amazing growth trajectory.  Kabbage is more than a lender for small businesses; our data and technology platform is now being used as a fully branded product by other lenders, and our products are expanding. We've received numerous awards & recognition, including Glassdoor's 2017 Best Places to Work, "36th fastest growing company in the US" on the INC 500 List, Fast Company's "Top 10 most innovative companies in finance" and Forbes' "America's Top 100 Most Promising Companies" among others.Your mission:Shape Kabbage's new products and features by gathering new product ideas, prioritizing efforts, and shepherding the best ideas into test and pilot programs.What you'll be doing:Gather ideas and identify market opportunities for new products and features.Define product structures and then model anticipated bottom line impact of those products from ramp-up phase through to scale production.Develop pilot program requirements and timelines and then operationalize them by coordinating across cross-functional teams, e.g., Creative, Technology, Legal, Marketing.Monitor key metrics of pilot programs to gauge success of each product or feature.What we're looking for in you:Self-starter mentality: with the ability to work well under pressure, thrive working under limited direction, and an attitude that no job is too challenging or too smallEnthusiastic: Exhibits passion and excitement for work. Ability to keep up with a high-paced, start-up environmentOrganized: Plans, organizes, and schedules in an efficient, productive manner; focuses on key priorities; manages time wellStrategic Thinker/Visionary: Able to see and communicate the big picture in an inspiring way; determines opportunities and threats through comprehensive analysis of current and future trendsCreative: Generates new and innovative approaches to problems; open to new ways of doing thingsAnalytical: Excellent problem-solving skills with an attention to detailWhat you should have:Eligibility: MBA, graduate, and postgraduate students are welcome to apply.Pursuing a degree in Finance, Economics, Statistics, or a related field of study.High proficiency in Microsoft Excel (vlookups, pivot tables, etc.), PowerPoint, and Word.Familiarity with VBA macros and SQL.Previous internships or other professional experience. The Kabbage AdvantageAt Kabbage, our people are awesome, so we built the Kabbage Advantageour way of being awesome right back. Our team members enjoy a dynamic work environment with daily catered lunches, fully stocked kitchens, cold-brewed coffee and beer on tap. We offer top-of-the-line hardware, onsite fitness classes, and adjustable sit/stand desksto name a few more.  While our perks and benefits are generous, the people are actually what make Kabbage great. Kabbagers are curious, creative, and resilient. We are enthusiastic, productive, and problem solvers. And we don't do it alone. At Kabbage, you will find low-key individuals who work hard to communicate effectively and work collaboratively. Kabbage is an equal opportunity employer. At Kabbage we make all employment decisions, which include hiring, promoting, transferring, demoting, evaluating, compensating and separating, without regard to sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, race, color, religion, age, national origin, pregnancy, citizenship, disability, service in the uniform services, or any other classification protected by federal, state or local law.

Name: GIS Consultant / Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionCohesive is looking for consultants for its Spatial Asset Management Practice to work on implementations of the integration of Maximo EAM and ESRI GIS. Consultants deliver projects through requirements gathering, testing, training, problem solving, implementing and documenting activities.  Consultants in this position need broad experience with technical, functional, and interpersonal skills. This role is customer facing, so presentation and diplomacy are crucial. As with any consulting position, travel to customer is frequent and mandatory. Consultants also must be self-starters and require the ability to act independently when necessity.  Cohesive will provide training for the right candidates that best match the profile. Junior/entry-level spatial consultants will be teamed up with senior team leads to manage their work, and support their growth until they are ready to take on leadership roles. Intermediate spatial consultants are provided support through teaming, mentoring, and project leadership.  This is NOT a GIS analyst, mapper, or GIS technician role. While you need this background you will be applying the knowledge in new innovative ways. Successful candidates will have a degree in engineering, information systems, or geography from a nationally recognized higher-level institution, or relevant career experience. The following skills are required: Desktop ESRI ArcGIS 9.3 and 10.xESRI ArcGIS Server & SDE 9.3 and 10.xBasic Understanding of databases (Oracle, SQL Server, DB2)Basic Understanding of networking and enterprise IT systemsWillingness to learn and step outside of traditional GIS rolesAptitude for understanding the business value that GIS plays in businessDesire to learn how to apply GIS to solve business problemsAdditional Desired Skills:Certification in ESRI ArcGISGIS-P CertificationTelvent ArcFM and Designer knowledgeAbility to write Action Handlers and Auto UpdatersKnowledge of SQLPrevious experience with Maximo or similar EAM software products is a plusKnowledge of deploying mobile applications

Name: Technical Analyst

Name: Sr. Consultant, Salesforce Business Analyst
Description: About Us Appirio, a Wipro Company helps customers improve Worker & Customer experiences with outcome-oriented consultants who bring the latest digital thinking and unmatched cloud experience. We create actionable strategies that deliver results quickly, and help organizations adapt to a new experience-driven era. We deliver results quickly by harnessing the power of thousands of pre-built solution accelerators. Appirio is a trusted partner to some of the world’s largest brands, including YP, Cardinal Health, Coca-Cola, eBay, Facebook, Home Depot, Sony PlayStation, Moen, and IBM. Brief Summary of Role Appirio Business Analysts (BAs) are tasked with facilitating requirements development sessions to gain an understanding of our customer's current state processes and technology in the CRM space, and supporting implementation work that follows. The BA will elicit current state pain points, and uncover gaps in CRM best practices. From the session output, the BA will lead design, with the delivery team, for a future state solution and be responsible for its approval and decomposition into user stories. When appropriate, they will also produce more detailed supporting materials such as business cases, business process diagrams, wireframes and other context diagrams.  As a Certified Salesforce Consultant, the Appirio BA should efficiently synthesize both technical and business information and present implementation needs and options confidently. The BA presents complex information equally well to a C-level audience or a developer community. The BA has hands on experience implementing Safesforce.com functionality and can act as a knowledgeable liaison between technical teams, testing teams and business stakeholders during the implementation phase. Responsibilities: Business Analysts will work onsite and remotely with customers to elicit and analyze their requirements, develop designs, and implement salesforce.com. Specific areas of concentration include: Build a clear requirements development strategy for each customer engagement.Strong understanding of Salesforce’s capabilities and limitations and can clearly communicate those to customers.Lead discovery workshops, which includes the facilitation of large audiences, solution presentations, and prototype demonstrations.Ability to organize and drive process reengineering sessionsExperience with Org Merge projectsResponsible for identification and inventory of customer process pain points and gaps in best practices.Perform rapid analysis and decomposition of complex business information into technical process components.Perform business process modelling, User experience modeling and basic technical architecture diagramming.Can interpret technical and business strategy roadmaps and apply a detailed technical solution.Comfortable building and demonstrating prototypes in Salesforce.Strong presenter to C Suite level audiences as well as technical teams.Comfortable with heavy involvement in user acceptance test planning.Effectively leverage multiple implementation team types (User experience, Change Management, Global Development Centers, Developer Communities)Has hands on experience in several mid-size, global implementations using salesforce.com in some of the following areas: *System Implementation & Adoption  *Salesforce.com Sales Cloud  *Salesforce.com Service Cloud (including CTI)  *Salesforce.com Marketing Cloud  *Salesforce.com Communities and Mobile  *Salesforce.com Force.com platform development  *Salesforce.com’s Apex programming language Education and Required ExperienceBachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, MIS or equivalent combination of education and experience5+ years experience as a Business Analyst or Systems Consultant for a mid-to-large sized organization, or direct consulting expertise leading sales and marketing transformation projectsExperience with Salesforce.com configurationExperience with Salesforce.com custom developmentExperience with other CRM software (Siebel, Clarify, Vantive, Peoplesoft, NetSuite, RightNow, etc.)Experience developing LOE’s in conjunction with salesStrong presentation and communication skillsFamiliarity with enterprise integration tools and extract, transformation and load (ETL) toolsFamiliarity with application development with Javascript, XML, HTTP, Java, C++, ASP, SQLLocated and able to work in the U.S. from a home office and able to travel up to 40-60%2 out of 3 of the following Salesforce.com consultant certifications; Sales, Service, or Community CloudNOT ELIGIBLE FOR VISA SPONSORSHIPWe are an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer. Minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.
