Name: Services Business Analyst
Description: Applies intermediate level of subject matter knowledge to solve a variety of common business issues. Works on problems of moderately complex scope. Acts as an informed team member providing analysis of information and limited project direction input. Exercises independent judgment within defined practices and procedures to determine appropriate action. Follows established guidelines and interprets policies. Evaluates unique circumstances and makes recommendations. Responsibilities:Formulate and define system scope and objectives using knowledge of information technology and industry knowledge/ requirements.Act as a liaison between client and technical solutions/ support groups, using strong communication skills to elicit, document, analyze and validate business processes, systems, and solution requirements.Research, identify, and specify solutions to problems.Support and conduct visualization, user experience and configuration elements of solution design.Document requirements specifications using high-maturity methods, processes and tools.Support requirements management and change management processes.Support aspects of the business cycle, including proposals, feasibility studies, and implementations.Consider the business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment.Education and Experience Required:Typically a Bachelor's degree in a technical or business discipline or equivalent experience.Minimum of 2 years of related experience or a Master's degree and up to two years of experience.Knowledge and Skills:Ideal candidate must be a recent University/College graduate (within 1 year)2 or more years experience which may have been fulfilled in various roles as a HP intern.Essential: requirements determination using structured techniques for documentation, analysis, evaluation/ validation; decomposition of high- level information into details; abstracting low- level information; distinguishing requests vs needs; distinguishing requirements vs. solutions; classifying/ prioritizing requirements; requirements change management and traceability; identifying risks; applying creativity to solving complex problems; building relationships and working collaboratively; effective verbal/ written communication; experience in an industry domain.Specialized: business rules modeling; develop and executing acceptance test plans.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Financial Analyst  Location  Atlanta, GA  Department  Asset Management  Apply Now Job Title: Financial AnalystSalary Grade: Analyst - 2Department: Primary Asset ManagementPosition Reports to: Team LeaderTrimont Real Estate Advisors is seeking a Financial Analyst to join our energetic team of analysts who work hand in hand with the Asset Managers to provide quality recommendations to our Clients. This role will involve working closely with asset managers, portfolio managers, and the servicing team to provide accurate, timely and consistently high quality services.ResponsibilitiesAnalysis of property level financial statements including Operating Statements, Balance Sheets and rent rolls.Analysis of property operations vs. operating budget and market.Critiquing/tracking of operating and construction budgets.Reconcile and review loan draws for funding of construction, leasing and capital costs.Prepare monthly and/or quarterly reporting packages, including quarterly property valuations.Analysis and interaction with property managers, leasing agents and borrower and client representatives.Conduct property site inspections and market research.Interact professionally with all other employees, customers and organizations.Work effectively as a team contributor on all assignmentRequired Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Real Estate, Business, Finance or Accounting.Working knowledge of complex financial calculations (IRR, ROI, COC, etc).High Level Proficiency in Microsoft Excel.Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills.Ability to multi-task and meet deadlines to exceed expectations of client.A desire to succeed in a team-structured, fast-paced environment.Great attention to detail, analytical mindset and ability to work independently as well as in a team environment. Preferred Qualifications:0-2 years of experience related to commercial real estate preferred.Construction administration experience including lending and investment strategy is a plus.Internship experience in the commercial real estate industry is a plus.Trimont Real Estate Advisors is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud to support and celebrate diversity in the workplace. We are committed to equal consideration for all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. If you have a disability and need an accommodation or assistance with the application process and/or using our website, please email TeamHR@Trimontrea.com . Trimont Real Estate Advisors is a drug-free workplace.Trimont Real Estate Advisors participates in e-verify to verify the employment status of all persons hired to work in the United States.

Name: Research Analyst Real Estate
Description: Are you a Research Analyst looking to do more than just crunch numbers? Are you ready to interface with Clients, Investment Managers and a broad range of internal partners? If so, read on and consider a position in Mercer as a Research Analyst for our Real Estate practice. This is an opportunity to work for a global specialist for private market investments, offering real estate advisory services, customized and pooled investment solutions for institutional investors around the world. You will be part of a team of people dedicated to private market investing in the sub-asset class of real estate. If you career experience and can talk about your qualifications in the following areas submit your resume and lets talk. Responsibilities Deep quantitative analysis of Mercers vendors through developing and maintaining vendor research reports, charts, summary views, detailed analysis. You will spend time one on one with the investment management firms to verify the information they have provided. You can provide qualitative analysis which involves comparing the total returns the Investment Manager is generating against the peer groups information comparing over specific time periods. You can determine if the Investment Managers operate their business ethically and ensure they can provide a quality service as providers to our clients. Preparation and presentation research reports, which is a written communication outlining the strengths and weaknesses of a given strategy and states the recommendation based on that research. Providing support to the global real estate team on select client projects and research assignments, interfacing with real estate investment managers, maintaining file systems such as the Real Estate Boutique Inbox, gathering real estate market data from multiple sources, and assisting with various tasks. Managing the real estate investment pipeline process Maintain Mercer Investments custom software and databases Assist in writing and reviewing real estate research on due diligence performed on investment management firms You will delivers the technical support, along with interpretation of results, and project management to produce required client analysis and reports (including analytics projects, vendor searches, microsite development assistance, strategic work) to the Mercer Leadership team. Qualifications Bachelors degree in finance, real estate, or similar business related degree and/or requisite experience Strong organizational and multi-tasking skills with ability to manage multiple while meeting performance goals and deadlines; exceptional attention to detail and ability to work proactively Possess excellent oral and written communication skills; ability to formulate clear and concise correspondence with internal and external parties Intermediate proficiency with MS office suite to include Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and AdobePro; ability to learn new systems quickly Must be comfortable following up with team members and investment managers to collect and sort requisite data; able to handle sensitive material and maintain highest level of confidentiality Experience with Bloomberg a plus. At Mercer, we make a difference in the lives of more than 110 million people every day by advancing their health, wealth, and careers. Were in the business of creating more secure and rewarding futures for our clients and their employees whether were designing affordable health plans, assuring income for retirement or aligning workers with workforce needs. Using analysis and insights as catalysts for change, we anticipate and understand the individual impact of business decisions, now and in the future. We see peoples current and future needs through a lens of innovation, and our holistic view, specialized expertise, and deep analytical rigor underpin each and every idea and solution we offer. For more than 70 years, weve turned our insights into actions, enabling people around the globe to live, work, and retire well. We embrace a culture that celebrates and promotes the many backgrounds, heritages and perspectives of our colleagues and clients. At Mercer, we say we Make Tomorrow, Today. Visit www.mercer.com for more information and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter @Mercer Marsh & McLennan Companies offers competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits and programs including: health and welfare, tuition assistance, 401K, employee assistance program, domestic partnership benefits, career mobility, employee network groups, volunteer opportunities, and other programs. For more information about our company, please visit us at: http://www.mmc.com/ . We embrace a culture that celebrates and promotes the many backgrounds, heritages and perspectives of our colleagues and clients. For more information, please visit us at: www.mmc.com/diversity . Mercer LLC and its separately incorporated operating entities around the world are part of Marsh & McLennan Companies, a publicly held company (ticker symbol: MMC). Marsh & McLennan Companies and its Affiliates are EOE Minority/Female/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity employers. R_033596-en R_033596

Name: Supervisory Management Analyst
Description: Help  Help  Duties  Summary AREA OF CONSIDERATION: This vacancy announcement is open only to: (1) Current FWS status employees in the competitive service (Block 24 of your SF-50 must show a "1" or "2" and Block 34 must show a "1"); and (2) Current/former Department of the Interior (DOI) LMWFA eligibles (you must submit all SF-50s and performance appraisals for each period of qualifying service). Please see announcement for what documentation must be submitted to be considered under these options.Learn more about this agencyResponsibilities MAJOR DUTIES: Primary duties include but are not limited to:  Serves as the Chief, Branch of Facility Management, within the NWRS Division of Budget and Facilities Management. As such, develops and oversees the implementation of the Region's real property and equipment management program.  Develops and maintains data in the Service Asset Maintenance Management System (SAMMS), Financial Business Management System (FBMS) and Service Application for Material Inspections (SAMI) system to guide management of real property and equipment resources.  Directs and supervises a broad array of information related to the acquisition and management of real property and equipment assets.  Responsible for the accountability of Real Property Inventory and completing assessments for all real property assets.  Responsible for assessing damages from natural disasters and preparing cost replacement estimates of damages to real property assets.  Responsible for the formulation and justification of 5-year construction, transportation and maintenance plans.  Supervises a multi-disciplinary staff in the areas of program analysis, civil engineering, real property and equipment management, and support staff. Travel RequiredOccasional travel - Comprehensive Condition Assessments, natural disaster post assessments, site visits for on-going projects, training, or Regional representation at national meeting Supervisory statusYes Promotion PotentialNone

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Data Analyst Location  US - GA - Atlanta - 1230 Peachtree Street Department  Corporate Solutions Position Type  Full timeApply NowBE agile. BE the expert. Be authentic. Be all that and more at Colliers International. Join our team as a Data Analyst in Atlanta, GA.  At Colliers International, we help leaders succeed by helping them build amazing workplaces, businesses and communities around the world. We do this by thinking differently, sharing innovative ideas and offering a unique and collaborative workplace where you can succeed.  Who you are  You will be a part of the corporate solutions technology team, working within our proprietary system, Colliers 360. You will be responsible for understanding large complex data sets and providing analysis to help clients make strategic real estate decisions. You will work closely with team members and clients to deliver your findings, and work within a deadline driven environment. You will manage and monitor ongoing data imports, and fix defects identified.  What you bring A minimum of 3 years of experience in a data analyst/ intelligence roleAdvanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel – must be comfortable with Pivot Tables, V – Look Ups and other advanced functionsA degree in Computer Science, Finance or BusinessExcellent communicator both written and orally Bonus skills and experience SQL experience is an assetAbility to work in a deadline driven, client facing environment What success looks like A key member of the Corporate Solutions Technology team, you will provide information used to make strategic business decisions to your clients BE who you are and what you want to be with Colliers International. We’d love to meet you. Apply today to join our team.  Direct applicants only please, no agencies.  Colliers International provides equal employment opportunity to all persons. No employee or applicant for employment will be discriminated against because of race, creed, origin, marital status, sexual orientation, age, otherwise qualified disabled or veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.  #LI-NS1

Name: Conflicts Analyst
Description: Greenberg Traurig, a global law firm, currently has an excellent full-time career opportunity for a Conflicts Analyst in our Atlanta (ACE), GA office. Position Summary The Analyst is responsible for working closely with firm attorneys and the Conflict & Intake Director and the Conflicts Manager in connection with the review of new business to identify and facilitate resolution of potential conflicts, business and General Counsel policy issues. This position reports to the Conflicts Manager. Responsibilities Successful candidates will understand legal conflicts, related ethical rules and current developments; review conflict requests and obtain clarity on parties and positions; perform data analysis and identify possible issues or “stop issues”, e.g. General Counsel business and risk policy issues, pending laterals, matters against significant clients, etc. and notify the requesting attorney; evaluate conflict report and clear potential conflicts according to GT policies; communicate directly with GT attorneys to determine legal conflicts or completed matters; document process and keep records of conversation with GT attorneys; track waivers, engagement letters, acknowledgement to close matters, etc.; capture institutional knowledge discovered during conflict resolution; elevate issues to submitting attorney, e.g. non-responsiveness, etc.; and identify and escalate ethical conflicts and unresolved issues to requesting attorney. Qualifications Four or more years’ experience as a Litigation Paralegal, Library Researcher or other comparable position consisting of researching in a legal environment preferred but not required, or business experience in an analytical role. Advanced graduate degree preferably in competitive intelligence, business analysis, research studies or similar; JD desired. Exceptional critical thinking and analytical skills; high level of discretion in handling confidential information; excellent communications and interpersonal skills, detailed oriented with excellent follow through. Must have ability to accept direction and constructive feedback; ability to take ownership and resolve problems. Willingness to work overtime. At Greenberg Traurig, we are committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. It has been, and continues to be our goal, to foster a well-balanced workforce that contains a significant presence of minorities and women.

Name: HR Operations - Global Service Delivery Process Analyst (3 - 5 years exp.)
Description: HR Service Delivery Process Analyst  Job Level - 3-5 years  Job Location - US/ Canada, East Coast strongly preferred  About the role:  As a Human Resources Service Delivery Consultant, you will be responsible for HR service delivery support for your area(s) worldwide. Overall, you will be a key player in helping Avanade HR continuously move towards industry best practice standards, ensure scaling of HR practices, and help ensure compliance with legal requirements, Avanade policies, and audit requirements.  This role will review and be accountable for ensuring HR service delivery meets best practices for core HR processes globally, including metrics and cost factors and help assess current process state against global standards and local requirements. The objective is to be a strong partner to local HR, Service Managers, Content mgmt., Accenture Service Delivery and others to identify opportunities for portal adoption, process improvement, standardization, efficiency, or automation to support the transformation of HR.  This role will be an important escalation point for major service issues and takes a critical role in service issue meetings. Additionally, you will play a key role in the change request process, be an escalation point for major service issues, be responsible for global process documentation/job aids, training and Svc. Center engagement efforts  Day-to-day you will:  -Define and govern global HR processes based on industry best practice and local Avanade practices  -Identify market best practices including Accenture and Microsoft with a view to service excellence, scalability, efficiency, legal and policy compliance  -Benchmark against internal Avanade HR practices as well as best practices in Service center delivery environments  -Establish and evolve core HR metrics and cost/resource factors in partnership with Accenture, our service delivery provider  -Ensure effective monthly service reviews (MSR) with each region facilitating meaningful conversations about services provided, service opportunities, trends, insights, absorption and adoption  -Review/Document/Train and improve "core" HR processes across the organization  -Partner with local HR teams to review existing process workflows and documentation to identify gaps and opportunities to refine process based on global standards and need for local variation  -Create and maintain quick reference guides and other HR job aids and training for HR members worldwide on core HR practices  -Produce and maintain process descriptions, HR tools and job aids, templates etc.  -Continuously improve HR processes in close partnership with regions/areas  -Review/Update HR processes with support from HR Svc. Center teams  -Refine processes based on changes to process model  -Identify opportunities, coordinate and deliver training to HR Svc. Center staff on new/modified processes  -Coordinate and deliver regular communications and connection points with Svc. Centers to ensure a strong partnership and connection as well as a pulse on the engagement of the Svc. Center team  -Support development of global Svc. Center and local HR knowledge base  -Work with regional teams and content mgmt. to ensure existing Ping content is a useful, up-to-date HR and employee resource  -Has a critical role in the change request process, logging CRs, reviewing CRs for prioritization, and partnering as appropriate with local and program teams to ensure process and enhancement details  -Partner with HR+ to identify opportunities and to optimize manual localized HR processes through adoption in Ping other technologies  -Effectively sync with Service Managers regularly to ensure a strong partnership proactively looking for opportunities to enhance services and efficiency.  _An escalation point for major service issues and defects, partnering to ensure proper escalation and management of the issue, communications and ultimately issue/defect fix.QualificationsYears of Experience:  3- 5 years of increasingly diverse or complex HR field or process/consulting experience.  Previous experience in working within an international / off shore delivery environment  Education: Bachelor's degree in HR, Business Management, or related field r experience  Other Skills/Knowledge: HR field experience, ideally in a generalist role within an international environmentQuality-driven, thorough and excellent HR process understandingStrong skills in Business Analysis/Requirements DefinitionProven skills documenting, assessing, and optimizing HR processes across an area.Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills with all HR teams world-wide including strong intercultural skills.Outstanding communication skills, both written and verbalStrong English language skills, other languages a plusExcellent organizational capability. Ability to manage multiple workstreams with competing priorities at any given time.Strong skills in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio)Technical aptitude in Sharepoint for portal, collaboration and automation activities.Ability to succeed in an environment that demands flexibility and offers ambiguity; self driven.Ability to interact with all levels of people. About Avanade  Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital and cloud services, business solutions and design-led experiences delivered through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem. Our professionals bring bold, fresh thinking combined with technology, business and industry expertise to help fuel transformation and growth for our clients and their customers. Avanade has 35,000 digitally connected people across 24 countries, bringing clients the best thinking through a collaborative culture that honors diversity and reflects the communities in which we operate. Learn more at www.avanade.com  More About Avanade  At Avanade, we are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace where our people can be the best at what they do. We are proud be among leading organizations who are taking a stand for gender equity, both in and outside the workplace. This includes teaming with like-minded partners who are as passionate as we are about strengthening the role of women in the workplace, including Women in Technology International, Anita Borg Institute and Catalyst.  Is An Equal Opportunity Employer. Avanade promotes equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, status as a protected disabled or Vietnam Era Veteran, disability, or any other legally protected status. Requisition ID - 57539 Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital and cloud-enabling services, business solutions and design-led experiences, delivered through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem. Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation and has 30,000 professionals in 24 countries. Visit us at www.avanade.com. Show More  Show Less

Name: Systems Analyst
Description: The Georgia Department of Community Health (DCH) is currently procuring the EDS, a large data warehouse and decision support system. DCH is seeking a qualified candidate to serve full-time, on a contract basis, as a Project Integrator for the EDS implementation. The qualified candidate must work efficiently and effectively and possess a variety of skills and experience related to coordinating the implementation efforts between DCH, the Apparent Successful Vendor (ASV), Georgia Technology Authority (GTA) and the affiliated Service Providers (Capgemini, AT&T, IBM) to ensure project success. Additionally, the candidate must be capable of fulfilling the following requirements at a minimum and pursuant to state policies.  Roles and Responsibilities Facilitate the review of Project technical documents, such as the Technical Infrastructure Plan and Solution Design documents to ensure alignment with State technical standards and guidelinesReview the ASV’s technical response for requirements related to the DCH Request for Service (RFS)Develop and submit the DCH RFSCoordinate and obtain input from GTA and the affiliated Service Providers for approval of the DCH RFSEnsure the Integrated Project Plan covers all project activities and resources related to the implementation of the technical architecture for the proposed solution. Facilitate all activities in the plan which include at minimum:Description of work to be performed by each resource, expected deliverables and results, deliverable dates and project milestones, stage gates, risks and cross-vendor dependenciesEnsure meaningful service and performance levelsEnsure accurate metrics are developed to measure Service Provider’s performanceEnsure maintenance of support levelsand response timesDocument performance issues and follow escalation paths as defined in the project planReview all project change requests, communicate them to DCH, the ASV, GTA and the affiliated Service Providers to ensure they are incorporated into the Integrated Project Schedule.Ensure the ASV’s Project Communication Plan includes integration between GTA and the affiliated Service Providers.Ensure the completeness and clarity of the Solution’s technical designServe as SME for the EDS technical solution and system design/architecture and prepare documents, (i.e., schematics, diagrams) detailing solution as implementedMonitor progress of technical solution implementation and report to Project LeaderFacilitate a Technical Architecture Review that includes but is not limited to the following:Evaluate, assess and suggest improvements, if necessary, for the infrastructure design for development, test and production environmentsEvaluate the effectiveness of the Solution’s design in terms of reliability, availability, scalability, security, maintenance and performanceEvaluate, assess and suggest improvements, if necessary, for operations, processes and procedures including Business Continuity and Disaster RecoveryEvaluate the operational manual for industry best practices in terms of database and system backups, batch processes and other operational details as applicable for efficient operation of the system. Required Skills and Experience 5 – 7 years of experience related to:Facilitating the development, testing, and deployment of large data warehouses in a multi-tier data center environment.Management of multiple vendors during the implementation of a large-scale project.Managing technical projects with multiple coinciding or competing priorities and strict timelinesUse of Microsoft Office environment (Power Point, Excel, Word, Visio) in managing projectsDisplays business and technical competenciesExcellent verbal and written communication capabilities, including proactive information dissemination, meeting facilitation and presentations.Demonstrated ability to facilitate meetings and discussions at the senior executive levelAbility to advise business and IT stakeholders in an objective and professional mannerStrong leadership skillsIdentify problems and recommend solutions to maintain target delivery dateSelf-starter and ability work independently with minimal directionAbility to analyze and communicate business and technical needs, user requirements and procedures to ensure compliance with business processes Preferred Skills and Experience Facilitating data center activities for hosting/deploying a data warehouseFunctional knowledge of Data warehousing and integration between different componentsKnowledge and experience in Medicaid, commercial health plans or Health Information Exchange (HIE) systems Education: BA or BS in Business Information Systems, Information Technology, Computer Science or related field AND five (5) years of related experience is preferred.Required Skills Required Experience Job Location  Atlanta, US-GA

Name: Business Analyst, CPQ/CLM - dvisory Services Senior - Performance Improvement - Customer - Sales & Service
Description: Todays companies are experiencing unprecedented digital growth as digital-physical systems, powered by Internet of Things and fuelled by data, create a fully interconnected society. Increasing customer demands require companies to create a seamless experience across all channels. Its an increasingly complex, digitized, fast-changing and interconnected world and as part of the Customer Sales & Service practice, youll help leading companies across industries strategize and execute on their future customer vision and experience.  The opportunity With rapid growth across digital, were looking for people in a wide range of focused areas. So whether youre interested in customer service, customer experience, sales strategy, digital strategy, or social selling, we have a role for you. Whichever you choose, you can expect to work in a truly leading-edge environment, surrounded by some of the most engaging and knowledgeable colleagues in the business. This is also an opportunity to get in on the ground floor as our practice expands and be a part of creating and executing a vision for the future in an entrepreneurial environment within the larger firm.  Your Key Responsibilities In this role, youll work on a dynamic mix of projects helping our clients solve some of their most pressing issues. Working in diverse, inclusive teams to build relationships with our clients, youll deliver innovative high quality work products. As a Senior and Sales Strategist, you will oversee the development of the overall customer sales strategy, execution of that vision and management of client service delivery.  Skills and attributes for success To qualify for the role you must have Experience across multiple full lifecycle technology-enabled business transformations, enabled by CPQ and other front office technologies to help clients reinvent their future state customer sales and service delivery models. Experience in developing following for sales and service : Agile user story development / methodology Business process redesign for lead-to-cash processes Requirements gathering, definition, and prioritization Sales and service operating model design Implementation roadmapping and planning Business case development Change management and business readiness planning Experience in enabling leading-practice CPQ/CLM-related business capabilities, including: product rationalization/simplification, configuration logic design, pricing/discounting logic design and processes, contract simplification/harmonization and design, solution and guided selling process development Specific experience with Apttus or Callidus CPQ implementations Past experience working with IT and business stakeholders to achieve expected outcomes Ability to foster an innovative and inclusive team-oriented work environment. Youll play an active role in managing, counselling, and mentoring junior level consultants Demonstrated understanding of CPQ/CLM and related Lead-to-Order technologies Bachelor's Degree with 2-4 years of work experience in Consulting, Sales, Sales Operations, Customer Service, CPQ/CLM Technologies, Channel Marketing, and/or Customer Experience. A valid passport and US drivers license; willingness and ability to travel estimated 80% both domestically and internationally. Ideally, youll also have Advanced knowledge of industry trends, best practices and technological innovations to refine/evolve sales strategies accordingly. Experience with helping organizations deliver a differentiated channel experience addressing both their sales and service needs. A valid passport and US drivers license; willingness and ability to travel estimated 80% both domestically and internationally. Past experience in consulting, sales operations, customer sales or other relevant experience in a client facing role. What we look for Were seeking passionate leaders with a strong digital vision and a desire to stay on top of both customer experience, customer service, and digital trends across all customer touchpoints and who value diversity and inclusion who team to provide our clients with innovative solutions. If you have a genuine passion for helping clients define and execute on their customer service and future sales vision, EYs Customer Sales & Service Practice could be the next step in your professional journey.  What working at EY offers We offer a competitive compensation package where youll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, both pension and 401(k) plans, a minimum of 15 days of vacation plus ten observed holidays and three paid personal days, and a range of programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:  The opportunity to manage a portfolio of talent within a designated service line A collaborative environment where everyone works together to create a better working world Excellent training and development prospects, both through established programs and on-the-job training An excellent team of accessible senior colleagues, dedicated to managing and varying your workload About EY As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.  If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. Join us in building a better working world.

Name: Business Analyst, Insights - Entertainment and Media Industry Opportunity
Description: Analyst, InsightsCOMPANY SUMMARY: IgnitionOne offers technology and services that help marketers win. The company focuses on intelligent audience creation, real-time cross-channel scoring, and robust optimization providing a layer for smarter marketing decisions and deeper insights, whether you use native IgnitionOne solutions such as Search, Display, Email, and Website Personalization or the marketing technology you already have.  With a global footprint of hundreds of employees in 10 countries, IgnitionOne is one of the largest independent marketing technology companies in the world, currently scoring over 300 million users monthly in 75 countries and powering more than $60 billion in revenue each year for leading brands, including General Motors, CenturyLink , La Quinta and Acer, as well as advertising agencies such as 360i, GroupM and ZenithOptimedia.  Work in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment alongside some of the smartest thought leaders in advertising technology. Be the member of a team that delivers innovative marketing technology that simplifies marketers lives and drives performance to new heights. Have fun collaborating on ground-breaking, challenging assignments where your opinion matters, you grow professionally and high performers are recognized and rewarded. And join a company on the cutting edge of digital marketing and technology that is regularly honored with awards and has been featured in major news media such as WSJ, NYT, Bloomberg, AdAge, ADWEEK and more. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Accelerate delivery of Automotive, Retail, & Hospitality industry insights across all IgnitionOne channels  Lead initiatives to improve existing marketing industry reports and jumpstart implementation of a commercial automotive analytics offering  For our largest accounts, hone analytics strategy and develop insights roadmap aligned to client goals  Build automated templates for common client deliverables in Tableau / Excel / Powerpoint  Validate and QA global site personalization data and play a leading role in data stewardship (i.e. getting the data right)  Primary vertical focus in automotive industry and functional focus on website personalization  Serve as a thought leader for the Automotive industry, both internally and externally EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS REQUIRED: 3 -5 years of experience in digital analytics / digital media / marketing analytics  Bachelors degree in business, marketing, statistics, computer science, economics, psychology, or related field  Fluent in SQL, Python, and R and data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau)  Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint)  Ability to translate complicated data sets and technical queries / models into actionable insights for clients  Excellent verbal and written communication skills - ability to clearly explain complex concepts and statistics in simple terms  Strong attention to detail, demonstrates initiative, and facility operating independently and working collaboratively across time zones with global cross-functional teams  Core skill set in establishing priorities while working on multiple assignments, active management of expectations, and delivering against tight timelines  Critical thinker who is constantly looks for ways to improve own skillset and meaningfully contribute to the broader team / organization IDEAL CANDIDATE: Balanced mix between technical / coding skills and business fluency  MBA, Masters, or PHD in related field a plus  Passion for digital marketing, analytics, and driving actionable insights  Fluency in Spark, Scala, and other Big Data tools a plus  Familiarity with range of analytic approaches (linear / non-linear regression, Bayesian, clustering, etc.) and AI / Machine Learning concepts a plus  Prior experience in consulting and structured hypothesis driven approach a plus  Prior experience in Mar Tech, Ad Tech and understanding of DMPs (e.g. BlueKai, etc.) / attribution models a plus

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Job Description Finance is all about the numbers…unless you work at Amazon; it’s knowing the numbers and so much more. Enthusiasm and energy help us deliver new ideas, and solutions. Do you view problems as treasures, and are you willing to dive deep to develop those solutions and deliver results? Will you seek to challenge the status quo, and accept that your ideas and mechanisms may be tested daily? At Amazon, we move with purpose and speed, and this requires we work with a dynamic network of Operations, HR, Tech and Retail partners. We help others understand finance and are *the* trusted business advisors by employing every facet of data and communication to ensure our partners and our leaders have the most up to date and reliable information to help them make the best possible decision. Come teach us a few things, and we’ll teach you a few things as we navigate the most customer-centric company on Earth.This is a perfect position for someone who knows how to work fast and smart. Your experience has taught you how to avoid sticky predicaments, and you are good about avoiding the mess, sooner rather than later. You know which details make all the difference, and which ones don’t add value. You know the difference between spending time wisely and wasting time.Job Responsibilities include:Expertise collecting, analyzing and managing quantitative data and creating meaningful analyses to lead business improvement and cost reductionsRoot cause analysis and uncovering core issues using data, then assisting the Transportation team improve and create new measures for productivityManage the development of all planning, forecasting, and reporting models and their continuous innovation and communicating to your Operations partnersWork with data source providers and technology teams to ensure that key decision data is accurate, automated and timely.Basic Qualifications * BA/BS degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, Engineering and/or similar discipline with analytical bias* 5+ years relevant experience in positions that require analysis and reporting financial results* Experience in Excel (macros, index, conditional list, arrays, pivots, lookups)* Demonstrated financial acumen and/or analytical experience delivering forecasting, budgeting, and variance analysis, and data interpretation of results* 4+ years of experience performing financial and ad hoc analysis using data reporting toolsPreferred Qualifications * MBA and/or Professional certification (CPA/CMA/Qualified Accounting certificate) + relevant experience* Management experience with demonstrated leadership skills with proven ability to take on new assignments* 1+ years of proven familiarity with concepts of U.S. Generally Accepted Accounting Principles* Advanced experience demonstrating problem solving and root cause analysis* Highly analytical, detail oriented and strong business sense; proven ability to manage new ideas and creative solutions and demonstrated experience managing such mechanisms to an end result* Ability to manage tight deadlines, prioritize workload and achieve effective results in a fast-paced, dynamic, ever-growing and often ambiguous environment; effective multi-tasking skills are vital* Demonstrated effective communication and presentation skills working with multiple peer groups and senior levels of management* Experience working with large-scale data mining and reporting tools (i.e. SQL, MSAccess, Essbase and/or Cognos) and other financial systems (i.e. Oracle, SAP, Lawson, JD Edwards), providing solutions based on results of ad hoc analyses to senior management for strategic decision-making* Previous transportation experience a plus* Career progression and willingness to relocate for advancement opportunitiesAmazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual OrientationApply Now at Amazon

Actively participates in cross-functional groups to solve problems across conflicting projects.Strong interpersonal skillsDetailed, organized: be able to manage multiple projects at any given time and move them forward concurrently based on the priority and the business needsACCOUNTABILITIES:Analyze, define, and document complex requirements and business processes.Develop complex systems specifications, process flow, and conversion strategies.Create complex technical and functional user documentation.Contribute to the development of new tools, processes, and solutions to meet desired product needs.Follow established business processes, protocols, and quality standards in the development and deployment of complex solutions.Maintain stakeholder expectations and raise appropriate issues to upper management as necessary.Develop “trusted advisor” relationship with senior stakeholders through effective communication and efficient, quality execution on projects.Gather business requirements and translate them into user stories/functional specifications.Identify and document process improvements and functional specifications based on research of best practices and analysis of work group data.Perform analysis on existing systems; identifying options for potential solutions and assess for both technical and business suitability.Work between remote development teams, internal IT, and business to ensure requirements are being met.Work with Tech Lead and/or Development resource to finalize the implementation design to meet the business requirementsCreate data mapping table to illustrate the data communication and storageCreate Functional Requirement Specification (FRS) including business requirements and high level design approach with screen shot illustrationCoordinate between the internal development team and business stakeholders (clarify requirements, manage change requests), other development teams (interface implementation), QA team (resolve defects timely), and PMO project manager (status updates, issue resolution, change control) to implement the project on agreed scheduleConduct User Acceptance Testing where applicableCoordinate release for each impacted component timelyKeep project stakeholders and upper management informed of project progress and issuesPerform production support duty and turn over the project to Operations team when production is stabilizedAll other duties as assigned. Name: Intelligence Analyst (35F)
Description: Intelligence Analyst (35F) EnlistedOfficerActive DutyArmy ReserveEntry Level Overview The intelligence analyst is primarily responsible for the analysis, processing and distribution of strategic and tactical intelligence. They are integral to providing Army personnel with information about enemy forces and potential battle areas. Job Duties Prepare all-source intelligence products to support the combat commanderAssess the significance and reliability of incoming information with current intelligenceEstablish and maintain systematic, cross-reference intelligence records and files Requirements Those who want to serve must first take the Armed Services Vocational Aptitude Battery, a series of tests that helps you better understand your strengths and identify which Army jobs are best for you. Training Job training for an intelligence analyst requires 10 weeks of Basic Combat Training and 16 weeks of Advanced Individual Training with on-the-job instruction. Part of this time is spent in the classroom and in the field. Some of the skills you’ll learn are:Critical thinkingPreparing maps, charts and intelligence reportsMilitary symbologyUsing computer systems Helpful Skills Interest in reading maps and chartsGathering information and studying its meaningAbility to think, speak and write clearlyRequired ASVAB Score(s)Skilled Technical (ST): 101Learn more about the ASVAB and see what jobs you could qualify for. Compensation Total compensation includes housing, medical, food, special pay, and vacation time. Learn more about total compensation. Earn Cash For In Demand Jobs You could earn up to $40,000 in cash bonuses just for enlisting under certain Military Occupational Specialties. Visit Jobs in Demand to see if this job qualifies for an enlistment bonus. Education Benefits In the Army, qualified students can earn full-tuition, merit-based scholarships, allowances for books and fees, plus an annual stipend for living expenses. Learn more about education benefits. Future Civilian Careers The skills you learn will help prepare you for a career in research, business planning and even government agencies such as the Central Intelligence Agency. PARTNERSHIP FOR YOUTH SUCCESS (PaYS) Program Those interested in this job may be eligible for civilian employment, after the Army, by enrolling in the Army PaYS program. The PaYS program is a recruitment option that guarantees a job interview with military friendly employers that are looking for experienced and trained Veterans to join their organization. Find out more about the Army PaYS Program at http://www.armypays.com.AAI CORPORATIONCONCURRENT TECHNOLOGIESGENERAL DYNAMICS LAND SYSTEMSLOCKHEED MARTINURS

Name: Business Systems Analyst - SAP Production Planning and Materials Management
Description: Tracking Code 3154-159 Job Description Graphic Packaging International, LLC, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Graphic Packaging Holding Company (NYSE: GPK), is committed to providing consumer packaging that makes a world of difference. Headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, we are a leading global provider of paper-based packaging solutions for a wide variety of products to food, beverage, foodservice and other consumer products companies. We are one of the largest producers of folding cartons and hold a leading market position in solid unbleached sulfate, coated unbleached kraft and coated recycled paperboard. Graphic Packaging’s customers include some of the most widely recognized companies in the world.We achieve our vision by delivering value to our customers, building a high-performance culture for our employees, creating superior returns for our shareholders, and being an environmentally responsible leader in our industry and in the communities where we operate. Graphic Packaging has approximately 17,000 employees working in more than 60 locations in North and South America, Europe and the Pacific Rim. We are committed to workplace diversity and offer compensation and benefit programs that are among the best in the industry to reward the talented people who make our company successful. We invite you to review the following employment opportunity and to learn more about us at www.graphicpkg.com.Mission:As an expert in SAP Production Planning and Materials Management modules and processes, the mission of this position is to analyze business issues and to identify projects and technologies which will enable significant operational improvements in the corporation’s supply chain and manufacturing planning functions. The Analyst formulates and defines systems scope and objectives based on both business needs and a solid understanding of industry requirements and best practices. In addition, the Analyst may function as a project manager to coordinate and facilitate the work of cross-functional company resources assigned to technology projects. This position may also assist in routine maintenance for specific modules in the company’s suite of business applications. This position collaborates with business process owners to foster a positive IT customer relations environment.Essential Job Functions:The SAP Business Systems Analyst is responsible for the following functions:Define information business systems requirements jointly working with management and professional staff in user departments. Technical solutions must satisfy the business needs for the future, i.e., take into account Company growth and customer service objectives.Develop working relationships with a diverse group of business people and gain an understanding of the complex nature of the Company’s business. Maintain familiarity with the business plans of the Company and the departments serviced. Remain knowledgeable of information technology and Company business operations.Responsible for assisting user and IT management in setting priorities within the supply chain and manufacturing planning area and work with IT Leadership to communicate with senior management.Work with more experienced Business Systems Analysts. Participate on project team, completing individual responsibilities, providing input on resources needed, and consulting schedule to ensure timely completion of project and meeting deadlines of project. Familiar with the systems scope and project objectives, as well as the role and function of each team member in order to effectively complete the activities of the work team.Provide support for designated application systems. Augment and facilitate the design, development, implementation of enhancements to existing business systems.Provide guidance in creating standards, testing procedures, version control, etc. Maintain a professional awareness of tools and techniques that might be used to improve the quality of service.Other duties as assigned - Project ManagementEnsures all projects are executed in accordance to established GPI IT governance practicesFoster cross-functional relationships inter- and intra-departmentally for effective project managementExecute assigned projects and track the completion of major milestonesEducational Requirements:Background / Experience:4-year college degree in general or IT-Related field required. Equivalent work experience considered.Specialized or technical knowledge:4+ years IT experience including 2 years in SAP PP and MM modules. Experience in both implementation and application support is desired. General experience should include systems architecture and business processes similar to those at GPI. 1 year project management experienceExperience in SAP discrete production order process requiredExperience in SAP repetitive manufacturing process requiredExperience in SAP MRP process requiredExperience in SAP PP Master Data (materials, BOM, routings, work centers requiredExperience in SAP PP-PI a plusExperience in SAP variant config a plusExperience in shop floor reporting/interfaces requiredExperience in production scheduling required Experience in SCM/APO a plusExperience in SAP capacity planning a plusExperience in SAP SOP or IBP process a plusOther Required Skills:Strong understanding of business operations and best industry practicesDemonstrated perceptual and analytical thinkingExcellent interpersonal communication skills and ability to translate technical information into language non-technical people will understandExperience effectively working in an organization of senior professionalsAbility to identify deficiencies in technical work and implementation plans, and to identify schedule conflictsFortitude to demand excellence from self and othersBusiness process mapping and flow charting expertiseTenacity to set and achieve complex objectives from multiple teams in order to meet business objective, and to effectively manage cross-functional resourcesGraphic Packaging is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All candidates will be evaluated on the basis of their qualifications for the job in question. Name: Business Analyst, CPQ/CLM - dvisory Services Senior - Performance Improvement - Customer - Sales & S
Description: Business Analyst, CPQ/CLM - dvisory Services Senior - Performance Improvement - Customer - Sales & Service  Advisory  Requisition # UNI00CR5  Post Date Nov 13, 2018  Today?s companies are experiencing unprecedented digital growth as digital-physical systems, powered by Internet of Things and fuelled by data, create a fully interconnected society. Increasing customer demands require companies to create a seamless experience across all channels. It?s an increasingly complex, digitized, fast-changing and interconnected world and as part of the Customer Sales & Service practice, you?ll help leading companies across industries strategize and execute on their future customer vision and experience. *The opportunity** With rapid growth across digital, we?re looking for people in a wide range of focused areas. So whether you?re interested in customer service, customer experience, sales strategy, digital strategy, or social selling, we have a role for you. Whichever you choose, you can expect to work in a truly leading-edge environment, surrounded by some of the most engaging and knowledgeable colleagues in the business. This is also an opportunity to get in on the ground floor as our practice expands and be a part of creating and executing a vision for the future in an entrepreneurial environment within the larger firm. *Your Key Responsibilities** In this role, you?ll work on a dynamic mix of projects helping our clients solve some of their most pressing issues. Working in diverse, inclusive teams to build relationships with our clients, you?ll deliver innovative high quality work products. As a Senior and Sales Strategist, you will oversee the development of the overall customer sales strategy, execution of that vision and management of client service delivery. *Skills and attributes for success***To qualify for the role you must have** + Experience across multiple full lifecycle technology-enabled business transformations, enabled by CPQ and other front office technologies to help clients reinvent their future state customer sales and service delivery models.  + Experience in developing following for sales and service :  + Agile user story development / methodology  + Business process redesign for lead-to-cash processes  + Requirements gathering, definition, and prioritization  + Sales and service operating model design  + Implementation roadmapping and planning  + Business case development  + Change management and business readiness planning  + Experience in enabling leading-practice CPQ/CLM-related business capabilities, including: product rationalization/simplification, configuration logic design, pricing/discounting logic design and processes, contract simplification/harmonization and design, solution and guided selling process development  + Specific experience with Apttus or Callidus CPQ implementations  + Past experience working with IT and business stakeholders to achieve expected outcomes  + Ability to foster an innovative and inclusive team-oriented work environment. You?ll play an active role in managing, counselling, and mentoring junior level consultants  + Demonstrated understanding of CPQ/CLM and related Lead-to-Order technologies  + Bachelor's Degree with 2-4 years of work experience in Consulting, Sales, Sales Operations, Customer Service, CPQ/CLM Technologies, Channel Marketing, and/or Customer Experience.  + A valid passport and US driver?s license; willingness and ability to travel estimated 80% both domestically and internationally. *Ideally, you?ll also have** + Advanced knowledge of industry trends, best practices and technological innovations to refine/evolve sales strategies accordingly.  + Experience with helping organizations deliver a differentiated channel experience addressing both their sales and service needs.  + A valid passport and US driver?s license; willingness and ability to travel estimated 80% both domestically and internationally.  + Past experience in consulting, sales operations, customer sales or other relevant experience in a client facing role. *What we look for** We?re seeking passionate leaders with a strong digital vision and a desire to stay on top of both customer experience, customer service, and digital trends across all customer touchpoints and who value diversity and inclusion who team to provide our clients with innovative solutions. If you have a genuine passion for helping clients define and execute on their customer service and future sales vision, EY?s Customer Sales & Service Practice could be the next step in your professional journey. *What working at EY offers** We offer a competitive compensation package where you?ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, both pension and 401(k) plans, a minimum of 15 days of vacation plus ten observed holidays and three paid personal days, and a range of programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:  + The opportunity to manage a portfolio of talent within a designated service line  + A collaborative environment where everyone works together to create a better working world  + Excellent training and development prospects, both through established programs and on-the-job training  + An excellent team of accessible senior colleagues, dedicated to managing and varying your workload *About EY** As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. *If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.***Join us in building a better working world. Apply now.** EY, an equal employment opportunity employer (Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Disabled), values the diversity of our workforce and the knowledge of our people. .

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Working at ICFWorking at ICF means applying a passion for meaningful work with intellectual rigor to help solve the leading issues of our day. Smart, compassionate, innovative, committed, ICF employees tackle unprecedented challenges to benefit people, businesses, and governments around the globe. We believe in collaboration, mutual respect, open communication, and opportunity for growth. If you’re seeking to make a difference in the world, visit www.icf.com/careers to find your next career. ICF—together for tomorrow.Health, Environment, Analytics, Resilience & Social PolicyHealth, Research, Informatics and TechnologyAtlanta, GAAre you passionate about improving quality of life through disease prevention and health promotion? Then consider ICF. We work at the forefront of today’s global health issues, helping clients understand the specific needs of diverse populations and address complex health challenges with behavior and disease surveillance and monitoring, research and surveys, training and technical assistance, and informatics and systems.Job Description:ICF has an opening for a Data Analyst. Performing in the role of a Syndromic Data Analyst II, in conjunction with CDC staff. The analyst shall analyze, or interpret BioSense Platform data utilizing ESSENCE software deployed on the Platform, SAS and/or RStudio, and may be required to leverage external information sources, such as public health event reports, for interpretation of analytical results. The Syndromic Data Analyst may be required to produce and analyze reports, identify topics for analysis, conduct ad hoc investigations or analyses to be included in standard reports. The Syndromic Data Analyst will need the ability to quickly comprehend public health threats and leverage available analysis tools against existing BioSense Platform data sources to meet situation awareness reporting needs, and share expertise with other programmers and staff members. Duties will include:Monitoring daily analytic output of the syndromic surveillance systems hosted in the BioSense Platform environment utilizing the ESSENCE interface and other analytic tools (SAS, R, SQL) to identify and characterize potential public health events of interest.Performing “Enhanced Surveillance” analysis and report generation to support CDC needs for event-specific surveillance utilizing CDC-provided reporting formats or templates.Supporting the CDC and NSSP during events such as declared public health emergencies, Events of National Significance or environmental threats to public health.Closely collaborate with NSSP, CDC program, or jurisdictional partner staff as needed to provide syndromic surveillance support that may include reports and analysis.Participate/collaborate with NSSP, CDC program staff to produce analysis and reports for publication.Perform in a Syndromic Surveillance leadership role to guide and instruct other staff in syndromic surveillance.Basic Qualifications:Masters in Public Health2 years of experience in Epidemiology2 years of Survey Research experienceProfessional Skills:Ability to work independentlyStrong analytical, problem-solving and decision making capabilities based on use of dataExcellent English verbal and written communication skillsDemonstrated ability to work effectively in cross-cultural situations and developing country environmentsProficiency in MS Office Applications (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, Excel)ICF offers an excellent benefits package, an award winning talent development program, and fosters a highly skilled, energized and empowered workforce. ICF is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity at all levels. (EOE – Minorities/Females/ Protected Veterans Status/Disability Status/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity)Working at ICFWorking at ICF means applying a passion for meaningful work with intellectual rigor to help solve the leading issues of our day. Smart, compassionate, innovative, committed, ICF employees tackle unprecedented challenges to benefit people, businesses, and governments around the globe. We believe in collaboration, mutual respect, open communication, and opportunity for growth. ICF—together for tomorrow.About ICFICF (NASDAQ:ICFI) is a global consulting and technology services provider with more than 5,000 professionals focused on making big things possible for our clients. We are business analysts, policy specialists, technologists, researchers, digital strategists, social scientists and creatives. Since 1969, government and commercial clients have worked with ICF to overcome their toughest challenges on issues that matter profoundly to their success. Come engage with us at icf.com.Georgia Client Office (GA88)

Name: Public Health Data Analyst
Description: PRISM seeks a Research Data Analyst to provide data management and epidemiologic support to research projects focused on HIV prevention programs and app-based interventions. In addition to database development/management, the individual would be responsible for development of data collection tools, performing QA/QC, exporting data, creating reports and conducting basic statistical analyses for epidemiologic studies in SAS. Key Job Functions:Manage day to day research and programmatic activities as they relate to database development and database management for research projects and programsProgram web-based surveys in Survey GizmoSetup case report form (CRF) database using DataFax tools in LinuxEdit check programming, query management using DataFaxGenerate data reports and materials for site management using SASPrepare usable datasets, perform QC, and monitor data from mobile apps created by various developersDevelop creative solutions independently or as part of a team to solve data issues and facilitate study managementMaintain, repair, manage, and update databases; provide programming for projects on an ongoing basisManage data sets and conduct data cleaning to facilitate data export to statistics packages.Create Standard Operating Procedures with respect to database management and database development. Develop best practices for data collection and storageConduct basic statistical analyses for epidemiological studiesOther duties as assigned JOB DESCRIPTION: Creates and maintains a data dictionary and meta data. Supports efforts to ensure that data standards are developed and maintained. Ensures that the uses of data through reports and queries are accurate. Supports business and system re-engineering and architecture development to define future data needs. Serves as an organizational consultant on matters relating to databases by providing expertise to assist users in meeting their needs. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Two years of experience in processes and standards related to data OR a bachelor's degree.  Excellent working knowledge of SAS. Experience with other programming languages a plus. Experience working with relational database structures such as Microsoft Access, SQL, or other form collection tools Experience in generating SAS-based reports using a variety of methods (e.g., PROC REPORT, PROC TABULATE, macros, ODS) and exporting those reports to other formats such as Microsoft Excel, PDF, and HTML. Knowledge of web-based survey development in Survey Gizmo or similar tools such as ACASI, Qualtrics, RedCAP, etc. Experience working with DataFax for CRF data management Outstanding organizational skills, ability to work with quantitative data, basic understanding of epidemiology and biostatistics, familiarity with epidemiologic/medical terminology Able to handle multiple tasks at once; meet deadlines, familiar with databases, detailed, flexible, able to manage relationships Demonstrated experience contributing data analysis to manuscripts and reports to funding agencies Experience with work related to HIV, sexual minorities, and social/sexual behavior Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to foster a good working relationship on team and multisite studies-73345BR

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Our client, a leading provider of computing, applications management, IT procurement, network, and telecommunications services to public organizations, is looking to hire a Data Analyst. Key Responsibilities . Work with district leadership, school leadership, and the Office of Safety and Security and school leadership to provide actionable data on student behavior for improving student outcomes. . Develop, manage, and maintain the research database for the initiative. . Work with external stakeholders to acquire relevant data and key metrics for the initiative. . Develop data collection and sharing practices to ensure all parties adhere to client and grant partner policies. . Participate in a variety of planning and development activities to assist in creating short-term and long-term plans for Safety & Security support throughout the district. (e.g., planning meetings, committees, user interviews, quality assurance testing, etc.) . . Prepare materials in both printed and electronic formats for the purpose of database documentation, records management and retention, and evaluating program outcomes. (e.g., state and local compliance reports, technical specifications, user manuals, training guides, memos, procedures, project documentation, data/process flow charts, etc.). . Name: Business Analyst - EPMO
Description: This role will be part of the Enterprise Program Management Office (EPMO). This role will lead a variety of strategic initiatives & projects that are designed to realize synergies and significant impact across the Veritiv enterprise. EPMO will be driving multiple projects for the Optimization phase for Veritiv.  This role will identify issues, analyze the situation and available data and evaluate & propose solutions for business issues through application of problem solving techniques including Six Sigma methodology, continuous improvement and standard business processes and practices. Develop options for resolving issues that may include business process efficiencies, structural changes, risk analysis and implementation plans. This will involved ideitfying and analyzing current state business conditions / processes and deficiencies and implementing improvement projects through cross-functional team involvement. This may involve analyzing reports and determine cost reduction techniques. Provide expertise in Six Sigma analytical/statistical tools to management, process owners, users, and key stakeholders on effectiveness of controls and recommend procedural changes. Program Management Under the guidance of the Manager - EPMO Programs, this role will support senior leaders and business owners by addressing specific business challenges by developing problem statements, defining solutions, identifying detailed implementation plans including specific tasks, task owners, sequencing and duration required to take strategic initiatives from concept through execution. The type of projects that this role will help will include: defining and implementing inbound load policy, NetOps, WMS implementation, cost change management initiative, NIR initiative, driving preferred supplier and CDI policies, defining and implementing Veritiv’s return policy, etc.  Provide program management & process support for assigned projects by applying process, organizational, financial, business, strategy and project knowledge to help assess improvement opportunities and help define and deliver solutions. Provide objective advice, expertise and specialist skills with the aim of creating value, maximizing growth or improving the business performance of key Veritiv processes. Participate or lead with the assessment of potential new projects. Job Responsibilities: This position will be responsible for driving and supporting multiple work streams with several interdependent functions, organizations with a variety of stake holders. The key to success for this role is the utilizing following competencies- problem solving leadership, analytical skills, verbal and written communications, executive presence, and driving consensus. quantify the business case supporting the strategic initiative and execute the projects on budget and on timeReport on risks, issues, and barriers to successful execution of initiatives required to deliver value creation targets.Implement change management strategy and support for specific strategic Veritiv integration initiatives including:Interventions / solutions intended to create alignment, Name: Financial Analyst - FP&A
Description: I believe my work is my calling.  Compassionate care, uncompromising service and clinical excellence that's what our patients have come to expect from our clinicians. Kindred at Home, a division of Kindred Healthcare Inc., is the nation's leading provider of comprehensive home health, hospice, and non-medical home care services.  Kindred at Home, and its affiliates, delivers compassionate, high-quality care to patients and clients in their homes or places of residence, including non-medical personal assistance, skilled nursing and rehabilitation and hospice and palliative care. Our caregivers focus on each unique patient to deliver the appropriate care and emotional support to our patients and their families.  As a Financial Analyst - FP&A you will prepare financial analyses/budgets and act as a liaison to management for the interpretation of financial data.
