Name: Financial Analyst - LATAM
Description: Job Description SummaryReporting directly to the Finance Director International, the Financial Analyst for Latin America will be the senior financial advisor to the leader of this business as well as support financial analyst to International Business SVP. The Financial Analyst participates directly in the formulation of strategic and tactical business plans and objectives and helps to ensure proper processes and procedures are developed to keep the business on track to deliver on its financial commitments. As the finance partner to the business leader and an integral member of the cross-functional leadership team, the individual will be responsible for providing insightful analysis, forward thinking recommendations, as well as financial advice and counsel in the development and implementation of business strategies and objectives to drive growth in these businesses. In addition, the individual will be expected to present financial information in business reviews with International Business SVP and Internal Finance Director.Key customers for this position are the International Business SVP, LATAM Business Leader and International finance leader. Customers require active participation in the ongoing management of the business including timely and accurate analysis of the business and financial impacts to facilitate sound decisions.Job DescriptionPrincipal Accountabilities:Provide management with financial advice and counsel on all pertinent business matters by supplying ongoing, timely and meaningful financial analysis, both routine and as needed, of its results, capital expenditures and expenses.Provide a source of business knowledge and problem-solving capabilities to assure sound analyses, recommendations, and actionable programs arising from assignments involving a wide range of business or financial problems. Perform financial analyses on business opportunities to assure optimal business results, growth, and sound programs and investments.Prepare and evaluate financial targets and business plans and analyze profit and loss statements and balance sheets to help ensure profitable operations and consistency with sound business management.Coordinate, review, or develop strategic requests and support them with financial evaluations to ensure timely and profitable business decisions, and complete audits of projects to determine profitability and achievement or original objectives. Also, ensure project requests meet CFI and senior management expectations in terms of clear, concise and complete presentation and communication.Facilitate job process changes to improve efficiency within the team. Also, enhance the position by thoroughly reviewing all the various activities performed in order to improve the quality and productivity of his/her own work and services provided.Demonstrate a commitment to quality performance through personal example by adopting a customer-based philosophy in the level of service provided. Demonstrate a leadership style amongst Finance peers and mentor more junior analysts.Communicate fully with superiors, subordinates, and others who have need to know. Be informative. Communicate in a way that is timely, yet prompt; complete, yet concise; and clear, yet responsive.Contribute to an environment in which all team members are respected regardless of their individual differences and are motivated to improve both their individual and team contributions to achieve desired business results.Minimum Qualifications:Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in an analysis role; preferably with healthcare experienceBachelor’s degree in Finance, Business or other related fieldStrong project management skills – ability to deal with multiple tasks and prioritize effectivelyAbility to interact, communicate, and influence at senior levels and operate across culturesBroad understanding of finance, economics, business management, business/strategic planningStrong problem solving skills and balanced conceptual and pragmatic thinkingSelf-starter/ ability to work independentlyAvanos Medical is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.If you are a current employee of Avanos or Halyard Health, please apply here.

Name: Financial Analyst III
Description: Job Purpose: Develop and compile financial data and conduct often complex analyses, reconciliations and projections in support of an academic, research or administrative unit. Prepare a full range of financially related reports. Areas of involvement may include costs studies, budget forecasts and pricing. May provide work direction to other financial and accounting personnel. Major Responsibilities:Define project scope based on general assignment.Develop and organize data required for projects; determine approach and develop project parameters.Perform or oversee required data entry, calculations, estimates, reconciliations, etc. consistent with project parameters.Prepare and present project results.Provide explanations of methodology employed as required.Remain current on financial reporting requirements, applicable regulations, processes, etc.May provide work direction to lower level financial personnel.Perform other related duties as assigned.Basic Qualifications:Education: Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Business, Finance, or related field or equivalent combination of education and experienceWork Experience: Minimum of four years in professional level accounting/finance related field.Certifications: N/ASkills: Specialized skills required for this job: Application of accounting and financial reporting principles and practices; advanced financial analysis and forecasting techniques; use of specialized financial/accounting related software; project organization and management; communications and presentation skillsPreferred Qualifications:Preferred Education: MBAPreferred Work Experience: N/APreferred Certifications: Professional certification in accounting or financial analysis.Preferred Skills: Application of specialized skills within a university or government agency environment; ability to apply knowledge of regulations and reporting requirements specific to area of involvement.Additional Information: This position is on the Business Operations team and supports a range of financial processes and compliance activities. This position will have primary responsibility for reviewing system, process, and policy exceptions, including T&E, labor and leave, procurement, and project maintenance. In addition, this position will create periodic metric and financial reports, and provide policy and process guidance to lab researchers, administrative staff, and lab leadership.As part of the GTRI-Accounting Lab Business Operations team, this job is also responsible for reviewing/approving the following financial transactions: procurement requisitions, PCard expenses, and Travel and Expense requests during peak periods or when a Lab Business Operations team has an extended absence or vacancy. This position also serves as a back-up for the Director of Business Operations and will be responsible for special projects and support for external audit activities.Successful candidate must be able to pass a background check which will include a credit check. Please visit http://www.policylibrary.gatech.edu/pre-employment-screening to obtain GT's background and credit policy. Impact & Influence: This position will interact on a consistent basis with: campus financial personnel. This position typically will advise and counsel: campus financial personnel

Name: Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence- Boomerang
Description: Req ID: ****** The Turner Story  Turner is a division of WarnerMedia along with our sister companies, HBO and Warner Bros. We are better known as the folks who bring you CNN, HLN, TCM, TNT, tbs, Adult Swim, Cartoon Network, Turner Sports, truTV and so much more! From cutting-edge breaking news stories, up-to-the-minute sports coverage, and the characters we grew up loving on to the shows we love today, Turner continues to be the gold standard in first class television programming and a demonstrated leader in digital content. We tell the stories the world wants to hear. Won't you be a part of our story? **************  See what it's like to work at Turner! Follow us on Instagram, Twitter and Facebook  What part will you play?  The Senior Analyst of Business Intelligence (BI) for Boomerang will play a key role within Boomerang's Data and Analytics group - working closely with stakeholders and executive leadership to understand key business drivers around acquisition, engagement and retention. Boomerang is a joint venture between Turner and Warner Brothers and this role will need to recognize the many interests that will need to be considered to support these business drivers. The Senior Analyst will be responsible for providing research, modeling, analysis and guidance using modeling and Data Sciences techniques to develop business solutions that effectively support the business model. Solutions typically involve formulating, designing and developing decision support models, proofs-of-concept, and prototypes to solve complex business problems or processes.  The Senior Analyst of BI will use their knowledge of product analytics, marketing lifecycle economics, audience analysis and engagement pattern finding and time series analysis to work with a broad set of business partners. Appreciation for data quality, data shaping and inferential statistics will be required to uncover insights for improving and accelerating decision making across all aspects of Boomerang.  What will you be doing?  Goals & Tasks Synthesize daily, weekly, monthly and ad hoc data points into purposeful cause-and-effect analysis; distinguished candidates will be able to modify communications based on audience (un)familiarity.  Lead and deploy the data quality and audit practices on enterprise data sets.  Lead the monitoring of product performance: subscription health; subscriber lifecycle; churn analysis; audience segmentation and engagement and, have a clear understanding of campaign effectiveness for paid, earned and owned media.  Lead and develop sensor systems to identify the early signs of performance shortfall.  Communicate and escalate urgency commensurate to business impact(s).  Work with leadership to provide clear and understandable metrics/analyses that enable stakeholders to make data-informed decisions.  Serve as the internal SME for marketing science techniques: classification modeling; segmentation, simulation and time series analysis.  Consider yourself a necessary business player in a start-up product where your role is critical to ensuring that the product / business stakeholders are asking the right performance questions and answering these questions with accurately and appropriately.  Based in Atlanta, this role will require limited travel to work with various stakeholder teams and present findings to stakeholder groups primarily located in New York, Philadelphia and Burbank.  What do we require from you?  This role requires an MS-level understanding of inferential statistics and commercial experience communicating advanced statistical concepts to less initiated audiences.  An MS degree in economics, mathematics, applied statistics, engineering, analytics or data science; PhD preferred.  Commercial programming experience with SAS (or R), Python and SQL  A history of technical roles with increasing responsibility and visibility  5 years of agency and /or consulting experience preferred (post-degree)  A history of procuring, processing, securing and auditing big data assets  Experience translating complex statistical and econometric findings into spreadsheet (XLS) and presentation (PPT) communications  Experience with subscription products and their lifecycle components  Familiarity with matrix organizations and shared-resource environments  Comfortable taking a problem statement from diagnosis to delivery with limited supervision  Ability to assess, document and recommend scope-appropriate analytical and visualization tools  But wait, there's more!  Paid time off every year to volunteer  Access to wellbeing tools, resources, and freebies  2017 Best Company for Working Mothers  An in-house learning and development team to help shape and grow your career  Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands  Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. and its subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity Employers and E-Verify users. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

Name: Desk Top Support Analyst
Description: Excellent opportunity in a hot emerging market. A rapidly growing Technology/Real Estate Asset Management Company seeks an experienced Property Manager. If you share a passion for working in a fast paced, rapid growth company committed to professional excellence, then we're interested in talking to you. Job Description We are seeking a highly motivated, organized individual to join theResidential Capital Management team and serve as a versatile Desk Top Support Analystfor Google and Microsoft based environments. The successful candidate will provide timely and professional support to internal users across multiple owned and affiliated organizations.  The best candidate will be well-versed in Google, Windows 7, Windows 8 and Windows 10 desktop technologies, Active Directory and network technologies. This passionate and tech savvy Support Desk Analyst will be the ‘go-to’ person, resolving technical issues at a variety of levels. They will also be responsible for documenting IT processes and providing training for the company staff as well as providing input during the development of IT infrastructure projects. The candidate will need to work closely and efficiently with various internal and external stakeholders and should possess excellent interpersonal communication skills.  · Maintain the company’s LAN telecommunications equipment and services, as well as all printer configurations/fax/scan devices  · Troubleshoot related issues and perform PC maintenance as software installations, printer configurations and computer upgrades.  · Troubleshoot issues related to network connectivity, image laptops and desktops during initial deployment and end life replacement.  · Performs build and maintenance tasks on active directory and Google and Microsoft Exchange.  · Documents where the hardware devices are being deployed within the organization, go-lives as it relates to IT infrastructure.  · Provide technical support and problem resolution for complex problems involving enterprise application infrastructure, including, but not limited to, application servers, web servers, batch servers, database servers and supporting control software to maintain required system availability for the business  · Provide all levels of technical support, as necessary, for end user reported technical problems  · Track case tickets within a Helpdesk Management System to document resolutions for future reference  · Lead and develop special projects pertaining to IT  · Enforce Internal IT policies pertaining to the corporate network and security  · Travel: 20%, on average; Multi-site support in Atlanta region when not traveling  · 2+ years of enterprise level experience of IT support  · Hands on field services background  · Ability to effectively communicate with every level of employee from general end user to high level managers  This is a non-management position  This is a full time position

Name: Senior Business Analyst with SCM and WMS -
Description: OverviewHi,  Hope you are doing great!!  : Atlanta, GA Duration: 12+ Months Job Overview This  Senior Business Analyst and :: Atlanta, GA will be part of Business Engineering, supporting applications development that assist warehouse management and logistics optimize and integrate the solutions with internal and third-party systems. Candidate will have other responsibilities to include working with system owners, support personnel and end users to triage and analyze application behaviors and defects. Defects will be remediated by operations developers; candidate will be responsible for functional testing of defect resolutions and will work with all stake holders for implementation.  Business analysts focus on the collection and documentation of business requirements that drive the design of business systems solutions. They may also participate in business planning, needs analysis and business risk assessment, leading business process redesign, acclimating business processes to changes in technology and consulting with the customer on how to best support the business through the effective use of technology. This role is an independent contributor Business Analyst role that participates in the effective documentation of work processes and business requirements. Perform other duties as assigned.  Essential Functions Facilitate requirements gathering sessions for moderately complex requests, accurately capturing client needs. Create requirements definition documentation and functional specifications to capture business needs using emerging understanding of business processes. Validates with the customer and shares with project stakeholders. Validate and obtains sign-off for functional requirements/specifications and tracks changes to requirements. Track progress of plans. Identifies and escalates deviations from requirements. Review test plans and scripts for completeness and accuracy. Perform implementation support. Help in formulating a business vision for project stakeholders. Ensure that all analyses carried out by his/her team are well documented as well as archived. Find solutions to challenges coupled with a willingness to do what is necessary in order to ensure timelines and make sure that goals are met. Regular, dependable attendance & punctuality. Education/Qualifications Bachelor's degree preferred and 5+ years of related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Strongly prefer a domain combination of one or more of these areas : Logistics, Supply Chain, Retail, Omni-Channel fulfilment Strongly prefer packaged software experience in WMS and/or Order Management from vendors such as Manhattan Associates, Sterling, JDA, etc. Demonstrate experience with Agile software development methodologies, creation of user stories, backlog grooming and strategy to determine Demonstrate experience leading full lifecycle software development in medium to large size enterprise CSPO certification strongly preferred Communication Skills Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills. Ability to read, writes, and interprets business and technical documents. Ability to communicate across all levels of the organization from developers to C-level executives. Mathematical Skills Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, and analytical skills. Reasoning Ability Able to understand and take specific direction to complete tasks; uses good judgment in selecting appropriate work procedures or approaches, with guidance. Seek advice and approval to expedite results. Physical Demands This position involves regular walking, standing, sitting for extended periods of time, hearing, and talking. May occasionally involve stooping, kneeling, or crouching. May involve close vision, color vision, depth perception, focus adjustment, and viewing computer monitor for extended periods of time. Involves manual dexterity for using keyboard, mouse, and other office equipment. May involve moving or lifting items under 10 pounds. Other Skills Self-starter, high tolerance for ambiguity, less structured. Must multitask and maintain focus while doing such. Must be comfortable with tight timelines. Must have a sense of urgency. Must possess speed and versatility. Work Hours Ability to work a flexible schedule based on department and company needs.

Name: Senior Executive Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionSenior Executive AnalystAmerican Management Services$150,000 - $250,000 a year$150,000 realistic 1st year earnings, top performers earning more American Management Services is searching for dynamic Senior Executive Analysts to join our team. You will be onsite with our client’s nationwide working with Presidents and owners of privately held small to medium sized businesses. We ultimately provide a blueprint of recommendations and solutions identifying measurable costs, savings, and profit improvements that can be implemented in real-time, guaranteeing profit gains. This role is ideal for the self-motivated person and is generously compensated by an uncapped commission structure and great bonuses.  We are not for everyone! If you have an edge, a competitive drive, and a good working knowledge of financials along with operational functions we will teach you the rest! Responsibilities of a Senior Executive Analyst:Working side by side with ownership to identify the REAL problems the client’s company haveFrom a P&L prospective, what the problems’ real cost areGetting business owners to disclose their shortcomings/weakness and need for assistanceMeeting a lot of “type A” personalities/driversGetting decision makers to open up and talk about the areas of their business they aren’t happy with or that need improvementAsking a lot of questions in your approach and holding the owner accountable to answering each question truthfully100% domestic travel (leave on Sunday nights return on Fridays) consistent for approximately 48 weeks a yearClear understanding of what makes a business tickRoll up your sleeves work ethicBeing comfortable challenging business owners on their shortcomingsAnalysts are provided with extensive training and the tools necessary to accomplish the task. Successful Analysts have attributes that cannot be taught. They are strong, dynamic and confident communicators.To succeed in this position you must have financial/operational skills as well as the ability to close high ticket clients. A TRUE RAIN MAKER!Sales skills are a plus, not afraid of closing six figure dealsDesired Experience, Skills, and Character of Senior Executive Analyst:At least 15 years’ business experience in one or Name: Data Engineering Analyst Senior
Description: TITLE: Data Engineering Senior Analyst (Job Code: GA0422)DUTIES: Execute analytical projects, at times  leading project development efforts for statistical model development, data  analysis, and decision support tools, from solution design and data integrity  evaluation through solution documentation and implementation. Collaborate with  internal and external clients to determine the appropriate analysis parameters  and performance measures to be applied, as well as requirements for decision  tool and strategy implementation and monitoring. Communicate with and deliver presentations to  end users on analysis results. Work with the completion of projects coordinated  by lesser-experienced staff. Produce implementation plans and participate in  audits to support the implementation of statistical models and other decision  tools. Support field sales force and marketing organization by providing  analytical expertise. Support the development of new analytical and data  products and services, and the enhancement of current processes and offerings.  Possible remote / telecommute work options. All U.S. locations considered.  Development of advanced analytical solutions for Experian clients, including  scoring and business intelligence for account acquisition, applicant  decisioning, and account management.REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s degree (or foreign equivalent)  in Math, Statistics, Computer Science, or Management Information System plus 3  years of experience in the offered position or position in statistical  modeling/data analysis. Alternate Requirements: Master’s degree (or foreign equivalent) in Math, Statistics,  Computer Science, or Management Information System plus 1 year of experience in  the offered position or position in statistical modeling/data analysis. SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: Must  possess expertise/knowledge sufficient to adequately perform the duties of the  job being offered. Expertise/knowledge may be gained through employment  experience or education. Such expertise/knowledge cannot be “quantified” by  “time”. Required expertise/knowledge includes: Experience with statistical modeling / data  analysis experience including data manipulation experience using SAS, R,  Python, SQL, or VB. Advanced knowledge of Unix and Microsoft office products. OTHER: Job Site: Atlanta, GA. 40 hours/week; Salary: $59,946.00– $77,145.00  per year. If offered employment must  have legal right to work in U.S. EOE. CONTACT: Experian Information Solutions, Inc. Attn: Collette Moore, HR Administrator, contact via email at recruitment@experian.com (Reference Job Code: GA0422)  This notice is being provided as a result of the filing of a permanent  alien labor certification application for this job opportunity. Any person may provide documentary evidence  bearing on the application to: United  States Department Of Labor, Employment & Training Administration, Atlanta  National Processing Center, Harris Tower, 233 Peachtree Street, Suite 410,  Atlanta, CA 30303.  This position is eligible for Experian  Information Solutions, Inc’s Employee Referral Program.

Name: Lead Epic Service Desk Analyst
Description: The Lead Epic Service Desk Analyst is responsible for providing Tier 1 support to patients, physicians, and hospital staff for Epic related hospital applications, managing the day to day workflow of Tier 1 operations, and executing ticket escalations for high priority issues during their assigned shift. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: To perform this job, an individual must perform each essential function satisfactorily with or without a reasonable accommodation. Routine SupportProvide 24/7/365 Tier 1 support to meet and exceed established Service Level Agreements (SLAs) and follow ITIL processes.Triage end user issues and determine if the issue can be resolved at Tier 1 or if it needs to be escalated to Tier 2.Utilize customer service guidelines as outlined in HDI training.Use client provided knowledgebase and client specific procedures to resolve issues.Managing Workflow and EscalationsEnsure adequate Tier 1 staff coverage.Monitor activity in the Supervisor dashboard and adjust agent activities as needed to ensure client SLAs are met.Follow client procedures to escalate high priority issues to the appropriate support team to facilitate resolution within client defined timeframe.Continuing EducationAcquire and maintain a general knowledge of client and Epic applications.Attend professional development training as appropriate.Obtain necessary technology skills to perform common client specific first call resolution tasks, with training, including password resets, Citrix troubleshooting, common desktop troubleshooting, etc.Regular and reliable attendance.Perform other duties as assigned.Additional Information:  Customer Focus: Position primarily serves external customers. HIPAA: Exhibit a basic understanding of healthcare regulatory and compliance (e.g., HIPAA). Skilled in the application of policies and procedures. Knowledge of Corporate Standards and Recommended Practices.KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES: The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills and/or abilities required. Education: High School Diploma, GED, or equivalent Experience: Less than 2 years Certifications & Licenses: Valid State Drivers' License Skills and Abilities: Business Mathematical Skills -- Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rates, ratios, and percentages and to draw and interpret graphs.  Foundational Computer Skills -- Frequent use of electronic mail, word processing, data entry, spreadsheets, graphics, etc.  Foundational Communication -- Simple messages communicated orally. May write brief messages and keep simple records. May explain and offer guidance on routine procedures.  Routine Business Problems -- Problems encountered are routine, somewhat repetitive and generally solved by following clear directions and procedures.  Job Specific Impact -- Decisions generally affect own job or assigned functional area.  Foundational Judgement -- Results are defined and existing practices are used as guidelines for how to complete work activities' works closely with supervisors/manager who provides broad guidance and overall direction.  Foundational Planning / Organization -- Prioritize assigned and routine tasks. Handle appropriately.

Name: Implementation Consultant - Contact Center Experience
Description: Position: Implementation ConsultantLocation: Alpharetta, Georgia / Remote  Reports To: Director, Services Delivery  Position Summary:  The Implementation Consultant (IC) is responsible for implementing and migrating customers to the Intradiem service. As the expert on customer goals, customer operations, and Intradiem capabilities, the IC applies this expertise to guide the customer on solution configuration and Best Practices in preparation for driving adoption during the initial launch of the Intradiem solution and thereafter as the project transitions to the Customer Success team. This individual should be comfortable consulting with and influencing customers (change management), backed by a strong understanding of the customers business objectives and the capabilities of the Intradiem solution.  Responsibilities Ensure customers are positioned to derive maximum value and net benefit from their investment in Intradiem.Develop a trusted advisor relationship with customer executives and other Intradiem champions, such that all Intradiem activities are closely aligned with the customer's business case and business strategy, allowing the full potential of their Intradiem solution to be realized.Maintain strong working relationships with other Intradiem customer facing personnel in the Sales, Operations, Marketing, Product Management and Engineering teams.As a business and functional consultant on the project team, the IC owns components of the implementation of the solution, providing guidance and consulting to the customer on key functionality, configuring the solution to best meet the customers needs, facilitating the development of an adoption and launch program, and providing launch support.Track and measure the initial net benefits of Intradiem against well-defined goals and objectives, and provide quantified data to customers and internal Intradiem teams.Possess a comprehensive understanding of the Intradiem solution in order to serve as an internal and external product subject matter expert (SME), trusted advisor and consultant during the implementation and migration phase of projects.Identify, document and communicate best practices. Key Skills: Strong customer focus and service orientation.Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to build trusted relationships with individuals at all levels of an organization.Excellent Change Management skills, including the ability to influence, motivate and persuade.Ability to accomplish results working through others.Excellent written and oral communication skills, including presentation skills and ability to consult remotely and onsite.Hands on, individual contributor and collaborative team player.Strong ability to convey technical information to non-technical personnel at all levels; and good listening skills to translate requirements from non-technical customers into requirements for the Product Management team.Strong analytical and problem-solving abilitiesSelf-driven, with excellent time management skillsWilling to travel 50%Required Experience & Education: Minimum of Bachelors Degree in a technical field or relevant post graduate experience.Minimum three (3) plus years of relevant work experience.Experience interfacing with customers, sales, consulting services and executive management.Experience with SaaS software solutions preferred.Two (2) or more years WFM admin/analyst experience preferred. About Intradiem:  Intradiem is the leader in intraday automation solutions for multi-channel contact centers. Intradiems customers achieve an invincible customer experience with a real-time workforce by automating manual processes such as intraday task management, intraday staffing, channel balancing, and real-time alerts.  Intradiem empowers an immediate and consistent response to unpredictable events and changing conditions, resulting in labor savings, improved employee performance and a better overall customer experience. More than 450,000 contact center, field service, retail, bank branch, and back office employees around the world use Intradiems solution every day.  Contact Us:  At Intradiem, we are always looking for talented individuals to join our team. If your skills and experience align with this position and you would like to be a part of a growing on-demand software company that offers employees a top tier benefits program and industry-competitive salaries, send your resume to careers@intradiem.com.

Name: Market Intelligence Analyst - Aviation
Description: Oliver Wyman is a global leader in management consulting. With offices in 50+ cities across 26 countries, Oliver Wyman combines deep industry knowledge with specialized expertise in strategy, operations, risk management, and organization transformation. Our 4700+ professionals help clients optimize their business, improve their operations and risk profile, and accelerate their organizational performance to seize the most attractive opportunities. Oliver Wymans thought leadership is evident in our agenda-setting books, white papers, research reports, and articles in the business press. Our clients are the CEOs and executive teams of the top Global 1000 companies. Visit our website for more details about Oliver Wyman: www.oliverwyman.com CAVOK, an Aviation Management Consulting company, part of Oliver Wyman, with offices in Atlanta, GA and Keller, TX, is looking for a Market Intelligence Analyst to work in our Atlanta office. As a member of the aviation market intelligence team, you will play a critical role in supporting CAVOK and Oliver Wymans efforts to develop and implement key strategic intelligence, data reporting, and analyses. Responsibilities: Work closely and productively within a team to achieve established goals Become familiar with commercial air transport industry data sources and issues Collect and summarize market insights about economies, airports, airlines, and policies Analyze key drivers and trends of the commercial air transport industry, particularly the Maintenance, Repair, and Overhaul (MRO) business within it Research historical data to map trends and determine how they will influence the industry in the future Undertake complex quantitative, qualitative, strategic and financial analysis through a variety of activities which include: Primary and secondary research Benchmarking Model building Analyzing client data Evaluating improvement initiatives Manipulate large amounts of data and present findings in a cohesive manner Assist in developing and maintaining Oliver Wymans commercial air transport forecast models Assist in long-term client engagements primarily revolving around market sizing, strategic planning, and merger and acquisition due diligence Assist in developing client deliverables Assist in developing internal and public facing presentations for CAVOK and Oliver Wyman Assist in developing internal and public facing publications for CAVOK and Oliver Wyman Assist in developing full articles and interview responses for commercial aviation magazines and journals from around the world Required Qualifications: Bachelors Degree required Strong interest in the aviation industry Advanced experience with Microsoft Office Suite (Excel and PowerPoint in particular) Proficient with Microsoft SQL Excellent verbal, interpersonal, and written communication skills Strong analytical, problem solving, and decision making skills Ability to multi-task in a fast paced environment Candidates must have unrestricted authorization to work in the United States R_041468-en R_041468

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: The Role Our Health and Benefits business helps large and mid-size clients control soaring health and welfare plan costs, improve health outcomes and promote employee engagement through broad-based, state-of-the-art interventions. We provide solutions encompassing creative plan design, vendor evaluation and management, pricing and funding strategies, data analytics, valuation support, legal compliance and governance strategies. We also provide Specialty consulting services including clinical/health management program design, pharmacy solutions, disability/absence management strategies and claims audit services. Product based solutions such as our pharmacy purchasing coalition round out our broad-based suite of offerings.You will partner with consultants to provide support on projects through:Performing financial analyses, including developing pricing, creating employee contribution strategies, modeling plan design alternatives, and calculating reservesAnalyzing and comparing vendor products, services, and contractsResponsibilities:Work with clients, carriers, vendors and service team to manage the time-line for marketing projects and annual renewalsReview marketing results to ensure consistency with requested proposals and modify if neededNegotiate renewals with carriers and vendorsContribute to client deliverables; including spreadsheets and presentations reflecting results and optionsPrepare competitive benchmarking analysis of benefit plan designsAssist with special projects as neededIncrease efficiency within client teams by identifying ways to improve processesBuild relationships internally and collaborate effectively on cross-functional teamsComply with Willis Towers Watson Excellence Management (WEM) programSize & Complexity of Clients:Fully-insured and self-insured clientsMulti-stateTypical size: 100 to 5,000 employeesMinimum Criteria & Skills (including education & licenses) Requirements:2 years of financial/analytical work related to group insurance and/or employee benefits programs preferredBachelor’s degree required, preferably in mathematics, economics, statistics, finance, insurance, public health, health management or any major with significant quantitative course workState Life and Health license required within 90 days of employmentWork experience that demonstrates strong technical and/or client service skills (analyst type of internship preferred)Underwriting experience a plusPassion for solving problems and sharing solutions to exceed the standards of the clientAbility to be a self-starter and work independently, but also cooperatively in a close team environmentExcellent oral and written communication skillsAdvanced Microsoft Office skills, particularly in ExcelAvailability to travel on an as needed basisThe Company Willis Towers Watson is a leading global advisory, broking and solutions company that helps clients around the world turn risk into a path for growth. With roots dating to 1828, Willis Towers Watson has 40,000 employees serving more than 140 countries. We design and deliver solutions that manage risk, optimize benefits, cultivate talent, and expand the power of capital to protect and strengthen institutions and individuals. Our unique perspective allows us to see the critical intersections between talent, assets and ideas – the dynamic formula that drives business performance. Together, we unlock potential. Name: Marketing Data Analyst
Description: is looking for a junior to mid-level marketing data analyst to join our Business Analytics team and bridge the gap between digital marketing strategy and data analysis. With an incredible amount of data that includes a decade-long end-to-end view of market, product, and shopper behavior that spans thousands of web properties, we have layers of complex seasonal and environmental demand factors on top of traditional retail and e-commerce competitive and user behavior data. Were looking for the person who can see the story behind all these numbers, and tell that story to both technical and non-technical audiences to drive strategy for our company and our clients. If youve got a proven track record, passion for modeling purposeful data, and an independent and analytical approach to your work, youre exactly who weve been looking for.Our ideal candidate can extract data from multiple sources with ease and can take ownership of several projects at once, all with an eye on the prize. You also enjoy the challenge of grasping and deciphering complex data schema while leveraging your analytical skills to drive strategic thought and effective decision making.  Responsibilities: Develop processes to ensure analytical insights can be incorporated into key decision making Develop creative solutions that improve business performance and can scale across multiple clients Assist with data automation projects to improve the efficiency and accuracy of reporting and analytics Develop understanding of clients performance across multiple channels Prepare brand-level presentations with impactful data to provide updates to executive leadership teams, showing flexibility and agility as the presentation message adapts to meet the business need Develop dashboards that provide insights and visualization into performance relative to KPIs, projections, and historical performance Proactively identify opportunities for growth and competitive advantage for our clients Qualifications: Degree or experience in business, economics, math, data analytics, or a related field Strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills Proficiency in PowerPoint and Microsoft Excel (including pivot tables, v-lookup, concatenation) Experience designing analytical models and data visualizations using Power BI or a similar tool, in other words, being able to tell a story with data Experience analyzing consumer and financial data and identifying solutions to a business problem Confidence in ability to systemize tasks and improve processes Strong oral, written, and interpersonal skills Ability to set goals and execute under tight timelines Experience, knowledge, or passion for the automotive and/or powersports industries is a plus Experience with R, Python, or SQL is a plus This is a fun, fast-paced, close-knit environment with plenty of room to grow and be creative. We are an established, solidly profitable company with a start-up working environment and a brilliant team. We offer full-time W2 positions with company-paid health/dental/vision/life benefits, FSA, matching 401(k), paid vacation, dog-friendly office, relaxed dress code, eclectic company culture, and a great office location in Downtown Atlanta. is a comprehensive e-commerce solution for automotive manufacturers and dealers interested in engaging the online auto parts consumer. Our dynamic suite of platforms and marketing services are proven to facilitate buyer engagement throughout every step of the purchase process and stage of vehicle ownership. Through constant innovation, SimplePart helps connect drivers with the best parts for their vehicles, one site at a time.We are a nerdy and data-driven group, using design hand-in-hand with science to stand out in a dynamic retail market. Our portfolio of 1700+ national and dealer websites serves a worldwide user base of more than 4,700,000 unique monthly website visitors and delivers more than 12,000,000 daily page-views.In your application, please be sure to include a cover letter that gives us an idea of your personality, who you are and what you're all about. Candidates must be authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship. No recruiters, please.

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Primerica currently has the following opening at our corporate office in Duluth, Georgia:Data Analyst functions as a primary source of analysis, reporting and the design and development of datasets and analytical tools. Projects will include formulating and generating reports, sourcing, organizing and analyzing company & industry statistics to determine trends, monitor performance and identify effectiveness of internal incentives. Additionally, find and create mechanisms to improve production or workflow within the company. Must be self-motivated and enjoy working in a demanding and fast-paced environment.KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIESMinimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Economics or equivalentOne to three years business and/or data and financial analysis and reportingAdvanced MS Access skillsSignificant experience with using MS Office as a foundation for business solutions, with preference for advanced to intermediate skills in MS Access and integration to other system, including mainframe tablesAdvanced QMF / SQL query writing skillsAdvanced Internet literacyExperience with VB, .NET, HTMLStrong Research, Analytical, Organizational & Mathematical skillsExcellent oral and written communication skillsSelf-motivatedTeam playerGood judgment, with ability and experience to make significant strategic decisionsGood interpersonal skillsAbility to work independently, while knowing when to seek adviceAbility to handle multiple and changing priorities simultaneously while meeting numerous deadlines.ABOUT PRIMERICAPrimerica is a Main Street Company for Main Street North America. Our goal is to create more financially independent families. We are located in Duluth, GA. Primerica employees support our representatives to provide appropriate solutions through term life insurance, mutual funds, annuities and other financial products. We insured more than 5 million lives and have over 2 million client investment accounts. Our stock is traded on The New York Stock Exchange under the symbol “PRI”.Four years in a row Primerica has been recognized by the Atlanta Journal-Constitution as one of the best workplaces in Georgia! Over the past five years Primerica has consistently been voted Best Employer by Gwinnett Magazine in its special "Best of Gwinnett" winner editions.

Name: Business Transformation Manager
Description: The Business Transformation Manager is an integral member of the Business Transformation & Program Change Management Team. The Business Transformation Manager will support the execution of business transformation projects, program level change activities, senior leadership sponsorship activities, and facilitate stakeholder engagement activities to achieve organizational alignment and readiness for Elavon’ s top initiatives. Additionally, the Business Transformation Manager will support product, sales, operations, and other business and functional stakeholders to ensure that business transformation solutions are adopted enabling changes across the enterprise as part of Integrated Payment Solutions and eCommerce program. This role will play a key part in project management, data analysis, process documentation and implementing a consistent framework for program change management. The Business Transformation Manager will model effective change leadership, engagement and execution skills as well as deliver high quality change management deliverables.This person will report into the Head of Business Transformation & Program Change Management.What You Get to DoWork with others in the organization to succeed. Manage actionable and targeted program change management plans – including stakeholder analysis, communications planning, change impacts, change networks, organizational readiness, and training plans – to increase team member adoption and usage. Manage project activities. Manage project activities for business transformation, program change management efforts, and/or leader sponsorship activities crosses multiple business lines. Drive process development and identify opportunities. Identify and document high and detailed level business processes for current and future states for identifying effectiveness/ efficiency opportunities that increase organizational effectiveness.Equip the workplace with best practices. Evaluate the effectiveness of the business transformation projects and change management activities and implement improvement strategies. Prepare appropriate reports and documentation including monitoring success metrics. Deliver high quality results leveraging expertise and resources. Collaborate with respective Elavon partners to communicate project scope and approaches and gain alignment and buy-in. Develop insights of progress and course correct program efforts as needed. Develop communications collateral that helps tell story for Elavon.Support the build out and deployment of consistent frameworks and tools. Leverage best practices, methods and tools focused on business transformation activities, change approaches and implementation plans.Critical CompetenciesStrong Communication SkillsAbility to Build RelationshipsCritical/business acumen Adaptable and Able to Manage ChangeCustomer Orientation/FocusSelf-StarterResults DrivenAbout Elavon (www.elavon.com)Elavon is wholly owned by U.S. Bank, the fifth-largest bank in the United States, and provides end-to-end payment processing solutions and services to more than 1.3 million customers in the United States, Europe, Canada, Mexico and Puerto Rico. As the leading provider for airlines and a top five provider in hospitality, healthcare, retail, and public sector/education, Elavon’s innovative payment solutions are designed to solve pain points for businesses from small to enterprise-sized.Basic Qualifications Bachelor's degree, or equivalent work experience Eight to ten years of experience in project management activities3-5 years business analyst or change management experience; consulting experience preferredPreferred QualificationsParticipate in multiple projects concurrently, when neededAble to work effectively at all levels in an organizationCreate and manage project plans, status reports and materials for project readouts with leadership teamsAnalyze qualitative and quantitative data and tactfully synthetize the information Write documents that explain changes and how to implement themExperience in the developing and designing documents including, process outlines, process flows and implementation proceduresExperience and knowledge of change management principles, methodologies and toolsExceptional communication skills, both written and verbal; high EQ and excellent active listening skillsAbility to develop and clearly articulate messages to a variety of audiencesFlexible and adaptable; able to work in ambiguous and changing situationsOrganized with a natural inclination for planning and tacticsProblem solving and root cause identification skillsMust be a team player and able to work collaboratively with and through othersAcute business acumen and understanding of organizational issues and challenges

Name: Dialer Analyst/MIS Analyst
Description: Job Description:Headquartered in Atlanta, GreenSky is among the top 3 most valuable U.S. financial technology companies established since 2000, and our $1.0 billion Initial Public Offering marked the largest U.S. Technology IPO of 2018. Our mission is simple. We power commerce. Our highly scalable, proprietary technology platform enables over 12,000 merchants to offer frictionless promotional payment options to consumers at the point-of-sale, driving increased sales volume and accelerated cash flow. Our bank partners leverage GreenSky’s technology to provide loans to super-prime and prime consumers nationwide. Since our inception, over 1.7 million consumers have financed over $12 billion of commerce using our paperless, real time "apply and buy" technology. For more information, please visit https://www.greensky.com.Looking for great talent to help us continue our rapid growth!Overview:The Predictive Dialer Analyst/MIS Analyst is responsible for implementing and maintaining dialer strategies designed for Collection’s, Sales and Merchant Management calling campaigns, as well as any other department that may require enhanced outbound dialing. Is responsible for working with the predictive dialer system and maintaining Service Levels, abandon rates, connects per hour, RPC’s penetration rates and list performance. Is responsible for real time monitoring of all outbound dialing campaigns, inbound blend, manual phone efforts and to monitor agent performance and maximizing campaign results and agent productivity. Also responsible for maintaining strict FCC mandated service levels for outbound dials and FCC/FTC mandated laws and regulations surrounding outbound telephony including, but not limited to, strict compliance with the Telephone Consumer Protection Act(TCPA). Assure that all dialer campaigns adhere to strict FDCPA guidelines for time of day, number of calls, left messages and valid numbers.Duties & Responsibilities:Implement, manage and maintain daily operation of the dialer campaigns, and other systems as required while maintaining a broad range of hours of operations which typically are; Monday through Thursday 8am-11pm, Friday 8am-7pm, and Saturday 9am-6pm, including most CEC holidays. These hours of operation are subject to change and will be expanded in the future.Maintain strict compliance with FCC and FDCPA mandated service levels on outbound dialing campaigns by monitoring and tracking data on an active real time, daily, weekly, monthly and yearly basis by campus or brand platform for millions of outbound dials placed each year by the dialer system.Build and maintain all daily campaigns based on business rules & strategic dialing attributes and load it into the dialing system for the dialer systemBuild, model and maintain and follow our extraction strategies and Call Selection Lists(CSL’s) based on projected inquiry volumes, projected staffing levels and hours of operations or legally mandated calling restrictions based upon state licensing requirementsResponsible for building and operating dialing campaigns to appropriately contact delinquent accounts broken out accordingly by the collection’s strategy.Build and follow sales, lead and merchant call lists as appropriate.Create, maintain and analyze reports on an intra-day/hourly, daily, weekly, monthly and yearly basis to monitor performance of strategies, agents, lists, campaigns and health of system performance and uptimeMonitor key performance indicators in real time to access performance of associated systems, agents, and campaignsMonitor all agents/staff logged into dialer system to assure staff logged into appropriate campaigns for each department group and to maximize utilization of agent productivity while logged into campaigns.Report on and communicate daily campaign strategyReport all issues pertaining to the dialer’s functionality to the appropriate peopleProactively communicate and engage with support resources both internally and with vendor as requiredMaintain a positive and professional demeanor towards all internal and external customersProactively look for more streamlined processes in dialing processes.Maintain department history and event logs of system changes, system outages, upgrades, or other significant factors that impacted dialer production or availability.Maintain department dialing history database of all outbound dials and associated data points to be made available upon request for time sensitive for reports and requests.Develop and maintain dialing reporting including new and current reports.Other duties as assignedLocation: 1797 Northeast Expressway, Atlanta, GA 30329 (Little if any travel required)Shift: Collections hours are Monday and Thursday 8:00am-9:00pm, Tuesday and Wednesday 8:00am-11:00pm, Friday 8:00am-5:00pm, and Saturday 9:00am-6:00pm, including CEC holidays. Hours can change depending on coverage. You will have to work tow late nights during the week and two Saturdays a month 9:00am-6:00pm.Organizational: This position is a member of the Collections Team.Required Experience: Required Skills & Qualifications:Education and Experience (Minimum):High SchoolOne year or more previous experience with analytic responsibilities One year or more previous experience with predictive dialer systems and associated systemsEducation and Experience (Preferred):Bachelors Degree preferredPrevious experience with running predictive dialer systems and associated systemsStrong analytics skillsKnowledge, Skills and Abilities, Competencies:Advanced level experience with utilizing Microsoft Excel Experience with utilizing Microsoft Access (intermediate to advanced level) or other database systems (Microsoft SQL, Oracle, etc)Some knowledge of SQL Experience with utilizing Microsoft Word Experience with utilizing Microsoft Outlook Experience in automating manual tasks Advanced level experience with predictive dialer systems Efficient work style and sense of urgency Strategic thinking and problem solving abilities Strong organization and interpersonal skills Strong communication skills including email, chat, and verbal Strong time management skills and scheduling skills Excellent analytical and problem solving skills Ability to work independently Ability to work as part of team Ability to develop and prepare business analysis and recommendations Ability to present a professional image and demeanor to internal and external customersAbility to setup dialing processes in morning or implement mid-day changes as necessary GreenSky is an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of age, color, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any classification protected by federal, state, or local law. We strongly encourage Armed Forces Veterans to apply Keyword: Dialer  From: GreenSky  Apply now

Name: Service Desk Analyst II
Description: Job DetailsLevel ExperiencedJob Location APRIO Home Office - Atlanta, GAPosition Type UndisclosedEducation Level 2 Year DegreeSalary Range UndisclosedTravel Percentage UndisclosedJob Shift DayJob Category Information TechnologyDescriptionJoin our Information Technology team and you will help clients maximize their opportunities. Aprio has a career opportunity for a Service Desk Analyst II to join their dynamic team.  Submerge yourself with creative innovators striving for excellence. Aprio, LLP is the 50th largest CPA firm in the nation and was recently named one of the Top Places to Work for in Atlanta by the Atlanta Journal-Constitution. Whether it is adding to our 25 different spoken languages or sharing your expertise in 1 of our 8 industry specialties, you have priceless experiences and skills to drive our company’s growth and success. Aprio, LLP wants you to define our brand positioning, contribute to industry leading innovation, and help our clients thrive. Position Responsibilities: The Service Desk Analyst II is team member responsible for providing prompt, courteous and accurate service in response to reported incidents. While he/she provides hardware and software support, this position has a strong customer focus. The Service Desk Analyst II position receives escalated requests and either addresses them immediately or routes them to appropriate resources. The ideal candidate will be forward thinking and keenly aware of the need for continuous service improvements including identifying automation opportunities. Aid in resolving submitted requestsResolve incident requests within agreed upon SLA. (Service Level Agreement)Prompt routing/escalation of incidents requests not addressed or handled by second level per IOP. (Internal Operating Procedure)Utilize root cause methodologies for problem managementWork within change management to implement /deploy solutions of identified problemsCreate base image of computer OS and firm software for distribution to endpoints, using tools such as Desktop Central, KACE, etc.Build patches to install updates, uninstall existing software, test and deploy to endpoint, using tools such as Desktop Central, KACE, etc.Assist in documenting procedures and standards as well as common incident resolutionProvide extended business hour support on a rotational basis with other members of the IT DepartmentProvide moderate to complex technical advice and guidance to ensure high levels of customer serviceMaintain a high degree of professional proficiency relative to firm systems, and emerging technologiesProvides firm wide telephony supportAssist end users with setting up new or replacement mobile devicesProvide conference room audio visual supportPerform basic AD Management - Adds / moves / changesQualificationsQualifications Needed: Aid in resolving submitted incident and service requests.Contribute to written installation procedures and standards development to establish consistency.Install, configure, and update desktop/laptop software applicationsMaintain a high degree of professional proficiency relative to Firm systems, and emerging technologiesEstablishes work-arounds to incidents and works with problem manager to uncover root cause of issue.Properly use service desk tracking software.Provide extended business hour support on a rotational basis with other members of the Information & Technology DepartmentProvide moderate to complex technical advice and guidance to ensure high levels of customer service.Provide firm wide telephony support.Responsible for ensuring firm wide desktop hardware life cycle is being met.Maintain advanced understanding and support of the firm’s software in use.Work with firm’s power user community to document resolution to complex issues.Identify document work arounds of escalated requests making these available in the knowledge base.Assist end users with setting up new or replacement smart mobile devices.Conference room audio visual support.Create, modify and delete Active Directory accounts as needed. Preferred Skills Demonstrated ability to accomplish multiple tasks in a heavy workload environmentMinimum of three years providing hardware and software supportBachelor's degree or mix of education and experience 3 years of experience substituting for year of education.At least 3-year experience providing telephone and desk side computer support to end-users in a Windows enterprise network environment.Experience working with third party software vendors.Clear, effective written and verbal communication skillsAbility to generate and interpret individual reports and metrics.Experience supporting VPN environments, Microsoft 365.Excellent time and project management skills.Excellent interpersonal skills. Why work for Aprio?  At Aprio, we are passionate about helping our clients and our associates achieve what’s next. We are a premier CPA-led business advisory firm where thriving associates serve thriving clients. Whether you are just starting out, looking to advance into management, or searching for your next leadership role, Aprio offers the opportunity to join a winning team. At Aprio, you will work with industry-leading clients and collaborative and caring colleagues. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race; color; religion; national origin; sex; pregnancy; sexual orientation; gender identity and/or expression; age; disability; genetic information, citizenship status; military service obligations or any other category protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

Name: Oracle SOA Development Analyst
Description: Job descriptionAccenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions – underpinned by the world’s largest delivery network – Accenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With approximately 425,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives. Visit us at www.accenture.com.  People in our Client Delivery & Operations career track drive delivery and capability excellence through the design, development and/or delivery of a solution, service, capability or offering. They grow into delivery-focused roles, and can progress within their current role, laterally or upward.  Software Engineering professionals work across the Service Delivery Lifecycle to analyze, design, build, test, implement and/or maintain multiple system components or applications for Accenture or our clients.  The Oracle SOA Development Analyst develops and designs technologies that improve the way our clients and the world works. Supporting the core of Accenture's Technology business, they are eager to learn and use that curiosity to solve Technology problems through developing, designing, and configuring software products or systems that enable client strategies. They use their versatility and experience to design technology solutions that meet client requirements from analysis to implementation. Job Description Oracle professionals design, implement and deploy Oracle solutions to achieve defined business goals. Maintain skills in Oracle applications process design and configuration; Oracle application design, development, integration, testing and deployment; and Oracle application technical architecture.  The Oracle SOA Development Analyst will work with implementation of complex interfaces across Oracle applications and legacy applications. The candidate will have the following skills: Oracle SOA developmentExperience in Oracle SOA / OSB implementationsUse SOA skills with a focus on BPEL, OSB and BAMExperience in Error handling, Oracle FMW architecture and J2EE technology stackExperience in using Web Services, SOAP, WSDL, XML etc+ Basic qualificationsBasic QualificationsA minimum of 3 years of Oracle OSB Development Experience and/or 3 years of Oracle BPEL Development ExperienceA minimum of 6 months of experience with Service Component Architecture and core SOA Design patternA Bachelor’s degree or relevant experiencePreferred QualificationsOracle 12c experienceProfessional Skill RequirementsProven success in contributing to a team-oriented environmentProven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environmentDesire to work in an information systems environmentExcellent leadership, communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills All of our consulting professionals receive comprehensive training covering business acumen, technical and professional skills development. You'll also have opportunities to hone your functional skills and expertise in an area of specialization. We offer a variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training conducted online, in the classroom, or in collaboration with teammates. The sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an unbeatable platform from which to build a career.  Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture.  Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.  Accenture is a federal contractor and an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.  Equal Employment Opportunity  All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.  Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.  Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

Name: Analyst, Entrepreneur Selection & Growth
Description: Job Title:  Analyst, Entrepreneur Selection & Growth Location: Atlanta Language Requirement: Only English required Challenge Area: Sales & Marketing Duration: Permanent Position Estimated Start Date: 9/1/2018 Company Description: Endeavor, a leading global non-profit with an innovative model for private-sector economic growth, seeks a dynamic professional to join its operations in Atlanta. Endeavor is leading a global movement to catalyze long-term economic growth by selecting, mentoring, and accelerating high-growth entrepreneurs worldwide. Endeavor helps the fastest growing entrepreneurs create lasting enterprises in Atlanta by providing the resources they need to scale, including access to world-class mentors, smart capital, and global markets. Over the past 20 years, Endeavor has selected 1,600+ entrepreneurs across 30+ countries. Supported and mentored by our growing network of 3,500+ local and global business leaders, these entrepreneurs have created over 700,000 high-value jobs and generated more than $10 billion in annual revenue. Endeavor Atlanta, founded in March of 2017, now supports some of the top local entrepreneurs from BitPay, QASymphony, LeaseQuery, and Cognira. Position Description: We are seeking a top-caliber professional with 0-2 years’ experience who is passionate about entrepreneurship and believes in Endeavor’s mission to support entrepreneurs to catalyze growth and change in Atlanta. Key Responsibilities and Deliverables: 1. Selection of Highest Potential Entrepreneurs Oversee the upkeep of operational data on candidate pipeline and selected entrepreneursComplete high-quality entrepreneur profile candidatesSupport entrepreneurs through the selection process through mentor research and outreach, meeting coordination, and detailed note-takingPrepare and train entrepreneur candidates for the selection panelsPrepare for and participate in local and international selection eventsAcceleration of entrepreneur impact through Endeavor servicesHelp selected Endeavor Entrepreneurs grow faster and more effectively by proactively managing their required servicesAnticipate the needs of local selected entrepreneursContribute to the creation of new entrepreneur services where required in the local Atlanta marketIncrease Endeavor’s brand awareness and leadership position in the Southeast ecosystemTake a lead role in managing Endeavor Atlanta’s marketing activities including writing a monthly blog and newsletter and publishing to social channelsProvide input into the management of Endeavor Atlanta’s marketing strategy and messaging Skills & Qualifications: • Strong interest and passion for business, economics, entrepreneurship, and/or international development Up to two years of relevant work experience in business, consulting, entrepreneurship, venture capital, finance, or international developmentAbility to work in a fast-paced, often ambiguous environmentExcellent communication skills, both oral and written. Detail oriented: is willing to go from interacting with executives and mentors one minute to taking detailed notes the next.High interpersonal and organizational abilities and strong attention to detailStrength in business areas and an understanding of finance, with an ability to identify and evaluate entrepreneurs, business models, growth markets, companies, and projectsFlexibility and willingness to travelFamiliarity with business software products (GSuite, MS Office, Salesforce) a plus Works With: Manager, Entrepreneur Selection & Growth  Managing Director, Endeavor Atlanta

Name: Data Analyst I
Description: Transforming the future of healthcare isn’t something we take lightly. It takes teams of the best and the brightest, working together to make an impact.As one of the largest healthcare technology companies in the U.S., we are a catalyst to accelerate the journey toward improved lives and healthier communities.Here at Change Healthcare, we’re using our influence to drive positive changes across the industry, and we want motivated and passionate people like you to help us continue to bring new and innovative ideas to life.  If you’re ready to embrace your passion and do what you love with a company that’s committed to supporting your future, then you belong at Change Healthcare.Pursue purpose. Champion innovation. Earn trust. Be agile. Include all.Empower Your Future. Make a Difference.The Data Analyst will join the data science team embedded within the Technology Enabled Services organization. The team member will assist in the creation of data driven solutions to business problems including data consolidation and normalization, generation of actionable business insight, building advanced analytical models, and partnering with operations and overhead partners for feedback and user acceptance. The position will receive a business-driven problem, gather and cleanse data, build complex and automated models, draw key insights from the data, and ultimately deliver interventional tools to drive savings to the bottom line. The ideal candidate for this role has a propensity for data mining, and can draw insights from analytics to improve and develop measurable interventions.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Collects, cleanses, and automates data flows into a central repositoryAnalyzes existing data sets to identify patterns, outliers, and areas of inconsistencies through relationships that exist in the dataCollaborates with business leaders to validate data insights, and design strategies or recommend changesBuilds models for automated data analysis and predictive insightsCreates data visualizations for end users including the use of dashboards (Power BI) or user interfaces (PowerApps or other web-based interface)Facilitates cross-functional teams and uses an inclusive approach to understanding current operationsDemonstrate good judgment and analytical skills to conduct option analysis and present recommendationsActively works to overcome project barriers, and follows up with stakeholders on statusOther duties as assignedEducation:BA or BS degree in a quantitative discipline such as Business, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or Computer ScienceRequirements:0-1 years of experience. Entry levelExcellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skillsStrong personal computer literacy required including working knowledge of relevant software packages such as Microsoft Excel, statistics packages (Python or R), and data visualization suites (Power BI, Spotfire, Tableau, etc.)Ability to work with large amounts of data, including checks for integrity, summation, and effective communication (written and verbal) to internal and external constituents“Self-starter” attitude with the ability to excel in dynamic work environmentsAbility to manage multiple prioritiesTravel and Hours:This is an exempt position10% travel is required with this positionGeneral office demands Join our team today where we are creating a better coordinated, increasingly collaborative, and more efficient healthcare system! Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Commitment All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.
