Name: Operations Analyst
Description: Company Overview HD Supply (NASDAQ:HDS) ( www.hdsupply.com ) is one of the largest industrial distributors in North America. The company provides a broad range of products and value-add services to approximately 500,000 customers with leadership positions in maintenance, repair and operations and specialty construction sectors. Through approximately 260 locations across 36 states and six Canadian provinces, the company's approximately 11,000 associates provide localized, customer-driven services including jobsite delivery, will call or direct-ship options, diversified logistics and innovative solutions that contribute to its customers' success. With an active commitment to the communities in which we operate, HD Supply associates are part of a thriving organization that supports the virtues of wellness, diversity and inclusion - all of which are top priorities for the company. Equally as important is empowering our associates to grow professionally while providing competitive benefits and compensation. If you're ready to find a rewarding career and achieve your full potential with a growing industry leader, HD Supply is ready for you! Job Description & QualificationsJob Summary Gather disparate data from various data sources; analyze and normalize to ensure data integrity for analysis. Provide consistent, relevant and accurate data as well as guidance/knowledge of the data and definitions that are available for analysis. Major Tasks, Responsibilities and Key AccountabilitiesServes as a resource to assigned client in area of expertise.Gathers and compiles raw data; conducts research for industry trends and benchmarks; and normalizes data to be incorporated into a centralized data format.Analyzes, reports, makes comparisons to industry/company benchmarks, determines trends, and prepares cost analyses.Defines data definitions and documents data limitations.Prepares spreadsheets for data analysis; prepare reports with charts and graphs, mailing lists, maps and ad hoc requests. May make presentations.Provides recommendations based on findings and analysis. Provides input on policies and procedures.Participates in department and interdepartmental projects.Performs other duties as assigned.Nature and ScopeDemonstrates skill in data analysis techniques by resolving missing/incomplete information, inconsistencies/anomalies in more complex research/data.Nature of work requires increasing independence; receives guidance only on unusual complex problems or issues. Work review typically involves periodic review of output by supervisor and/or direct "customers" of the process.May provide general guidance/direction to or train junior level support personnel or professional personnel.Work EnvironmentMost of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles.Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.No travel required.Education and ExperienceTypically requires BS/BA in related discipline. Generally 2-5 years of experience in related field; certification is required in some areas OR MS/MA and generally 2-4 years of experience in related field. Certification is required in some areas.Preferred Qualifications & Job Specific DetailsPreferred QualificationsExpertise in working with spreadsheets, strong understanding of financial concepts and data.Expertise with the assimilation of large volumes of raw data, understand, analyze, and present the various elements of complex sales and financial reports to senior management.Experience and willingness to drive activity in other employees according to a process.Ability to communicate clearly with both internal and external parties.Operations reporting experience.PRID PRID141 Job ID2018-29306Business UnitFacilities MaintenanceFunctional AreaOperationsRemote Position?NoPosition TypeFull-Time HD Supply is an Equal Opportunity Minority/Female/Individuals with Disabilities/Protected Veteran and Affirmative Action Employer. Name: Implementation Consultant - Operations
Description: You will work in teams to help clients build capabilities in delivery and execution, both during an active project and continuing after our consultants have shared their recommendations.  You’ll have the opportunity to make a meaningful, hands-on contribution by managing projects and progress with minimal supervision, including tracking metrics, handling complex analyses, and preparing communications to report back to client and internal leadership. You will develop trust-based relationships with clients and be seen as a specialist in implementation and delivering results.

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionThe Data Analyst will provide critical support to the National Institute of Justice (NIJ) Comprehensive School Safety in Atlanta Public Schools grant partnership a five-year initiative designed to: improve school policing practices; identify school systems of support; and leverage data analytics to support predictive policing and student behavior.  In coordination with the APS Data and Information Group, the Data Analyst will work closely with grant partners, the project team, and other stakeholders to gain insight on the types of key metrics needed to effectively evaluate the initiative. Additionally, the Data Analyst will be responsible for developing a comprehensive database utilizing data from internal and external sources. The Data Analyst will design reports, develop performance dashboards, present data, and facilitate analytical discussions that will inform data-driven decisions to guide the strategic direction of the program and provide school leaders with critical, timely information on student discipline, school climate and culture, and potential threats impacting school safety.  Software used for this work will include the SQL Server Management Studio, Tableau, and Stata. ESSENTIAL DUTIESWork with district leadership, school leadership, and the Office of Safety and Security and school leadership to provide actionable data on student behavior for improving student outcomes.Develop, manage, and maintain the research database for the initiative.Work with external stakeholders to acquire relevant data and key metrics for the initiative.Develop data collection and sharing practices to ensure all parties adhere to APS and grant partner policies.Participate in a variety of planning and development activities to assist in creating short-term and long-term plans for Safety & Security support throughout the district. (e.g., planning meetings, committees, user interviews, quality assurance testing, etc.) .Prepare materials in both printed and electronic formats for the purpose of database documentation, records management and retention, and evaluating program outcomes. (e.g., state and local compliance reports, technical specifications, user manuals, training guides, memos, procedures, project documentation, data/process flow charts, etc.).Respond to inquiries from a variety of sources to provide technical assistance, advice, and support. (e.g., staff, administrators, school-based personnel, vendors, and service providers, etc.)Respond to research requests for data extracts/reports, following established data-sharing policies.Create and summarize data analyses for grant partners and other stakeholders.Performs other related duties as assigned. EDUCATION: Bachelors degree in related field required.  CERTIFICATION/LICENSE: None required. WORK EXPERIENCE:At least two years of full-time experience working in data management or analysis with a strong background in either relational database design or data analytics.KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & ABILITIES: The ideal candidate will have experience both building SQL databases and with advanced data analytics and reporting. Candidates with at least one of those two skills and a demonstrated ability to learn new skills will also be considered. The following will also be important:Ability to use software to merge, manipulate and analyze large data sets with complex structures.Data visualization skills, ideally including interactive reports.Interest in issues of school safety and public education.Detail-oriented and ability to keep accurate, well-organized records.Ability to manage time with flexibility and limited supervision.Excellent interpersonal skills.Ability to interact and partner with various levels of management, staff, faculty, and external constituents. DURATION: 18 - 24 months (End date listed as 6/30/19 to coincide with our fiscal year end but position will go longer)

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Job Summary: Who are we? Live Nation Entertainment is the world’s leading live entertainment company comprised of global market leaders: Ticketmaster, Live Nation Concerts, Live Nation Media & Sponsorship and Artist Nation Management. Ticketmaster is the global event ticketing leader with over 465 million tickets sold and more than 12,500 clients in 22 countries. Live Nation Concerts has become the single largest provider of live entertainment in the world producing over 25,500 shows annually for over 3,300 artists in 37 countries. Artist Nation Management is one of the world’s leading artist management companies, representing more than 350 artists. These businesses power Live Nation Media & Sponsorship to deliver music marketing programs across 900 brands enabling advertisers to tap into the 63 million fans Live Nation Entertainment delivers annually through its live event and digital platforms. For additional information, visit www.livenationentertainment.com. Who are you? Passionate and motivated. Driven, with an entrepreneurial spirit. Resourceful, innovative, forward thinking and committed. At Live Nation Entertainment, our people embrace these qualities, so if this sounds like you then please read on! The Role: The Financial Analyst will be responsible for developing and maintaining financial planning models, management reporting, operating metric analysis, participating in the planning process, and ad hoc analyses as needed. Responsibilities:Assist in preparing all forecast related schedules and deliverables (i.e. event forecasting analysis, fixed cost analysis, etc.)Analyze variances to plan, prior year and forecastSupport monthly/quarterly reporting requirements for Corporate and participate in the month end actual analytic processPartner with business partners (operations, marketing, production, ticketing) to create dynamic reporting and analysis toolsSupport ad hoc requests generated by market leadershipFinancial planning process improvement for effectiveness and efficiencyQualifications:BA degree in Finance, Accounting, Business or related field required2 – 3 years Financial Planning experience (budgets, forecasts, etc.)Advanced MS Excel skillsProficient in Microsoft PowerPointExcellent communication skills, written and verbalAbility to solve problems independentlyHighly organized with outstanding project management skillsAbility to balance and prioritize multiple tasks If the above description sounds like you and fits your background, apply online at www.livenation.com/careers to join the Live Nation Entertainment team today!  Applicants for employment in the U.S. must possess work authorization which does not require sponsorship by the employer for a visa. EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY Live Nation Entertainment strongly supports equal employment opportunity for all applicants regardless of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by state or federal law. HIRING PRACTICES The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.  Live Nation Entertainment recruitment policies are designed to place the most highly qualified persons available in a timely and efficient manner. Live Nation Entertainment may pursue all avenues available, including promotion from within, employee referrals, outside advertising, employment agencies, Internet recruiting, job fairs, college recruiting and search firms.

Name: Voice of Customer (VoC) Analyst
Description: Primerica currently has the following opportunity at our corporate office in Duluth, Georgia:THE CHALLENGEAs the Voice of Customer (VoC) Analyst on the Customer Experience Innovation (CXi) Team you will contribute the power of our quantitative customer feedback to drive meaningful customer experiences and effective product development decisions.You will help build and grow a deeply impactful VoC program built on the Qualtrics Experience Management platform that strategically advances how CXi ideates, builds, measures, and improves products. You will design surveys, perform data analysis working with our analytics team, create dashboards and reporting of customer experience and satisfaction data.You will analyze disparate customer feedback data sources (e.g., NPS, CSAT, CES, social media, product feedback) to present comprehensive views of customer experience. You will be an advocate for the voice of our customers with the power of our customer data.WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE IN THE ROLE You inspire those around you to be customer obsessed. You love turning data into insights. You thrive when people take action on the insights you provide. You infuse the CXi team with customer data and easy to digest reporting and dashboards to make our products better. You have internal stakeholders craving more.You are involved in the entire research process, including everything from designing surveys to developing the requirements identifying the customers that need to be surveyed or interviewed.As Primerica continues to grow at an accelerating rate, we are in need of talented people who can grow into the roles that are on the horizon. If you love learning new technologies, thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, and love the idea of pursuing new challenges every single day, this position is for you!A DAY IN THE LIFEWork closely with the CXi research and analytics teams to:Design, develop and analyze Primerica’s many ongoing and ad-hoc agent, client, and employee surveys.Monitor multiple sources of VoC feedback, including customer surveys, product reviews, interview input, feedback on the website and app experience, and social media content to identify and assess gaps in the customer experience.Continuously improve the effectiveness and efficiency of the VoC team’s research and analysis methodologies, processes, and deliverables to ensure our feedback process is optimized.Work with the research team to present a comprehensive picture of the customer’s experience based on both primary research and VoC analytics.Work closely with IT to manage integrations of feedback collection mechanisms into our online applications.Respond to unique business opportunities by analyzing existing feedback or developing new feedback sources.Partner closely with the analytics team to leverage existing customer data sources, identify and implement additional data sources that will drive an aligned, cohesive and comprehensive view of customer experience and service data, to assess, define and influence a Name: HOA Analyst

If you share a passion for excellent customer service, then we’re interested in you. Name: Acquisitions Analyst - Atlanta, GA
Description: Job DescriptionAbout the teamYou will join a brand new team that is at the center of Zillow’s effort to transform the future of home selling. This team will be responsible for establishing and developing best-in-class operations for residential real estate transactions, central to our mission to make the process of buying or selling a home a consumer friendly, state of the art experience that can be launched with just the click of a button.About the roleZillow is looking for an Acquisitions Analyst to underwrite single-family homes including purchase and sale pricing, renovation estimates and general property level P&L. You will be able to demonstrate your experience to provide insight and analysis to the Market Teams to hone in pricing, evaluate ROI, analysis of upgrades and capture local intel on market conditions. You will work closely with Asset Manager and the field team on any price adjustments during diligence or closing process of acquisitions and resale. You will:Be responsible for verification of automated valuation pricing, initial pricing & final pricing of acquisitions and sales pricing/days on market monitoring of dispositionsDevelop and maintain complex and detailed financial models in ExcelPerform market research and trend analysisPrepare investment committee memorandumsMonitor and seek ways to optimize existing portfolio of propertiesAd hoc data analysis and reporting relevant to acquisitions activityDevelop deep understanding of the market to help the field team make financially sound, operationally efficient decisions Who you are Business major focus preferredResidential real estate underwriting experience a plusDetail-oriented, analytical, and accurateStrong verbal and written communication skillsFocus on delivering business impact rapidly via analyticsWell organized and capable of handling multiple critical projects at a time Get to know usZillow Group is owned, fueled and grown by innovators who help people make better, smarter decisions around all things home. We encourage one another at every level, and our efforts are supported by employee-driven, world-class benefits that enable us to enjoy our lives outside the office while building fulfilling careers that impact millions of individuals every day.  Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Name: HRIS Functional Analyst
Description: A Career at Rheem: Where Comfort Is Your  Calling At  Rheem, we’re dedicated to bringing comfort to people’s lives. And, as a leading  global manufacturer of heating, cooling and water heating equipment, we’re  innovating all-new ways to deliver just the right temperature while saving  energy, water and supporting a more sustainable future. It’s an exciting  challenge that requires a team of talented, passionate people with a diverse  set of skills. From engineers to accountants, sales professionals to support  experts, Rheem depends on people to power our innovations. Join Rheem, and help  shape the future of products that impact people’s lives—every day.  In this exciting role, the HRIS  Functional Analyst support the maintenance and  process improvement of the HCM applications Oracle Fusion and Kronos. This  position serves as a point of contact for assigned functional areas and assists  subject matter experts with ensuring data integrity, testing of system changes,  report writing, analyzing data flows, and configuration changes for process  improvement opportunities.  The HRIS Functional Analyst also serves as “the business analyst” for HCM application  implementations, upgrades, patches, testing and other technical projects as  assigned. Maintain awareness of current trends in HRMS with a focus on product  and service development, delivery and support, and applying key technologies.  Examine trends in information systems training, materials and techniques.  Through classes, reading, CBTs or other mechanisms, continuously increase both  HR knowledge and HRIS application/tools knowledge. Participate in user group  meetings/conferences.  This  position will serve Rheem in Sandy Springs, GA. WHAT  YOU’LL DOSystem Maintenance (5" of time): Assist in the  review, testing and implementation of upgrades or patches. Collaborate with  SMEs and technical staff to coordinate application of upgrade or fix. Document  process and results.Production Support (25" of time): Work closely  with the SME’s for Kronos and Oracle Fusion’s Core HR, Payroll, Benefits,  Compensation, Goals & Performance,  and Taleo to solve complex business or systems issues. This requires helping  implement best practices based on system, policy/regulatory guidelines and partnering  with the Information Technology team.Projects/Process Improvement (55" of time):  Recommend process/customer service improvements, innovative solutions, policy  changes and/or major variations from established policy that must be approved  by appropriate leadership prior to implementation. Serve as a key liaison with  third parties and other stakeholders. Use project management skills in managing  projects. May provide overall project management for a given HR initiative.Reports/Queries (10" of time): Write, maintain  and support a variety of reports or queries using appropriate reporting tools.  Assist in development of standard reports for ongoing customer needs. Help  maintain data integrity in systems by running queries and analyzing data.Training (5" of time): Develop user procedures,  guidelines and documentation. Train clients on new processes/functionality.  Train new system users.WHAT  YOU NEEDBachelor's Degree in Human  Resources/Information Technology or related field of study5 - 8 years’ HRIS or HR  Generalist experience5 years’ HCM System  experience either on-premise or cloud such as PeopleSoft, Oracle Cloud, ADP,  Kronos or related applications1 plus years’ system  implementation experience. Hands-on role  as a business subject matter expert or implementation team memberExcellent communication skills, written and  verbal, with attention to detail and accuracy.Proficient computer skills and in-depth  intermediate to advance knowledge of relevant software such as MS Office Suite.Demonstrated ability to work well with others  in a matrix team environment.Strong interpersonal and coordination skills are essential.Occasional travel (5 to 10") to include international.HOW TO STAND OUTMaster's Degree for Human  Resource/Information Technology or related field.Certifications in HR and  Information Technology Certifications1 plus years’ HCM Cloud application experience or other related  Cloud applications such as Workday, SAP SuccessFactors, Oracle HCM Cloud1-2 years’ Project Management experienceSpanish a plus, but not requiredPrefer one full life cycle of system implementation experienceRHEEM IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYERNotice to Third Party Recruitment  Agencies Please note that Rheem and its  subsidiaries do not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment  agencies. In the absence of an executed Recruitment Services Agreement, there  will be no obligation to any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the  event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without an agreement,  Rheem and its subsidiaries shall explicitly reserve the right to pursue and  hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or  agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers,  shall be deemed the property of Rheem. If your agency would like to be  considered as a potential future recruiting partner, please leave your  contact information at TalentAcquisition@Rheem.com.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Posting Date :11-29-2018Primary Location :Atlanta Area, GA USWork Address :303 Peachtree StreetJob ID :W460272Schedule :Part-time :Financial-AnalystJob Description :Job DescriptionThe Financial Analyst will engage in all facets of the Strategic Expense Management function as well as Performance Management team. SunTrust utilizes ABC/M management techniques and software for assisting our business partners in understanding their direct and allocated expense structure, and how the consumption of that expense impacts the costs of activities, products, services consumed by SunTrust clients. This requires a basic to advanced understanding of the respective businesses for each Segment/Function the incumbent has accountability. Responsibilities include detailed expense analytics, cost allocation methodologies and measurement techniques, service provider/service receiver analytics and reports, monthly production reporting, and business partner meetings.  The incumbent will work closely with members of the Strategic Expense Management (SEM) and Cost Operations Teams in delivering consultative and analytical support to our business partners for making better informed and strategic decisions.  Among other responsibilities, the Financial Cost Analyst will be responsible for the following: Facilitates dialog with SFO’s in the discussion of potential changes or restatements, impacts to ABC rates/charges to service receivers, or allocation methodology changes and the related timing and impacts of such.Prepares and leads the monthly review of expense analysis for Actual, Plan and Forecast processes for their respective Segments and Lines of Business.Monitors and validates the monthly billing and chargeback processes performed in the various management reporting systems across the bank.Works with Finance community in the creation, alignment and monthly review of allocated expensesEnsure monthly statistics used in the allocation of costs are accurate and timelyAdherence to and maintenance of internal control procedures, including implementation, evaluation, and documentationCoordinates and facilitates the scheduling of annual methodology reviews, collection and review of documentation, storage, and implementation activities.Supports costing techniques that are necessary to drive business decisions and facilitate service provider/service receiver dialogue and effective expense managementIdentifies appropriate data sources for gathering statistics in support of ABC/M management techniques.Advises Business SFO’s on coordinating Change Management activities. Actively participates in SEM and Cost Operations Teams discussions for the incorporation and use of new statistics and required allocation methodology changesProvide end user support for cost information; facilitating the effective usage and interpretation of cost allocations and unit cost data across a variety of usesDemonstrated ability to leverage cost systems supporting Standard and Forecast unit costs, variance reporting, cost maintenance, operational metrics and scorecardsRemains knowledgeable about industry-standard and best-in-class allocation methodologies and usage; incorporating into SunTrust processes where appropriateJob DescriptionQualificationsBasic Qualifications: Expertise and business experience in decision-making regarding accounting and financial matters or combination of degree in accounting or finance and 6 years related work experience. Expertise with common financial or accounting software tools, such as Excel, G/L systems, Crystal reports, etc.Equal Opportunity Employer: SunTrust supports a diverse workforce and is a Drug Testing and Equal Opportunity Employer. SunTrust does not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, creed, color, gender, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, pregnancy, marital status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other classification protected by applicable laws.  To review the EEO Poster, copy and paste the following link into your browser: http://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf

Name: Compensation Analyst
Description: Role: Compensation Analyst  Duration: 1 year (Temp to Perm)  Location: Atlanta, GA 30328  Description:  Role Summary:  Participates in the development, implementation and administration of compensation programs and compensation related project work.  Primary Responsibilities and Essential Functions:  Maintains and analyzes ongoing compensation programs; evaluates jobs using market data and established evaluation systems and/or procedures; audits evaluation of jobs; ensures compliance with all legal aspects of the compensation function  Performs market analyses and job evaluations following an assigned methodology across the enterprise for broadbase roles.  Assists with yearly updates to enterprise systems such as the market evaluation system (Kenexa CompAnalyst)  Maintains enterprise portfolio for compensation surveys; preparation and analysis  May counsel leaders regarding the development of job summaries and/or descriptions  Administer performance recognition award programs; monitor effectiveness of programs; recommends changes as necessary  Assists in the administration of merit & equity programs; reviews proposed changes in pay for conformance to policy; prepares analysis in support of establishing merit budgets  Produces reports and analyzes compensation data to support client deliverables such as merit budget, salary structure management, and incentive plan data. Prepares special studies and recommendations on subjects such as base pay delivery, incentive compensation, and performance management  Document report requirements and develop reporting in designated databases  Provides recommendations for enterprise level operational efficiencies and process improvements and assists in policy development to support change initiatives  Provides and presents recommendations to department leadership  Qualifications:  Minimum:  2 or more years of experience preferred in related field (i.e. Compensation, Human Resources)  1 or more years of direct compensation analysis experience  Requires demonstrated intermediate Excel skills  Discretion in dealing with confidential and sensitive information  Strong quantitative reasoning skills  Excellent interpersonal and collaborative skills to work effectively with teams throughout organization  Preferred:  BS/BA degree in related discipline strongly desired (i.e. Human Resources, Business, Mathematics, etc.). Name: Financial Analyst
Description: We have been engaged by an industry leading company at regional headquarters in Atlanta in its targeted search for an experienced Financial Analyst. This role will be work with a number of verticals with the business. Financial Analyst and reporting to the Finance Manager  Responsibilities will include: The Financial Analyst will, develop and support complex financial and operational objectives (i.e. reporting, financial planning) and/or strategy. This role will also work collaboratively with other business units/departments to develop actions plans to support specific business objectives as well as develop financial forecasts to in support of overall company objectives. The Analyst is responsible for critical and complex analysis, and reporting of financial and operational results Prepare monthly financial reporting package for the company, providing detailed business explanations behind variances against forecast, budget and prior year for Income Statement, Balance Sheet and Cash Flows. Gather data and perform analytical review of actual results versus budget, forecast, and prior year at varying levels of the organization and across different information systems for functions and business segments. Prepare, review and present financial projections and recast financial statements, provide variance analysis, research financial irregularities and use the analysis to develop meaningful financial reporting. Analyze financial performance, prepare monthly variance to forecasts and present recommendations to business unit management and operators. Develop, prepare and present specialized reports, forecasts, profitability analysis, pricing analysis, other ad-hoc projects and complex financial models. Track key performance indicators and provide analysis to support business decisions. Analyze and report on financial and/or operational results/analysis. Ensure historical information, current trends, regulatory environment and tax consequences are factored into analysis. Deliver ad hoc analytical projects to provide insights as required with focus on meeting deadlines and providing communication to management. Provides support to Senior Management including financial presentation and analysis. Prepare presentations to highlight financial trends, summarize business plans, and communicate process changes across the enterprise. Analyze data and provide solutions/recommendations in response to anticipated and unanticipated fluctuations in the company?s business. Only qualified candidates will be contacted and considered; please no phone calls  If you are interested in this opportunity with a growing organization please send resume to Sarah Rowland at sarah.rowland@roberthalf.com

Name: Business Systems Lead Project Contour

A BA III manages multiple programs and/or projects with a high degree of complexity and scope. This position is required to understand, translate, and document complex business requirements to enable design, development, and implementation of IT solutions. The BA III will build relationships and have direct access to senior leaders so they can assist with the evolution of the IT Roadmap and strategy for their areas of expertise. MS Project, Excel, Visio, SharePoint etc.Proficient at developing and managing project budgets and rolling estimatesProficient at leading and facilitating group meetings to drive desirable outcomes and decisionsIn-depth understanding of information technology systems, standards, and architectureMakes effective decisions in a timely manner and escalates issues as appropriateEducation: Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Management Information Systems, or a related field. PMP and/or BA Certified or equivalent experience preferred. Experience:Managed multiple programs or projects with a high degree of complexity and scopeMultiple implementations with leadership accountability for multiple functional areas7+ years' Business Analyst experience in functional area (business process) and managing IT projects or processes/work streamsFunctional SkillsProject Management - successfully utilizing accepted methodologies to lead projects/teams to completionCollaboration (specifically between IT, business functions, vendors, etc.)Strategic Thinking and Strategy DevelopmentPrioritizing Multiple Deliverables, Ensuring ExecutionJob Requirements:Years of Experience:Leadership Behaviors:DRIVE INNOVATION: Generate new or unique solutions and embrace new ideas that help sustain our business(encompassing everything from continuous improvement to new product and package innovation).COLLABORATE WITH SYSTEM, CUSTOMERS, AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS: Develop and leverage relationships with stakeholders to approximately stretch and impact the System (Company and Bottler).ACT LIKE AN OWNER: Deliver results, creating value for our Brands, our System, our customers, and key stakeholders.INSPIRE OTHERS: Inspire people to deliver our mission and 2020 Vision, demonstrate passion for the business and give people a reason to believe anything is possible.DEVELOP SELF AND OTHERS: Develop self and support others' development to achieve full potential.Growth Behaviors:GROWTH MINDSET: Demonstrates curiosity. Welcomes failure as a learning opportunity.SMART RISK: Makes bold decisions/recommendations.EXTERNALLY FOCUSED: Understands the upstream and downstream implications of his/her work. Tracks and shares external trends, best practices or ideas.PERFORMANCE DRIVEN AND ACCOUNTABLE: Has high performance standards. Outperforms her/his peers.FAST/AGILE: Removes barriers to move faster. Experiments and adapts. Thrives under pressure and fast pace.EMPOWERED: Brings solutions instead of problems. Challenges the status quo. Has the courage to take an unpopular stance. Name: Sr Business Analyst
Description: Sr. Business AnalystAlpharetta, GAThis position is a senior-level position that will work with one or more Business Units, supporting multiple complex assigned projects aimed at delivering IT solutions and services that meet company cost, quality, and strategic targets. The role will serve a dual role of the business analyst (predominately focus on gathering and analyzing work group data, defining current processes and requirements, researching best practices, and identifying and documenting process improvements and functional specifications) and project manager (lead the requirement, design, testing, planning, implementation, and production support using a waterfall and/or hybrid methodology between Agile and Waterfall).QUALIFICATIONS: 5+ years of IT business analyst experience5+ years of IT project manager experienceBS/BA degree in technology relevant discipline or equivalent experience requiredTechnical knowledge – Software Development Lifecycle. Familiarity with Agile.TECHNICAL SKILLS:Broad understanding of software development methodologies, platforms, tools, and languages.Experience using a recognized development methodology; e.g., Agile, SCRUM, KANBAN, and WATERFALLProficient in Microsoft Office productsModerate facilitation skills; ability to facilitate workshops.IT research, software analysis, and design skills.Business requirements gathering.Understanding of the role of BA in the full software development life cycle.Experience in gathering business requirements and translating them into user stories/functional specifications on complex or large projects.Previous experience of working in an agile environment and using recognized development methodology; e.g., Agile, SCRUM, KANBAN, and WATERFALL.Communicate Effectively: Speak, listen and write in a clear, thorough and timely manner using appropriate and effective communication tools and techniques across all levels of the organization including process documentationCreativity/Innovation: Develop new and unique ways to help remove project roadblocks or improve organization productivity. Demonstrates superior collaboration skills and techniques which appropriately define alternate solutions; resolve conflicts; and create lasting, productive partnerships with clients. Works with senior management to resolve more complex problems.Foster Teamwork: Work collaboratively and effectively with others to set goals, resolve problem, and make decisions that enhance cross functional effectiveness.Lead: Positively influence others to achieve results that are in the best interest of the organization.Make Decisions: Assess situations to determine the importance, urgency and risks, and make clear decisions which are timely and in the best interests of the organization.Organize: Set priorities, develop a work schedule, monitor progress towards goals, and track details/data/information/activities, including managing project budgets of $1M or greater.Plan: Determine strategies to move the project forward, set goals, create and implement actions plans, and evaluate the process and results.Solve Problems: Drive organizational change taking full account of obstacles, opposition, and differing stakeholder priorities. Actively participates in cross-functional groups to solve problems across conflicting projects. Strong interpersonal skillsDetailed, organized: be able to manage multiple projects at any given time and move them forward concurrently based on the priority and the business needsACCOUNTABILITIES: Analyze, define, and document complex requirements and business processes.Develop complex systems specifications, process flow, and conversion strategies.Create complex technical and functional user documentation.Contribute to the development of new tools, processes, and solutions to meet desired product needs.Follow established business processes, protocols, and quality standards in the development and deployment of complex solutions.Maintain stakeholder expectations and raise appropriate issues to upper management as necessary.Develop “trusted advisor” relationship with senior stakeholders through effective communication and efficient, quality execution on projects.Gather business requirements and translate them into user stories/functional specifications.Identify and document process improvements and functional specifications based on research of best practices and analysis of work group data.Perform analysis on existing systems; identifying options for potential solutions and assess for both technical and business suitability.Work between remote development teams, internal IT, and business to ensure requirements are being met.Work with Tech Lead and/or Development resource to finalize the implementation design to meet the business requirementsCreate data mapping table to illustrate the data communication and storageCreate Functional Requirement Specification (FRS) including business requirements and high level design approach with screen shot illustrationCoordinate between the internal development team and business stakeholders (clarify requirements, manage change requests), other development teams (interface implementation), QA team (resolve defects timely), and PMO project manager (status updates, issue resolution, change control) to implement the project on agreed scheduleConduct User Acceptance Testing where applicableCoordinate release for each impacted component timelyKeep project stakeholders and upper management informed of project progress and issuesPerform production support duty and turn over the project to Operations team when production is stabilizedAll other duties as assigned.At LexisNexis Risk Solutions, we believe in the power of data and advanced analytics for better risk management. With over 40 years of expertise, we are the trusted data analytics provider for organizations seeking actionable insights to manage risks and improve results while upholding the highest standards for security and privacy. Headquartered in metro Atlanta, LexisNexis Risk Solutions serves customers in more than 100 countries and is part of RELX Group plc, a world-leading provider of information and analytics for professional and business customers across industries. For more information, please visit www.lexisnexisrisk.com. LexisNexis Risk Solutions is an equal opportunity employer: qualified applicants are considered for and treated during employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, protected veteran status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. If a qualified individual with a disability or disabled veteran needs a reasonable accommodation to use or access our online system, that individual should please contact 1.877.734.1938 or accommodations@relx.com.

Name: Technical Systems Analyst
Description: Description: Primary Duties and Responsibilities  Act as Lead System  Analyst on projects and oversee on-time delivery of design artifacts  from cross-functional areas.  Apply modeling  techniques to Analyst deliverables.  Interact regularly  with Systems Analysts, Business Analysts, Architects, Developers,  Application Support, Enterprise Test, Operations, and Senior Management.  Plan, facilitate, and  participate in working sessions with cross-functional resources.  Collect information to  analyze and evaluate existing or developed T-Mobile applications or  systems, prepare detailed flow charts (work flow, activity, sequence  diagrams), outlining systems capabilities and processes following  waterfall SDLC or RUP guidelines. Translate business and user  requirements into accurate system requirements specification documents  through systems and data analysis.  Demonstrate knowledge  of the business processes in their area of responsibility and work with  the Business to define requirements that will drive efficiencies in the  business taking into account the entire picture as well as the details.  Demonstrate knowledge  of the application systems in their area of responsibility and can  identify, evaluate and define impacts of changes, provide alternatives  both to the application changing and all upstream and downstream  systems, or identify if a change is a manual process taking into account  the entire picture as well as the details. Generally assigned to  Enterprise cross-functional and cross-departmental projects with high  complexity and cross-system impacts.  Conceptualize,  document and communicate innovative solutions to meet or exceed business  objectives.  Develop and drive  creative yet workable design solutions to difficult, complex problems  across own line/division.  Promote Enterprise  Architecture vision to support EIT, business-wide by working with  partner teams and relaying all pertinent information back to impacted  teams. Also, digest the given information and incorporate the  Enterprise Architecture Team's vision into the overall system designs  through design and analysis on projects.  Contribute to  definition, design, and management of Enterprise Architecture components  and low-level technical Architecture design documents for core systems.  Conduct peer reviews  to solicit feedback on materials created.  Secondary Duties and Responsibilities  Provide accurate  estimates of effort and timelines for completion of assigned tasks and  workload to achieve deliverables and goals, delivering on time and on  estimation for medium to complex projects.  Take initiative to  determine the need and to design and deliver training to department and  business.  Manage vendor  relationships and resources as required.  Initiate and execute  initiatives to improve the processes, procedures, and tools utilized by  the team.  Review deliverables  and provides input for other analysts.  Create and deliver  articulate and effective oral presentations to a variety of audiences,  large or small, internal or external, business or technical.  Effectively manages  analyst expectations and deliverables in large and complex projects  through the software development lifecycle.  Review and reconciles  project delivery to strategic EIT capability roadmap.  Functional/Technical Skills  Must be a strong team  player with a commitment to excellence.  Proven leadership  skills.  Ability to challenge  users, business analysts and others, to achieve appropriate and desired  solution for the business  MS Office Tools (Word,  Excel, Project, PowerPoint, Visio)  Working Knowledge of  UML, SQL, JMS, SOAP, .NET, XML, Oracle. Java knowledge preferred.  Solid Understanding of SOA Experience with  multiple functional areas including billing, service, and finance  required  Thorough working  knowledge of various business process and system modeling tools  including: Data Flow Diagrams, Process Models, ER diagrams, Dimensional  Data Models, Context Models, Event Modeling, State Modeling, Process  decomposition, and Use Case Scenario.  Thorough working  knowledge of the system development life cycle and can train others on  SDLC concepts  Thorough working  knowledge to effectively manage time, prioritize work, multi-task across  many assignments, create deliverables and delegate to others as well as  monitor their work for completion  Ability to assess the  impact of new requirements on an existing suite of complex applications  Technical writing  skills producing clear and unambiguous deliverables  Experience with  supporting both purchased and in-house developed applications required  Strong analytical and  problem solving skills  Excellent communication  and documentation skills are required.  Must have ability to  handle multiple concurrent activities and have a flexible positive  attitude.  Experience  5 years minimum  experience in software development, software design or business process  design (example: process modeling, use case analysis, etc) and  implementation preferred  Experience creating  Functional Specification documents required. Experience creating Impact  Assessment documents is preferred.  Experience in Systems  Analysis of medium to large-scale projects with multiple functional  components  5 years minimum  experience with supporting both purchased and in-house developed  applications required  5 years minimum  experience with a formal SDLC preferred  5 years minimum  experience developing business solutions with a variety of tools  preferred  2 years minimum  Project Management, Management, Team Lead, or other equivalent  leadership experience preferred  5 years minimum  experience in telecommunications industry preferred  Knowledge of wireless  industry is a plus  Development Experience  Preferred but not required.  Education/Vocational Training 4 year degree in Computing Science, MIS or equivalent.

Name: IT Business Systems Analyst Finance & Accounting
Description: IT Business Systems Analyst Finance & AccountingThe IT Business Systems Analyst Finance & Accounting is a key role for the Finance and Accoutning functions. The primary mission of the position is to drive functional business objectives and technical development and support with information technology, digital, data, analytics, strategy, solutions and services, provoke strategic directions through internal/external perspective and proactively seek out and manage value opportunities for IT solutions and services.Key Responsibilities:Function as a partner and trusted advisor to functional leadership and serve as a contributor to the deployment and realization of the functional and business objectives.Assure secure compliant stable operations in technologies enabling HR/Finance functional unitsIn partnership with HR/Finance leadership, define strategy, roadmap for technology, information, data and digital technologies.Drive innovative solutions to support the growth, efficiency, agility of the commercial businessServe in a critical role within Design Group-Americas IT as an influential player in the IT TeamContext and Scope:Information and Digital Technologies Strategic LeadershipIT Business Systems Analyst Finance & Accounting is responsible for establishing trusted relationships with key stakeholders and leaders in the function, being a connected, influential player in the business. They will understand and contribute to business strategic directions and goals, define an IT strategic plan aligned/embedded with business strategy. They will ensure governance and alignment of business demand with supply. They will communicate plan effectively and gain support from key stakeholders, including functional leaders.Service DeliveryIT Business Systems Analyst Finance & Accounting develops a depth of understanding in Finance & Accounting operational capabilities. They will provide visibility to stakeholders with ongoing communication and reporting and ensure compliance to IT security and controls framework.Business Change InitiativesIT Business Systems Analyst Finance & Accounting will develop and agree an on-going project portfolio to achieve the HR/Finance IT strategy, taking into account goals, corporate priorities, technology /data opportunities, and cost pressures. They will lead, jointly with peers in business functions, the delivery of business change initiatives, ensuring the timely and on budget delivery of IT components. They will provide prioritization guidelines and lead a focused agenda. With adept understanding of business value, they will drive clear prioritization of value driving initiatives of business impact.Finance and Value ManagementThe IT Business Systems Analyst Finance & Accounting will define a portfolio of investment initiatives inclusive of value proposition and prioritized investment portfolio. Provide transparency of IT costs to functional leadership; Bring in relentless leadership in cost reduction and total cost management generate head room towards fueling investments to drive growth enablement.Key Priorities:Contribute / enable tech, data, analytics and digital capabilities enabling the following:Omni Channel shiftAnalytics - a holistic analytics capability embedded and adopted by the businessMerger/Acquisitions/ Joint Venture migrations as requiredMeasured OutcomesContinued sustenance of operational metrics of IT systems and enable operational excellenceSecurity and compliance metricsIT costs controls and reductionImproved Agile and Test & Learn approachesLeading change agent in delivering and embrace digital strategiesEducation:BS degree in Business, Computer Science / Data Science / Information Technology or related field, advanced degree desired.Knowledge and Experience;Minimum of 8 years demonstrable strategic impact and delivery in the Information Technology field, operating within an innovative and highly agile customer environment.Outstanding career of professional accomplishment and a broad range of experience focused on business solutions.Experience delivering IT services in an ERP environment, where the Digital/Data agenda is shaping the future and an external lens is adopted to support internal strategic thinking.A successful track record working with business and IT peers and partners worldwide in a highly proactive manner. Strength, in relationship building and partnering embodies true partnership of co-creating and defining the future along with business and IT teams.ERP background preferredeCommerce / Retail / CPG / Data / Analytics businesses background highly desired. Key Supporting Competencies:Adaptable to fit in to the Design Group CultureDemonstrates exceptional learning agility supported by self-investmentLeads and engages teammates to be a high performing teamCreates an environment where people feel valued, supported and motivatedDelivers consistent strategic and tactical resultsCreates respectful and collaborative relationshipsApproaches day-to-day with humility, energy, a sense of purpose, and fun!Drives sustainable business change and transformationBuilds and fosters customer relationship High tenacity, change agent, leading with courage, humility

Name: Budget Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionBudget Analyst Summary  The candidate shall provide daily onsite budget execution and operations services to the OCFO’s Office of Budget in the Atlanta Metropolitan Area This work shall include, but is not limited to, the following tasks: Budget Analyst Duties and ResponsibilitiesDevelop, analyze and execute budgets for both CDC/UFMS.Evaluate relationship between IRIS/B&PI reports and COAST.Provide leadership for budget preparation, formulation, presentation and execution.Ensure there are adequate funds for programs within the organization.Evaluate the performance of a program and adjust funding if necessary.Analyze financial data providing recommendations for creative/effective solutions.Summarize budgets and submit recommendations for the approval or disapproval of funds requests.Analyze department budgeting and prepare reports for OCFODemonstrated proficiency with the Microsoft Suite Software with emphasis on Excel and AccessProficient with government financial management systems (IRIS, UFMS, MACCS, GovTrip, ICE)Required SkillsMust be US Citizen or eligible to work in the USKnowledge of and demonstrated proficiency in the use of Microsoft suite (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, Word)Excellent written and oral communication skills (includes editing and proofreading)Strong research and analytical skillsCDC experience a plus but not requiredExperience working within government agency is requiredEducationBachelor’s Degree in Public Administration, Business, Finance, or equivalent field of studyMinimum two years of experience as Budget AnalystSalaryCompetitive Company DescriptionCetechs is a strategic staffing and workforce solutions firm headquartered in Mesa Arizona. As a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business, we are committed to providing the VA and DOD with exceptional personnel, providing quality patient care to our active duty and retired military members, and their beneficiaries.

Name: Senior Integration Analyst - HCM
Description: A Career at Rheem: Where Comfort Is Your CallingAt Rheem, we’re  dedicated to bringing comfort to people’s lives. And, as a leading global  manufacturer of heating, cooling and water heating equipment, we’re innovating  all-new ways to deliver just the right temperature while saving energy, water  and supporting a more sustainable future. It’s an exciting challenge that  requires a team of talented, passionate people with a diverse set of skills.  From engineers to accountants, sales professionals to support experts, Rheem  depends on people to power our innovations. Join Rheem, and help shape the  future of products that impact people’s lives—every day.  The Senior  Functional Analyst HCM will be responsible for is a  technology specialist who provides guidance and hands-on support to the HR  users in the enterprise. Act as the  primary liaison to HR from Information Technology. Facilitates and supports key  processes for Human Capital Management. The Senior Functional Analyst will  partner with business analysts and stakeholders in finance & HR to  configure and support Oracle Fusion across business units for all Enterprise  System projects. The ideal candidate for this role will have extensive  functional knowledge, extensive expertise with system configuration, solution  design, build, test and implementation of Oracle Fusion.  This  position will serve Rheem Enterprise located in Atlanta, GA. WHAT  YOU’LL DODuties  include working on projects and providing guidance to end users, consultants,  and vendors.Current HR  and payroll systems include Kronos and other time keeping systems maintained at  division location.Long-term  business and IT strategy will include evaluating, upgrading, or replacing these  systems.Rheem  Manufacturing is an international business and plans to upgrade technology to  allow users to view HR, benefits, and payroll information enterprise-wide.Experience  with Oracle's HCM Cloud is desired.Experience  should be across multiple modules such as; Core HR, Payroll, Compensation,  Recruiting etc.Extensive  experience in gathering business requirements; performing functional fit/gap  analysis; presenting best practices; creating current & future process flow  diagrams; performing risk analysis; recommending solutions, alternatives &  workarounds;, creating functional specs for tech team; configuring, creating  testing strategies, test scenarios, & test scripts; leading all phases of  the implementation/upgrade life-cycle.Excellent  communication. Needs to be an effective liaison between the client executive  team, business analysts, and technical team. Works well with clients and other  consultants.Troubleshooting  production issues and thinking critically in pressure situations.HRIS  experience providing support for HR and employee queries.Assist in  assessment of upgrades and testing during system upgrades and patches.Collaborate  with 3rd party vendor and HR to drive system enhancements as requiredAssist in  assessment of upgrades and testing during system upgrades and patchesMust have  ability to work hands-on with the systems in the configuration, testing and  training.Ability to  lead and facilitate meetings to bring disparate skill sets and viewpoints  together to solve problems.Solicit  input from all appropriate parties to ensure solutions are consistent with  enterprise direction.Helps  identify process improvements through changes in practice, standardization or IT  automation.Track  issue and resolution for all HR systems.Monitor  the service ticketing system for HR issues and requests.Prepare  complex reports for employee data contained in the HRIS in response to requests  from users within Human Resources and from users in other departments.Experience  in HCM Extracts, BIP and fast formulas.Perform  other duties as assigned.WHAT YOU  NEEDRequired BS/BA in Human Resources, Business,  Computer Science, or related field of study.At least 10 years relevant experience.Willingness  to travel as necessary, work the required schedule, work at the specific  location required.Hands-on  experience with implementation, configuration, and support of packaged software  for HR, payroll, and benefits administration required.Functional  and configuration hands-on experience.Knowledge  of SQL is required.Knowledge  of enterprise HRIS such as Oracle required.Prior  experience developing reports required.Demonstrated  ability to lead small initiatives and provide oversight to consultants.Experience  with full life cycle for software implementation or upgrades.Demonstrated  ability to "dig in" and solve problems with minimal background  information.Business  analyst experience such as gathering requirements, designing business  processes, documenting processes, unit testing, facilitating design meetings  with users, etc.Good  communications skills (written/verbal), with emphasis on demonstrated ability  to convey complex technical principles to non-technical audiences.Ability  to lead and facilitate meetings to bring disparate skill sets and viewpoints  together to solve problems.Experience  with a structured development methodology.Proficient  skills using the MS Office suite including Project and process modeling tools  such as Visio.Proficient  skills for using SharePoint as a collaboration tool.Successful  candidates must be able to work in a collaborative and teamwork driven  environment.Ability  to travel domestically and globally.  Estimated amount of travel is 40  .HOW TO  STAND OUTPreferred  consulting experience with a variety of mid to large size companies.Preferred  experience in manufacturing or high-tech industries.Knowledge  of Recruiting, Payroll, Core HR and Benefits Administration required.Rheem is an Equal Opportunity EmployerNotice to  Third Party Recruitment Agencies: Please note that Rheem and its subsidiaries do not accept  unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of  an executed Recruitment Services Agreement, there will be no obligation to any  referral compensation or recruiter fee. Any unsolicited  resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, shall be deemed the  property of Rheem. If your agency would like to be considered as a  potential future recruiting partner, please leave your contact information  at TalentAcquistion@Rheem.com.#LI-KF1

Name: Warehouse KPI - Analyst
Description: Company DescriptionDo you want beneficial technologies being shaped by your ideas? Whether in the areas of mobility  solutions,  consumer goods, industrial technology or energy and building technology  with us, you will have the chance to improve quality of life all  across the globe. Welcome to Bosch.  BOSCH is a proud supporter of STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics) Initiatives:  FIRST Robotics (For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology)  AWIM (A World In Motion)  Position your career for long term success by joining the world's most admired motor vehicle parts supplier as ranked by Fortune for the third consecutive year.Job DescriptionPosition Responsibilities:Perform financial analysis and reporting for warehouse costs: actuals vs. plan/forecast including comments and risks and opportunitieshave ownership of financial and operational KPI-reporting, analysis and trackingPreparation of yearly business Planning and a recurring Forecasting with the local cost-center-owners and consolidation the results for further presentation and discussionManaging financial and operational PDCAscreate ad hoc analysis of financial figures for warehousingDeveloping and maintaining a logistic pricing model (performance-driven pricing of warehouse-services)Perform capital investment calculations incl. regular follow-upMonitoring of Service-level deviations caused by the warehouses and performing service-level correctionsOverseeing cycle-count-activitiesPerformance-related projects with customers and suppliersQualificationsBachelor in Business Administration, Accounting, Finance, Supply Chain or similar fieldUnderstanding of controlling or accounting functionsKnowledge of general accounting proceduresUser-knowledge in SAP and WMS-systemsExtended knowledge in MS Office-applications (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)General Understanding of supply-chains and warehouse-operationsGood communication skillsAnalytical skills Additional InformationBy choice, we are committed to a diverse workforce-EOE/Protected Veteran/Disabled  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Name: Senior Reimbursement Analyst (Advanced Excel) - Consulate Health Care - Maitland
Description: **Job ID** _40437_ **Position Location** _US-FL-Maitland_ **Alternate Position Location** _Atlanta/GA_ **Facility Name** _Consulate Health Care - Maitland_ **Job Category** _Finance - Accounting_ **TC** _CB_ **Position Status** _FT (Full Time)_**Job Overview** **Purpose of Your Job Position** As a Consulate employee, you are entrusted with the responsibility of carrying out your daily tasks and assigned duties while demonstrating Consulates Core Values of Compassion, Honesty, Integrity, Respect and Passion. You are expected to provide innovative, responsible results with the creation and implementation of new ideas and concepts that continually improve systems and processes to achieve superior results. The primary purpose of your job position is to prepare accurate and timely cost reports for assigned facilities. **Job Functions** As Senior Reimbursement Analyst, you are delegated the administrative authority, responsibility, and accountability necessary for carrying out your assigned duties. This position is responsible for the preparation of complex excel models and templates related to Medicare and Medicaid Cost Reporting and rate-setting. This position is a non-supervisory function. Every effort has been made to identify the essential functions of this position. However, it in no way states or implies that these are the only duties you will be required to perform. The omission of specific statements of duties does not exclude them from the position if the work is similar, related, or is an essential function of the position. **Duties and Responsibilities** + Develop and maintain complex spreadsheets and databases to support Medicare and Medicaid Cost Report preparation and analysis. + Develop rate-setting models based on cost report and other related information and update those models on an as needed basis. + Use Advanced excel skills to identify areas of opportunity to automate and improve current processes to improve departmental efficiency. + Continually monitor changes in regulations and methodology to ensure assigned states receive appropriate payment for services rendered. + Represent the company during cost report audits as necessary. + Provide summary of results to department management on an as-needed basis. + Prepare accurate and timely cost reports for assigned facilities as needed. + Other duties as reasonably related and assigned. + Assist with various audits, including the annual financial audit and various government audits. + Embrace Consulates five core values of compassion, honesty, integrity, respect and passion, and incorporate them into ones daily job function. + Demonstrate respect and compassion in every interaction. + Conduct oneself with the highest degree of honesty and integrity in every interaction. + Perform other related duties as required and assigned. **Education** + BS/BA in Accounting or Finance; a business degree with a major in Accounting preferred. + Attends and participates in continuing educational programs. **Experience** + Four (4) years of Professional Accounting experience preferably in a health care environment. **Specific Requirements** + Advanced Excel skills Advanced Access skills and familiarity with Word and Outlook preferred + Advanced Knowledge of automated general ledger systems. + Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively communicate with others. EEO/MFDV **Company Overview** **_Where Will Compassion Take You?_** At Consulate Health Care, we're looking for talented, compassionate and hard-working individuals who are eager to serve others. Our team members go above and beyond to give our residents and patients the care they deserve so you'll find that every day with Consulate Health Care offers new and exciting opportunities to learn and grow. _Compassionate hearts and passionate dedication_ these two qualities shine in our team members and provide the foundation for our mission of **_Providing Service With Our Hearts and Hands_** . The compassion you'll show to residents, patients and their families is the lifeline of our business, while relationships with your peers and coworkers will strengthen our vibrant, diverse community. Consulate Health Care is one of the nation's leading providers of Senior healthcare services, specializing in post-acute care. Operating in 21 states, we offer services ranging from short-term transitional care to Alzheimers and dementia care. + 24-hour skilled nursing care + Comprehensive post-acute care + Physical, Occupational and Speech therapies + "Your Journey Home" short-term rehab program + Alzheimer's and dementia care + Care for medically-complex patients

Name: Senior Business Solution Consultant
Description: This is a remote opportunity and can be based anywhere in the US (travel required)Position overview The Senior Business Solution Consultant (BSC) is responsible for understanding our Retail & Wholesale clients unique business process, documenting requirements and functional configuration elements, supporting client business owners, solution testing and training retail super users on how to use the new software. It is important that the person in this role has a firm grasp and demonstrated experience of retail concepts and methodologies. Hands on experience with Price/Promotion Management solutions is ideal.What you'll be doingDefines and documents customer business functions and processes. Include future business processes, all expected and required calculations, screen mock-ups, Excel data representations and definition of success samples.Lead design sessions, and best practice recommendations regarding achieving identified business challenges using the Demand Management (FKA JustEnough) Software. If you know what theyre asking will cause them difficulty in the future, diplomatically lead them toward an appropriate alternative solution.Work with Project Manager and Delivery leadership to develop a project plan, budget, scope, charter and manage scope creep including identification of risks and issuesActs as a liaison between client end-users, technical analysts, information technology analysts, and Demand Management resources in the analysis, design, configuration, testing and maintenance of Demand Management system to ensure optimal operational performance.Tracks and fully documents changes for functional and business specifications; writes detailed universally understood procedures for permanent records and for use in training.Personal Development and On the Job TrainingRetail concepts Strive to understand retail concepts to enable effective communication with the Demand Management Business consultant and client.Relate these concepts when translating business requirements for configuration of the Demand Management system Consulting soft skills and client management:Behaviors, insights and techniques for effective project managementCommunication strategies and tactics for information sharing, issue management and guidanceMethods for discussing change and its relationship to scope managementDemand Management Software functional knowledge Strive to understand if custom requests are reasonable and achievable within the functionality of the Demand Management system.What you bring to the tableKnowledge of retail and wholesale concepts (open-to-buy planning, merchandise planning, assortment planning, replenishment & allocation, demand forecasting, inventory planning) with clearly demonstrated business acumen.Strong communication and interpersonal skills to with a proven ability to facilitate design sessions and cross functional collaborationSoftware implementation experience either in consulting or as part of client implementation teamRetail Experience with preferable experience across a number of capabilities (Price an Promotions required, along with Allocation, Replenishment, Forecasting, Merchandise Planning ideal)Ability to work independently with minimal supervisionBachelors Degree in relevant field or equivalent work experienceAbility to travel 75% of the time in support of the client implementationsBonusPrevious consulting experience with a top tier technology consulting firmKnowledge of data modeling / database structureExperience in leading and developing training materialAbout Mi9 Retail Mi9 Retail is committed to helping retailers create great experiences for their customers online, in store, or wherever they occur. We believe that a great experience takes place when optimized product planning and inventory management intersects with skillful customer engagement and point-of-purchase execution. We are a rapidly growing tech company that develops leading Demand Management, Merchandising, Business Intelligence, e-Commerce and Point of Sale systems for large and mid-sized retail enterprises. Our clients include globally recognized names, including Levis, Abercrombie & Fitch, BevMo!, Billabong, Dolce & Gabbana, Tommy Bahama, Barneys New York, Tory Burch, Home Depot, and Nike. Our global and diverse workforce has driven our significant growth, and our commitment to outstanding customer service earned us the top vendor in retail concentration designation from the RIS Software LeaderBoard for 2017. Were on a mission to make the retail industry great!  We are a successful, global, fast-growing company with a start-up work vibe, where your ideas will be heard and you can have an impact. Are at the forefront of tech and the retail industry. We are passionate about our clients and live/breathe the client experience. We believe in autonomy, taking initiative and holding each other accountable for shared success Local candidates preferredMust be legally authorized to work in United States without visa sponsorship for employment.Mi9 Retail is an Equal Opportunity Employer.No phone calls please.Mi9 Retail participates in e-Verify for all positions based in our US offices. For more information, please click here (English | Español).

Name: PeopleSoft HCM Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description: Req ID: ****** The Turner Story  Turner is a division of WarnerMedia along with our sister companies, HBO and Warner Bros., delivering brands like CNN, HLN, TNT, TBS, Adult Swim, Cartoon Network, Turner Sports and so much more! **********************  See what it's like to work at Turner! Follow us on Instagram, Twitter and Facebook  The Team  As a technologist at Turner, you will work at the intersection of art and science. You'll work for brands that inform and entertain the world including [adult swim], Bleacher Report, Boomerang, Cartoon Network, CNN, ELEAGUE, FilmStruck, Great Big Story, HLN, iStreamPlanet, Super Deluxe, TBS, Turner Classic Movies (TCM), TNT, truTV and Turner Sports - which includes the NBA, NCAA March Madness, Major League Baseball and the UEFA Champions League. You'll be part of a company that enables community and belonging by creating content that connects with fans whenever and where ever they want it.  The Job  The Senior Business Systems Analyst provides guidance, leadership, and execution of business analysis and related project initiatives for the selection and development of custom PeopleSoft modules and packaged HR applications. Typically works on multiple, technically complex, mission-critical, and/or high-profile projects.  The Day-to-Day  Work with project and customer management to facilitate communication between IT and business, including open issues, project prioritization, resolutions, and project requests.  Facilitate cooperation and rationalization of unclear or conflicting goals, assist in identifying and communicating viable alternatives, and assist in the implementation of decisions.  Using advanced business knowledge, proactively research requests for assistance and recommend software solutions or process improvements that will meet business needs.
